name: Sol Sauna
address: Strawhall Industrial Estate, Strawhall, Carlow, R93 RX88, Ireland
reviews_text:
Fabulous Sauna, really spacious and very clean, the hot tub is a great bonus, staff are so lovely too! I‚Äôll definitely be back || This place is wonderful, we're very happy: the sauna is just hot enough to stay there for a long time. The outdoor jacuzzi is an incredible solution, but it's a shame there's only one. We really enjoyed everything, and we'll recommend this place to our friends. || An excellent new Sauna and Cold plunge experience that has just opened in Strawhall Carlow.

Really well organised - two large saunas that have their entry times staggered

The place was full but never felt busy or crowded

Large amount of individual changing rooms and storage. Hair dryers are a nice addition also.

Very large cold plunge tank. And a good size hot tub. (Both were checked by staff for PH balance when I was there)

The saunas are very spacious and were at a high but good temp.

5 stars - next visit booked already || Amazing place so spacious and clean! Sauna and ice bath so roomy. Definitely worth going ü§© || I had an excellent experience doing the sauna thanks to Aoife. She was very friendly and it‚Äôs a relaxing atmosphere. Highly recommend this sauna

name: Woodfield sauna
address: highfield house, strand road, Ballickmoyler, Carlow, Co. Laois, R93 E6F4, Ireland
reviews_text: This is a little gem sauna setup. Set in an abundant woodland area with a stream for cold plunge contrast, which makes it a truly unique experience. Fionn met me as I arrived and explained the lay of the land. The sauna wood fire was kept to a high temperature, very clean and comfortable. Give yourself 15 minutes from your car to the dressing room and back and don‚Äôt be in a rush. Looking forward to seeing this business develop with breathwork & yoga retreat offerings in the future. An opportunity to complete immerse yourself in nature. Highly recommend. || The experience offered @ Woodfield Sauna is second to none. The host is very friendly, professional, a sign of things to come when you arrive @ the sauna. Return customer for sure ‚ú® || I was here last week and loved it. The place is beautiful. The whole experience felt relaxing, I especially loved the river dip/plunge. Sauna was spotless and a great temp. Very scenic location. All in all 10/10 || A fantastic gem of a sauna set in lovely natural woodland - its wood-fired, with a lovely little stream option as a cold plunge. Very relaxing experience and a,reset for body and mindüòÅ || One of the most relaxing blissful afternoons I‚Äôve had. Set by a beautiful stream in a lovely wooded area of co Laois. Really lovely experience.

name: Valhalla Saunas
address: Milford, Carlow, Ireland
reviews_text:
gorgeous lil sauna hidden in the forest, nice and private over looking the Barrow river! the coffee place beside it is nice, plenty of parking, really friendly owner üòä || Lovely setting. Very relaxing. Great to have the new changing area. || Used to be 4 person capacity sauna which was perfect for a few friends to hang and chat but they renovated it and now it's a really tight over-crowded 8 person sauna, everyone we were there with (3 groups) was not happy and wasn't told about the new capacity. Fantastic sauna and I wish them the best but I'm pretty sure there gonna lose a lot of business now because they've lost there small personal sauna experience and turned into a communal sauna which I don't think is gonna fly long term. || This was my first time experiencing this sauna on a beautiful sunny day, and I must say‚Äîit‚Äôs a 10/10! I've only ever used leisure centre saunas before, so this felt like a truly authentic experience. The hostess was lovely and guided me through the entire process, which made me feel very welcome. I would highly recommend this sauna to anyone looking for a genuine and relaxing experience! || Excellent Sauna setup on the banks of the river barrow

Book online in advance

Parking and coffee dock nearby

name: Heron Sauna
address: The Quay, St. Mullin's, St Mullin's, Co. Carlow, Ireland
reviews_text:
Had a great experience at Heron Sauna. Everything was clean, well-maintained, and thoughtfully organized. The atmosphere was relaxing, the temperature settings were perfect, and the staff were very friendly and welcoming. I left feeling refreshed and fully satisfied. Highly recommend this place for anyone looking to unwind and enjoy quality sauna time. || We absolutely loved our visit to Heron Sauna in St Mullins. The riverside setting on the calm Barrow is just perfect..stepping from the heat of the wood-fired sauna into the refreshing cold plunge felt incredible. Everything was so well thought out, from the cosy changing spaces to the relaxed atmosphere. Finishing up with a coffee by the river made the whole experience feel complete. Such a peaceful, restorative way to spend our Sunday morning...we‚Äôll definitely be back! || An easy 5 star rating

Lovely location, excellent service, great setup.
Sauna is located close to the cafe, it‚Äôs very close to the river.

You can cold plunge beside the sauna or in the river

I can‚Äôt wait to return already. || I had a wonderful experience at Heron Sauna. We had an magical evening session as part of a Sleep Lab with Mulvarra house.
Fairy lights, fantastic scenery and clean, well kept facilities. There is a little coffee shop onsite too if you fancy a hot/cold drink afterwards. Felt amazing after a few dips in the plunge pool. Thanks so much to Lauren too who was super friendly. Will definitely be back! || Absolutely gorgeous spot for a sauna looking out over the Barrow River In St Mullin's and with a fabulous cafe right next door. Everything is spotless and plenty of changing rooms, plus a nice plunge pool and cold shower. And a very safe spot to swim in the river just opposite the sauna. Perfect sauna experience!

name: The Sea Sauna
address: Tower Bay Beach Car Park, Quay, Portrane, Co. Dublin, K36 RX92, Ireland
reviews_text:
Visited Sauna Donabate on Sunday and honestly‚Ä¶ magical. I went on my own and ended up having such a deeply emotional and grounding experience, especially in the ice bath. There was something incredibly powerful about this space, the heat, the sea air, and then surrendering to the cold. I left feeling lighter, clearer, and so grateful. Highly recommend to anyone‚Äîwhether you come alone or with others. ‚ú® || What a great experience! The sauna itself offered beautiful views, and there were even cold water barrels outside for a refreshing dip. Just a heads-up, no phones are allowed inside.
The changing room is open to all, so definitely come prepared with your swimsuit under your clothes. Afterwards, there's a coffee truck right outside for drinks and snacks, which is super convenient." || We went to the Sea Sauna for the first time today and would highly recommend it! Location is stunning, there‚Äôs a lovely cliff walk with gorgeous views,a quiet beach great for swimming and a llthe carriage truck that does great food and coffee!

The sea sauna set-up itself is great- a really clever use of what is a small space, looking forward to seeing it expanded in the future!

Robin, the staff member on-site was fantastic, super knowledgeable, approachable and friendly which was great for us as non-regular sauna users! She was really on-top of keeping the saunas, plunge barrels and showers clean and at the right temps!

The box sauna itself was really enjoyable, clean, spacious and at a consistent temp. The view is the best I‚Äôve seen from a Dublin sauna! The showers and plunge barrels are well located, and although they can be busy we didn‚Äôt ever have to queue for more than 2 minutes for either.

The beach is a 3/4 minute walk away and is a lovely swim spot. There are a good few steps down and *lots* of seaweed on the shoreline but still, a fantastic place to go in between sauna sessions!

Lovely chill place to spend a Saturday morning/ afternoon and we will absolutely be back! || I had a wonderful experience at the sauna.
The staff were really friendly, especially Robin she was exceptionally kind and helpful. The atmosphere was relaxing. I can definitely recommend this place. || Fantastic place, really relaxing. Amazing views from the sauna. Owners keep them very clean and are super helpful, highly recommended.

name: Sea View Saunas
address: B√≥thar an Teampaill, An Inse, Co. Contae na M√≠, A92 A2P8, Ireland
reviews_text: The views from the sauna were spectacular. An amazing experience. Well worth the trip üëå || Seaview Sauna‚Äôs is best thing to come to laytown and Bettystown in a long time. To have this on our doorstep right beside the sea is a blessing. Sean is great to deal with and always so welcoming. Love coming down here || Visited here for the first time today. Sauna was perfect! Facilities really clean and owner was very welcoming. View from the sauna was amazing. Will definitely return again! || Wonderful barrel sauna by the coast in Laytown. Great setup and it's a lovely area with sea swimmers frequenting the beach and making use of the sauna. A great addition to the community promoting wellness culture. Recommend a visit. || Amazing evening sauna.  My skin was glowing, sea dipped 3 times and had the best sleep after. Very clean and the views are amazing. Will be a regular it‚Äôs such a boost to my health

name: The Sea View Sauna Shroove
address: The Sea View Sauna, Stroove, Shrove, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews_text:
We had a great time at the sauna. The facilities were clean and well-maintained, and the whole process‚Äîfrom booking to using the sauna‚Äîwas smooth and easy. The location is unbeatable, with a beautiful beach and clear water just steps away. A perfect way to relax and spend a Sunday afternoon. Highly recommend! || The sauna is well-maintained and perfectly heated. The surrounding landscape is absolutely stunning. I love going for a dip right after the heat. It‚Äôs incredibly refreshing. Highly recommended! || We had a great morning at Stroove beach, made even more special by our time in the Sauna and cold water.  Loved it as did my family. Darragh was a great host also.
Thank you. || Not our first time but great experience, easy booking, Martina couldn‚Äôt have been nicer and even let us stay on a few mins extra with no extra charge. Would highly recommend, looking forward to the next time already! || .. It is very convenient that there is a beach nearby, where after the sauna you can cool off in the ocean) There is a place where you can change clothes, after the sauna drink tea, sit at the table and watch the fur seals. They are frequent guests. Near the lighthouse and there is a trail where you can climb and see everything from the mountain where there is a more open ocean, beautiful waves and beautiful rocks. There are surfers here. Who wants to learn how to sing this place is suitable for them, for professionals this beach is small.
The minus is that there is no toilet in such a place

name: The Sea View Sauna Culdaff
address: Knock, Culdaff, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews_text: Fantastic experience..when we went for a swim and walked upto the sauna we were met and friendly greated.The sauna was all ready for us.We loved the gorgeous view and relaxing experience. Cappuccinos after from the coffee van across the road. Altogether a great time. Thank you.‚ù§Ô∏è || I visited the Sea View Sauna in Culdaff on Sunday. I was booked onto a shared session and had great fun with the others who attended. It was the perfect temperature and being able to go for a dip in the sea in between sessions was so invigorating. Great experience, would recommend! || Such a beautiful place for a healthy meet up with friends- the sauna is always tended to - you definitely get a warm Donegal welcome! - sweat it all out and then plunge into the Wild Atlantic healing waters of Culdaff - there's also an excellent coffee van at the car park or go into the Black Heart Cafe in the village for delicious home made breakfasts falafels and all sorts of cakes - no better way to heal yourself than regular saunas here üåäüíô || Had a lovely time. The sauna is clean and the host is a doll and keeps the fire well stocked up.  She was always on hand to answer the many questions we had as new comers.  Everyone using the Sauna was full of chat and really friendly.  Have used the sauna two weeks in a row now and couldn't be happier with the reception.  Top marks! || Really enjoyed the sauna, beautiful view, clean and perfect temperature!

name: The Boat Yard Sauna
address: Wicklow Harbour, Corporation Murragh, Wicklow, Ireland
reviews_text:
My Weekly Reset ‚Äì Absolute Gem by the Sea
The Boat Yard Sauna is hands down one of my favourite places. I go at least once a week and honestly, I‚Äôd go more if I could. The moment you step in, everything slows down. Sitting in the heat, looking out at the sea - it‚Äôs pure magic. That view alone is worth it.

The atmosphere is always calm and welcoming. The team are great, friendly, easygoing, and they clearly care about keeping the place clean and running well. It‚Äôs spotless every time.

What I really love is the people you meet. There‚Äôs something about sitting in a sauna, dripping sweat, that strips away pretense. Everyone‚Äôs just there to relax, unwind, and reset. It‚Äôs peaceful, grounding, and oddly social in the best way.

If you‚Äôre thinking about it - just go. You won‚Äôt regret it. || Such a lovely experience at the Boat Yard this evening. The facilities are top notch and the place is spotless. The sauna was the perfect temperature and the essence was lovely. We were very well looked after by a girl called Izzy :) || Warm welcome and introduction to the boat yard sauna from Callum. Loved the private sauna, changing areas and showers. The place was so clean and colourful with all the plants and scrubs. Like a spa experience. Sea access was easy too. Truthfully my best ever experience of sauna and sea. || This is one of the best places I have been for a sauna .

Magnificent views of the sea where it‚Äôs a short stroll for a dip

Table and bench to sit down and have a coffee before or after the sauna .

They have two showers üöø two ice cold fresh running water . Drinking filtered water .
A dry area to hang your dry robe.

Sauna hats are provided  to protect your hair .

Dave who own the business is very friendly and helpful. His sister is extremely friendly and welcoming.

I would highly recommend to try out this sauna experience.

If you buy 10 you get one free üòÅ || Unbelievable experience! The team down there really know their stuff and both saunas are spotless. I‚Äôve been to different saunas around the Dublin/Wicklow area, but the boat yard stands on its own with regard to overall experience!

name: Seawater Saunas
address: Strand Rd, Bray, Co. Wicklow, A98 N8N3, Ireland
reviews_text:
I live nearby so I thought I‚Äôd stop in to catch the sunrise in a sauna before working from home. And oh my gosh am I happy I did!! The place itself is beautiful and spotless clean. Catching the sunrise over the sea while warming up was such a peaceful way to start the day. Everything felt calm, clean, and thoughtfully set up. I‚Äôll definitely be back in the very near future!! What a great way to start the day. || This place is Magic.

We had an amazing morning in Seawater saunas Bray. This place is such a gem. We are visiting Ireland for a week and my in-laws organised this as a special treat. And what a treat it was. The place is spotless, 3 saunas with unbeatable vieuws(we were there for sunrise), lots of icebaths and a jacuzzi.

We have been to a lot of saunas but this one is by far the most luxureous one. More like a spa experience! Incredible value for money. || A charmingly peaceful place, with absolute discretion. Every sauna is unique and has a sea view. It is clean and has sufficient infrastructure. After the fantastic experience, you can immediately sit down next door for a good coffee or a pleasant lunch. I recommend the unforgettable experience for couples‚Äîcontemplating the sea from the wooden hot tub is a must for everyone. || Absolutely stunning views and great vibes but unfortunately it just doesn‚Äôt always feel clean. I‚Äôve been here a couple of times and it‚Äôs been hit and miss. The last time I was here I couldn‚Äôt see my hands in the hot tub because it was so foggy. The place felt like it needed a good clean and power hose ‚Ä¶. Won‚Äôt be returning.

There are many other saunas I would visit before here ü´† || What a great place! Such a great vibe, 3 types of sauna (brilliant to have a quiet sauna as well) and the view is stunning! The cold plunges could be colder for my taste but it's probably due to the heatwave.

name: The Hot Box Sauna Graiguenamanagh
address: The Quay, Tinnahinch, Graiguenamanagh-Tinnahinch, Co. Kilkenny, R95 X635, Ireland
reviews_text:
Amazing experience and so welcoming. Nice relaxed atmosphere and great to have 3 options of cold water! Sauna is a great size and a fab view over the river || Had an excellent session at The Hot Box Sauna in Graiguenamanagh. The sauna itself is top-class ‚Äî clean, well-maintained, and perfectly positioned by the water for a refreshing dip after. Special mention to Keith for the great service ‚Äî welcoming, friendly, and made sure everything was spot on from start to finish. Highly recommend it if you‚Äôre in the area and looking for a proper sauna experience. Will definitely be back! || Absolutely love this place, have been here several times and I bring visitors & family too. Gorgeous location, friendly and very helpful staff. Lovely place to go for  a walk & lunch afterwards || The Hotbox Sauna in Graiguenamanagh is a winner for me. The setting is stunning, right on the river barrow, and the whole place has a peaceful, grounded atmosphere that makes it easy to switch off and drop into the moment. The heat is perfect, the cold plunge is revitalising, and the overall setup feels really well thought out. For some reason it just hits me better than other Saunas, I travel well out of my way to use this one, even though there are several that a closer.

Keith is a fantastic host warm, welcoming, and genuinely passionate about creating a great experience for everyone who comes through the door. You can tell he cares about the small details, and it makes all the difference.

I always leave feeling clear-headed, with a new perspective. || Brilliant experience! Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. All areas were so clean and accessible to everyone. Overall great experience and will definitely be coming back for more dips!!

name: The Barrel Sauna Greystones
address: The Boat Yard (beside La Cr√™perie, Beach Rd, Rathdown Lower, Greystones, Co. Wicklow, Ireland
reviews_text:
This is my husband and I's favorite place to go for a sauna. They are always super friendly and have a very welcoming environment. It is always clean, there are many changing rooms, and a nice bathroom on site. I love the multiple different cold plunges- all with ranging temperatures. This past Saturday my husband and I booked in and when we arrived there was no one there(there had been a mix up in scheduling). They were very apologetic, refunded us, and gave us 2 passes to use in the future. I was very pleased with this! I will definitely be coming back and I recommend 100%! || Hands down the best Barrell Sauna spot around. Amazing atmosphere, and feel to it with incense burning, gorgeous greenery all around.

Extremely clean, snacks, and the owner is incredibly kind and accommodating- always trying to create best experience for you and he has a great attention to detail

Some photos below ‚ù§Ô∏èüôÇ || Best sauna in Greystones! Had the best experience and the facilities are fantastic. Loads of changing rooms, lockers to store your things, cold showers and 2 plunge pools that you can use throughout your visit. Feels very private and has a lovely relaxing vibe. Also in very close proximity to Burrito Box and Roots for a nice lunch or juice afterwards.

Would 100% recommend and will definitely be going back. Staff were lovely as well and were super understanding and accommodating when we were running a bit late for our session. || Great way to start a Sunday, easily the best sauna I've been to in Ireland so far. Was 90 degrees the first time we went in this morning and we were in the first slot of the day. Easy to have a dip across the road in Greystones harbour before hand too. Very clean and a great set up overall.

Will definitely be back! || Absolutely love the Barrel in Greystones. The botanical indoor outdoor feel makes for a cosy vibe no matter the weather. The facilities are the best around; the saunas are always hot and showers, barrels and temperature controlled cold baths mean you can curate your hot and cold therapy exactly as you want. Gorgeous incense burning helps to calm the mind. Always such a consistently nice visit to the Barrel and looking forward to the next one ü•∞

name: Sauna Sessions
address: Timahoe Road, Stradbally, Co. Laois, Ireland
reviews_text:
I have visited a couple of times and want to share my overall opinion after several visits.

They have two saunas - one is a good bit hotter than the other. So you have options to choose from. This can lead to the hotter one being fuller though.

The river being used as the cold plunge is excellent and obviously will never get full - this is a highlight and adds to the uniqueness of this place

Toilets have been added at the back - this is a welcomed addition.

The shared changing rooms are on the smaller side and fill up rather quickly - staggered welcome times might assist with this.

A hot tub was roasting and really enjoyable - a proper treat after the cold plunge on a winters day

They have plenty of seating around a fire pit, cold showers and drop buckets also

A great sauna that I‚Äôll visit again || This is a genuine review.

Really nice setup - cold shower, buckets, swimming area, and a lovely Finnish style sauna üî• The only things that let it down is that the toilet is located about 100m away, is locked, and a member of staff has to take you there. The parking situation isn‚Äôt great either as there isn‚Äôt enough of it, and the carpark is very muddy. However the sauna itself is top notch üëå

Edit: 30/09 after my second visit. Great value at ‚Ç¨15 for an hour, and the recent addition of the wood fired hot tub is very nice! The sauna is also very clean. I'd give 4.5 stars if I could - all that's missing is a toilet, because you know, nature calls.

Edit: 23/12, Really nice experience visiting after dark when it's all lit up ‚ú®Ô∏è and the fire is going üî• Plenty of parking now too, albeit a bit muddy at this time of year. || I had an amazing experience at the sauna sessions nestled deep in the forest. The place is incredibly peaceful and quiet  the only sounds come from the gentle rustling of the trees and the nearby waterfall. The natural surroundings create the perfect atmosphere for relaxation and mindfulness. The sauna itself was cozy, clean, and beautifully designed to blend with nature. The staff are amazing. || A True Return to Nature
I‚Äôve tried many saunas, but nothing compares to the Sauna Sessions at Stradbally experience. The commitment to sustainability isn't just a marketing gimmick‚Äîit‚Äôs woven into the entire design. Being out in the fresh air, surrounded by the peaceful Stradbally countryside, instantly drops your stress levels before you even step inside. The heat is deep, clean, and perfectly managed by the sauna experts. I want to express my heartfelt gratitude to Marius for his professionalism and genuine care for the guests. His dedication to making sure we are well taken care of truly makes a difference. You can tell this isn't just a barrel plopped down; this is a meticulously designed space for healing and relaxation. For anyone who cherishes nature and wants a truly conscious wellness experience, this is the only place to go. I felt renewed, recharged, and immediately booked my next session. You will absolutely keep coming back after your first try. || One of the best sauna experiences I've had. The setting is just incredible and the views from the sauna and the hot tub just spectacular. The layout and the whole feel of the place is very special.  I'll definitely be going back üôè

name: Sandycove Sauna by the Sea
address: 17 Sandycove Point, Sandycove, Dublin, A96 Y165, Ireland
reviews_text:
Mixed review, the good points first:
Nice staff
Nice view
Easy access from city for a short day trip.

Not so good:
Heat is definitely not as hot as others i have used. However this may be part of it's unique style as a caravan vs purpose built sauna barrel etc.
Little on the expensive side for what it is.

So for newbies to sauna I would recommend but anyone looking for intense heat, try elsewhere. Nice visit for tourist to pass a few hours from city centre. || Wonderful little sauna i found the tempeture really good  even bwttee was the lovely lad who was full of knowledge and very welcoming...it seems people would rather complain about bottled water  than there experience     it aint state of the art but perfectl location right on the sea..absolute  pleasure   i suppose u cant please the public. Dnt let one or two bad remarks  put u off having a nice experience. try it for yoursel..the  competiors envy is real.. || Similar thoughts to another reviewer.
This feels like an absolute cash-grab. 20‚Ç¨ for an hour is well too expensive for what you get.

Major problems are:
1. The sauna itself:
- It is not well insulated.
- The door doesn't shut properly so there is a
cold draft coming in constantly.
- Single glazed window saps the heat out of the
sauna.
- Lack of cleanliness from the floor and the
boards you sit on.
- No thermometer.
- No double door/porch area so when someone
leaves the sauna all the heat is sucked out.
- Most saunas you can last max 15
minutes but here I spent the whole 1 hour
session in the sauna without needing a break.
It felt like a warm room with cold drafts rather
than a sauna.
2. Amenities:
- no showers,
- no toilets or sinks
- no lockers
- no changing rooms
- no taps to refill water
- no plunge pool. There is the sea which is
great but for 20 euro there should at least be
an in-house shower

Positives: small coffee shop in there and staff are nice.

Would not return. || This review is about sustainability only! ‚ò∫Ô∏è

I was disappointed to see the sale of plastic bottled water on the premises. Especially a mere stone‚Äôs throw from the beach.

By 2050, there will be more plastic in the ocean than fish. Over 95% of the plastic that we create, use, and even intentionally recycle, does not actually get recycled. Instead, it ends up in landfills, incinerators, and in our waters. It then breaks down into micro plastics, which are having a profoundly negative effect on human health, let alone other species.

The ancient global (and local) tradition of sauna and sweat lodge has no place for plastics. In fact, it feels antithetical to the practice at large.

I wonder if instead you could at least sell aluminum, canned water, as aluminum can be infinitely recycled. But selling plastics to those who have come to enjoy a very place that is being degraded by plastics, feels misguided.

Thank you for considering how to run this sauna more sustainably. I had a wonderful time here, and the service was friendly. But surely there is a way to better align sauna philosophy and wisdom with sustainability efforts. Our earth can‚Äôt wait. || 5 stars to this amazing located Sauna. Friendly and helpful staff and literally just in front of Sandycove Beach and just a minute's walk from Forty Foot. Definitely, the installation can be renewed with time and move stuff around so the Sauna window could actually point out to the beach instead of the coffee shop. (Just a suggestion) The place has so much potential and I wish them the best of luck with its service.

name: Sauna and Sea
address: strand, Portstewart BT55 7LY, UK
reviews_text:
10/10 recommend.  Fantastic set-up on one of the best beaches on the North Coast.  Sander is such a welcoming host.  The sheltered changing area is brilliant for a bit of extra privacy / shelter from the elements.

This is my favourite sauna layout&I've been in a fair few!  The L-shaped bench is great for chatting with friends / family while you sauna and enjoy the views out of the huge window!

The deck chairs are a great idea for folk to relax and cool off on if you don't want the cold water contrast.

A sauna is my favourite way of catching up with friends and the social saunas are great for meeting new folk.  Delighted with the extended opening hours over the Xmas period.

Get yourself booked in! || I joined a social sauna on a cool summer Friday morning  and I can't say enough amazing things about it. It was a lovely time with four others. I enjoyed every second of the experience. Sander, the man in charge was friendly and helpful. Would do again. Thank you! || We had a fantastic time on 3rd Jan 26. Outside it was very cold, hailing and windy which made the in between swims all the more exhilarating.  Brilliant day for the family.  We have done it several times now and would highly recommend. || I can highly recommend this beautiful Sauna. Such a great set-up with an enclosed area at the back of the sauna where you can get changed in privacy, hang up your clothes and grab a drink from the water dispenser.
Probably one of the best saunas I've been too, the view is stunning and the staff are so welcoming and friendly. || Great experience at Sauna and Sea. Lovely setup; and Sander is a great host who let us stay on as long as we wanted, because there was no booking after our slot. Felt amazing afterwards. Highly recommend!! üôèüèªü§©

name: Tinte√°n Sauna
address: Burgage More, Blessington, Co. Wicklow, W91 HFX3, Ireland
reviews_text:
First Time visiting and definitely won't be the last! Grace was a great host, super friendly and had a great playlist playing for us! Stunning views || Great wood burning sauna with a beautiful view over Lake Blessington. Temps got to over 100 degrees inside, followed by a nice 8 degree cold plunge. The cold plunge buckets felt a bit awkward to get in & out of though. There were only 4 of us inside which was perfect, I think if it was at full capacity (8) it would be a bit of a squeeze. All in all, great experience and I would definitely be back. Oh and the pizza next door is also worth a mention. || Incredible !!! The sauna temperature perfect. The plunges were amazing and the showers.

The views are out of this world.

Every detail was thought of. The people running it are so kind. Well be back again and again thank you !!!! || Really good experience here. View is amazing and staff (Grace) very helpful. Will definitely be back || Had a brilliant time at this Sauna, Ice baths and hot saunas. 10/10 would recommend to everyone. And they have the best staff. Really friendly and so helpful with information about things to do in the local area

name: Graiguecullen Swimming Pool
address: The Numbers, Graigue, Carlow, Co. Carlow, Ireland
reviews_text: Tis a grand ole spot for a steam i didnt use the pool ...but the people and the experience i had were just grand out. I left fresh and revived || Nice staff clean pool could do with better shower and changing  facilities otherwise great || Stopped off at this pool while on the way to Gorey. This swimming pool is not too far outside Carlow town centre, it has a small pool, a sauna, and steam room. The lockers and changing area are right beside the pool side. The price is similar to other leisure centres, ‚Ç¨11.50 for 1 child and 1 adult per hour. From what I gather there's no staying in this pool beyond the time paid for. The building in the past used to be a school and it converted to a swimming pool, you'll see this on your visit. Wasn't bad visit but wasn't really anything special either but ideal if you like to swim. || Friendly staff, very well run and exceptional service || Lovely clean water, perfect temp. Advise to ring beforehand as lessons do be on

name: The Nook Sauna
address: Drumnagran, Tullyvin, Co. Cavan, H16 VH66, Ireland
reviews_text: This is a haven in the tranquil Cavan countryside. The vibe is so modern and peaceful. The natural rolling countryside views are mindful escapes framed by the beautiful wildflower bedscape. The place is always spotless. It is nice to move between the outdoor showers, plunge pool, and river to cool off between sauna sessions. Must go if you‚Äôre in the area! || An amazing facility for the area, absolutely worth a trip if you‚Äôre curious and haven‚Äôt visited a sauna before. The sauna was hot, about‚ÄØ80‚ÄØ¬∞C after a splash of water, the scenery was beautiful and peaceful, and the shower temperature was perfect after a wee swim between the dipping areas in the river. Overall, a fantastic experience! || Mark has a fabulous place here. The sauna and ice bath are super. Everything is absolutely spotless. The river Annalee is great for a swim. And if you have time grab a tea or coffee afterwards with delicious treats on site. || This is the best, cleanest and most relaxing sauna/ice plunge experience I have ever had. Everyone is so friendly and help to create a beautiful environment set on stunning grounds. || We went for around an hour and even though it was just a short visit it was very relaxing! The view out the sauna window is stunning and the river next to it is perfect for a dip - we‚Äôll definitely be back.

name: √âal√∫ Sauna
address: Cortober, Cootehill, Co. Cavan, H16 Y067, Ireland
reviews_text:
Fantastic experience in √âal√∫ this evening. We go to a sauna every weekend and this was one of the best equipped ones. I love that it has its own ice bath (not like the many that use a lake/river nearby), this place also has its own shower and it's own toilet. The inside changing rooms are a great asset too. Oh and my favourite part, the essential oils in the sauna! Bliss! || We had a beautifully relaxing hour with the place all to ourselves in the late evening which was nice. The lighting and soft romantic music playing in the background while we got our sweat on was magical. The cold dunk was also spot on with the option of a cold shower if you wish. We availed of all and it was just exactly what we needed after our workout in the early morning to soften our muscles. Then straight to bed for the most amazing sleep ive had in a while. We woke this morning totally refreshed. We highly recommend this venue for its peace and tranquility, and of course, the privacy. Thankyou √âal√∫ team, you are a Top notch service provider. || Peaceful, beautifully designed in a place surrounded by nature. The sauna was very clean, cozy, and had a lovely view through the large window. An ideal place to relax and recharge and offers complimentary fresh fruit and water which is lovely- really recommend! || Fantastic experience in the cold plunge and sauna. First experience for us all and it definitely won‚Äôt be our last. Andrea and Mark were brilliant hosts and made us feel very welcome. Beautiful grounds for a very chilled and relaxing experience. Can‚Äôt wait for our next visit! || 5 stars
Absolutely loved our visit to √âal√∫. The sauna area was fantastic. The atmosphere is so peaceful, making it easy to unwind. The location is fabulous, offering a perfect balance of nature and comfort. An unexpected but much-appreciated bonus was the BBQ setup by Mark, which added a warm, communal touch to the experience. Highly recommend for anyone looking to relax and recharge. Mark, Andrea and Niamh are so welcoming and friendly. Will definitely visit again.

name: Live Lagom Sauna
address: Annagh Lake, Annagh, Co. Cavan, Ireland
reviews_text:
A magical spot with soul!
Live Lagom Sauna by Annagh Lake is an absolute gem. The peaceful lake view, the sounds of nature, and the cozy wooden sauna create the perfect atmosphere to unwind and recharge. Everything was clean, well-maintained, and thoughtfully designed. It‚Äôs not just a sauna ‚Äì it‚Äôs a full slow-living experience. Highly recommended for anyone in need of true relaxation !! || Amazing sauna experience. Didi, one of the owners, is always asking how you feel, and if the temperature is ok, which is so important for newbies like me. Annagh Lake has changing rooms and a sandy beach, which was stunning with last weekends weather. Great experience, highly recommend to everyone to try out. Will never go to another sauna || Very clean, well kept sauna. Lovely essential oils smell radiating in the air. Undercover area to get changed in. Very friendly service from the owner Didi.
We're lucky to have this amenity in Cootehill, along with great coffee in the nearby walkabout cafe.
Check it out, you won't regret it! || We have been a few times now and each visit lives up to our expectations. Always greeted with a smile from Didi and people are always up for a chat making for a great atmosphere. A swim in the river is a perfect cool off between sauna sessions.
Also well located for a walk and coffee afterwards ! || Fantastic sauna at Annagh Lake. Clean and cosy and right on the shore. Changing area beside it. Lovely people running it and will definitely be back to them!

name: Outdoor sauna and leisure
address: Church St, Portaliff Or Townparks, Killashandra, Co. Cavan, H12 AY01, Ireland
reviews_text:
Had a lovely refreshing visit to Outdoor Sauna and Leisure Killeshandra. Paddy was flexible on my arrival time. The facilities are excellent and very clean. The sauna and plunge are great with fantastic views over the lake and dedicated space to swim in the lake also. Look forward to visiting again soon || Padraig was very welcoming and showed me around the facilities here. It‚Äôs a fantastic spot to relax and watch beautiful nature all around you. The views from the sauna & jacuzzi are incredible, they are overlooking a stunning lough with access for swimming. Highly recommend and great value for money. Will definitely be back. Regards Alan. || Brilliant recovery spot complete with very cold showers and cold water on plunge if you want. Lake also there but sliders needed for lake || Absolutely perfect. Both the Hot Tub and Shauna were at perfect temperature for our arrival. And Padraig was brilliant and let us go between both.
The area is beautiful, there are changing rooms and a toilet. A great cold plunge (or the lake) and a COLD shower.
Fantastic experience. We‚Äôll find a reason to be back this way to go again! || Myself and my girlfriend are just back from it. The guy who runs it is a gent. Very relaxing and enjoyable, I would bring swim socks for the lake, but would highly reccomend.

name: Lakeside Saunas Virginia
address: LAKESIDE MANOR HOTEL, Dublin Road, Burrenrea, Virginia, Co. Cavan, A82 YH30, Ireland
reviews_text: Lakeside Saunas were an amazing experience. Ronan and Tony were very friendly and accommodating ! Sitting in a sauna on a lake looking out the window at the water was a serene and surreal experience. 10/10 experience. || Booked a private sauna, with 7 friends, had a fab, fun and relaxing time. Staff are really friendly and the floating sauna is amazing. || Gorgeous setting on Lough Ramor - sauna is spacious, clean, and the perfect temperature. The changing rooms are cute & the cold plunge barrels and ladders into the lake make the location perfect with options for everyone. Ideal to be beside the Lakeside Manor for a bite to eat afterwards also. || Fantastic experience, very reasonably priced and in a beautiful spot. Ronan is a gent, couldn‚Äôt recommend this more. || Proper sauna. Super easy to book. Sublime serene atmosphere. Can't beat getting your sweat on and swimming in the lake.

name: The Sauna Society
address: Tudenham Shore, Lough Ennell Caravan Park, Carrick, Carrickwood, Co. Westmeath, N91 P798, Ireland
reviews_text: Great sauna! Located on a lake walking track. Comfortably fits all 7 participants in each session. Good value and the cold bucket, cold shower and plunge pools pair well with the sauna. Changing facilities onsite too || We had a great experience here today at The Sauna Society. The sauna itself was an ideal temperature of about 90 degrees. The combination of that with the cold plunge pools, shower, and ice bucket made it a very enjoyable experience. Handy that there are also changing facilities too. Highly recommend and looking forward to coming back soon! || What an amazing Autumn experience. This was the first time myself and my partner went and it was well worth it. From the amazing atmosphere with a lovely fireplace outdoors to friendly staff, it exceeded my expectations. There are two cold plunge pools, one shower and an ice bucket all to finish with the fabulous sauna.  Definitely worth it. || Truly such a gorgeous set up. A great way to spend an evening / afternoon. Such lovely staff as well to top it all off - Helen was welcoming, knowledgeable and supportive! || Amazing sauna in the woods right in front of the lake. Very new and fresh, the view is unbeatable. There‚Äôs a cold stream right next to it, a bucket with cold water and two cold water baths. Good changing rooms and a seating area for afterwards. And there is a great walk along the lake here too. Highly recommend and will come back!

name: Farnham Estate Spa and Golf Resort, Cavan
address: Paddock, Cavan, Ireland
summary: 16th-century property offering refined rooms and suites and a golf course, plus free Wi-Fi.
reviews_text:
We have attended Farnham the past few years to celebrate our anniversary, birthdays, any occasion really. Our recent stay at Farnham Estate was nothing short of magical, and it will forever hold a very special place in our hearts. During our visit, my partner had planned a surprise engagement that staff were in on and made happen, we got engaged down by the lake just the two of us. It was a beautiful walk down and the lake itself was breathtaking.

From the moment we arrived back, the staff went above and beyond to make our stay unforgettable. Every single person we encountered was warm, attentive and genuinely delighted to be part of our celebration. The level of care and thoughtfulness we received was exceptional.

The special treatment we were given made us feel so valued and celebrated, with little touches of glasses of champagne throughout the day,  that showed just how much pride the team takes in creating memorable experiences for their guests. Nothing was too much trouble, even when we had to make a last minute adjustment to our dinner time. We even got a tour of the grounds on how weddings are planned in Farnham, kindly organised by Danielle and given by the hotel manager Colm. They really were able to paint a picture on how magical our wedding day would look.

We cannot recommend Farnham highly enough and will cherish our engagement there forever. We are already looking forward to returning to relive the magic all over again hopefully on our wedding day. || We stayed here for my wife's birthday and I must say it was an amazing experience all the staff were lovely and they made a great effort for her birthday. We had dinner in both restaurants and the food was amazing.
The hole experience was really relaxing and lovely.
Just one thing they could fix is the pool temperature was just bit too cold and some of the showers in the steam room didn't work. || Spent 2 nights here and loved it. The only thing I would suggest is the cellar bar is quite small to host live music and you have to be lucky to get a table where the music is being played (which we did on our 2nd night) maybe there is something to be done in the future to expand it?
The food, the pool, the forest walk and the staff were all lovely. Will definitely look to return at some stage. || I returned to Farnham Estate with my mother during the week. We had a really enjoyable stay at this hotel. The staff were warm and welcoming from the moment we arrived. Our room was clean, comfortable, and with everything we needed for a pleasant visit.

Dinner and breakfast was delicious with plenty of choice, and the service was consistently friendly. The presentation of our dinner in the Cedar Rooms was notably beautiful.

There was a small hiccup during our stay when the boiler had an issue, which meant the water was cold for a while. I understand these things happen. The outdoor pool was also closed on the evening which we used the thermal suite facilities. This was rectified on the morning in which we checked out.

Overall, we really enjoyed our time here and would happily stay again. The hotel has a lot of charm, great service, and a welcoming feel that makes it easy to recommend. || I was really disappointed with our recent stay at this hotel having stayed there 16 years ago and been really impressed. Unfortunately the service has really declined. Very long wait times at the bar for a drink and some simple fixes for this that are not being optimised like young untrained staff who were having to hop up on counter tops to reach for bottles at the top of cabinets and/or being unable to slide open the bar display door. It's also not kept clean. We noticed at lunch time chips had been dropped on the floor and went back to the bar 5 hours later and they were still there but had been mashed into the floor due to being walked on repeatedly by staff and guests.

We waited 50mins for our dinner in the bar (having only ordered burgers). Staff apologized after realizing our dinner order was forgotten but only after we highlighted this but then took a further 15 minutes to receive food. Most of the staff are young school going teenagers.

Dinner in Maxwell's did not reflect the price point. We received our starters before our wine then I found a hair in my steak and when returned to me was reheated and burnt to a crisp and I had lost my appetite at this point too.

Breakfast is plentiful and breakfast staff are pleasant however I ordered poached egg from the menu the second morning and this took 40mins to come and when it did was more like two boiled eggs, completely hard.

The grounds are beautiful, the bed is extremely comfortable and the complimentary water is a nice bonus. However I could not recommend a stay based on how it's currently run, which is such a shame.

name: The Hidden Haven
address: Corcaghan, Co. Monaghan, Ireland
reviews_text: Just what the doctor ordered after a night at Hughies whilst we were staying in the schoolhouse next door for a hen party. Great facilities and lovely staff ||

name: Sauna Huts
address: Cortober, Carrick-On-Shannon, Co. Leitrim, Ireland
reviews_text:
I can‚Äôt recommend Saunahuts enough. From the very beginning Egis was very patient giving helpful advice on sauna choice and base requirements. Communication was excellent and the sauna was delivered promptly after assembly. This is where you should spend your money rather than other suppliers with inferior products. || So I absolutely love my sauna from Suanahuts. Egis was fantastic to deal with along the way and very transparent with any details of the sauna process. If you were looking for a Sauna, I would highly recommend Sauna huts. || We recently purchased a sauna from Saunahuts. Egis was a pleasure to deal with and the quality of the sauna is exceptional. Egis was fantastic to deal with and we discussed the specific size and dimensions and he was able to find a model that was perfect. He came and installed it and the did an excellent job. Couldn't recommend enough! || Delighted with the sauna, Egis was excellent to deal with and I would be happy to recommend him. || Real pleasure to deal with these professionals.
Great service and product even better.
I do highly recommend.

name: Aqua Sana Forest Spa County Longford
address: Center Parcs Longford Forest, Newcastle Road, Newcastle, Ballymahon, Co. Longford, Ireland
reviews_text: An absolutely fantastic time had here. Lovely staff and a really chill, easy going approach while still providing a high end spa experience. With a single entry you can access all 21 Spa Services as well as two complimentary Spa Experiences and access to the Spa Restaurant, not open directly to the public. Changing rooms are well designed and offer lovely additional touches such as swim suit drying machines. The food is excellent and highly recommended. There are numerous Steam and Sauna options, as well as relaxation rooms. The pool is a lovely indoor/outdoor infinity pool with lovely views of the forest. I would recommend one of the package options which includes a meal and drinks. || I highly recommend visiting this place. My experience was delightful in everything. Rest, food, place, everything is excellent. That place I don't want to leave. I will definitely come many more times. Special thanks to Liz, I've never seen the staff more friendly and kind. || Loving this place,need time away just to switch off or spend time with your family? Aqua sana Forest Spa is the place to be. I was surprised to see different eateries, water spots,zip lining,mini golf park,tennis court,cycling, a big spa with alot of different things to do in it not just the usual things we are used to in a Spa. There's a restaurant in the spa,mind blowing. I will be coming back soon. Love this place. || Really amazing place, we were especially lucky with the weather as well. You can truly relax and forget about the routine of life or your phone, hence not many pictures. The place is beautiful and well maintained. Great variety of saunas and steam rooms, my favourite was Salt Steam Room‚ò∫Ô∏è Would definitely go back for a longer stay. || One of the nicest spa experiences I have ever been too and I have been to quite a few. All of the staff were so friendly and helpful. The free sound bath/skincare/meditation sessions are such a nice bonus to the relaxing day. The combination of indoor and outdoor experiences is a nice touch. Cannot recommend this place enough‚ò∫Ô∏è

name: River Fane Retreat
address: Moyles, Co. Monaghan, A91 FY04, Ireland
reviews_text:
Highly recommend! Accommodation had everything we needed. Host was very accommodating and gave us some milk for our coffee the next morning. The site is beautiful and everything was well maintained and spotless. Really loved the pizza oven and the beautiful lights onto the river :) it shows that the hosts have put a lot of thought and work into making this place so special || So wonderfully created, it's a place engineered to precision but lavished with love

The silence beat of seclusion combined with the hum of the jacuzzi, the splashing of the river and the heat of the fire.

It was truly wonderful. I went stressed and uptight but as time passed, it was a total change of mood. As soon as I left the deep deep plunge and laid back in the hot tub I was not in any part of Ireland I have ever been before

The host was so thorough and kind with advice and suggestions. You can just feel this kind energy and love, it is a place where care is gardened and you as a guest really get to harvest a wonderful time || A very unique and special retreat. Great attention to detail that you'll make you feel in a wonderland and never want to leave. A overwhelming feeling of relaxation and peace. We were there only one evening but it really stopped our clocks.
Very accommodating hosts with everything very well explained.
We will be back for sure.
Tania and Janet üòä || Excellent retreat with great decorations and beautiful scenery. Lots of facilities and the outdoor pizza oven was fab. Great privacy. Hosts were lovely too, very welcoming when showing us around. Would definitely recommend to friends, family and others. || Beautiful views of green fields, and so tranquil just listening to the waves of the river pass by the cottage. Amenities are clearly well looked after and everything was sitting ready to use for our arrival! A gorgeous retreat for a one night stay, would 100% stay again for a couple of nights.

name: Cavan Crystal Hotel
address: Dublin Rd, Pollamore Near, Cavan, H12 P6E5, Ireland
summary: Modern lodging offering free Wi-Fi and breakfast, plus an indoor pool and a fine-dining restaurant
reviews_text:
Hotel is in a very good location, easy access, lots of parking. Close to the very busy road but when you‚Äôre inside it‚Äôs very tranquil. Very warm welcome at the reception. Our room was exceptionally clean and spacious, lots of storage room, very spacious bathroom. My only complaint, no towel racks, plenty of towels provided, but we just don‚Äôt like to waste them. And definitely there‚Äôs enough room to put a small fridge. We enjoyed our dinner at the bar, food great, service absolutely fantastic. Overall it‚Äôs an absolute gem in Cavan town with superb hospitality. || I booked the 1 night Bed & Breakfast with Dinner. Got checked in nice and quickly and the room was lovely. Jamie on Reception helped bring my luggage up to the room as I had alot and a baby to carry. He was generally very kind and friendly.
Dinner was 10/10 as per usual and all the staff in the Bar were lovely.
Breakfast was also brilliant.
I used the pool with my daughter in the evening and used the jacuzzi and the sauna in the morning before breakfast.
The only thing I'd say is the jacuzzi wasn't very hot but more luke warm. Still the jets were powerful amd the staff down in the leisure centre were friendly and helpful.
Will deffinetly be returning üòä || This is the best location to stay in Cavan - the staff, facilities, food is excellent.
Rooms, bathroom and furnishings are spotless.
Staff are wonderful and very attentive.
Breakfast and evening meals are quality and impressive in portions and taste.
Will be returning soon
Thanks to all involved. || Even over the Christmas break, I was able to get in a swim before breakfast. Best breakfast tea I‚Äôve had in a long time.
Good lunch menu. Best to make a reservation as it‚Äôs a popular spot. || Very clean.
Very comfortable
Easy to find
Big carpark
Enormous beds and  rooms
Great lunch and evening food nut slightly let fown by weak breakfast service when eggs were over cooked. Tomato, raw and plates cold.  I was in a hurry to leave or id have sent the breakfast back.

name: Live Lagom Sauna
address: 47RX+3R location on N87, Lake Car Park, Brackley, Bawnboy, Co. Cavan, Ireland
reviews_text:
A peaceful escape with a personal touch
The Live Lagom Sauna at Brackley Lake is a true hidden gem. The location is absolutely breathtaking ‚Äì right by the water, surrounded by nature. The sauna itself is beautifully crafted, warm, and welcoming. What made the experience even more special was Didi ‚Äì his calm energy and attention to detail make you feel truly cared for. The contrast of heat and cold lake plunges left me feeling completely refreshed. Can‚Äôt wait to come back!

name: Cavan Massage at The Sanctuary Holistic Studio
address: 1B, Glenside Rd, Kilnavara, Cavan, H12 PP62, Ireland
reviews_text:
Recently got an alignment of Jan at the clinic. It really was transformative and a great spiritual journey. I didn‚Äôt realise I needed it so much until I had it. She created a safe space for me and I left feeling amazing. Thanks :) || From start to finish, the experience was exceptional. The space was calming, Jan was knowledgeable and caring, and the massage addressed exactly what my body needed. I noticed real relief in my tension and stress. I will definitely be returning.
Thank you so much Jan || I had an incredible massage this morning. and I can hosestly say it was one of the best I‚Äôve ever had. from the moment it started, she made me feel completely relaxed and comfortable.  Her technique was perfect firm in all the right places yet soothing and calming throughout  you can tell she really cares about her work and takes pride in helping  her clients feel their best. || My experience in Sanctuary Holistic Studio  was amazing. Jan made me feel so relaxed and comfortable. At massage time I had a goosebumps all over my body, that was amazing feeling. At the end of massage my tears went over my cheeks, it was feeling like my body said thank you for this massage. If you want to release physical or emotional tension you definitely have to meet Jan. Highly recommended, it‚Äôs a best massage and stress therapy in Cavan. Thanks a lot Jan for your job, it was awesome. See you soon! || üåüüåüüåüüåüüåü

I‚Äôve been living in Ireland for 4 years and tried many massage places around Cavan, but nothing helped ‚Äî until I found her!

She is truly amazing, professional and has magic hands. I finally felt real relief and deep relaxation.

Highly recommended! Thank you from the bottom of my heart!

name: Slieve Russell Hotel Golf & Country Club
address: Cranaghan, Ballyconnell, Co. Cavan, H14 FE03, Ireland
summary: Country resort offering stylish rooms with free WiFi, restaurants, golf course and an indoor pool.
reviews_text:
From the moment we arrived, this hotel impressed us with its beautiful, spacious bedrooms and fantastic facilities ‚Äî but what truly made our stay unforgettable was the incredible food.

Our dinner was a highlight of the entire trip. The starter, a beautifully presented salad topped with perfectly crisp lamb croquettes, was fresh, flavourful, and plated with real attention to detail. The main course was just as impressive: a perfectly cooked fillet of seabass. Every bite was balanced and delicious. And dessert was the perfect finale.

The dining experience alone is worth staying here for. Combined with the elegant rooms and excellent amenities. Highly recommended ‚Äî we can‚Äôt wait to come back! || Fantastic 2 days, food was delicious. Staff were amazing. The South African girl in the Summit restaurant (didn‚Äôt catch her name) she was so attentive and lovely with the kids. The breakfast staff were also lovely. Kudos to the night porter who was unbelievably helpful when my son became unwell I would like to thank him but again didn‚Äôt get his name he was working on the night of the 25th and really couldn‚Äôt do enough for us. Room 204 was fabulous for a family of 5. Very spacious. Leisure centre was clean and warm. The spa is unbelievable ! Thermal suite was closed for maintenance but we honestly didn‚Äôt need it as we were relaxed enough after wonderful massages. We will definitely be back. Please thank the night porter from me I would have loved to see him before we left to thank him myself. || I booked the Slieve as a present for my partner and paid extra for use of the spa. The ‚Äúfoot spa‚Äù was more like a sink and you controlled the temperate yourself (in comparison to other spas that have foot spas which generally have jets and the water fills up itself and drains). The salt room also didn‚Äôt work. The tropical shower was supposed to light up but they were not working and one of the buttons didn‚Äôt work. The lift to our room was not accessible on x2 occasions as when we tried to get to our room as staff left large laundry trolleys inside them leaving no room for us to stand inside. When we did get to our room for the first time after check in, there were empty alcohol bottles and glasses lying outside the door. I sent an email as general feedback, stating areas of concern as stated above and areas that were great, such as the summit restaurant aswell as the bar. The hotel manager stated their apologies and said if I paid for another room and return to the Slieve, they‚Äôd offer the spa for free. It‚Äôs worth noting the price offered for a second stay was actually more than what I originally paid. I had said I was not keen to pay a large sum of money yet again to stay, just to get free access to the spa which was disappointing regardless. I asked kindly if, since they were going to offer free use of the spa on another occasion, they could instead refund us the cost of the spa given a lot of the facilities weren‚Äôt working. They declined this and said their ‚Äúoffer of goodwill‚Äù was the only option as a refund for the spa was ‚Äúnot appropriate‚Äù. I genuinely would have considered returning to the Slieve with the intentions of giving a second chance incase of just getting them on a bad day - like I said, my initial email was sent for feedback purposes. However the way management handled this situation has entirely put us off. Therefore we will no longer be returning and definitely will not be recommending it to anyone. || My partner surprised me with 2 nights stay here for engagement and it was just fantastic! We couldn‚Äôt get over how friendly and helpful the staff were. The manager Georgina was so lovely and spent time with us showing us the rooms used for their weddings. She is an absolute credit to the place and because of Georgina we have provisionally booked our wedding there for 2027ü•∞Also I am coeliac and I have to say the food in both restaurants here is just incredible. We absolutely loved the place! || Such a great stay at the Slieve Russell.
The staff and the excellent service really elevate the place, nothing is too much trouble and everyone delivers with a smile.
Breakfast and dinner were equally great, could not fault.

name: Riverside Spa
address: Drumlaunaght, Stradone, Co. Cavan, H12 H7X8, Ireland
reviews_text:
We had a brilliant experience with Natasha and Caroline as our masseuses today, the massages left us feeling so relaxed! The Riverside facilities are absolutely top notch, we had such a chill time in the jacuzzi and outdoor hot tub - couldn‚Äôt fault a single thing at all. We will definitely be back! || My husband and I had an absolutely wonderful time at Riverside Spa! We enjoyed a relaxing body massage, and I also had a facial, followed by some time in the thermal suite ‚Äî everything was perfect from start to finish.

The staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming. A special shout-out to the lovely owners, Caroline and another lady whose name I‚Äôve forgotten (it starts with an M ‚Äî sorry!), for being so warm and kind, and for the thoughtful free samples at the end. We also want to thank Cora and Joanna, our masseuses, who were truly amazing and made the whole experience even better.

We loved the refreshments afterwards too ‚Äî such a nice touch.

Overall, it was a fantastic experience and definitely worth trying. We‚Äôll 100% be coming back again. Highly recommended! || I had a relaxing, professional, and therapeutic full body massage with Joanne. I got my hair done with Carmel - an amazing, talented stylist. It was such a nice treat to finish off my spa day.  All staff I encountered were very friendly and helpful and offered refreshments.  I enjoyed 'my spa experience - great value for money. || Excellent service. Brilliant advice. Treatments tailored to individual. Caroline is excellent at what she does and results are immediate. See you again soon. || Mairead was so kind and friendly! My hair turned out so beautiful! Niamh was assisting and she was also excellent!

name: Cavetown Lake Sauna
address: Cavetown Or Ballynahoogh, Croghan, Co. Roscommon, F52 N290, Ireland
reviews_text:
Lovely morning at Cavetown Lake sauna. So lucky to have this on our doorstep‚Ä¶ brought back memories of swimming in the lake as a kid!!
Mark is very welcoming & friendly. The sauna was lovely & the lake very refreshing. The little extras you won‚Äôt find anywhere else‚Ä¶ flavoured water, seating, swim shoes, towels, essential oils & maybe a few extra minutes if the next slot is quiet! üòâ Will definitely be back! || Stayed in car park in motor home for one night and had a fabulous sauna the next morning. It is brilliant to chill in the sauna and then cool down in the Lake. Everything was so clean and Mark made sure it was a great experience. One of the best! || What an amazing experience at Cavetown Sauna! The setting is absolutely beautiful and peaceful, perfect for a relaxing escape. Mark gave such a warm and friendly welcome. Loved the little touches like the essential oils and mint water so refreshing! Honestly, the hottest sauna I‚Äôve ever been in (in the best way), and cooling off in the calm lake afterwards was just incredible. Came away feeling totally refreshed and re-energised. Can‚Äôt wait to go back! || 10/10 sauna! The best one I‚Äôve ever been! They are taking care of all the details and it makes the experience unbeatable. The spot is perfect, the way to go into the lake is easy too and the area is quiet and peaceful. I will go back soon sure!!! Thank you ‚ú® || What a lovely experience ‚≠êÔ∏è met up with friends at cave town , had lovely walk, picnic, sauna & dip. Would highly recommend the sauna - Mark is so helpful and helps create such a chilled vibe there

name: FIRECRACKER Sauna
address: Leebeen Park, Dunbeggan, Aughnacliffe, Co. Longford, N39 WK74, Ireland
reviews_text: Fantastic sauna in Aughnacliffe, lovely setting and views across the lake. Really enjoyed my sauna session today and already looking forward to my next visit || Absolutely stunning Saturday afternoon in firecracker. The amenities are top class and welcoming staff. We will be back. || Lovely location, great price and friendly staff. I really enjoyed the amazing views of the lake and the very elegant swans! Highly recommend this sauna. || I‚Äôve been twice now and our group plan to make it a weekly routine. name: C√© Sauna

reviews_text:
What an exhilarating experience. Located in a relatively secluded part of the park beside the lake for a nice plunge before, during and after the Sauna has left me refreshed and wanting more.
Fair play to the the lads for setting this up for so many to enjoy without having to break the bank.  It was a fantastic experience which I would highly recommend to anyone with chronic pain. The combination of hot and cold has really worked wonders on my shoulder. || What a wonderful way to spend an afternoon. A sauna with a view of the stunning Lough Key, a clear lake in which to take a dip and chairs to take in the scenery after you're done. Bliss! Value for money-wise this can't be beaten. Add to the fact that is good for the body and soul, it's a must. As an added bonus this sauna has changing rooms and a place to store your clothes. I can't recommend Ce Sauna enough. || Absolutely fantastic,the location is amazing a little piece of heaven and the sauna is so gorgeous. Had the most fabulous time here,Shane is great couldn't do enough for you.Lovely oils used in the water in the sauna too makes it even nicer .Fab seating for afterwards if you just want to chill for a while watching the swans and ducks that are on the lake .One of the nicest experiences I have had will definitely be back for more and so reasonably priced. Well done lads .. || A beautiful barrel sauna, perfect temperature and very clean, in a great setting in lough key park forest. One bit of advice is get a shower card in the main reception before you head over to the sauna, the showers are located beside reception cost ‚Ç¨6. Highly recommend Ce Sauna it makes the trip to the park! || If you're hungover, have joint problems or just need to be reinvigorated or all of the above, this the spot! Excellent location, excellent value and excellent staff. I felt brilliant after it. Highly recommended.

name: Slainte Saunas Wild Atlantic Sauna
address: Old Head Beach, Oldhead, Louisburgh, Co. Mayo, Ireland
reviews_text:
Overall not a good experience, most overcrowded and coldest sauna I‚Äôve ever been in. The temp is a byproduct of how overcrowded it is. 80 degrees is unacceptable, door was left open for 2 minutes between changeovers, it‚Äôs a shame as it‚Äôs in such a beautiful spot. || Fab addition to Old Head! As saunas go, the treck to the sea through part of the car park is not ideal. A Few more hooks or a sheltered changing spot wouldn‚Äôt go amiss. It can also get a little too hot at times (over 100¬∞C), but overall, it‚Äôs still a solid 4-star experience! || Lovely warm n clean sauna! By great if it hour sessions! || It's a functional sauna and a great spot. But with such an easy business the least you could expect is for it to be given some care.
The timer has been broken all summer.
There is a black tar like substance seeping through the wood in the Sauna.
A little extra effort could make this a 5 star spot but as it is, the place is lacking || Facilites were severely lacking.
No showers or plunge pool.

One bucket to clean feet of all clients.

The sauna was not cleaned between shifts during my experience and it seemed severely overcrowded with people coming and going. This cause the temperature to be lowered and un controlled.

Even timer within sauna was broken. There was no gauge for time.

Views were lovely, and the location was special.

Other than that, I would not recommend.

name: Cavan Swimming Pool and Leisure Complex
address: Drumalee, Cavan, H12 Y9W4, Ireland
reviews_text:
Steam room you can't sit on seat over  steam or you will burn, no notice saying not to sit on hotplate, I used to come here regularly over 20 years ago it was fine then, not now, sauna out of action ment steam room all on top of eachother, steam room and sauna not good enough or big enough, One of the worst swimming pools in Ireland that I've experienced in recent years. The girl at reception very nice and professional, she gets the one star I have to give, with sauna out of action and pool half closed of for training I was going to ask for a refund, the facilities are not up to standards across Ireland now, rust everywhere and mold, Cavan council needs to renew or replace || ‚∏ª

Great Gym Experience!
Clean facilities, modern equipment, and a motivating atmosphere. The staff is friendly and helpful, and there‚Äôs a good mix of group classes and personal training options. Highly recommend for anyone serious about fitness. || The air in the pool area was really cold, couldn't stay too long with the kids because of it. The pool itself is grand, decent size kids area, a separate warm kids pool, two swimming lanes. Changing rooms were fairly messy a few times I was there. Token needed for the lockers so all before you go in || swimming pool, gym, everything is fine, but the changing room is not up to today's standards || You are looking at potential lung cancer here. Black mould covered all over the shower walls & deviders, and the toilet. After paying a hefty membership fee, you would expect the staff to keep the showers clean. Not to mention the the toilet, no proper ventilation and again absolutely dirty.
When ƒ∞ finish work, ƒ∞ come to a place to relax, swim and feel clean after a long day. But instead ƒ∞ come across these moulds, it's like putting the nail in the coffin. These black moulds are a source of lung cancer, and ƒ∞'m not sure how this is going unnoticed, considering that ƒ∞'ve complained multiple times. This must be washed with proper chemicals every day, not wait for the moulds to come back and then wash. ƒ∞ didn't pay to get stressed.
The only thing they care about is whether you tapped your membership barcode at the entrance.

name: Salt and Ember Sauna
address: Boat Quay, W End, Magheracar, Bundoran, Co. Donegal, F94 HV21, Ireland
reviews_text: Absolute gem down in Bundoran! Wee Sauna right by the sea with steps down to the water! Very easy access. We were very pleased with the Sauna its self and the area. Staff were very helpful & you can pay by revolut. ‚Ç¨15 for 45mins I think is reasonable, especially with the ease of access right by the sea. Will definitely return regularly! 5/5 || I visited this sauna on a cold, wet and windy day.  The walk to the pier was tempestuous.  All was forgotten once I got into the sauna.  The woman working there was really friendly, welcoming and helpful.  She explained everything,  and said I could go down some steps and cool off in the sea. I was shivering "I doubt it"  "Oh you'll get very hot" and indeed I did, and ended up splashing myself in the frigid sea at the foot of the steps three times!   Came away buzzing and refreshed and the weather could no longer touch me.  Highly  recommend! || This is a truly awesome experience! Having visited a number of times in Bundoran, Creevy Pier and Rossnowlagh beach we can only but highly recommend! Also helps being run by such a lovely human! Highly recommend and see you again soon! || Great Sauna üßñüèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è we booked and didn‚Äôt realize it is in Bundoran not Buncranna. Broghna we so kind, let us cancel without charge, and even recommended a sauna üßñüèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è close to us! || Had the best time at the sauna! Such a relaxing experience after a morning surf üòç

reviews_text:
The best sauna I‚Äôve been to by far. You won‚Äôt find another one as hot, or with better access to the sea. No walking down over rocks or long treks to get to the water. Such a wonderful atmosphere thanks to the owners Cillian and Megan, and the returning customers that are down every weekend. Going to BlazeIt is the highlight of my weekend üî• || 20 Stars. Megan and Cillian run an incredible sauna experience on Mullaghmore harbour. Everyone is made to feel so welcome and shown all the ropes before relaxing in their stunning sauna. Best views in the land and I never sleep so well as I do on sauna day! Loads of free parking and some excellent coffee spots close by.
Thanks Megan and Cillian, see you back at the sauna soon :) || Blaze It Sauna is in a beautiful location right on the harbour in Mullaghmore. The owners Megan and Cillian are so welcoming and friendly and I always meet some nice like minded folks in the sauna for a friendly chat. I always feel relaxed and recharged after this sauna experience. I can‚Äôt rate it highly enough. || Such a nice sauna, and an amazing location being so close to the water for a dip too.
It's so cosy there in the evenings after the sun has set.
Very friendly staff and always so accommodating for bookings.
Views of mullaghmore harbour and the dartry mountains are amazing from inside the sauna! || I don‚Äôt usually leave reviews but Blaze It Sauna is hands down the best sauna I‚Äôve ever had the pleasure of using! The quality of the sauna itself is second to none, the heat was incredible, and with beautifully insane views of the beautiful Sligo backdrop as we relaxed inside mixed with cold dips in the Atlantic ocean at Mullaghmore to cool down in between sessions, we knew we made the right call. I‚Äôve never felt as rejuvenated in my life than after our sauna session - it was absolutely epic!

The owners couldn‚Äôt have been nicer to deal with, Cillian was an absolute gent, great craic and couldn‚Äôt have been more helpful! Now that it‚Äôs on my radar, I‚Äôll be back here every time I‚Äôm back in Sligo. 10/10 recommend - thanks lads!!

reviews_text: I visited Furnis Sauna Village last Saturday evening and I am so impressed with what they have created, with two fantastic wood-fire saunas, and cold plunge baths of varying temperatures. Everything is so well put together and the atmosphere there is so chill. Will definitely be paying this place regular visits from now on! || Definitely the best sauna I‚Äôve been to, a really calm atmosphere and so clean. The sauna was a perfect temperature as well. name: Glow Salt Rooms
address: Grousehall, Loughduff, Co. Cavan, H12 D799, Ireland
reviews_text: I visited Glow Salt Rooms last week with my 2yr old who has always suffered with her chest. Laura, who was very professional recommended 2-3 sessions in the first week which we did. After the first visit we had two restless nights of coughing and waking up, but since the 2nd session and now the third she has slept through the night, the cough and rattle in her chest is gone. Laura advised that at the first sign of a cough or runny nose to return for one more session which should be enough, and I most definitely will book that when it happens. Overall very happy with the service, the advise, and most importantly the result for my little girl. || Beautiful Salt Rooms great space with plenty of toys to keep the little ones entertained, really relaxing experience and very efficient staff.  Love the online booking system on the website it‚Äôs so convenient. I could feel the benefit after one session, my skin was so soft after. || Highly recommend Glow Salt Rooms. I have visited this clinic as I have asthma and sinus and I already feel the salt helping with my breathing. Looking forward to continuing my sessions and reap the benefits. || Beautiful clinic, very easy to find, excellent facilities, so cosy and homely. Highly recommended and will be back. || Relaxing place to spend some time healing

reviews_text:

The staff are amazing; big shout out to Chloe in the Nature Spa who gave the most incredible and healing massage, and to Shane and all the staff in the Cabin Club for the most delicious cocktails. Beautifully appointed cabins, great facilities and magical vibes. Will be back! || ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
I have been to Cabu by the Lakes twice, and each stay felt absolutely magical. It‚Äôs one of those rare places that instantly makes you feel calm and inspired ‚Äî surrounded by nature, beautiful design, and pure comfort. The cabins are stylish yet so cozy, every detail perfectly thought out to make you feel at home.

I especially loved the Japanese bath ‚Äî such a peaceful, unforgettable experience ‚Äî and the charming Cabu Corner Shop, where every visit feels like a treat.

I truly miss this place and wish to return one day. It will always remain one of my top favorite escapes in the world. üåø‚ú® || We had an absolutely brilliant stay at Cabu this week. It far exceeded our expectations. The staff are all so friendly and helpful. Special shout out to Calvin who took us on a 2 hour kayaking trip! The cabin itself was gorgeous - it had everything we needed and was so comfy and cosy. Love the cabins, kitchen is really well equipped, beds are super comfy, it's very clean and cosy. Recommend doing kayaking.

name: zenzonesauna
