reviews_text: A really nice afternoon activity, well looked after and very peaceful || Great Sauna in a perfect spot.

name: West Coast Sauna Co - Enniscrone.
address: Cliff Rd, Carrowhubbuck South, Enniscrone, Co. Sligo, Ireland
reviews_text:
What a lovely evening we just spent in the sauna! It‚Äôs rare enough to get a sauna for a full hour, and I usually find the 45-50 minute sessions too short, so this was perfect. It‚Äôs so easy to book online, the access to the sea is great even at low tide, and the proprietor Richard is lovely! Well worth a visit. || Exceptional little spot! Amazing views, lovely sauna and great vibe in the area. You can dash down to the sea too if you want to cool off. Really easy to book via the website. ENJOY! || Bliss! Ive been to this sauna first thing in the morning and at sunset as well as times in between... its such a treat and always worth the drive (50 mins from our home)..

The location is amazing and the views out to sea are just fab... we often meet very cool people, have great conversations and finish with a dip in the sea and a coffee from one of the adjacent coffee vans... good for the soul! || Gorgeous spot, the sauna is immaculate with stunning views. Great set-up with changing area and public showers nearby, very friendly and helpful staff. So nice to dip in the sea, very tranquil. || This sauna is simply bliss. The location is stunning with a convenient, gradual and easy entrance point into the ocean right beside it. No rocks, no obstacles, no excuses, just get in! I do no exaggerate when I say there is a majestic view from the picture window. Breath it in, relax and be well.

name: Hillgrove Hotel, Leisure & Spa
address: Old Armagh Rd, Latlorcan, Monaghan, H18 RK15, Ireland
summary: Stylish property offering warm rooms and meeting space for 1,500, plus a bistro, a spa and a pool.
reviews_text:
The receptionist that checked us in was clueless with regards to dinner in the bar and breakfast times. He told us that the bar accepted walk in customers and that the bar was not at all busy on Fri evening. Alas, the opposite was true and the bar was packed. We were catered for in a function room. The poor man also needs to be updated on breakfast times as his current time of 7am to 10am is incorrect.
The indoor pool was quite cold considering the time of year too. It also took a while for the rooms heating to come on given the cold spell that we are currently experiencing. Finally there appeared to be no noise policy in operation as I was awoken three times by very loud guests at various hours of the early morning.

On the plus side the room was very spacious for a family of four and the bathroom facilities were top notch. The staff member who served us our food was very friendly, chatty and overall very nice. He definitely deserves a raise!! || I recently stayed at the hotel and here are my thoughts:

The Negatives:
- The bar area was absolutely filthy, it was busy yes, but I was sat down at a table that despite being wiped down still had chairs covered in crumbs etc, fair enough, easily wiped off.
- There was a fire alarm set off at around 9pm/9:30pm, the hotel did have a notification up in the lobby that there would be a test on Monday at 12:30pm but to ignore other ones (fair enough): I did mention this the following morning and was basically told that a guest had set it off, there was nothing they could do etc. A basic apology would have been a nice start. Understand guests can, and will, do stupid things, but at least apologize for the disturbance.
- Kids & Teens run rampant through the halls as late as 10:30-11pm. Staff can't really do much other than request them not to do this I guess? Despite the noise etc.

The Positive:
- Bar staff very helpful and polite despite being under pressure.
- Food in the bar is absolutely fantastic.
- The hotel is very close to the nearby shopping centre.
- The hotel room (family one) was extremely spacious, with a decent sized fridge for storage.
- The breakfast buffet is very, very good.
- The swimming pool was lovely to use and the gym facilities are definitely better than the offerings from hotels I previously stayed at.
- Plenty of amenities for kids and a good selection of events on offer for the future.

All in all, more positive than negative, but the negative is something to be mindful of. I would still recommend a stay here. || We had our wedding at the Hillgrove Hotel on 12th September. What can I say in relation, there isn't enough positive adjectives in the dictionary for me to show our appreciation to all the staff at the Hillgrove. The made our special day all the more memorable.

We stayed the night before the wedding day and what I can say is from this point until the moment we checked out, everyone who attended and stayed were treated exceptionally by staff.

Special thanks to Dean Coyne (Wedding Coordinator) for making our day turn out the best it possibly could. From the moment we booked up until the day he made everything so easy, with packages including a variety of suppliers he trusted, who all turned out to be incredible. A massive thank you Dean.

If you're currently planning your wedding day, I would 100% recommend giving Dean and the Hillgrove a visit! || I just returned from a night away in the Hillgrove with my son , I decided to treat him before school starts next week as he loves the pool. Well it didn‚Äôt disappoint, as soon as we checked in my son was given a goody bag with treats and information on the kids club. We loved the pool, it was big and clean. Our room was very spacious and spotless and even though there was a wedding there was no noise at night. Food very nice, pleasant helpful staff. I didn‚Äôt get to try the spa this time but it‚Äôs my plan for the next visit. || Two night stay was very relaxing...food in bar and breakfast was delicious. Staff very attentive and helpful.

name: Shoreline Spa
address: 33 Letter Rd, fermanagh BT93 2BB, UK
reviews_text:
The sauna is free for guests staying here from 8.30am to 10.30am which is great but when I went down at 8.30am the sauna was stone cold. It didn't warm up until about 09.10am so was useless. It's a lovely sauna with views out over a lake but needs to be turned on about 45 minutes before opening. || Wow, we managed to get a beautiful Saturday yoga, Sauna and dip at this spa, it was beyond tranquil.

It was magical to have the rolling cliffs, paddlers paddling past, a bestie to join in the experience.

This is an easy day trip that I will absolutely be doing again. See you soon.

name: Finn Lough
address: 37 Letter Rd, Aghnablaney, Enniskillen BT93 2BB, UK
summary: Polished lakeside resort featuring a restaurant, a spa area & 2 marinas, plus free parking.
reviews_text:
The cabins are nice, quite large with a nice bed and large bathroom. About the size of a hotel room. The Bluetooth speaker was a nice touch.

The restaurant is a big let down, portions are tiny and after spending ¬£100 on food I left hungry.

The breakfast bap was okay but again it won't fill you. It's delivered to your cabin gate in a wood box.

The sauna is free from 8.30am to 10.30am which is great but when I went down at 8.30am it was stone cold. It didn't warm up until about 09.10am so was useless. It's a lovely sauna with views out over a lake but needs to be turned on about 45 minutes before opening.

All the staff were really nice and helpful at all times.

Overall it's not good value for money. It's a very expensive place which should be five star standard for the price but falls short. I'm being generous given it a four star review. || We received a gift voucher and chose to stay in the premium dome ‚Äî an experience that had been on our list for a long time and it absolutely lived up to expectations. The dome was very private, warm and cozy with a super comfortable bed, a great shower and plenty of thoughtful little touches that made the stay feel special.

We ate in the restaurant, Lasair, which was delicious. Each dish was bursting with flavours and the staff were genuinely lovely, so easygoing and welcoming..

The whole setting was quiet and peaceful, perfect for slowing down and unwinding.
We thoroughly enjoyed the experience and would happily return. || We loved it; went for one night to premium bubble dome. Its very relaxing;  Domes are very comfortable; Views are stunning. Very clean' . It was like sleeping outside.  We had a cloudy sky , only a few starts but was still amazing. Toilet area a bit small . Nice mini bar drinks. Food in restaurant was gorgeous. We went for vegan tapas menu. Every morsel was lovely. Desserts too chocolatey. It was the night of storm Amy so really noisy but it didnt affect our relaxation. Breakfast delivered; husband had everything bap; I had avocado/tomato bap . There as also pastries and granola. Nice not having to interact with others. We did Spa trail, you have it completely to yourself. I didnt feel rushed. Would have liked a bit more time in relaxation area. It  is expensive; but is unique; genuinely recharged our batteries and very relaxing, Wished we were staying 2 nights || We stayed at Finn Lough from the 1st‚Äì4th and it was an absolutely awful experience, especially for what we paid.

The dome was freezing the entire time with no proper heating. We had to wait 10‚Äì15 minutes just to get hot water every time, which is ridiculous for ‚Äúluxury‚Äù accommodation. The toilet was open with no real privacy, which made my fianc√©e extremely uncomfortable for the whole stay.

Breakfast was very poor and nowhere near the standard you would expect for the price.

The worst part was when two members of room service walked into our dome without knocking or announcing themselves while my fianc√©e was lying in bed. This was a complete invasion of privacy and extremely upsetting.

For the amount of money charged, this experience was nowhere near acceptable. We were expecting a relaxing, high-end getaway and instead it was stressful, uncomfortable, and disappointing. I would not recommend staying here. || From start to finish, the entire team at Finn Lough made our wedding day truly magical. We got engaged at Finn Lough last September, so when we found out they could accommodate our wedding, it felt like fate.

Emma-Kate was so helpful and informative from the very beginning. She went above and beyond to make our day feel personal and full of special touches. Kendall made us feel so welcomed every time we visited ‚Äî we genuinely felt part of the Finn Lough family, greeted with hugs on arrival.

The night before the wedding, one of our family members had a medical emergency. The staff handled the situation with such calmness, patience, and professionalism, and for that, we are incredibly grateful.

On the morning of the wedding, everything was just a phone call away ‚Äî from a breakfast platter delivered to our room to a glass of prosecco to start the day. The ceremony in the dome bubble was breathtaking, made even more beautiful by the care and detail the team put into setting it up. We were especially touched that they built the arch we were married under just for us ‚Äî it made the whole setting feel so personal and unique. The sunshine even appeared at just the right moment, making it all feel magical.

Buggies were provided for guests who needed them, which was perfect. We chose to cut our cake after the ceremony, and the staff outdid themselves with the presentation ‚Äî a stunning charcuterie board adorned with flowers that made our simple cake feel so special. Thank you so much to Cubbi for that.

The customised cocktails were incredible ‚Äî thank you to Barry ‚Äî and the team even created mocktails for our guests who weren‚Äôt drinking. Georgia kindly drove us around in the buggy for our couple photos, showing us the best spots to capture some beautiful memories.

Our reception setup was intimate, cosy, and just perfect. The food was absolutely amazing ‚Äî everyone raved about it ‚Äî and the kitchen was able to cater to various dietary needs, from vegetarian to complex allergies. Rachel was so attentive throughout, and from a bride‚Äôs perspective, I felt like a true princess.

The transition into the evening dancing was seamless thanks to the team‚Äôs organisation. A special thank you to Barry and Rachel for constantly checking in and making sure I always had a glass of water ‚Äî something so small but so appreciated on such a busy day.

Breakfast the next morning was perfect and gave us a lovely moment to say goodbye to our guests. The staff were so organised in packing everything up and ensuring we had all our keepsakes safely returned to us. We also did the Elements Trail Spa the following day, which was the most relaxing way to unwind after such a big day.

We had guests travel from all over the world, and every single one of them commented on how tranquil and special Finn Lough is. It‚Äôs a place that perfectly celebrates the natural beauty of this country, incredible talent, and genuine hospitality.

We can‚Äôt put into words how magical our day was. A massive thank you to every single person at Finn Lough who made it possible.

name: The Sauna Society
address: Hollywood, Lake Park, Mullatishaughlin, Ballinode, Co. Monaghan, Ireland
reviews_text: Have been a few times, always feel amazing afterwards! It‚Äôs a gorgeous new addition to the area. The sauna is really spacious, warm, clean and has a great view of the lake, especially at sunset. There‚Äôs changing areas and toilets near buy and hooks for your towel. The lake comes up about chest high where you get in so it‚Äôs perfect to stand or swim in. || Gorgeous and peaceful spot that has really brightened the park ||

name: Infinity Sauna
address: Ballydavid Beach, Murreagh, Co. Kerry, Ireland
reviews_text:
Really loved our time at Infinity Sauna. The land out the sauna window makes for an unreal view. We luckily had the place to ourselves and the lads have it set up really well with the shower and cold plunge along a wooden walkway.

Louis was great, and let us know that the slot after us was free if we wanted to stay past the hour we had booked. Would recommend after a long drive or a night out in town. || Absolutely incredible experience at Infinity Sauna! From the moment we arrived, the atmosphere was welcoming, peaceful, and perfectly set up for total relaxation. The view from the sauna was breathtaking‚Äînothing beats soaking up the heat while surrounded by nature.

A big shoutout to Tom√°s, the owner, whose passion and friendliness truly elevate the experience. You can tell he‚Äôs put his heart into every detail. And his bearded sidekick Louis brings great energy and charm to the place‚Äîan absolute legend in his own right.

Can‚Äôt recommend it highly enough. Whether you're local or just visiting, make sure Infinity Sauna is on your list. I‚Äôll definitely be back || Such an amazing experience at infinity sauna. The sauna was exceptionally clean and spacious. Tom√°s let us choose between a eucalyptus or lavender steam pour over.  We went with the eucalyptus and it was very relaxing.  We were glad for the very refreshing outdoor shower and barrel cold plunge to cool off. Absolutely lovely vibes, views and nature around. GRMA! || Have visited when the sauna is in Gallarus and in Ballydavid , a great sauna. Brilliant location in Ballydavid. Highly recommend and well run by Tom√°s. || ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è 5/5 ‚Äì An Exceptional Sauna Experience with Tom√°s Houlihan

From the moment you step into Tom√°s Houlihan‚Äôs sauna, you can tell this is something special. The attention to detail, the warmth (in every sense of the word), and the serene atmosphere create an experience that goes far beyond the typical sauna session.

Tom√°s clearly puts a lot of thought and care into what he does. The heat was perfectly balanced, the setting was calming, and the overall environment felt incredibly rejuvenating. You leave not just relaxed, but restored‚Äîboth in body and mind.

Whether you‚Äôre new to saunas or a seasoned enthusiast, this is a must-visit. Tom√°s has truly created a sanctuary. I can‚Äôt recommend it highly enough.

name: Sweathouse Battlebridge
address: Lustia, Battlebridge, Co. Roscommon, N41 XV90, Ireland
reviews_text: Great experience! One of the best saunas I've visited! The access to the river Shannon makes this an incredibly unique experience. Everything is spotless and very well maintained. Will definitely be revisiting. 100% recommend. || What a gem of a sauna! Right on the edge of the River Shannon ‚Äì such a gorgeous spot. The sauna itself was spotless, lovely and hot, and just so relaxing. Honestly one of the nicest sauna experiences I‚Äôve had. We came with a group of friends for the weekend and it was the perfect way to chill out. Enya was so friendly and helpful too. Would 100% recommend if you‚Äôre in the area ‚Äì total reset for the body and mind! || Located in the banks of the River Shannon, this sauna experience is second to none, with views, a cold plunge, and even a jumping platform into the river. The wood-fired sauna itself is absolutely top-notch, with an impeccable cedar build and large windows, and it reached over 100c when we were visiting. This is a top sauna destination in Europe, highly recommend. || Had an amazing time at this sauna! The location is stunning, super peaceful, and everything is really new and well-maintained. || Excellent facilities and great friendly folks. Excellent Harvia stove capable of managing the heat in a powerful but stable manner. Cold dip in the tubs or river is a great refreshment between hot sessions. Nice cool shower as well!

name: Cavan Massage Therapy Clinic

reviews_text: Visited Cavan massage therapy for the first time today. Yvonne was excellent in relieving all my aches with a deep tissue massage. Yvonne explained in detail what she was doing and was very professional and friendly. The clinic is very welcoming and beautifully decorated, making the entire visit an excellent experience. I will definitely visit Cavan Massage therapy clinic again and would highly recommend Yvonne to anyone looking for a great massage. Thank you Yvonne. || I would Highly recommend Yvonne I was in with her last week she gave me an amazing back massage I was in Chronic pain going in  an I have never felt as good after the treatment experiencing no back pain now I could not Thank Yvonne enough she is excellent at what she does It was the best massage I ever had I am so looking forward to visiting her again so professional and Friendly Thanks a million Yvonne || Was in a lot of pain before I visited Yvonne. Thankfully not anymore. I can't recommend Yvonne enough. Amazing at what she does. Highly recommend. || I went in with a severe pain in my neck and shoulder and I walked out with such a relief. Highly recommend Yvonne! || I attend Sabena every month for a massage. I wouldn't go anywhere else. I feel extremely relaxed after each massage. I have tried different massages from aromatherapy to hot stone and also reflexology. It is hard to pick my favourite as every massage is amazing. I highly recommend Sabena. name: Kilronan Castle
address: Castletenison Demesne, Ballyfarnon, Co. Roscommon, F52 R867, Ireland
summary: Quarters with old-world decor in a Georgian castle with dining, a modern spa, cottages & a pool.
reviews_text:
Our stay at Kilronan Castle was truly unforgettable.
We spent three wonderful days there, and absolutely everything exceeded our expectations.
The room was beautiful, spotless, and very comfortable. The atmosphere of the castle is magical ‚Äî elegant interiors, a sense of history, and at the same time a feeling of warmth and relaxation. The level of cleanliness throughout the hotel was impeccable.
The food was excellent, and the service in all the restaurants was attentive, professional, and genuinely welcoming. We especially enjoyed the opportunity to take long, peaceful walks around the castle grounds ‚Äî the surroundings are perfect for slowing down and fully enjoying the moment.
A special highlight of our stay was lunch at the Douglas Hyde Restaurant. It was an exceptionally pleasant experience that left us with a real sense of satisfaction. First-class food, outstanding service, a lovely atmosphere, and excellent value for money ‚Äî everything came together perfectly.
Kilronan Castle is a place where you truly feel cared for, and where every detail is thoughtfully considered. We will cherish these memories and would happily return again. || We arrived early at midday. Even driving up the drive and seeing Kilronan Castle on approach gave us the Wow factor!! We had a delicious lunch served by a lovely friendly young lady. After a leisurely drink in their homely beautiful bar, our room was ready. And what a fantastic surprise that was! We had a wonderful 2  1/2 hours in the thermal suite which was included in our package. My friend had 2 treatments which she relished in. The next day before checking out, we availed of their lovely swimming pool, sauna and steam room. We had booked dinner as advised. We opted for casual dining. However it was to such a standard, that we felt we were fine dining! The following morning we had a delicious breakfast. It was the first time anywhere, that we had someone show exactly where everything was in the dining room. Lovely atmosphere and with plenty staff to cater for all your requirements. In all we had a wonderful stay and highly recomend. And will definitely return. || Last month, our friends surprised us with a wonderful wedding gift ‚Äî a stay at this castle, including dinner at the restaurant and breakfast the next morning.

A very beautiful hotel. It really feels like stepping back in time for a few days. The whole interior is kept in one style ‚Äî a large antique bed in the room, high ceilings, and polished wooden furniture. At the same time, the room has everything needed for a comfortable stay, including a TV.

The restaurant definitely deserves a special mention. Both the food and the service are of a very high standard. The staff are attentive and professional and are happy to explain each dish.

Overall, the stay left very pleasant impressions. A peaceful atmosphere, a beautiful setting, and the feeling of staying in a real castle. We would love to return. || Absolutely top class!! 5üåü from start to finish. Beautiful castle, fantastic service & the meal in the Douglas Hyde restaurant was as good as it gets.
The leisure centre is beautiful with so much available from the pool, sauna, steam room, gym, spa etc. can't recommend Kilronan Castle enough. || One of the best, if not the best hotels in Ireland. 5 stars from start to finish. The rooms, reception staff, restaurant staff, the grounds, everything. We loved one one night stay so much that we would strongly get married here. It may be out of the way slightly but I have to say, it would be worth the journey every time. Would go back here in a heartbeat. We absolutely loved it. The staff here are a credit to themselves. The grounds are breathtaking. Food is delicious too.

name: Clonandra Cottages
address: Clonandra, Redhills, Co. Cavan, H14 YF98, Ireland
reviews_text: My favourite place to visit and relax. Been there 3 times already and definitely will be back for more. || The location was nice and relaxing, the house looks like the picture, The sauna and hot tub was worth the money, Pet Friendly,will be back again, The owner was really nice, the house was really clean || Beautiful chinese , nicest we've had in a long time. Well  Deserved a 5* || The good place to relax with friends and family, self catering house, good house, with good location, place nice and quiet. || Love this place.

name: Errigal Country House Hotel
address: Cavan Rd, Errigal, Cavan, Ireland
summary: Classic rooms in an 18th-century lodging with a spa, dining options and function space.
reviews_text:
Avoid! Definitely not a 4 star hotel whatsoever. Old fashioned and in need of a refurbishment. No entertainment on a Saturday evening. ‚ÄòDeluxe‚Äô room was above a smoking area that was in use until after 5am and extremely noisy, to the point I had to ring reception twice, once at 4am and once at 5am to complain. Receptionist- male voice was very unhelpful and had an attitude, I presume at having to leave the reception desk to tell the crowd to be quiet. Breakfast was very poor and the R&R wellness? The sauna didn‚Äôt work, changing rooms you have to share with both male and females, no indoor showers. It‚Äôs such a let down, just like someone‚Äôs back garden with a hottub plunked in it. We ended up not using any of it and leaving. Really annoying when you have spent a lot of money (not worth it) on a stay and are disappointed. Management is apparently contacting myself with a refund but we shall see.  I hate to leave a bad review but sick of places like here taking your money for such poor service. || Myself and my partner now husband got married here in the Errigal country Hotel in Cootehill last Saturday 13/12/2025. I would like to start of by thanking Niall for everything he has done for us. Anything I asked and more he done. He is amazing man and very patient and looked after not only me the bride and groom but my family and friends to. Everyone that works in the Errigal are the nicest people I could ever meet. Very helpful, kind, friendly and are amazing at there jobs. All my guests couldn't get over how big the rooms were. Bridal suit was top class. The chef, thank you, the food was absolutely delicious. There wasnt a plate in the room not cleaned off. People are still talking about how good the food was. My band Temptations PJ a local man done us proud the dance floor was never empty. We all danced the night away in a magical ball room all done up for Christmas. Niall thank you from the bottom of my heart for making are day so special from start to finish.
If anyone is newly engaged or getting engaged this Christmas please check out the Errigal hotel in Cootehill for your wedding you will not be disappointed how amazing the place is. I am so happy we choose here, staff, rooms, food ect was unreal. Niall thank you and your team for all you have done for me. X || My 2nd visit here a birthday treat. I done the fab new R&R thermal suite and their ‚Ç¨99 spa package. Like last year everything was amazing. prosecco, nibbles in there relaxation room. Fab massage with Shannon and a perfect wash n blow dry and chats with carmelle. Food was AMAZING My fave was the bao bun think it's called. It was so tasty. And the steak sandwich. Service was excellent üëå Breakfast excellent rooms  immaculate.  And the best part it's so reasonable priced. There was music in the bar too. A great birthday at Errigle for a 2nd year in a row. No doubt I'll be back next year and hopefully a few times. 10/10. || We had a really lovely stay here. The outdoor spa was our highlight. Meal, cocktails etc were gorgeous. Staff were all super friendly and attentive. Highly recommend for an affordable night away || While on route to visit friends in Cootehill, we called in at the Errigal hotel. We have stayed there previously on a number of occasions. We had afternoon coffee and relaxed for a while in the lounge before continuing our journey. I recommend a visit

name: Savasana Social

reviews_text: Wonderful start to our Christmas break. Visited with family. Staff are friendly and attentive. Molly made sure we had all we needed. Not overcrowded. Hot Sauna, cold plunge and the most relaxing hot tub. Delighted to see this in our locality. || We had an amazing time at savasana. It was the perfect step away from the hustle and bustle of pre Christmas madness and felt like we were fully submerged in nature! Looking forward to my next visit. || The most relaxing sauna that we have ever been to! The family that run the place are super friendly and make sure you are well looked after. name: Corick House Hotel & Spa
address: 20 Corick Rd, Clogher BT76 0BZ, UK
summary: Georgian house with refined hotel rooms, plus a spa with a hydrotherapy pool and 8 treatments rooms.
reviews_text:
From start to finish, the place felt incredibly warm and welcoming. The staff were absolutely unreal ‚Äî attentive, kind, and genuinely invested in making the day perfect. Nothing was too much trouble, and their calm professionalism made such a difference on the day.

We are also incredibly grateful to Orla and Damien, who organised and monitored the entire day with such precision. Their attention to detail, organisation, and reassuring presence meant everything ran seamlessly, allowing us to truly relax and enjoy every moment.

The food was top-notch and received so many compliments from our guests, and the decorations were beautiful ‚Äî elegant without being overdone, creating exactly the atmosphere we hoped for.

A special mention has to go to the Courtyard Suite, where the bride and bridesmaids got ready on the morning of the wedding. Having breakfast together there and getting ready in such a relaxed, beautiful space really helped calm the nerves and made the whole morning feel so special and memorable.

We are beyond happy with our choice of venue and will always be grateful to Corick House Hotel for helping make our wedding day so perfect. Highly recommend to any couple looking for a venue with heart, exceptional service, and a truly special atmosphere. || We found Corick house a few years ago and have never stopped coming ever since! Our whole family now love it and are the exact same always visiting. The staff are amazing,
Nothing is too much and the consistency is the thing I‚Äôve notice most - always good service, great food and a lovely stay consistently! The food is absolutely unreal! || Had a one night stay. 27.01.26.
1st thing staff was fantastic. Couldn't be more helpful.
Bar cold at the  window tables.
Hot chocolate very watery not very good.
Spa the cold pool small and some jets not working but it was very relaxing.
Room bit outdated. And no plugs for phone chargers.
Had to walk past a bunch of builders very friendly people
Dinner very nice only problem someone's brat child running around us and spoiled our experience. Us two being put bang in the middle of the room.
Breakfast  very nice. No complaints.
Overall  fantastic staff food good. Room just alright.(maybe why builders) || We didn‚Äôt stay here but did have my daughter‚Äôs christening dinner for 30 of us in one of the private dining rooms. Service was amazing from communication beforehand to on the day. Esp as we had lots of little kids running around, the waiting staff were so patient. Food was excellent. We loved having drinks before and after dinner by the fire in the bar area. Lovely touch from the hotel with a card and teddy for our baby girl. Thanks so much || My partner and I visited for a spa package. The massage itself was lovely and highly professional.
‚ÄãHowever, the attention to detail throughout the package was very disappointing. I included a special note on the order for a celebratory reason, and it was completely ignored‚Äînot even a simple card was left or any acknowledgement (its free to even say glad you've chosen us hope you have a good time.)
‚ÄãThere were forgotten inclusions: Prosecco and Strawberries were part of our package in the Serenity Suite. (Background we also did a pre-order of food to our suite.) They were never brought out to us within our timeslot. When I alerted the staff (after my times lot as I wanted to make the most of my time there) they did apologize, but then blamed the oversight on being "distracted" by our food order, essentially implying it was our fault.
‚ÄãThey eventually brought the forgotten items, but by that point, we were in the Thermal Suite where you can't have food/drink. This meant we had to rush as we also had an hour allotment to the thermal suite to finish this while still wet, in the corridor. This significantly ate into our relaxation time and completely ruined the intended experience.
‚ÄãThe excellent treatment was overshadowed by poor communication, lack of acknowledgement for a special visit, and an overall poor effort on service recovery.

name: Lough Allen Adventure
address: LOUGH ALLEN OUTDOOR PURSUITS CENTRE, Drumshanbo, Co. Leitrim, N41 PD62, Ireland
reviews_text:
We had a fantastic experience at the sauna at Lough Allen Adventure. The sauna was properly hot ‚Äî which was perfect after the cold plunge, and the views from the area are absolutely beautiful.
Although the hot tub wasn‚Äôt in operation due to the freezing weather, the owner was incredibly kind and flexible and generously allowed us extra time to make up for it. His friendly, welcoming demeanour really stood out and made the whole experience feel relaxed and personal.
A great setup in a great location, with excellent hospitality to match. Would love to visit again in summer! || Great spot.  We only came for the saunas/ice bath but Tojo was very welcoming and accommodating.  The sauna was roasting with lovely views of the mountains/lake.  The ice bath was proper cold/freezing, as was the outdoor shower, very refreshing.  There was a cabin to get changed/store your belongings.  There is also an outdoor hot tub which we didn't avail of this time but we will be back again to try it out! || Great way to spend an hour relaxing - we opted for the sauna, dip and hot tub option and it didn't disappoint. Hot sauna with eucalyptus, quick plunge in the bath or cold shower followed by hot tub. Appreciated the changing facilities and parking. Definitely recommend üëå || Our experience at the venue was a mixed bag, with both highlights and areas for improvement.

Scenic elements: The grounds feature beautiful touches like blooming flowers and pear trees, adding charm in parts. Great location.

Cluttered first impression: Unfortunately, the presence of old metal and kitchen equipment around the site detracted from the overall aesthetic and made a poor first impression.

Facilities maintenance: The indoor toilets had a broken door handle in the corridor, making access difficult. The shower area could also benefit from a thorough clean and a general refresh (e.g., paintwork).

Signage & navigation: There was a lack of clear signage throughout the site. The map at the entrance was not particularly helpful, and we had to ask for directions to the meeting point for kayaking/paddle boarding,which still proved difficult to locate.

Customer service: While staff were generally pleasant and carried out their tasks, the overall atmosphere felt transactional. A more proactive and welcoming approach would have made a noticeable difference. Staff not directly involved in your activity came across as indifferent, and we often felt hurried along once our scheduled part was complete.

Activity experience: The information pack mentioned wetsuits would be provided, but none were made available. We had booked paddle boarding but were told only kayaking was possible,citing setup time, even though the session started late due to a delayed family.

Storage & logistics: Storage for personal belongings was disorganized and insecure. Additionally, for guests doing both the wellness and activity experiences, there was no clear process for managing belongings between areas.

Kayaking: The kayaking itself was a lovely experience. However, a little background or storytelling about the lake, canal, or lock would have added depth and connection to the place.

Wellness area: This was a highlight. The cold plunge pool, two saunas (including essential oils), and jacuzzi were all great features. However, we were the only two using the space and were asked to leave after just over an hour, which felt unnecessarily abrupt given how quiet it was.

Communal spaces: The two covered eating areas could use some attention,tidying and general upkeep would improve the visitor experience. || We had an amazing morning kayaking on the lake. The guide was great with the kids and full of great information on the local area. 100% would go again

name: VIB-MoFo
address: 69 Main St, Townparks, Cavan, H12 D6P8, Ireland
reviews_text:
I have been to Marcin a few times now for massage and reflexology. I always walk away feeling light as a feather. He is very professional, kind and has a gentle manner. I like a deep pressure massage and he is my go to for any aces or pains! || I recently had a massage with Marcin, and it was an amazing experience! He is very professional, skilled, and made sure I was comfortable throughout the entire session. His technique was excellent, helping to relieve my tension and stress. I felt relaxed and rejuvenated afterward. I highly recommend Marcin to anyone looking for a great massage! || I had a lot of pain in my shoulders and neck. I was holding a lot of tension. It was recommended to me to get a massage to dissipate the acid. Marcin worked wonders. I was very much on the mend two days after the massage. I would highly recommend Marcin. He also gave very good advice on posture which I‚Äôm trying to keep in mind.
LC || Marcin definitely has healing hands. He is also highly qualified and extremely  professional throughout the entire session. He's also a very respectful person. The treatment room is tucked away upstairs, where its quiet and private. You wouldn't know you were on the main street in Cavan. I highly recommend. || I cant speak highly enough of Marcin. He gives a top class massage that loosens you out and makes you feel fresh again after a long week of sitting in the car or going to the gym. His massage is the best I've ever had but If you really want to reset then his reiki healing is a must try! Also, he is one of the most wise and knowledgeable people I have ever met so don't be afraid to open a conversation with him to get some advice!

name: Drumhierny Woodland Hideaway
address: Drumhierney Manor, Glenville, Leitrim Village, Co. Leitrim, N 42 T6P6, Ireland
reviews_text:
My friends and I spent three nights at this gorgeous property, and it was perfect. The grounds are stunning and very well thought out, incorporating the woodlands inside the cabins and practicing some cool sustainable ideas across the property. The staff were all insanely friendly and welcoming, even with our ten million questions the smiles never ceased to exist. We did the 2-hour wellbeing package that left us feeling zen and  glowing, and the facilities are just enchanting. With the trails on site, the history and surrounding area, there are plenty of fun things to do to keep you busy both inside and outdoors.

Leitrim Village itself is equally as friendly and enjoyable as Drumhierny, having met no strangers in the few days we were there. There‚Äôs a sense of passion and pride amongst the town that rallies behind one another‚Äôs work and ideas, indicating a strong sense of community and family.

If you‚Äôre looking for a place to host a beautiful event, have a romantic getaway or just a relaxing laugh with your friends, this is a perfect spot to do so. Simply put ‚Äî It‚Äôs majestically perfect. || The Welbeing Sanctuary is really wonderful. Even on a December day,  it being outdoors and raining did not dampen the experience. The sauna, jacuzzi and seaweed baths are so warm, clean and relaxing, in a truly beautiful and lush setting. Big thank you to Kathleen, who was so lovely and accommodating. Will definitely be back! || We have just returned from a stay at Drumhierny, a self-professed ‚Äúunique experience & sanctuary.‚Äù We had paid for a two-night stay at the Bird of a Feather lodge, along with two Wellbeing Experiences, which were advertised as 2 hours in the relaxation suite with hot tubs, seaweed or aromatherapy treatments.

We chose Drumhierny over other self-catering stays precisely because of this sanctuary element ‚Äî we wanted more than just a hot tub. Our plan was to enjoy extra treatments and a glass of bubbly, setting the tone for a relaxing, stress-free getaway.

On arrival, we had to inform reception that our wellbeing session hadn‚Äôt been booked. The lady at reception acknowledged this oversight and assured us that someone would call first thing the next morning to arrange it. She even made a note of it in our presence and gave the impression that she genuinely wanted to ensure our experience was everything we expected.

Unfortunately, the promised call never came. We spent much of the day waiting, as this was our final full day before departure, and we wanted to enjoy the experience without rushing. By mid-afternoon, with no progress, we returned to reception (14/10/25) to follow up.

This time we spoke with another receptionist (Throughout this interaction, the second receptionist showed little empathy and offered no apology for the oversight or the disruption to our plans) At first she seemed confused about our wellbeing experience. After some back-and-forth, she offered us a a slot for the following morning ‚Äî which would have been after we checked out and were due to head home. This was far from ideal and not the relaxing, planned experience we had paid for.

She then said if we went immediately, we could get 40 minutes in the hot tub only. When we expressed our disappointment, she changed the offer to allow us the ‚Äúfull time,‚Äù explaining that the sanctuary staff member should have finished work but would stay late. While we appreciated the attempt to resolve it, it hardly created the relaxing atmosphere we had envisioned. We didn‚Äôt feel comfortable attending a session knowing the staff were staying on after hours and that it was being squeezed in last minute.

In the end, we were refunded for the Wellbeing Experience which was little comfort as the key part of our stay ‚Äî the sanctuary experience ‚Äî simply didn‚Äôt happen due to poor communication and follow-through on their end.

The service we received fell well short of expectations. For a place that markets itself as a sanctuary, the lack of organization and empathy was disappointing.

A few additional notes from our stay:

- The main bed consisted of two single beds pushed together, which was not ideal for comfort.

- Privacy in the kitchen and living areas is limited, as passers-by can see directly into the lodge.

- A mid-week stay in autumn offered very little to do in neighbouring towns, so having the sanctuary experience would have been even more valuable.

We had flowers added as an extra 60Euros, these were an exceptional bunch of flowers  and really impressive || Last week we went to the Drumheiry Wellness centre at Drumheiry Woodlands just outside Leitrim village.   This was a fabulous experience in the stunning surroundings of the autumnal trees of the estate.  Mairead on reception is so lovely - she was attentive but also gave us lots of space to enjoy the hot tub and seaweed baths.   This is such a gem hidden in the woods!  I can‚Äôt wait to go back! 10 stars!!! || We stayed here mid-week as a group of friends, and couldn't rate it more highly. The lodges are modern, comfortable and well equipped. The staff are incredible and went above and beyond to make our stay as memorable as possible. The spa was also fantastic. 10 out of 10.

Great to have toilets and changing areas. || Beautiful scenic lake with changing facilities and benches, not a lot of parking so get there early on a sunny day. || One of the best places for a swim. There is plenty of parking and good changing facilities. The toilet is kept clean and the surrounding areas are also clean and clear of waste. I travel over an hour to get there as the water is clear and the beach, although a small area is just the right way. Shallow and then gently gets deeper. The swimming distance markers are well marked and shown.

name: Bailieborough Leisure Centre

reviews_text:
Nice place and well run. Nice crowd of friendly people. || Went in today with a view to signing up. Not a hope. Most of the equipment ie treadmills, bikes, cross trainers are so old that they need to retire. All of the equipment is out dated and in need of serious upgrading. Not one member of staff to be seen. That is if you don‚Äôt count the young lad walking around with a weight in his hand! (He‚Äôs about 12!)
The men‚Äôs changing room and showers smell like a nightclub at the end of a busy night. Disgusting. Children using facilities which aren‚Äôt fit for purpose:
The cobwebs on my treadmill were newer than the equipment. Because they have decided to sell pool time to lessons and other businesses , you pretty much can‚Äôt use the pool or jacuzzi for a lot of time during the day.
Overall‚Ä¶..won‚Äôt be taking out a membership. Overpriced. Dirty. Out dated and basically a money making machine for kids swimming classes.
Staff could not care less.
If you like smell of urine and paying a premium for something you could get for less a few miles away, this is the place to go.
Dreadful. || It's great for classes and the staff are very nice but the changing rooms are too hot and too small for the footfall. There's rarely enough seating for the parents which is tough when you're there for an hour with 2 kids and have a back problem. || Perfect for me, everything there Gym, Jacuzzi, Pool, Sauna, Steam Room.  The Staff are very friendly and helpful. || This leisure centre has so much potential,  staff are helpful, friendly and the gym is really well laid out. However there are areas that need improving , myself and a friend joined aqua aerobics we had to book each week for the following class we did 4 weeks then it was changed to booking only online , now we can't get a class booked as everytime we go to book its full. I wouldnt mind but we were really enjoying it .
I then joined swimming classes instead,  I did 2 classes but when I went to book week 3 I was told I can't its full. Like this has to change either put more classes on or let us book 6 weeks at a time at least that way you get to finish out a session of classes. So I've missed a class and have to skip to week 4 and I'm already struggling to keep up so I'm gonna be way behind. Very disheartening. Manager needs to change this.

name: Cocoon Sauna
address: Pier, Breaghy, Portnablagh, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews_text: A wonderful sauna experience! Really enjoyed this special time with sisters and nieces. Can't wait to repeat! || Had an amazing experience at Cocoon today. The saunas were immaculately clean and the water was intensely cold.  Went away feeling refreshed and relaxed. Eli is a gentleman. || Super. Great location - a few steps down to the water. Friendly staff. Worth a detour just to enjoy. || The Cocoon Sauna and swim.is now part of my weekly recovery and it does just that, helps you recover from life's stresses in a stunning setting.  I.love that the sauna is right beside the water.  Very quick access between the sauna and cool ocean.  Claire and Eli are incredible hosts.  The sauna is kept super clean.  The wood fire is well topped up and on a miserable day outside it's incredible to sit in this nurturing heat.  The view, the lovely touch with the essential oils, the authentic calm of Claire and Eli all lend for an incredible restorative experience.  Highly recommend. || The sauna is beautiful!! Its located right at the end of the pier which makes getting into the water very easy (there are steps down to the ocean).. One hour is the perfect length of time - going between the heat of the sauna and the cool refreshing water in the sea! Eli and Claire are very kind and helpful. The view from the sauna is amazing, very peaceful and just all round breath taking! Even on a cold day this would be a great activity to get out of the house!

name: Sabhna Saunas Keel Beach
address: Beach, Keel, Co. Mayo, Ireland
reviews_text:
We had an amazing time in the saunas this week, special thanks to Paul and his team for helping to organise such an unforgettable experience. We tried the saunas in both Keel and Keem, and neither disappointed. The temperature was spot on, nicely hot and toasty. I use saunas regularly, and I can say with confidence that these are some of the best.

Nothing compares to stepping out into the Atlantic afterwards. While the ocean may not be as icy as some cold plunges depending on the season, its definitely cold enough and the combination of salt water and the benefit of grounding more than makes up for it.

I‚Äôve visited Achill many times, and never leave without a session at Sabhna Saunas, highly recommend. || A must do when on the island. Paul and his team are wonderful. Perfect sauna and a short walk down to the beach alternating between heat and cold (contrast therapy). Best sauna I‚Äôve used and I‚Äôve used a fair few! || This was the best sauna experience I‚Äôve had in my life!
Amazing view from the hot sauna and then cooling off in the ocean is as incredible as it sounds. Highly recommend!:)
Also met the owner, super nice guy - thanks again üòä || Paul was amazing, the saunas were toasty, a short run to the sea. Felt magnificent after.
We arrived late and were accommodated so well.
Would love to come back. || A fantastic experience, right in the sand dunes at Keel beach. The sauna is great and the views across the bay priceless! Thanks Paul, great to meet you too!

name: Swede Sauna
address: Beach, Cork, Ireland
reviews_text:
Great welcome from Sarah the owner at Swede sauna. Sauna was 100 degrees plus. Fabulous views over Roberts cove. The sea was clear and the beach clean. One of the best sauna experiences of my life. || 10/10 the best sauna experience I‚Äôve had. The sauna was at a perfect temperature between 95-100 degrees. Robert‚Äôs Cove is a sand beach so no need to worry about walking on stones! Sara is an amazing host and even provides a skin scrub for your final dip! || Incredible sauna. Just had the loveliest swim/ sauna session. Sara is a 10/10 host. Head and body feeling great now. She also has a sugar scrub, skin feeling very soft || Swede Sauna is an amazing amenity located in Roberts Cove!
The facilities are perfect for anyone looking to experience hot and cold therapy!
I think it is an ideal way to enjoy swimming in cold open water during the winter months and as soon as we tried the Sauna once we are hooked!

The owner Sara is very friendly. She is really enthusiastic about her business and keeps her Sauna spotlessly clean!
She is always looking into new ways to help make the session a more immersive experience for her customers!
Some of the things Sara does is that she adds essential oils to the water bucket inside the sauna. Then as you pour this water over the hot rocks the steam is infused with the oils.
She also holds birching Sauna sessions, Yoga Sauna sessions and full moon Sauna sessions!

The Sauna:
It is a traditional wood framed Sauna which uses a wood burning stove to produce the heat. The stove is fuelled from the exterior while the body of the stove and chimney is on the inside. There are rocks surrounding the body of the stove and are constantly being heated.
There is a bucket of water beside the stove with a ladle and this can be used to pour water over the rocks to create steam!
There is a hygrometer and a thermometer allowing the customer to monitor conditions within the Sauna. There is also a sand timer in the Sauna rated in 5 minute increments and a maximum of 15 minutes. This ideal to track your session and wearing an electronic watch or metal watch is not ideal in the hot and humid environment of the Sauna!

Benefits for me:
I'm not going to claim all the benefits that some people say that Saunas and cold water swimming can aid to however, I do feel amazing after a session and Sara's Sauna is in the perfect location for me.
I love immersing myself in the cold water for a few minutes and then going for about a 15 minute sweat and then back into the water. Each time that we have went so far we have gone for an hour and we aim to get 4 to 5 dips with each session.
The amount of swims or how long you want to spend in the Sauna is all up to you and I find the sand timer great for this!

Cost:
I think the Sauna is very reasonable at ‚Ç¨10 for half an hour or ‚Ç¨20 for a full hour. This is for an open session where you and others can come and go as you or they please.
There is the option of booking a private session for ‚Ç¨85 for an hour. This is also reasonable in my opinion as if you can split it with 5 or more friends it works out cheaper than an open session!

Tips:
I would look at the tide times so that you can avail of the high tide and don't have to walk to far from the Sauna to get to the water.
Opening times change everyday as I believe Sara follows the high tide so it could be a morning session or an evening session that she is open for.
Bring 2 towels as you will need a fresh towel to dry off afterwards and I recommend to sit on a different one so that you keep it clean/hygenic for other Sauna users!

Overall opinion:
I think that the experienct you get at Swede Sauna is brilliant! Sara is very friendly and the location can't be beaten!
I highly recommend giving it a try, you won't be disappointed! || Have visited Swede Sauna 3 times in the last couple of months with family and friends. Visited at the weekend and  2 out of the 3 times Sara had overbooked the sauna so wasnt as enjoyable experience as other saunas I tried around Cork. Online booking says it holds 8 people but Sara has over booked it to be 12 people. Its too much of a tight squeeze and then youre coordinating with other between re who is in the sauna vs in the sea. The first time it happened Sara said it was an accident that it was overbooked by mistake but then it happened a second time I visited so I think its something that happens regularly. Such a shame as its a gorgeous location, just not very relaxing when youre packed in with too many people. Won't be back unfortunately.

name: The Sweaty Sanctuary Sauna
address: Inch Beach East, Cork, Ireland
reviews_text:
Love visiting the sauna. It has a great online booking system and they are always there to greet you.
Love the new addition of the little benches to the side to chill out before or after! || Immaculate and really friendly owner. Keeps a fire pit constantly being stoked up beside the Sauna to sit by and all customers are well looked after. Great view of Inch beach. Highly recommend. || Amazing treat, so invigorating and relaxing in equal measure. Was a treat while visiting my friend, though we enjoyedit so much, booked again for next day! Thank you for a fab experience in a gorgeous location üòä || I have been a regular in the Sweaty Sanctuary since last October. Even through the winter months when the air was 2 degrees and the sea was 9. It is a wonderfully invigorating experience and a morning session sets the tone for the whole day. I was happy to see the extended opening hours in the summer. || thesweatysanctuarysauna is part of my normal weekend ritual. Paddy and Abby are welcoming for newcomers and locals alike. There is a lovely community gathering around inch beach as a result of the sauna. I love the chats and I love the silence. I love the sea and the sauna. It is a great experience for those who have never been before and every time I go. Have huge gratitude to Paddy for making the sauna a constant in my life.

I took this photo of inch as I was leaving on Friday evening, and found this poem on the website formerly known as twitter. It was written by the daughter of @ThomasWPenny whose teacher is @CalebParkin. I am including here for those that have no answers, you may find them in the sweaty sanctuary sauna.

name: Driftwood Sauna
address: Spiddal Pier, Bohoona East, An Spid√©al, Co. Galway, Ireland
reviews_text:
Spent a lovely afternoon here for my birthday with my mum. Monique was so welcoming and made our first sauna experience at Driftwood really enjoyable. The views from the sauna are gorgeous, the plunge pools are spotless, the fresh drinking water is such a nice touch. Our fellow sauna-goers were very friendly as well. We left feeling so relaxed and refreshed. Well done! üßñüèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüåäüåø || The saunas are in an incredible location with stunning views! The sauna itself is excellent‚Äîintensely hot, just as it should be. You can cool down with perfect ice baths or even take a dip in the sea if you prefer. The staff were very friendly. I felt so relaxed and calm afterwards, and we also got to try some lovely R√≠ na Mara facial products. My skin felt incredibly soft after using them!
I‚Äôd 100% recommend giving this place a try! || What a beautiful experience. Went with two of my friends on a Sunday afternoon and it was amazing - lovely bunch of people. Finally a proper sauna - clean, hot and spacious enough for the group of us. Baths were super clean too. Beautiful view and we were lucky to watch the sun going down too.
Highly recommend! || I really enjoyed my social sauna experience! The views are lovely, and the facilities were nice and clean. Sauna temperature felt perfect. My only feedback is that 50min felt too short to do more than one hot/cold cycle without rushing. I would be willing to pay a bit more for a 70-90 min session, to be able to do a couple cycles and take my time dipping in the ocean/enjoying the fresh air before re-entering the sauna. || One of, if not, Galway‚Äôs best sauna. I‚Äôm a regular sauna goer and driftwood is up there with one of the best. The temperature is always right, the saunas are always clean and the views from the ice baths are phenomenal. Driftwood Sauna is an example of a business built with love and passion. If you havn‚Äôt tried a sauna / plunge experience yet or are a regular sauna user you won‚Äôt be disappointed!

name: Cedar & Steam Sauna | Ballycroneen Strand & Guileen Bay | East Cork
address: Ballycroneen, Beach, Cloyne, Co. Cork, Ireland
reviews_text: I booked in a private session with a group of friends and we had the best experience here facilitated by Mike. We will definitely be back!

name: Sandycove Sauna
address: Sandycove, Slipway, Co. Cork, Ireland
reviews_text:
Incredible sauna experience! Stunning views of the sea from the sauna itself through lovely semi circular window. Then the wild freedom of running straight into the sea to cool off. Sheer joy. Felt very looked after by the owner too, we were given hair oil and he topped up the sauna while we were in the water. Can‚Äôt recommend highly enough. || The Sandycove Sauna is everything you could want out of a sauna experience and more. The host is incredibly attentive and kind (more on this later). The sauna itself is wonderful and roars to a perfect 105¬∫C. Sandycove is right there and a delight to swim in, especially at high tide, where you can jump in, making for quick sauna-to-ocean transfers.

Having recently spent a few weeks in Denmark and the Faroe Islands at a dozen saunas, this sauna was up there with the best saunas of Copenhagen. Only advice is, if coming from Kinsale, do not walk; take a car (or maybe bike).

We were only in Kinsale for 1 night and upon arrival, I stumbled across the sauna on google maps. I called the phone number and while no reply, had a response within 2 hours and we were accommodated at the last minute an hour later. I am so grateful she made time because I simply could not recommend this experience enough to both the sauna novice and experienced sauna master. || I'm a regular here, it's absolutely lovely and the owners are really super chilled people. 100% recommend || First time using a sauna and then a sea swim. Love sandycove but was dreading the cold water after a sauna tbh. But was given great advice and went into the sea. An unreal experience and seems addictive. Felt great for hours afterwards. Anthony very easy to deal with and the woman operating the sauna was very friendly and helpful.  Will do it regularly and would highly recommend this sauna and the location || Anthony's an absolute gent offering a great sauna experience in a fantastic location with an equally friendly & chatty clientele. Forget all your worries and embrace a bracing sea-sauna experience!

name: Sauna Suaimhneas
address: Dough, Lahinch, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews_text:
So this was my second time visiting Sauna Suaimhneas. The first time was in Clahane and the second was just yesterday in Lahinch. For anyone thinking of trying the sauna experience with these guys, please do. I‚Äôve gone to many saunas in a hotel/leisure centre. The log saunas are so much better. Myself and my friends felt amazing coming out of the experience.
As for the service, I couldn‚Äôt fault it. Yesterday and on our first visit to the sauna, I couldn‚Äôt fault it. The team are very friendly and helpful. I couldn‚Äôt fault the service and I‚Äôd highly recommend it. I‚Äôll most definitely be back. || I had the most wonderful experience at white strand . Next time I‚Äôm in Clare I‚Äôll definitely be going back. The little touches like having the salt rub and being able to have a delicious Moss Boss brew afterwards made it the most beautiful spa in the world.
Loved meeting and chatting with Roisin , she was so welcoming and friendly and even the people we met in the sauna were so friendly.
The scenery and White Strand itself was just so beautiful. Hope to see you all again very soon.
Thanks to you all for a wonderful experience.
Love Clare , Love Clare People, ‚ù§Ô∏è || Absolutely cosy! And the owners are very lovely and friendlyüëå Whitestrand is a beautiful location next to the sea.. || The Sauna ceremony today was absolutely delightful. Loved every aspect of it including the salt rub, birch whisks and the oils used. I will definitely be back next time I‚Äôm in Clare! Thank you || We recently had a family gathering and booked the sauna in Clahane. It was so much fun. The sauna is great, very clean. It can fit up to 8 people. The Sauna Suaimhneas crew is super friendly and kind. Definitely doing it again.

name: Wild Atlantic Seaweed Baths
address: Doolin Pier, Ballaghaline, Doolin, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews_text:
An absolute must-do experience! Wild Atlantic Seaweed Baths is truly unique and super cool. You get to relax in recycled Irish whiskey barrels turned into hot saltwater tubs, filled with seaweed that‚Äôs amazing for your skin. The setup overlooks the Atlantic Ocean, with the breathtaking Cliffs of Moher in the distance‚Äîit doesn‚Äôt get more magical than that.

There‚Äôs also a cozy hot sauna, and since the number of tubs and sauna spots are limited, it never feels crowded. It‚Äôs incredibly relaxing to soak while listening to the waves crash against the shore. On top of that, you meet people from all over the world, which makes the experience even more special.

The staff are wonderful‚Äîso friendly and helpful, which adds to the welcoming vibe. I absolutely loved it, and can‚Äôt recommend it enough. If you‚Äôre in the area, this is something you don‚Äôt want to miss! || If you‚Äôre contemplating it, DO IT! It‚Äôs a remarkable experience ~ sitting in replenishing Irish seaweed, warm and cozy to the bone with the fresh Atlantic sea breeze and views of the coast. The staff were so lovely and helpful.

There are no bathrooms, so bring your clothes and towel to get changed in a nook behind the sauna.

Loved it! || Exhausted parents, this is the treat for you! We had the pleasure of (taking turns!) and basking in oh so comfortable seaweed hot-tub on a beautiful spring day on our sons first trip to the coast. The staff were extremely friendly, accommodating and genuinely nice which made it all the easier to sit back, relax and watch the waves roll in. The local seaweed and hot-water on demand was a great touch, meaning we were able to top the tub ensuring it stayed nice and hot throughout our session. It was so relaxing, I didn‚Äôt want to get out! The perfect seaside experience, I have bought it as a gift for friends and family since. Highly recommend || Wild Atlantic Seaweed Baths was genuinely one of the best experiences I have ever had. The staff were warm, kind, and so welcoming, which made the visit feel special from the start. I definitely recommend booking your own tub. Having that private time to fully relax, soak, and take in the experience without rushing made it unforgettable. The entire atmosphere is calming, unique, and something I think everyone should try at least once. I would return in a heartbeat. || What an amazing experience!
My first experience at Wild Atlantic Seaweed baths did not disappoint and it won't be my last. From the friendly introductions from Owen & Eoin, the breathtaking views, hot water on demand, luscious seaweed, option of cold water plunge and shower this was  a great experience. We felt renewed, revitalised and relaxed after this experience and we will be back! Thank you

name: Doolin Sauna (Seafoam Sauna)
address: Doolin pier, Ballaghaline, Doolin, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews_text:
I cannot recommend this experience enough! As a self proclaimed seaweed bath connoisseur, no one does it better than Wild Atlantic Way. Right on the Doolin Pier overlooking the Cliffs of Moher and Inis O√≠rr soak in a recycled whiskey barrel and freshly clean foraged seaweed. They‚Äôre incredibly accommodating and kind. There‚Äôs a cold plunge and cold shower to dip in and out of as well as a personal tap to refill your tub with hot ocean water. You will leave with your skin feeling soft as a seal for days! They also have a stunning sauna. || Had a sauna sesh before our seaweed bath and it was well worth it. They get it suuuuuper hot and then you take a cold plunge in the barrel filled with fresh sea water and it‚Äôs like medicine. So so good. || Had a lovely one hour sauna session with barrell dipping in between yesterday. Lovely view, great value and feel great after. Lovely experience. Easy booking online, recommend if in the area. || Lovely views and it‚Äôs piping hot - loved it
+ seaweed bath right next to it which I highly recommend || Amazing experience. I have never been as relaxed.

name: Brandon Bay Sauna
address: Fahamore Maharees, Fahamore, Castlegregory, Co. Kerry, V92 A3Y6, Ireland
reviews_text: One of the top spots to enjoy a first class outdoor sauna with epic view ,direct ocean access and dip,  cold plunge , shower.  And even inside you can see trough a big panorama window on Brandon bay || Great little sauna with an amazing view || This place is class, at the end of beach even on a busy August day it feels so calm down there with amazing views and access to the sea to cool down. Be sure to check tides as a Low tide makes access impossible. Amazing food & coffee truck beside the place too for afterwards. Not suitable for big groups as a small sauna but perfect for 4 people aprx! Kind and friendly host again for the views this place is great! || Wood burning sauna with easy access to the ocean and a nice pub across the street for a post sauna beer. Great spot! Thank you Ben! || My first beach sauna, very relaxed and enjoyable vibe, great value, sea was fabulous, am coming back  especially for winter. Thanks to Fiona running the place

name: SAY-Saunas
address: 27 Sandycove Road, Sandycove, Dublin, A96 KD53, Ireland
reviews_text:
Your sauna worker Eric is absolutely excellent. I am a regular customer and every time Eric is working the place is spotless, floors are dry, the saunas are roaring hot, incense is burning (very important touch to me), all water buckets are filled and infused with oils. Give this man a raise. He really really knows what he‚Äôs doing. The energy he creates is immaculate. He makes me want to return for a session sooner. || Very nice place that wasn't busy for a Sunday! Good scheduling I guess. Place is well organized.

Water pressure in the shower is low which takes time to shower, also it's not a proper shower just a pipe that has many holes in it. It does the job but would have been perfect with proper showers. || This place is so overbooked. The 2 saunas were completely packed in the 30 mins out of the one hour we booked. I was standing outside cold just waiting the whole time. At least 5 people were waiting outside for spots in the sauna.

They also did not prepare the ice baths before the customers came, so there were no ice baths during our slot. They then used the shower taps to fill the tubs, which made it impossible to shower.

It's a great concept, but poorly executed. There are much better places somewhere else in Dublin || Quirky place... Had really good sauna s and cold plunge pool and sauna... little food cafes as well ...wine and beers. ..young chatty staff ..Eva was very helpful and informative. || What a vibe- love this place so much! The sauna is a constant 90'C which Is in the optimum range for all the incredible health benefits you read about. I never saw any benefits from the sauna in my old gym which i now realise is because it was only ever 50'C!! Well done Trevor & team, keep doing what you're doing üëè

name: Samhradh's Sauna

reviews_text: A wonderful sauna experience overlooking the most beautiful landscape. Cromane beach is surrounded by the hills of both the Iveragh and Dingle peninsulas. Highly recommend. || Rain, hail or shine it‚Äôs amazing, all the elements, it‚Äôs one of the most revitalizing things to do! Thank you ü§© || Lovely setting, great service. Look forward to doing it again! || We enjoyed this experience! And sauna is nice ! Thank you

name: Connemara Seaweed Baths

reviews_text:
An absolute gem of a place! The Connemara Seaweed Baths are beautifully tucked away in a peaceful setting with stunning views ‚Äî a perfect escape. name: Sauna Suaimhneas
