We loved it and would highly recommend

name: Birchwood Sauna
address: Mountshannon Harbour, Mountshannon, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews_text: I‚Äôve been beyond lucky to have experienced three saunas at Anna‚Äôs Birchwood Sauna in the short time I‚Äôve been staying in the Mountshannon area. Anna‚Äôs thought of every detail: from the sauna towels, to the fragranced water that Anna puts on the coals at the end of the session, to the different scrubs that had been handmade by her, to the delicious homemade plant-based protein balls to finish off the experience. The experience is a sauna and spa experience on the banks of the beautiful lake which is perfect for the cold dips. The full moon session was incredible with a built fire and tea and some snacks. Thank you for your love and care, Anna!! || Had a wonderful visit to Birchwood sauna with my friends recently. The sauna temperature and treatment was excellent and the essential oil salts, ginger and lemon drink and powerball to finish were a fantastic addition. A really unique offering here at Birchwood sauna and I would highly recommend a visit when visiting Mountshannon. Perfect when you pull up in a cruise boat on the Shannon. || Went with 6 friends and it was a lovely experience - we LOVED the essential oils and homemade scrubs. My friends and I pulled the boat in at Mountshannon - it was great to get to swim in the lake and then hop back into the lovely warm sauna. I booked via messaging the Instagram page - was quick and easy and would recommend to all! The owner is very friendly. Great local business! || As if the sauna experience right on the lake front wasn't good enough, Anna provides refreshing infused water, lovely homemade body scrubs and delicious treats for after the session. The essential oils used for the steam smells amazing and it was a 10/10 experience all round! || A wonderful sauna experience. Anna is such a great host. There are various handmade bodyscrubs, very fine energy balls, of course also homemade, and a small, fine, aromatic infusion. Birchwood Sauna is the perfect place to relax and puts you in a very good mood. I'm already looking forward to my next visit to the sauna in the harbour.

name: Lakeside Sauna Skenanagh
address: XP9M+C5, Glenbower, Luska, Co. Tipperary, Ireland
reviews_text:
Really enjoyed this. Visited the sauna at Youghal Quay. It's a fantastic set up, and excellent service. Sauna is very hot and it's only a few short steps to jump into the water and cool off. Highly recommend. || I visited here this evening for a sauna in the dark. This is the best sauna experience I‚Äôve had on this island. The two barrels are bijou but the hosting was fantastic. Nicely lit around the saunas. Rope lighting guiding you to the best place to enter the lake.

Nice heat and mini aufguss. Wonderful soaked sauna beanies. Good fires in the stoves. Camomile tea and dates along with plenty of drinking water.

I would recommend this sauna to everyone. A bit of a drive to meet with some friends but met plenty more.

Manini take a bow. You nailed it. üéØ || A magical, relaxing, fun experience.  Move from the intense heat of the sauna to the  chilly shock of the lake and back again.
Beautiful restful view from sauna.
Lake shore very stony with sharp slippy stones which makes access tricky so wear swim shoes unless you have tough feet! || Unexpected:  mobile saunas on the lakeside, available to anyone. || Great for spend time

name: Cois Farraige White Strand, Miltown Malbay, Co. Clare
address: White Strand, Fintra More, Miltown Malbay, Co. Clare, V95 C867, Ireland
reviews_text: Brilliant sauna close to the sea, lots of room, great availability too! Had an amazing sunset sauna today, not my first visit & definitely not my last, can't beat the feeling üåäüíô || I like that fact that you can just rock on up without booking. The view of Mal Bay is spectacular and some days you can watch dolphins and seals swimming in the bay.access to the water is easy and  price is competitive . || COIS Farraige Sauna, based in beautiful White Strand is by far the best seaside sauna, location,  price, friendly owners and vista.......well worth a visit || Great price, friendly service, right beside the beach. Brilliant experience. Have been multiple times now and will continue going. üôè ||

name: Hidden Gem Retreat
address: Knockatullaghaun, Moughna, Co. Clare, V95 PR92, Ireland
reviews_text:
I have visited Hidden Gem retreat a number of times now and really recommend Suzy and the lovely space. I have found the float really restful and helpful as I destressed during a long illnes. I usually followed that with a massage and I think Suzy is the best I have met in a long time - so kind and intuitive - I could really rest into the experience. I've also had the Japanese facelift and it made me feel beautiful. All in all, highly recommend. || We visited Hidden Gem Retreat for a low key yoga hen party and it was absolutely fantastic. Suzy was so helpful and accommodating from the moment I got in contact to organise our retreat. We were a group of eight ladies, and Suzy first provided the most beautiful Italian-themed vegetarian lunch, which we ate in her lovely conservatory. We then had a wonderfully relaxing yoga class with Fiona, which we all thoroughly enjoyed.
I would highly recommend Hidden Gem for small group retreats, and if you are looking for a nice relaxed hen party or girls trip this is just perfect! It was also very reasonably priced for the quality and attention we received.
Suzy and her family are just lovely and it really felt like we were visiting a friend‚Äôs home. I will certainly be looking for excuses to go back! || I just had a wonderful experience with flotation therapy at The Hidden Gem. I highly recommend this to everyone‚Äîit‚Äôs so relaxing and therapeutic. Suzie was lovely and made me feel incredibly relaxed and welcomed. The Hidden Gem is a beautiful space, complete with a lovely orchard that adds to the tranquil atmosphere. A truly rejuvenating experience! || Suzy and Rob are great hosts - I had an extremely relaxing time in the flotation tank. The surrounding gardens, campsite and vegetable plot are well maintained set in stunning rural location with views over the hills. Will definitely be back! || A beautiful space surrounded by nature. I love coming here for a day retreat and a rejuvenating float! The food is delicious and made with lots of love during the retreats I have hosted and attended.
Rob and Suzy are the nicest people too :)

name: Serenity Saunas
address: Worlds End, Lacka, Castleconnell, Co. Limerick, Ireland
reviews_text:
Serenity Saunas never fail to deliver.  Always spotless, always improving. Particularly like the outdoor dressing bench and the faux grass.  I have to say that the customer service is 110% - never fails to go completely over the top. Nothing is a problem, always flexible, helpful, friendly - everything! There is a reason I am a solid regular and will continue to be - thanks so much for everything you guys!
Also - really enjoying the raised water level! Maybe keep it there for a while?! :D || Went to the O‚Äô Briensbridge location yesterday. Fantastic experience, stunning location for the views and a river dip. 10/10 highly recommend and I will definitely be back ‚ù§Ô∏è || OMG‚Ä¶..what a privilege to experience such a beautiful sauna on the Shannon River! Whenever I travel somewhere the first thing I do is look for a sauna and was absolutely delighted to find this gem! The sauna itself is a masterpiece and the heat from the Harvia wood stove is Devine and produces lovely Loyly! And then there is the serenity of the the setting and the cooling peaceful power of the Shannon River! The bonus was meeting several charming and welcoming people that made us feel like locals! Do not pass up an opportunity to visit Serenity Sauna! Also got to meet   Aine and Oren‚Ä¶.lovely beyond words!

Filled with gratitude! || I cannot recommend Serenity Sauna enough!
It is set in a beautiful location overlooking the river and is always very well maintained. The owners are always so friendly and have thought of everything from changing mats, securing your keys and phone, a beautiful scrub for your last dip and moisturiser to add to that zen feeling. Anyone in the area needs to check this out. || I regularly enjoy serenity saunas - 2 or 3 times a week. They have 2 usual locations (Castle Connell and O‚ÄôBrien‚Äôs Bride), both have their own charm. Aine, Tiernan, Josh and Sam are friendly welcoming and helpful. A lovely way to start or end the day. Thank you guys for making a lovely experience for us locals and visitors alike!

name: Falls Hotel & Spa
address: Glencree, Castlequarter, Ennistymon, Co. Clare, V95 D2PC, Ireland
summary: Cosy country hotel set in an 18th-century mansion offering a restaurant, a spa & an indoor pool.
reviews_text:
I‚Äôm trying to find something bad or wrong about this hotel, like.. really really trying.. and I simply can‚Äôt. I‚Äôm on a tour across the country to visit every single county atm so I spend every night in a different hotel. This is THE BEST hotel so far I came across (from maaany)

So what would you want from a hotel?
‚úÖ really comfy beds
‚úÖ unusually good at hospitality staff
‚úÖ swimming pool
‚úÖ hot tube outside with an amazing view
‚úÖ sauna AND a steaming room
‚úÖ relaxing indoor jacuzzi
‚úÖ breakfast that will make you rewatch all Gordon Ramsey clips to re-learn how to breakfast again
‚úÖ gym - let‚Äôs face it you will need it after breakfast like this
‚úÖ aqua aerobics
‚úÖ swimming classes
‚úÖ bridge tournaments‚Ä¶..

Did I mention the view??? I mean‚Ä¶ not. a. single. flaw!

Well done to whoever is managing this place to keep it affordable with all these revenue streams and kudos to the hiring team for having an amazing eye for outstanding hospitality staff. Special mention to the lovely lady in the swimming pool reception who made me feel so welcomed in a setting I wasn‚Äôt really comfortable with.
Photo of my dinner üòÉ || This is a great old historic hotel.  The rooms are very comfortable, but the furnishings do look a bit dated.  Rooms have old fashioned keys, not the electronic cards that we're used to.  These rooms are not air conditioned, so they could get warm in the summer months.  We were there in October and although is was very cool outside, the room did get warm. I made sure the radiator was off and the window was open, day and night.  One night we had to request a fan to cool it down.  The service was great and the staff extremely friendly and helpful. The food in the restaurants was great too!  While we were there, there was 2 weddings taking place! || The Falls Hotel was a lovely host during my recent visit to Cliffs of Moher.  The property is quite large. My room was spacious with a view of the falls.  The bathroom was large with tub and separate rain shower.  The breakfast is spectacular!  There is a pool and gym for guests. The hotel is comfortable and full of history. || This was our second time staying here, and again it was great, such a lovely clean hotel, great staff, great food, 13th December is their party night so plenty of buzz around the hotel. The swimming pool and hot tubs are great, not packed, clean, cosy. Would recommend for families and groups of friends, company parties, etc. || Just enjoyed a overnight dinner b&b at this lovely hotel. Spectacular views of the falls as well as being pampered by the staff at dinner and breakfast. Couldn't ask for better. Leisure center is lovely but the icing on the cake is the outdoor jacuzzi..at night while its raining so cool.

name: RealeBurrenSauna
address: h91kv4h, Moy, Kinvarra, Co. Galway, H91 KV4H, Ireland
reviews_text:
You must get to this amazing space. The Sauna was beautiful and what a view. The cold plunge after the sauna was revitalising to say the least. I was welcomed on arrival and shown how to use everything. If you are in the area trust me it will be worth getting yourself here üëå || Visited Reale Burren Sauna at the weekend and had an amazing experience. My partner booked an hour slot kinda last minute and the facilities were fantastic. The sauna was so spacious & comfortable and the plunge pool was incredible ‚Äî a great temperature and the ideal way to finish the session.
Although I can‚Äôt use a sauna at the moment, I was able to come along and sit by the pool, which was really appreciated. There‚Äôs a bench area and a clock clearly visible outside the sauna door which is so handy.
The shower and bathroom facilities were excellent, with great water pressure and a really nice setup to freshen up afterwards. There‚Äôs also a drinks fridge on site that you can Revolut to use ‚Äî such a lovely touch and definitely appreciated, as our 1L of water wasn‚Äôt enough!
Damien was incredibly friendly and accommodating, providing a genuine 10/10 service. We‚Äôll absolutely be back again ‚Äî well worth the hour‚Äôs drive from Limerick. || From the moment you step in, the space feels calm, warm, and intentional ‚Äî every detail considered. The sauna itself is beautifully crafted, clean, and super comfortable, with lovely views of the Burren. Whether you‚Äôre a sauna regular or trying it for the first time I can‚Äôt recommend it enough! || This was far and above the best sauna plunge experience I‚Äôve had to date. Gorgeous location. Lavish set up. Super kind hosts. 10 out of 10. Highly recommend. || I think this sauna has been the best I‚Äôve tried in Ireland so far! Everything was perfect and Damien was really nice in showing us around. The sauna is comfortable and cosy with the plunge room inside the changing room. The place has also a toilet and a shower, pretty handy if you‚Äôre not heading back home after. I loved the idea of having the speakers inside the sauna that we connected to our phones. A perfect set up for a fantastic and relaxing experience. We‚Äôll definitely be backüòä

name: Sionna Spa
address: Killaloe Hotel & Spa, Knockyclovaun, Kincora Harbour, Co. Clare, V94 W025, Ireland
reviews_text:
‚ÄãI unfortunately missed my original appointment (my fault entirely!). The manager, Clodagh, was incredibly kind and empathetic and helped me reschedule an appointment.I was especially impressed that Clodagh was so understanding and made the process extremely easy.
‚ÄãMy treatment with the therapist, √Åine, was absolutely excellent and a great value. The treatment was very relaxing and I loved every minute of it. The way they handled everything showed a truly exemplary, professional, and outstanding level of customer service.
‚ÄãBased on √Åine's skill, Clodagh's fantastic attitude, and their integrity, I wholeheartedly give them 5 stars! Highly recommend this spa for both quality and integrity. || At the desk Katerina, was friendly and welcoming as she helped me schedule a massage for the next day.
Since we were on bikes, she explained that my husband could wait in the sauna and relaxation room during my massage.
The hot oil sounded perfect for the October weather. Clauda is an expert in therapeutic massage. She went out of her way to take care of my special needs. For decades, I have received massage and Clauda is among the very best. Her touch is skilled and healing. She is caring and kind. Her treatment was a highlight of my three week European trip including Ireland. || Had a lovely afternoon yesterday in Sionna Spa. Clodagh was super friendly and so accommodating. We were treated to a bottle of prosecco which was an amazing surprise. My friend and I had treatments booked one hour apart but we were able to get our treatments at the same time which it very much appreciated. We thoroughly enjoyed our treatments. We regret not booking n overnight stay, we enjoyed it that much. Thank you. || Absolutely amazing experience, I went with my mum and we loved every second. We both feel so relaxed after it. All the staff were so friendly and kind, the atmosphere was so calm and zen - we feel so refreshed after our treatments! || My sister and I really enjoyed our experience recently in sionna Spa üôèüòä customer service was excellent. Cloddagh was so kind and empathic when I Had to cancel/reschedule a few times as I had no transport to travel from Galway, I am so grateful to her.Cloddagh and Izzy really went above and beyond for my sister and I, it really made our day.. The most zen calm peaceful time out üòä beautiful hotel and intimate peaceful spa.. Glass of prosecco upon arrival is a really nice touch üç∏üëå thanks so much üéÅ

name: The Barn Sauna & Cold Plunge
address: Coonagh Cross, Coonagh Rd, Clondrinagh, Limerick, V94 E5F6, Ireland
reviews_text:
I‚Äôve been here a lot and I have to say I will not be back. This place does not value its regular customers and it seems as though they‚Äôre trying to make as much money out of people. No toilet facilities within the barn facility itself. You hydrate and drink water when you‚Äôre in the sauna and have to go into the gym next door to go to the toilet. Now they‚Äôve put in an extra sauna but haven‚Äôt put in basic facilities. Talk about cramming people into a small space to generate more revenue.

I tried to use the shower after in the gym. Was told by one staff member I could and when I came in after using sauna and cold plunge pool, a staff member blocked my way and stood infront of me and told me I couldn‚Äôt. Despite the fact I was told I could before, he persisted in saying I couldn‚Äôt.

It‚Äôs clear they‚Äôve no loyalties towards their regular customers and it‚Äôs just about making as much money out of people. What a shame. || Tried to book 4 sessions with my girlfriend, I couldn‚Äôt find a way to pay or see if it was pay on arrival, or get in contact with the pages.

Got charged ‚Ç¨60 for 4 sessions that I had cancelled.

I booked and cancelled within an hour and There was no information regarding cancellation periods.

Booking system is ridiculous and  should really be reimbursed for that.

Have seen quite a few comments regarding booking sysmtem being iffy too. ||  ||

name: Foll√°ine Sauna
address: Annaghdown, Co. Galway, Ireland
reviews_text:
Fantastic spot. The sauna is spotless, well-kept, and perfectly heated. Having the pier right beside it makes the whole experience even better. A quick cold dip after the heat is genuinely refreshing and the views are unreal.

What really makes the place stand out is the owner. He‚Äôs incredibly friendly, easy to chat to, and creates a lovely atmosphere from the moment you arrive. You feel looked after without anything being forced.

Wishing them all the best. Highly recommended to anyone passing through or living nearby. || Fab Sauna. They keep it 100C+ and it‚Äôs great having the deep water pier so close. The super cold fresh water is great for the cycles and it‚Äôs nice not getting covered in salt || Beautiful setting and the sauna is top class. Too jump into the water to cool down after and during the sauna was amazing. Fantastic spot. || I visit this mobile twice a week, and it‚Äôs truly the best part of my routine. It‚Äôs a great place to relax and connect with others, and the couple who run it are absolutely wonderful. Always clean, calming, and well-managed‚ÄîI can‚Äôt recommend it enough || This is an absolute gem to our community,
It‚Äôs by far the best sauna I‚Äôve been to and the young couple that run it no matter the weather always have a smile on their faces and up for a conversation about anythingüòÅ
Highly recommend visiting this sauna at annaghdown pier

name: Cliffs of Moher Retreat
address: Moher Lodge, Kinielty, Liscannor, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews_text:
This was a beautiful experience from the start to finish. We stayed in Atlantic 1. Myself and my husband highly recommend this room as it has private en suite and beautiful view onto the sea. The bed was so comfortable. The food was absolutely incredible. The chef Martha is a wizard. The best part for both of us was our main facilitator Aoife Mc Dermott. I‚Äôve done years of meditation and yoga but nothing like what Aoife could offer. She‚Äôs amazingly talented and knowledgable as well as funny and laid back. She made everyone so relaxed and comfortable. The hot tub was available at all times, so nice late at night. Can‚Äôt wait to return!! || Cliffs of Moher Retreat exceeded my expectations in every way... to be honest, I didn't really have expectations because I didn't know what to expect :) I had never done a retreat before.  My friend and I signed up for the weekend Yoga & Hiking retreat on a whim - and flew over from the US on a long weekend.
Everything was incredible... THE FOOD!  WOW!  So beautiful and nourishing.... The setting .... GORGEOUS... The instruction (Aoife) was AMAZING... and the other participants were REFRESHING- I felt surrounded by like minded people.  I truly enjoyed EVERY MOMENT!  I also realized the weekend was not really about Yoga, but about wellness and well-being.  My friend and I would already like to plan a return trip.  I can't say enough good things about Cliffs of Moher Retreat. || A friend and I went for a weekend retreat and it was absolutely brilliant! The food, yoga and meditation, facilities, location... all of it, was excellent. And, I can't stress enough how kind and welcoming the staff were. I'll certainly be recommending this wonderful place to anyone looking for a few days of peace and relaxation. || A little piece of Heaven.  Everything is 5 üåü
It was the most relaxing weekend I‚Äôve honestly ever had.  It has now replaced the Maldives as my No.1 Happy Place. Worth every cent. I‚Äôll definitely be returning. || I had the most beautiful time last weekend. From the yoga, to the food and the breathtaking views it was everything I needed for a perfect reset. Aoife and Ciara were so warm and welcoming and every detail was thoughtfully considered. Thank you to all the team for such a memorable experience.

name: Kilkee Thalassotherapy Centre & Guest House
address: 19 Gratten St, Dough, Co. Clare, Ireland
reviews_text:
We had a very relaxing one night stay in this guesthouse. Eileen, the host was very welcoming. Beds were very comfortable. Room was fresh and clean. The full Irish breakfast was of excellent quality. I would return there again as it was very relaxing and good value for money. || Eileen is just a wonderful hostess.  Location is great, so near the beach but in quiet area. Highly recommend Ultra stress boost therapy, new me after that!!
Highly recommend both the guest house and spa || I didn‚Äôt stay in the guest house. I‚Äôm reviewing the excellent seaweed baths in the therapy centre which I would highly recommend. The centre is run by Eileen who is the epitome of Clare hospitality. You must try the seaweed baths, you will feel so refreshed afterwards üëåüèª || Eileen was a great host, friendly and knowledgeable. The rooms were classic with big iron baths and brass taps. Plenty of hot water on tap if you can handle it but the rooms were also well ventilated so you don't feel faint. The seaweed made the water super thick and we felt brand new after it. Highly recommended. We'll be back. || Outstanding breakfast, service, friendliness, flexibility on schedule changes.   All around great experience.  Only one block from beautiful beaches.  Can‚Äôt recommend enough.  Would definitely come back!

name: Sauna Fi√°in

reviews_text: This was such a great experience. Felt amazing to go between the heat of the Sauna and cold of the water. Never done anything like it before. Will definitely be back! Thanks so much for a lovely experience...highly recommended!! || Sauna Fi√°in is exactly what Renville needed! Emer is an absolute breath of fresh air. Her sauna is the perfect addition to the pier. name: Serenity Saunas
address: Main St, O'Briensbridge, O'Briensbridge-Montpelier, Co. Clare, Ireland

name: Revival Float Rooms
address: Revival Rooms, An D√∫n, Church Rd, Raheen, Limerick, V94 NY24, Ireland
reviews_text:
Had a 30-minute infrared sauna followed by a 60-minute float as a Christmas gift. The space was clean, quiet, and well set up, and everything was clearly explained beforehand. Both sessions were relaxing and unhurried, and the staff were friendly. A nice experience overall and something I‚Äôd consider doing again. || I had the most incredible experience at Revival Rooms in Limerick! From the moment I walked in, I was greeted by friendly and professional staff who explained everything in detail to make me feel completely at ease. I opted for the Double Float floatation therapy, and it was beyond relaxing! The pod, filled with magnesium Epsom salts, made it easy to float weightlessly, and the calming environment helped me unwind and clear my mind.

The ambiance of the place is peaceful and inviting, with soothing music and dim lighting adding to the calming effect. The staff were amazing, providing excellent service and making sure I had everything I needed. I highly recommend Revival Rooms to anyone looking for a holistic approach to relaxation, stress relief, or recovery from pain.

I‚Äôm definitely looking forward to my next visit! || I had my first float yesterday, wasn‚Äôt sure what to expect, took me a few minutes to get used to it, but very enjoyable and relaxing. The staff were lovely, explained everything before starting, the place was spotless and the atmosphere was so relaxing. || Fabulous relaxing deep soak in a beautiful peaceful space. Felt like I was in a bubble - a complete escape from the world.
Well designed spotless facilities with a additional Refresh room and Relaxation area. Very polite and helpful staff. Really enjoyed my first visit here and I slept like a baby afterwards. I will be back. || The float was great, but what‚Äôs more it‚Äôs the after service, the relaxation room with good tea, good reading materials written by the Eanna himself who is the owner..and instruments to play. Well thought out from user experience point of view!

name: Ritual Sauna & Coffee
address: The marina, Dromineer, Nenagh, Co. Tipperary, E45 FH93, Ireland
reviews_text:
Great sauna, very clean and a lovely view of the lake no matter where you sit. So close to the lake for dipping too. Also had a delicious hot chocolate after from the coffee hut ‚ò∫Ô∏è || Solo sauna user, lucky my slot was just me!!  Fab facilities at this static sauna with tremendous views over lough derg. A tranquil  experience  combined with refreshing lake water dips! || Absolutely stunning sauna with amazing views of Loch Derg! Lovely staff! It‚Äôs where my now fianc√© proposed. The staff were so helpful and the hot chocolate was delicious! Highly recommend!

The only thing we would say is that there are no lockers available. We were tourists so we were dropped off. Thankfully the lady let us leave my partner‚Äôs bag there (as my engagement ring was inside unbeknownst to me) but generally, it‚Äôs a very open and public area without lockers! Something to consider when going. || We booked the sauna for two hours for a day two activity for guests after our wedding in Ashley Park House over the weekend, and couldn't recommend it enough - everyone loved the sauna, the lake dips and coffee to sort out the heads after a big night.

The sauna itself is one of the best I've been to in Ireland - great heat, unreal view and very close to the water's edge.

The team were so sound and helpful. Can't wait to come back again soon! || Lovely sauna , excellent set up, especially like the details like the fake grass floor in the changing rooms, lovely underfoot. Fantastic view of the lake, perfect setting, great staff. Great little coffee place too with comfy seats and dog friendly. First time I did it in the evening close to sunset, gorgeous! So good that I came back the following day for another go! Highly recommend

name: Shannon Estuary Way Retreat and Training Academy
address: Shannon Estuary Way Retreat and Academy, Burren, Ballynacally, Co. Clare, V95 Y88H, Ireland
reviews_text:
The Sound Therapy Course was a truly wonderful and educational experience! Rosie equipped us with plenty of knowledge and confidence to produce a sound bath and sound massage. The course was hands on and the lunches provided were delicious! The retreat itself is stunning and a very tranquil experience. Highly recommend to anyone looking to further their holistic treatments and career. Thank you Rosie and Micheal at the Shannon estuary! || I went here recently for a WIM HOFF day retreat and it was amazing from start to finish. Michael and Rosie are so welcoming and friendly, I felt right at home. The experience was wonderful, I have been an avid cold water swimmer in lakes but I felt like I really learned a lot more about techniques for breathing when entering the water, when in the water and when warming up out of the water. There was great learning and fun all rolled into one. The facilities are top-notch from the cold water barrel, sauna to the hot tub.

I was nervous about doing the dance afterwards to warm up again but I wasn't long getting into it with the encouragement of everyone else and of course the benefit of it.

There was a delicious meal afterwards and no rush to leave. On the day itself, there was rain as I was driving there and then the clouds began to part and the sun came out - truly wonderful to watch this as you sit upstairs with the large glass landscape windows.

A truly unique experience, I would recommend to anyone curious. I came away with a lot of knowledge, a full heart and new friends.

Try it, you won't regret it. || It's very hard to describe the experience you will have at Shannon Estuary Way without fully experiencing it. I am currently undertaking the 200 hour yoga fusion training and to say it is the best decision I've made would be an understatement. The care, effort, support and knowledge from Rosie and Miche√°l is outstanding. The course is so informative, interesting and easily integrated into every day life. The space itself is like a warm hug and I look forward to going there on our weekend trainings, it truly feels like a retreat every month. The food is also a massive talking point every lunch and break, it is fresh, nourishing and locally sourced with the best ingredients. Meeting such like- minded people, learning from them and the connections and friendships made has been amazing. Rosie and Miche√°l are also extremely supportive and are at hand to answer any questions, give advice or simply just an encouraging word. I feel very lucky to be on this journey with them and my group. I couldn't recommend the Shannkn Estuary Way Retreat more and I will certainly be returning for more training after completing this one. || I completed my sound therapy training at the Shannon Estuary Retreat with Rosie and Michael, and it was a truly beautiful experience. The centre is stunning ‚Äî peaceful, grounding, and surrounded by nature. Rosie and Michael are incredibly knowledgeable, warm, and supportive, creating a nurturing and professional learning environment. I left feeling inspired, confident, and deeply grateful. I couldn‚Äôt recommend this retreat or the training more highly.
If i could give more stars I would!!! Make sure to check it out they offer so many amazing trainings and offerings! || The Shannon Estuary Way Retreat is a really special place. Went here with my Friend Brian for the Wim hoff retreat and it was an incredible experience and would highly recommend to anyone. Miche√°l who runs the retreat with his wife Rosie is really welcoming and kind. His knowledge and training of the Wim Hoff techniques were top class.The retreat is set in an idyllic location looking out across the spectacular Shannon Estuary and the ice baths,Sauna and hot tub are brilliant. Also we had an amazing vegetarian meal that was really fresh and tasty. A full 5 stars and would highly recommend for men and women and for anyone from all walks of life. Would absolutely recommend. Right next to a lovely beach so you can have a dip in and out without wasting any sauna time! Fifteen for an hour really good value :) The owner, Alex, is very friendly and he has water for customers || We visit Tragumna every year and going to this lovely sauna is one of the highlights - very clean and well maintained with complementary water, close to the sea so you can run in for a dip and there‚Äôs also a shower nearby. Alex the owner is lovely, very friendly and accommodating, we‚Äôll definitely be going back next year! || A wonderful experience with a very kind host!
Alex maintains his sauna in excellent conditions and really looks after his guests. The sauna itself is perfectly located on the picturesque Tragumna beach with easy and swift access to the beach. The beach also has a fresh water shower, toilet facilities and a lovely coffee and dessert truck.

We would highly recommend this experience with Alex! || A great way to spend an hour, heating up in the sauna and then plunging into the refreshing waters of Tragumna. Our group went back and forth from sauna to sea a few times in the hour, all of us feeling rejuvenated afterward. The sauna is clean and well-maintained, and the proprietor professional and easy to deal with. If you're in the neighbourhood, do it! || Amazing experience! The owner is very chilled in communication pre-arrival. When we arrived he was very accommodating, and was easy going with staying in a bit longer. Then, the view - there are no words. It is a wonderful spot for staring out of the window of the sauna for an hour. We dipped in the ocean for a couple of times, and the water is just so clear and clean. We have had a great experience and would definitely go back & recommend!

name: Sunset Sauna Allihies and Castletownbere
address: Ballydonegan Beach, Allihies, Co. Cork, Ireland
reviews_text:
We booked an hours sauna for our group. Towels were provided for sitting on and a bucket outside for cleaning sand off our feet before entering. It was perfect for our group of 6 but any more than this, it would be tight for space. A quick run down the ramp to the beach provides the perfect cold dip in the Atlantic.  The beach is stunning, the views spectacular. A little gem in a very remote part of Cork. || One of the best yoga sessions I‚Äôve ever done! Lovely and relaxing and a great stretch in beautiful scenery. Trudie was brilliant, provided us with mats as we were just visiting for the weekend, and guided a great class - including for our pregnant friend. We didn‚Äôt want it to end! Would highly recommend booking a sauna session at the same time - a great morning. || Such a fantastic experience at the sauna in Allihies! The location is absolutely beautiful‚Äîright by the beach with the sound of the waves and stunning views all around.

Alice and Adam are incredibly warm and cheerful hosts. They create such a relaxed and welcoming vibe, and the sauna is always perfectly hot and ready to go.

You can also book a private session, which is such a lovely and romantic option‚Äîideal for couples or just some peaceful time alone.

I go as often as I can‚Äîit‚Äôs the perfect place to unwind, reset, and enjoy nature at its best.

Highly recommend this little hidden gem in Allihies! || The sauna in Allihies is amazing! It‚Äôs on a lovely campsite right by the beach, with beautiful views all around.
The sauna is always hot and clean‚Äîperfect for relaxing after a swim or walk.
It‚Äôs such a peaceful spot. I always feel great after going. Highly recommend! || The sauna in Allihies is an absolute must-visit. The setting is breathtaking, right on the beach with stunning views of the coastline.

The sauna is always perfectly heated, making it so relaxing, especially after a chilly day outdoors. Booking a private session is a fantastic idea‚Äîit offers a peaceful and romantic atmosphere that‚Äôs hard to beat.

It‚Äôs become my favorite spot to disconnect and recharge, surrounded by the beauty of nature.

If you‚Äôre in the area, don‚Äôt miss the chance to experience this wonderful sauna!

name: ReCoop Sauna
address: Carrigaline GAA Club, Kilnaglery, Carrigaline, Co. Cork, Ireland
reviews_text: Just back from Recoop   First time in a Sauna and a coooold Bath . I feel tens years younger. What a spot, well done to all at Recoop. Recommend it to anyone who hasn‚Äôt been. || Blown away with my experience at Recoop! Such a relaxed vibe in there, spotless and inviting!  And the staff are lovely! Can't believe it's right on my doorstep and I hadn't been before! Will definitely become a regular thing in my life üî•üßä || Hands down the best sauna and plunge pool experience in Cork! The setup is fantastic ‚Äì well-designed, clean, and perfectly maintained. The team running it are incredibly friendly and welcoming, making the whole experience even better. Plus, on weekends, you can grab a Three Fools Coffee next door ‚Äì the perfect way to round off a relaxing session. Highly recommend! || I visited the sauna and plunge pool facility yesterday and was blown away by how incredible I felt afterward. The setup is fantastic ‚Äî spotless, thoughtfully designed, and well-maintained. The staff were so friendly and welcoming. There is access to private changing rooms and the selection of essential oils provided made this whole experience even better. Highly recommend! || Loved my experience at Recoop Sauna and Plunge Pool! From the moment I walked in, the atmosphere was incredibly relaxing and welcoming. The facilities are top-notch - clean, tidy and spacious. I felt completely rejuvenated after my session. The staff were friendly and knowledgeable, making sure I had everything I needed. I highly recommend Recoop to anyone looking for a fantastic wellness experience. I'll definitely be back!

name: Coastal Roast Sauna and cafe, Garrettstown beach, Kinsale, Co Cork
address: Garrettstown, Kinsale, Co. Cork, Ireland
reviews_text:
Been a few times to the ice baths and sauna and it is 10/10! The sauna has stunning views out over the beach, perfect setting to chill out with relaxing music and all being played inside the sauna! It‚Äôs the perfect set up. 100% will continue to call down regularly and recommend to friends ! || This is an absolute gem of a place, clean, well organised and the lady who greeted us was so friendly and kind. The views and facilities are amazing, was so fortunate a lovely group invited me for a sea swim which was stunning. || Unreal experience, from Chilling in the Sauna looking out to the ocean and hopping into the ice baths. Showers a great addition !!! tasty hotdog and coffee to finish it off.
Will definitely return againüëåüèª || This is one of my favourite places to go on the weekend. Positioned perfectly beside the beach, you have breathtaking views of the Atlantic Ocean while you relax in the sauna or dare to plunge in the outside ice baths! It‚Äôs clean and well organised with showers available for use as well.

The service is 10/10 every time and you even have the option for a light snack or coffee, What more could you ask for!
I‚Äôd highly recommend giving this a go :) || Great setup. Beautiful view while sitting in the sauna. We will definitely be back

name: Warren Sauna
address: Betterdayz Sauna, Warren Beach, Creggane, Co. Cork, P85 Y188, Ireland
reviews_text:
Glorious spot, great sauna, warm welcome and a lovely sandy "excellent water quality" beach with rolling waves. Everyone I shared the sauna with was super friendly. || Best sauna i‚Äòve ever had!! The owner was very kind,  helpful and easy going. The location was wonderful, located right next to the beach || Laid back owner and all around lovely experience. Worth visiting especially on a moody day || Excellent sauna
Great location and proper heat
The owner is a top bloke || Superb location with top class friendly service. Very relaxing experience looking out at the warren beach. I go regularly and feel the health benefits paying dividends.

name: South Coast Spas & Saunas
address: Noel O'Flynn Business Park, Unit 1, Old Mallow Rd, Blackpool, Cork, T23 F72N, Ireland
reviews_text:
BEST PURCHASE WE MADE IN YEARS
Very professional company to deal with , very easy to talk with and very friendly. Always available to speak with during the process from ordering to set up. I ordered a hot tub and had It delivered and set up all within the agreed time frames. We decided after a few weeks to upgrade to a bigger hot tub which was never a problem. We love the new hot tub and use it up to 6 times a week , the jets have a perfect mix of strong and gentle. It has a very strong and durable surround , led lights , speakers and drinks holder. It‚Äôs a fantastic addition to the family for spending time together in the evening time. My energy bills were lower than expected also costing on average 30/ 40 euros a month for a lot of usage.
Best of luck with your business Derek and Carol || The folks working here very nice and very helpful. They are very good at giving advice for the type of hottub you want for your situation and recommending the best lines et cetera. On installation day they came out and spent hours with me showing me how it works, making sure it‚Äôs filled, making sure it started and started heating. They also walked me through how to keep it clean which I wouldn‚Äôt underestimate for a new begin. All in all, I would highly recommend this company || Got my Hot Tub delivered and installed by Brett. Have to say that Brett was very easy to deal with and talked me through the whole process of what I would need to maintain my Hot Tub. Brett is also at the end of the phone if you have any problems, which is a real bonus and peace of mind. || Purchased the Activity 1 Deep Swimspa last October. Could not be more pleased. The heat pump was more than able to maintain temperature over winter without the need to run the internal heater. Brett and Shelby are extremely helpful at all times and I can highly recommend South Coast Spas. || Got a lovely jacuzzi with a nice free upgrade of a better jacuzzi than what i paid for‚Ä¶ the lads were great to deal with and the jacuzzi was delivered and installed a month earlier than what was arranged which i was very happy with‚Ä¶ jacuzzi works great and is getting plenty of use 10/10 to the lads

name: The Recovery Pod Sauna
address: beach, Inchydoney, Co. Cork, P85 AT27, Ireland
reviews_text:
Lovely area to visit - the entry path to the beach extremely steep and slippy - (not recommended) - walk to the water  takes too much time (really eats into booking).  Needs to move the pod for it to be better positioned.  Facilitator not very approachable. || I recently had the pleasure of visiting The Recovery Pod Sauna on Inchydoney Beach, and it was absolutely phenomenal! From start to finish, the experience was perfect.

The sauna itself is beautifully maintained, offering stunning views of the beach‚Äîthere‚Äôs nothing quite like relaxing in the heat while hearing the soothing sounds of the waves. Kevin‚Äôs attention to detail really shines through ,the space was clean, welcoming, and perfectly designed for ultimate relaxation.

The location is unbeatable. After a good session in the sauna, stepping out into the fresh sea air or taking a dip in the water is sheer perfection. Kevin was a fantastic host‚Äîfriendly, accommodating, and clearly passionate about creating an amazing experience for his guests.

Whether you‚Äôre a local or just visiting Inchydoney, this is an absolute must-try. I can‚Äôt wait to come back and would recommend The Recovery Pod sauna to anyone looking for a unique and rejuvenating experience. || Visited last weekend Top service from Kevin at the Recovery Pod Sauna a very nice spot to visit lovely view of the beach from inside the sauna highly recommended!
Will definitely be back in the future üôåüèº || The recovery pod sauna is a great facility in a stunning location located just off inchydoney beach. Such a wonderful way to relax and replenish with such amazing views. Kevin is very friendly and always at hand to answer any questions or give any assistance you might need, would definitely recommend to anyone visiting the area || I recently block booked a couple of hours in the recovery pob sauna on inchydonney beach after my wedding. It was perfect and they are so nice there.

name: Bluefin Sauna Cork
address: Pier, Cuskinny, Cobh, Co. Cork, Ireland

name: AquaSpa
address: Eden Hall, Model Farm Rd, Cork, Ireland
reviews_text:
Aqua Spa is not just a massage shop, it‚Äôs an experience. It was my first time in Aqua Spa and so I arrived only 10min before my appointment and it was the only time I was secretly hoping they‚Äôd be late.
When you come in you are taken to the relaxation room, where you can have tea and relax before your appointment.
The massage was amazing and once I was  finished I was once again taken to the relaxation room. I honestly didn‚Äôt want to leave.
I will definitely be back and will recommend to anyone and everyone. || Amazing massage, relieved a lot of tension I was holding without being too painful. Also Caoimhe gave me some practical advice on how to minimise tension going forward. Nice relaxing area with tea, coffee, snacks is a lovely touch. Will be back, thank you! || It was my first time in Aqua Spa and I was blown away. The whole experience was so relaxing, starting with the relaxation room and then the wonderful massage. I feel so relaxed and will definitely be recommending your business to everyone.
Thank you. || Maegan was absolutely amazing ! So kind and made sure my experience was as relaxing as possible and catered to any needs I had. Felt 100% restored afterwards. || Very pleasant salon in a convenient location. I had a wonderfully relaxing pedicure with Joanna and felt very well looked after ‚Äî I‚Äôll definitely be visiting again.

name: Bellevue Spa
address: Montenotte Hotel, Middle Glanmire Rd, Tivoli, Cork, T23 E9DX, Ireland
reviews_text:
Best massage I‚Äôve ever had by ‚ÄúChara‚Äù I believe was her name. Loved the whole experience and refreshments after would go back ü•∞ || I cannot recommend the massage experience at Bellevue spa in Cork with Pablo at the Montenotte hotel enough! From start to finish, everything was absolutely perfect. The calming ambiance of the spa was pure bliss, and from the moment I walked through the door, I was greeted warmly and made to feel completely at ease.

Pablo, my massage therapist, was simply brilliant. He was incredibly knowledgeable and highly skilled, tailoring the treatment to my specific needs and preferences. He consistently checked in with me throughout the massage to ensure I was comfortable and relaxed, really taking the time to get to know me and my needs. He used a combination of techniques that left me not only feeling rejuvenated but also invigorated.

One of the best parts of my experience was the quiet room, where I was encouraged to unwind and take a moment to myself. Sipping on a glass of champagne made for the perfect touch to end my tranquil treatment. It's clear that Bellevue Spa values their guest's experience, and I appreciated every moment spent in their care.

Overall, the Bellevue spa at the Montenotte hotel in Cork is an absolute must-try for anyone in the area. The entire experience is simply sensational, and I know that I will be back time and time again. Thank you to Pablo and the team at Bellevue spa for a truly unforgettable experience! || I booked the ‚ÄùHo-Leaf and Rosemary Muscle Melt‚Äù  for my mom to treat her for Mother‚Äôs Day. I personally didn‚Äôt experience the massage, however since it was her first massage I wanted her to have the best experience, which it was. She shared that it was the best thing she has ever felt. It was a 10/10 experience for her, she said the masseuse was so welcoming and extremely kind, making her feel so comfortable. The massage was very relaxing and she stated it relived all the tension and stress in her muscles.

As I can say, Evie, the receptionist is so kind hearted and helpful. From the moment we arrived, even just stepping foot into the reception area I felt at ease. I could tell that the spa was exactly what it claims to be. The cleanliness and atmosphere of the whole spa was impeccable.

Finally I would like to add that both me and my parents were both so impressed with the Spa. It is definitely worth-while looking into all their packages and deals. If you‚Äôre staying at the Montenotte Hotel, definitely book yourself in for the spa. Personally I will be returning here in the future. || Beautiful spa and great staff! Rachel did a wonderful job on a full-body massage. Very happy with the spa and highly recommend it if you are in the area. || Loved my treatment, beautiful atmosphere , great staff from concierge at front door who is always so lovely to the girls in the spa equally kind. Highly recommended.

name: Fota Island Resort
address: Fota Island, Foaty, Co. Cork, T45 HX62, Ireland
summary: Plush rooms & lodges in a posh resort offering 3 golf courses, a spa & an indoor pool, plus dining.
reviews_text:
After a busing Christmas we stayed in fota for 2 nights. The resort is in a great location, service was top class and the food could not be faulted. From the moment we stepped in we were made feel welcome. The door man Michael I think it was really made our trip. So welcoming every time and very helpful and informative.

We stayed in a double room. Very spacious. The bathroom is spotless and the cleaners did a stellar job.

We enjoyed our stay so much we extended for a day. The price quoted at reception was quite a bit more expensive than booking on hotels.com or bookings.com. We said this to them and they matched the price instantly. Very happy with all interactions. || This hotel is amazing!! The whole property is huge and so pretty. We got there at night and left the next day, so we weren‚Äôt able to use the spa, but it looked amazing. We ate dinner and had breakfast here and everything was really good. Really fresh ingredients and great quality. The room was beautiful and had a bath tub which was so nice because it was so cold, so taking a warm bath was just what I needed. The staff was so kind as well. I recommend this hotel to anyone going to Ireland! || 5* doesn‚Äôt give this hotel justice. Top class service with Irish hospitality at its finest.  Was there for 3 days with family of 10. Service was exceptional, standard was beyond amazing and place was spotless. Like with any venue the staff are the backbone and the making of the experience. Everyone person we met was lovely, personable and very professional. Will be back. || Good sized rooms, with a good selection of amenities and comfortable too. Check in and check out was quick as was services in the best and restaurant. The hotel itself is a little shabby in spots and showing its age a little, it's a pure Celtic Tiger creation. It was a little cold too as they haven't turned on the heating and this was late October. Beautiful setting. || We recently stayed here as a family for a few nights and were so happy with our stay. We booked a family room and on booking we were unable to add the no. of children to the booking so we rang and informed them over the phone. We gave the age of our children (one newborn baby) on the call.

When we got to the room there was a beautiful fruit platter and teddy bear in the room congratulating us on our new baby which was lovely and really appreciated. The room was also really spacious and clean with a big bathroom. The beds were very comfortable.

We used the pool which was also clean and could be booked easily and the breakfast in the morning was great with lots of options for everyone.

One of the days we visited Fota Wildlife Park which is just a few minutes drive away and another we spent walking the Fairy Trail on the hotel grounds. The spa facilities are great to unwind with a lovely relaxation room overlooking a peaceful courtyard which you can use after a treatment. There is also a 'cinema room' showing movies for older kids.

Overall I highly recommend a family stay here and we're looking forward to coming back.

name: Naturally Sauna
address: Kilmacsimon, Co. Cork, P72 KW58, Ireland
reviews_text:
Fantastic hot/cold therapy experience with sauna, ice baths and a hot tub in the beautiful peaceful surroundings of Kilmacsimon House. Guided throughout by Colin who was extremely knowledgeable on the benefits, history and mythology behind the various treatments. Absolutely loved it and will be back! || As the original Saunaman of Cork County, I pronounce this fantastic spot to be a proper health retreat üòÄ.   Stainless steel is way to go for hygiene in dip barrels. Completely new level. I would add here a shed with infrared sauna as well then it be perfect. || As a doctor, I can guarantee the staff here are very knowledgeable about the human body. They also explained how the spa treatment works on the body more than anyone ever did for me in medical school.

Came here after hiking Mt. Carrountoohill and felt no pain whatsoever in my body after doing the lactic flush.

Highly recommend to come here after any hike to recover and have a fantastic time! || I came here last week, as a regular sauna and swim user I was curious to see what this retreat centre had to offer. I was genuinely blown away by the location, the facilities and with Paul‚Äôs friendly and professional demeanour. The experience was unlike anything I‚Äôve experienced from a regular swim and sauna thus far. It lasted 2.5 hours and I felt completely relaxed and renewed afterwards. I met very similar, likeminded people and had great fun getting to know them. There were also snacks, skin oils and a relaxation tent to rest in before going back to the real world. I highly recommend checking this out if you‚Äôre interested in the benefits of saunas and contract heat therapy. Thanks again to everyone! || Fantastic day, started with incredible breathwork and sound therapy that enabled significant healing, followed by sauna and ice bath therapy. The Ayurvedic lunch was so generous and delicious. Can't wait for the next one.

name: Saunas Cork
address: Youghal Rd, Killeagh Gardens, Killeagh, Co. Cork, P36 RK30, Ireland

name: The Spa at Kingsley
address: Carrigrohane Rd, Sunday's Well, Cork, T12 P680, Ireland
reviews_text: Fabulous day at the spa today. Checked in 90mins early to enjoy the thermal pool overlooking the River Lee, the sauna, steam room, jacuzzi, and thermal suite. The thermal suite includes a lavender steam room, lemongrass steam room, Turkish steam room, another sauna (Finnish), salt therapy room, another jacuzzi, and an infrared room. So much choice! My therapist, Kassey, collected me from the thermal suite and I had a bamboo full body massage for an hour, before light refreshments and another chance at the thermal suite for infrared light on my tired legs. Fantastic service from the whole team. Thanks to Kassey for her time, effort, and friendly nature. True professionals and a brilliant facility. We'll be back! üòÅ || I had a really lovely time at the Kingleys spa. Right from the moment I arrived at the front desk, Stephanie showed me how to use the lockers and they already contained my size flip flops and robe. When I was ready she brought me down to the spa and showed me all the facilities. I also got a hot towel, fruit shot and aroma bracelet. The facilities were really nice and clean. There was a good variety and it wasn‚Äôt too crowded so you could enjoy everything without stress. Carol was the therapist who did my treatment. She was very good, it was really relaxing and she was very helpful and friendly. I got the rainforest treatment which included an exfoliation, wrap and massage. The refreshments and relaxation area were lovely. Really enjoyed the whole experience. Everything was well sanitised and it never felt like you were too close to others. All therapists wearing masks. My only complaint is the group of women who were talking and laughing very loudly non-stop in all of the relaxation areas. The quiet rule should be enforced better. || Had a most wonderful  experience  at the spa last Monday afternoon. Daria was my therapist, she was amazing & so professional . Highly recommend.

name: Wet and Wild Sauna
address: Ballynaule, Galley Cove, Co. Cork, Ireland

name: Woodlands Sauna and Wellness
address: Woodlands, Commeen, Carrigaline, Co. Cork, Ireland

name: Planet Health Club
address: Old Mallow Rd, Blackpool, Cork, T23 NR4R, Ireland
reviews_text:
Good gym with lots of equipment. Gym very dated though and dressing rooms definitely need work. Music is far too loud as most people use their own headphones. Also no one follows the rules. People are always shaving in the men‚Äôs dressing rooms which is disgusting. Don‚Äôt wear footwear in saunas etc. Always putting those smelly oils in the sauna which I hate. Not wiping down machines. Staff do nothing to stop any of this. Definitely needs an app as well to book classes. Most other gyms have this now. Overall it‚Äôs really slipping behind other more modern facilities || Equipment itself was good however wouldn‚Äôt recommend this place to anyone looking for just a single months membership. I got a membership here as I travel for work and it was convenient, I signed up then instantly filled out a cancellation form as they recommended however I have been charged for another month and they are ignoring all my emails and instagram messages I‚Äôve sent through (4 and counting) shocking behaviour. || Pretty decent gym & swimming pool, the facilities and management could definitely be improved though.

The main focus seems to be on the gym there, which has 4 huge rooms full of equipment. There's also a separate ladies gym.
As a casual gym-goer, I find that there's a great selection of cardio machines, strength training machines, and loads of free weights. The gym is usually pretty busy during peak times, but you'll always be able to find a spot somewhere.
There's also 2 studios for classes, which can be also be used while there's no classes ongoing.

The pool is grand. It does the job. It's 15m and there's no deep / shallow end, it's all the same depth. There's also a sauna and steam room. There are much better and bigger pools around though, so if you're only wanting to join for the pool, I would consider other options.
The changing rooms, I think, are the biggest downfall. They could definitely be improved. They are open plan, which is fine I guess, but as a very self conscious person, it makes me uncomfortable. There also doesn't seem to be any consideration for gender non-conforming people, as there's only male or female.
There are lockers but you need to bring a lock yourself for them, which is pretty standard. Many of the lockers are broken though, so there's no way to lock them. Generally I've been able to find an available, not broken one though.
The showers leave a lot to be desired. They have frosted glass swinging doors, kind of like a saloon door, but they don't meet fully in the middle so you do feel kind of exposed. I've started hanging my towel spread out completely over it for a bit more privacy, but that doesn't feel very hygienic. There is a basket to put shampoo, etc into, but I haven't seen any hooks to hang things on, which would be nice to have. They have also smelled pretty bad a few times I've been there.
The hairdryers are also, unfortunately very bad. There doesn't seem to be any high power setting so it would take hours to dry your hair completely.

Initially I went down there and asked it I could do a trial run before committing to a membership. Was told they don't do that, and they don't do guest passes so the only options are to sign up immediately (and I believe commit to paying at least 3 months before you can cancel, but I can't quite remember because you don't get any copy of everything you signed) or go elsewhere. They gave me a quick tour of the place though.
So I signed up for a membership because it's within walking distance for me and has basically what I need.
While filling out the forms, I ticked the box to say that I would like to have a gym orientation. According to their website all memberships include "personalized programs", but I told them I'd just like to be shown how to use a few of the machines to get started and get a feel for the place and I might look for a specific program later. Was told to come back on 'x' day at 'y' time for it. Grand. Showed up at the specified date and time and they had no idea what I was talking about and didn't have me booked in for anything and had no one there to do an orientation. The lad at reception just gave me (another) tour of the gym, but he was at least very nice about it. || Great place to push your body to the limits. Best hours to train are 6-11am and  8:30-10pm as place is not as crowded. Good selection of machines and free weights. || Absolute disgrace 6 weeks waiting for steam room to be fixed people having to queue for the sauna

name: Maryborough Hotel & Spa
address: Maryborough Hill, Douglas, Cork, Ireland
summary: Elegant lodging with a spa, an indoor pool and an upscale restaurant, plus free Wi-Fi.
reviews_text:
Stayed here for a one night getaway with my husband with spa, 4 course dinner and breakfast. Loved the spa's thermal suites, and the hotel. It was a proper hotel where they still provided slippers, robe and the little toiletries. I have missed those in my recent travels.
The food at the restaurant was amazing and the service was awesome. We got on with the service manager Kieran (sorry if I spelled his name incorrectly) and he was so easy to talk to and a really nice fellow.
Would 100% recommend this hotel for a romantic getaway. You won't be disappointed. || I recently stayed at The Maryborough Hotel & Spa in Cork, and it was pleasant from start to finish. Nestled in the leafy Douglas area, the hotel perfectly balances comfort with easy access to the city. The old Georgian manor house and gardens all decked out with Christmas üéÑ trees and lights create a stunning backdrop that immediately sets a relaxing tone.

The staff on the whole were consistently warm, attentive, and professional nothing ever felt like too much trouble. From the Spa to the restaurant team, everyone went out of their way to make the stay feel special.

Dining at Bellini‚Äôs Restaurant was a highlight. The food was beautifully presented and full of flavor, with excellent options for all dietary preferences.

Breakfast was equally impressive, offering both hearty Irish classics and lighter choices.

The ESPA spa and leisure facilities are world-class. The thermal suite, pool, and treatments provided the perfect escape, and the health club‚Äôs narrow indoor pool was a bonus.

Whether you‚Äôre visiting for business or a romantic getaway, the hotel caters to every occasion with style and charm.

Overall, The Maryborough is a luxurious yet welcoming, historic hotel.

I left feeling refreshed due to the insanely comfy bed and pillows and already planning my return. I Highly recommended for anyone seeking a memorable stay in Cork. || This is a 2 star hotel with a 4 star reception area. Very disappointed with the Maryborough from the moment we left the reception area. The entire hotel is just run down. The rooms where very gruby with handprints, chips and paint splatter on the walls (see photos). Some of the light switches just didn't work either. The switch for the reading light didn't work on my side but did on my partners. As you can see in the pics, very amateur wiring done on the back of the headboard. Our room was headboard to headboard with the adjacent room which must also have had the same botch job done of sealing the wall as we could hear every word that was said in the other room.

Spa was what really drove me to write this review. Very very unkept, not dirty, just unkept. Thermal room had a plastic bag and 2 cups floating in the water which I had to bin. The whole time we waited for our treatments not one member of staff came in to do a check, or clean. Relaxation beds were broken and gruby.

The service in general was very very poor. Breakfast has a set menu but good luck getting anyone to take your order, and god forbid you ask for something additional because you will be in for a long wait. Staff write down your order and just never come back. Simple things like "can I get ketchup" just don't happen until the 4th time asking. Overall the staff were rude and unhelpful, not making room to move in the bar, or restaurant just barging passed because what they are doing is very important. They aren't very welcoming either. If you're unhappy working over new years get another job. || Lovely people lovely place.
Two nights here in the pouring rain as storm Bram approaches.  We have eaten lunch in the bar, it was very good, seafood chowder then fish and chips.
Breakfast, great choices on offer, I had a very rich omelette, coffee great, atmosphere relaxed for a Sunday.
The room, large warm as is the bed.
Great weekend getaway. || This hotel was beautiful!  The location was perfect - just outside of town for easy access, and peaceful.  The breakfast that was included was delicious and the staff were very helpful and kind.  Oh and the beds and pillows were so comfortable!  We would definitely stay here again if we are ever in the area!

name: Atlanticway Sauna
address: DePuy Synthes, stop 245471, Ringaskiddy, Co. Cork, Ireland
reviews_text:
A hidden gem! Crystal-clear blue water, soft white sand, and a peaceful atmosphere ‚Äî exactly what I needed to relax and recharge. The beach is small, not crowded (especially at the end of the week), and perfect for quiet moments. No loud tourists, just the sound of waves and nature. Beautiful, simple, and calming. Highly recommended for anyone looking to escape the noise and enjoy pure serenity. || What a lovely little hidden gem in amongst some large multinational companies. The access to this beach is almost through a business park. We were relatively early on a bank holiday so there wasn't much crowds, just gorgeous doggos üê∂
It's a calm beach but may require aqua shoes if going for a swim. Found lots of sharp shells along the shore. My only disappointment was that there wasn't a single bin provided by the council. There was so much of rubbish flying around, it was heartbreaking. Not a bad spot for bird watching too! || Nice long sandy beach in Ringaskiddy. Next to factory there is a concrete walkway, to the beach.
Lot of shell all over although nice sandy shore. In april it is windy, but in the summer it is the perfect family beach. Dogs also enjoying beach.üòä || Really nice place, quiet and clean beach..
Not too far from the city...
One of not so well known beach in Cork.
Only problem is not enough parking place, otherwise it would deserve 5 star || U might need a car to get here. There isn't a huge parking. It's a nice place to walk your dogs who enjoys the water. Visited there on a cloudy weather and was quite windy, so it was cold. Surely though, people will enjoy this beach if it was a nice sunny weather. Sand was very fine, so wear Ur slippers. There's 2 wind mills nearby which is a great feature. There's a lot of shells near the water. Thing tho is, the portable toilet stinks. Otherwise, it's free and u can still enjoy nature by the beach

name: District Health & Leisure
address: Tivoli, Silversprings, Co. Cork, T23 52DH, Ireland
reviews_text:
I found learning to swim as an adult quite difficult. You must be determined and practicing between lessons will help.
So here's my advise, take a series of one-to-one lessons with Giada. She's just brilliant.
I previously took 6 group and 2 one-to-one lessons at a different pool but still out of breath after a few strokes.
Giada identified my specific errors and explained/demonstrated how to rectify them. After the 6 lessons I'm now very confident in the pool and capable of swimming full
lengths. || My 11 month old son has been attending baby swimming classes at District for the last 7 months.  He loves it, the swimming instructor is excellent with all the babies & makes each session fun.
The changing room facilities are ideal for mom & baby, there is a little play pen so mommy can get dressed.

The complex is amazing. It is a fantastic gym, with many classes, there are squash courts, tennis courts & a lot more.

I dealt with a lady called Catherine a lot, she is friendly & very helpful. || Brilliant gym with very friendly reception staff . Been a member for the last few months having previously been with dennehys . While district is more expensive you do get what you pay for imo . Plenty of machines & everything is well serviced . Not too busy around lunch time which is when I go . I would prefer if there was an option for a gym only membership as I've never used the pool facilities . || Ive been part of District health and leisure since 2021. The staff are all as helpful as each other and nothing is ever a problem for them. The facilities are clean and up to date. Both gym floors and equipment are fantastic,  the pool is excellent with a sauna. Changing rooms always clean and fresh. || District is a fantastic Gym, facilities are excellent, several different areas to work out, and an extensive range of classes. Staff are so friendly and go above and beyond to help. Always willing to modify exercises in a class to facilitate any injury I have had. The facility is spotless. I have been a member for years, it's a very friendly gym and I  would highly recommend.

name: Wild Hideaways Eco Spa Retreat
address: Wild Hideaways, Laharanshermeen, Bantry, Co. Cork, P75 P599, Ireland
reviews_text: Stunning location and cabin, a little slice of heaven. So warm and cosy, the bed is huge and super comfortable. The smell from the diffuser was devine, the treats were a lovely extra touch. The seaweed bath and sauna were so relaxing, we completely unwinded. To top it off it is doggie friendly, our little cockapoo had the best time. Couldn‚Äôt recommend more, we will 100% be back. || We are just back from a wonderful weekend at Wild Hideaways. The lodges are stunning and so cozy. It‚Äôs so quiet and relaxing here and we had lovely walks with our dog Bruce who‚Äôs loved it here. We went for the Relax package which gave us delicious scones on arrival which was needed after our long drive. We had the Antipasti platter for dinner which was incredible, highly recommend. The next day we had a great wonderful Irish breakfast and pizzas that night, these were also fab. We used the sauna and then when the rain finally died down we lit the fire pit which was amazing. They have everything you need and have thought of everything. || Location deserves six stars! It‚Äôs an incredible setting with an awe-inspiring view. Opening your curtains in the morning is pretty special. We loved the sauna and cold plunge too. The perfect place to spend an evening - and would have stayed longer if we‚Äôd had the time. Beautiful. || We haven't had a holiday in awhile and decided to treat ourselves to a 2 night stay at Wild Hideaways. We were the only guests on the compound as it was during the off peak season and on a weekday. The views were stunning, so serene and peaceful! We were so spoilt waking up in the mornings with the lovely view through the huge glass window. The alfresco bath was so relaxing and at night, we saw so many stars and even a few shootings stars! The amenities in the lodge were great. We ordered the dinner for 2 and it was amazing! The best part of it all was that we had Charlie our golden retriever with us :) We really did not want to leave! Highly recommend and will definitely stay again! || This is an absolutely fantastic little hideaway to get away from the hustle and bustle. Comfortable beds, tidy equipped kitchen and cosy. It was during a stormy week I stayed so unfortunately didn't get to make full use of the area but that didn't take away from my enjoyment and relaxation one bit. I would definitely stay here again.

name: Zero Gravity Float Cork
address: Edenhall, Model Farm Rd, Cork, T12 A9XE, Ireland
reviews_text:
The float was excellent and very relaxing. Wali was really informative and friendly and put us at ease. My partner and I really enjoyed the ability to change and shower in our own room with no need to walk around in robes. The provided hair dryer is also super nice for these cold days so you don't walk around with wet hair. I would definitely go here again if I was back in Cork. || Relaxing sensory deprivation float followed by a wonderful massage . So relaxing and calming . I bought a package for 3 more floats and am looking at getting a monthly membership. Great facilities and library of books to read with a cup of tea afterwards  .  Parking outside || My wife and I did our first flotation therapy on December 20th. We were both a little apprehensive but the staff were so welcoming, and explained everything in detail. They really put us at ease and we had a fabulous experience. Highly recommend! || I have floated in the US and Germany, and I think the facilities and my experience at Zero Gravity is my favorite. I did the doubles room and not the pod, but everything was clean and well-appointed. The woman who worked there was very friendly and explained it all thoroughly.

If you completely give in to the experience and just let your mind wander, it can feel a bit like hallucinating. At first you may think, bwoa, how can I spend an hour in here? But the hour just warped by. I will be back! || Great experience and an amazing gift to receive. Judith gave a very warm welcome and took the time to explain everything for my first float. I really enjoyed it and the icing on the cake was the amazing massage from Ciara, who tailored the session on the spot to take care of my shoulder impingement. Worked wonders! The place was spotlessly clean with a lovely atmosphere and chill out area. Website is great as well, very easy for a last minute gift and they send a personalised gift card. Thank you, I'll be back!

name: Zetland Pier
address: Derreenacarrin, Co. Cork, Ireland
reviews_text:
What a gorgeous little cove and sandy beach. It truly was a hidden gem and finding a sandy beach in the area is tough. While the small beach was excellent getting there could be tricky if you have mobility issues as the path there was very overgrown. Water was crystal clear and quite warm. || Superb pier and swimming. The path to the right leading to small coves is overgrown. Eady ladder into the sea from the pier.
A total surprise yo find a mobile sauna on the pier, apparently they're a 'ting' around these parts. Research West Cork Sauna for venues, times and booking. || Beautiful place, there are coves with clear water you can go swim.
At the pier, facing the water, if you go to the right, after a few meters you can see a path, there's a gate, lead to different coves .
Try walk all the paths as there are different spots you can swim. || Amazing spot for a swim, with clear water and not much seaweed.
When the tide is in you can even jump off the end of the pier.

There is an unofficial one way system when driving down, the way dowm starts by a house on the main road and the way back passes the quarry. || According to some people it doesn't exist as a name or as a place, because no Irish words begin with a Z. So Zetland Pier apparently is not a place it is a "ting"! In my opinion it's one of the best places to go swimming in all of Eire.

name: The Beautique Spa in Hayfield Manor
address: Perrott Ave, College Rd, The Lough, Cork, T12 HT97, Ireland
reviews_text:
I had an amazing spa day with my friend, with a full body massage, the pool area, steaming room and jacuzzi were delightful, not even mentioning the relaxing room which was lovely with tea and sorbet. We both are completely relaxed, Thank you to Karen and Laura which were beyond talented, gentle and kind. We both feel 10 pounds lighter. Daria at the reception of the hotel was lovely too. The receptionist at the Spa was very nice as well. I will come again, truly recommend it || I had the absolute pleasure of spending the day before my wedding at the Hayfield Manor Spa with my Mom, Maid of Honour, and Man of Honour. From the moment we arrived, until we finally made our way out of the relaxation room, we were completely looked after with the highest level of hospitality. I can't thank Spa Manager Sarah enough for being so gracious and adding all the lovely touches that really made our experience extra special! I cannot recommend this Spa enough to all brides- to- be, our experience there was the absolute best way to spend the day before the big day! Thanks again to Sarah and all of the amazing massage therapists at the Hayfield Manor Spa! || Beautiful treatment by Karen , great therapist feel great after a full body massage by her.
Lovely pool and steam room also the manager Sarah is very welcoming and super helpful.
Looking forward to returning. || I visited Boutique Spa in Hayfield Manor twice now and both times I was extremely happy with everything. The therapist, Rachel, addressed concerns I had in relation to my skin and recommended a treatment that left my skin feeling fresh, plumped and tightened up. The whole experience including a head and arm massage was so relaxing. What I really like about this Spa in particular is that they use a range of Elemis products which I find very good and the effects last for a long time. I felt 10 years younger! The hotel itself is stunning and located on the beautiful grounds with a lot of greenery, which creates a nice setting from the moment you step in, followed by a very relaxing atmosphere and beautiful smell in the spa itself. I wholeheartedly recommend this spa and therapist Rachel. Thank you so much for a great experience and taking care of my skin! || I had a lovely experience at the Beautique spa today. Karen, my therapist, was exceptional. She had a beautiful, calm energy that resonated throughout the treatment and her technique was impeccable. I highly recommend the bespoke treatment, it is an excellent way to spend 90 minutes at this brilliant estate!

name: Sona Saunas
address: Ventry Bay Beach, Cantra, Dingle, Co. Kerry, Ireland
reviews_text:
Had an absolutely fantastic time here this morning. Extremely professional set up. Tom provides a real experience and it's location makes it ideal for quick dips in the sea. || Incredible sauna and Tom the owner creates an amazing vibe. The sauna itself is so beautiful with a view across Ventry beach. I really enjoyed the little extra touches like the incense burning, the tranquil music and especially the aufguss, which is something I have never experienced in a sauna in Ireland. Couldn‚Äôt recommend this little gem enough. Will be back next time I‚Äôm in Dingle ‚ù§Ô∏è || This sauna was a highlight of my trip to Dingle. The location is gorgeous, the sauna is steps from a beautiful sandy beach, making the cold plunge in the ocean easy.

There wasn‚Äôt much information online, so we had to figure it out as we went. Bring your own towels and sandals. The changing area is very limited. After booking online, all you have to do is show up and sauna! The staff was very helpful and kind, we enjoyed chatting with the woman working.

If you‚Äôre expecting a traditional Finnish sauna, this isn‚Äôt it, the benches are a single level, and it‚Äôs not particularly hot (averaged 80 degrees C while we were there). But regardless, it was an amazing experience to go between the cozy barrel sauna and the gorgeous ocean. Highly recommend! || Sona Sauna is class. Great setup, brilliant location, and everything run really professionally. Big shoutout to Tom the legend as well ‚Äì sound out and makes the whole experience even better.
