Would highly recommend. || We visited as a group of 8 friends and had a brilliant experience. The sauna was excellent and the host went above and beyond to make sure everything was perfect. Highly recommend!

name: Hayfield Manor Hotel
address: Hayfield Manor Hotel, Perrott Ave, College Rd, Centre, Cork, T12 HT97, Ireland
summary: Upscale hotel with a fine-dining restaurant, a spa & an indoor pool, plus free Wi-Fi & parking.
reviews_text:
We had an absolutely wonderful stay at this hotel! Our room was simply stunning ‚Äî the bed incredibly comfortable and the decor stylish and thoughtfully arranged. From the moment we arrived, the service felt truly exceptional. We especially want to mention Daria, who speaks our language, kindly signed a card for us in Ukrainian, and even called to check if everything was to our liking. Such attention to detail is rare and heartwarming.

The food was outstanding ‚Äî everything tasted amazing. We particularly loved the breakfast porridge and the steak, which were both perfect. The pool area is simply magical, and the outdoor jacuzzi is such a brilliant idea ‚Äî so relaxing under the open sky. The sauna and steam room are incredibly cozy, and the overall atmosphere of the hotel is just wonderful.

We had a truly relaxing stay and would love to return again. A heartfelt thank you to the entire team for making our visit so memorable! || What a great stay at the Hayfield Manor Hotel. My husband and I felt welcomed and taken care of throughout our stay. We stayed in December and the decorated Christmas tree was just a great treat - it made the room feel even cozier and more inviting than it already was. Breakfast food was so delicious. We enjoyed the restaurants at the hotel for drinks in the afternoon and lunch the next day. The staff was helpful and delight to deal with. We would happily return to the Hayfield Manor hotel next time we are in Cork. || The service at Hayfield manor hotel was perfect! Turn down service, bags to the room, welcome drink and early check in. All staff were so attentive.

Our classic room had everything you could need loved the beige tones and the marble in the bathroom. The pillows weren‚Äôt so comfortable and we could hear noise of chairs below us from 12am until 1am not sure if it was the bar.

We also went to the spa which had an outdoor jacuzzi and steam room, plenty of extra towels and slippers.

Dinner in Orchids was nice, our steaks were cooked perfectly! We had a drink in Bloom in the garden but the atmosphere there wasn‚Äôt our favourite it smelled of beer and was very quiet so we went inside to the manor bar. The selection of cocktails is quiet poor for the price. For ‚Ç¨20 per drink I‚Äôd like to see more flavours, names and a dedicated cocktail menu. The two we did try were average.

The hotel is cosy and classic, some birds at the side of the manor and nice little area to walk around even though theres no gardens. Breakfast was lovely I can tell why it‚Äôs so highly rated, we loved the scones! || Amazing hotel with unbelievable staff. From the moment you walk in the door, the festive decor and smell was amazing. Staff were so helpful, it‚Äôs impossible to pick out anyone in particular. Superb 5 star service. The full size Christmas tree in the bedroom was also unreal! Cannot praise this hotel anymore. Will definitely be returning. Food was so amazing in Perrotts restaurant. || The nicest Christmas gift of time together that we gave each other as a family was a night away in the Hayfield. Bearing in mind, we brought our teenage son & as any parent knows, teenagers are notoriously difficult to impress, but we were all agreed, it was the injection of Christmas Spirit we all needed & enjoyed. With the warmest of welcomes, exceptional service & kindness, our beautiful dinner in Perrott's, to the comfort of our room, we were so spoiled. Add in thoughtful wee touches of the card & the teen was walking on air & wanted to move in. The hotel was decorated so nicely for Christmas, with music by talented musicians drifting from the inviting lobby into the bar and restaurant areas, all enhance the atmosphere. It was delightful from start to finish. As you can see in the pictures, the teenager was thoroughly impressed & planning his next visit already.

name: LeisureWorld Bishopstown
address: Rossa Ave, Cork, T12 HP29, Ireland
summary: Health and fitness centre offering fitness classes, 7-a-side soccer, swimming pools and a cafe.
reviews_text:
I visited this swimming pool today with my children and it was an absolutely disgusting experience. I spent a fair amount of time at the swimming pools across Europe and this one is by far the worst.
The level of cleanliness was shocking. Floors around the pools area were covered with dirt, hair, used plasters and debris, and it looked as if they hadn‚Äôt been cleaned for days (at least).
The water in the 18-metre pool was cloudy(!), and the glass panels separating the pools were covered with old, dried stains.
The changing rooms were unusable ‚Äî in most of them there were clothes and bags left behind, making it impossible to get changed.
Overall, the conditions were far below basic hygiene standards. This was my first and last visit.
Extremely disappointing experience at LeisureWorld Bishopstown. || A welcoming leisure facility where everyone belongs.
David and Jane üíï deliver outstanding aqua aerobics. Rebecca and Katie‚Äôs superb coaching at Revelate and in other fitness classes energises, challenges, burns and for sure tones. Ageless Movement program is based on soothing motions with enduring strength. Traffic can be tricky, parking a challenge, and the pools do get packed on weekends; despite these drawbacks, the quality and variety of classes make this a recommended fitness centre. || The gym used to be good. It had gone downhill so much. The price increased and the equipment lessened. They removed the monkey bar which was so useful for pull ups and swinging.. They used to have skipping rope and gone for while. They then bought some skipping rope but in kid's sizes üòë. || Excellent leisure center with great swimming pools, modern gym facilities, and plenty of classes for all ages. The staff are friendly and professional, and the place is always clean and well maintained. A perfect spot for fitness, relaxation, and family activities. || hi. come here with my kids after school pay as you go. i‚Äôm scred to take my eyes off them, only one person in yellow watching three different pools. this is definiitely not good or safe never see anyone come to help. lives are at risk here üò°

name: Inchydoney Island Lodge & Spa
address: Inchydoney Island, Co. Cork, P85 X258, Ireland
summary: Luxe rooms & suites with sea views in a high-end resort hotel featuring eateries, a spa & a lounge.
reviews_text:
The hotel was absolutely amazing 10/10! I stayed a while ago, and from the moment I arrived at reception, the staff were super friendly and welcoming. The weather was perfect, which made the whole experience even better. The spa and food were pure luxury, and the cocktails were incredible. The staff in general were really kind and attentive specially a Spanish guy from the lounge who made some truly outstanding cocktails. Overall, such a friendly atmosphere and top-notch service. || Stayed for two nights in the hotel. Quiet weekend break, essentially staying in hotel for the 2 days. Made use of the fantastic spa and had some treatments. Ate in the restaurant and bar both nights.

Stands out as our best hotel stay in Ireland - staff go above and beyond and are so helpful. Excellent areas in hotel for unwinding, lounge area was fantastic, and restaurant with sea views fantastic.

Complimentary chocolates both nights and homemade jam on checkout were nice touches. || We had a fantastic 2 nights here. The setting is fab, the staff are amazing and the food was terrific.  The wall are a bit thin but that's the only fault I could have. || Inchydoney is the only vacation spot that we have stayed at multiple times.  13 to be exact.  The hotel, the pub, the restaurant and the spa are all 5 star plus.  The staff are warm and welcoming and have become part of our extended family. As Americans traveling to Ireland we look forward every time we go there knowing there will be no negative surprises.   This is the one vacation spot I would highly recommend to anyone traveling to Ireland. || Beautiful hotel. Wonderful staff, delicious food, great spa facilities. A welcome drink on arrival and a little gift on departure. The room was spacious, and had a sea view. Only downsides: no bath, no aircon, no usb sockets.

name: Kinsale Hotel & Spa
address: Rathmore, Kinsale, Co. Cork, P17 F542, Ireland
summary: Polished spa hotel featuring an airy restaurant, an indoor pool & panoramic bay views.
reviews_text:
We had a lovely 2 night stay here just after Christmas. The hotel is just stunning, very warm and welcoming. The food we had was 5 star all the way, absolutely delicious. A very special mention to Jack on Reception who was very helpful and informative. All the staff were happy and there was a great atmosphere at all times, you can tell they are happy in their jobs. The only thing we missed were bathrobes in the room which would have been handy as we used the leisure centre a few times and Netflix was not available on the TV's. That aside, I would highly recommend this hotel. We will be back soon. || We spent NYE at the kinsale hotel and spa.

The staff was friendly and the food was really good (we pre-booked the special new year dinner)
Breakfast was great with lots of delicious savoury and sweet options.

The spa was a bit of a letdown however. The sauna and steam room were ok but the swimming pool was really disappointing: none of the jets, small water waterfalls or reclining bubble beds were working. In total only 1 of the 8 "stations" in the pool was working (the standing bubbles).
The whirlpool seemed to constantly be taken by other people who had just finished their gym session.

The rooms were spotless and comfortable.

Overall it would've been a great stay if only the swimming pool had been repaired... || Tammy, Sarah and Jack couldn‚Äôt have been more accommodating when sorting out different needs for my family during a large group stay over Christmas and New Year's. Spotless rooms, great food with lots of things to do with children, walks on the grounds, a swimming pool and a playground. Will definitely be back! || Wow, what can I say? We got married here on Saturday! üíç‚ú®

We planned the whole wedding all the way from Australia, and our first night at the hotel was the evening before the big day. üá¶üá∫‚úàÔ∏è

Laura and John were absolutely outstanding, the perfect duo. Nothing was ever too much to ask for. üëè
The bar staff were dancing and great craic, and the wait staff were amazing. üçπüíÉ The chef even came out to check on us personally. As someone who‚Äôs gluten-free, I really appreciated how accommodating they were. üôèüçΩÔ∏è

I had one issue regarding reservations, and John made me feel truly heard and that meant the world. üí¨‚ù§Ô∏è

The food was delicious and one guest even said it was the best salmon she‚Äôs ever had! üêüüòã

John, I hope you finally found some grapefruit juice! üòÑ Also, thanks to Dino.

My mum passed away in May so it was a tough day but everyone helped make it feel truly magical. ‚ú®

Thank you all for making our day so special. üôåüíï || We attended a wedding here 2 weeks ago. From start to finish we couldn't have asked for more. Our rooms were ready early, the staff were so accommodating and friendly.  The food and the views were spectacular.  Thank you for a great day and night.

name: Luxury Hot Tubs Ltd.
address: Townshend St, Coronea, Skibbereen, Co. Cork, P81 N449, Ireland
reviews_text:
Tried to visit their site, no longer there and was informed the owner has gone back to Lithuania. Actually called too and the guy started making things complicated and saying how difficult delivery etc is, at which point I told him not to bother. || Janius provided a great service - he provided a lot of details about the different hot tub options, allowing me to make an informed decision about which to purchase. He was always very communicative and was very flexible about delivery, working around my schedule and the builders who were fitting the decking. On seeing the site, he advised a longer flue would be appropriate and came round the next day to fit it. All in all, an excellent service. Thank you! || Took delivery of Hot Tub last week and we are 100% happy.   The product is sturdy and beautifully finished.  Lit the first fire and 2 hours later it was up to temp and so inviting !
Our communication with John was perfect. John suggested 4 to 6 weeks lead time the tub was installed within 4 weeks of ordering. John kept contact during the 4 weeks and gave great advice on positioning and installation.

We would not hesitate in recommending Luxury Hot Tubs Ltd if you are considering one of the products offered by this company. || I've had my HotTub for over a year now and we still use it weekly. We've had 0 issues with it. At one point when we wanted to extend the flue and Jaunius was able to help us out with that which is much appreciated. The HotTub itself is also extremely well insulated and we only lose a few degree's overnight which is quite easy to warm back up again. Jaunius was also able to guide us on how to maintain the water which we've now become experts at and it's also quite easy to clean the tub. Initially when we were looking into getting a HotTub Jaunius was also able to guide us through all the various options and features to choose what was best for us.
-Barry Mc || So happy with our new sauna. It's a high quality product and a lovely addition to our garden! The wood burning stove is very powerful. The whole buying experience with John was smooth and efficient and the installation took only one day. Highly recommend you check out their hot tubs and saunas.

name: The Montenotte Hotel, an SLH Hotel
address: Middle Glanmire Rd, Montenotte, Cork, T23 E9DX, Ireland
summary: Upscale hotel with elegant quarters, a rooftop bar, a restaurant & a leisure centre with a pool.
reviews_text:
I've stayed in a lot of 4 star hotels, and truly, The Montenotte blows the rest out of the water. I actually did not want to go home after two nights away here, I was so relaxed and comfortable. The service from the lovely staff, the food, and the amenities are second to none. We had dinner for our engagement anniversary and it tasted absolutely amazing - food we had elsewhere on the second night seemed so bland by comparison. The drinks and cocktails were delightful also in The Glasshouse and the live music in both the restaurant and bar makes it truly special. Breakfast was amazing - an excellent continental selection for making a yoghurt and berry bowl with seeds and nuts, a huge selection of cooked food, and eggs cooked to order. Liked the coffee also, both in the room and at the restaurant. The pool and amenities were very quiet and spacious - as a person who wanted some quiet time, this was amazing to not be struggling for personal space. Loved the free cinema each night; a special treat. The gardens are very tranquil with interesting sculptures and beautiful to look out on from the balconies. I will certainly be back again soon. Worth every cent! || From the moment we arrived, our stay at The Montenotte Hotel felt special. Though the entrance from the road is on a sharp turn and a little awkward to navigate, the warm welcome from the staff immediately set a positive tone. Martha at reception was very helpful, offering thoughtful local recommendations and a great overview of the hotel‚Äôs amenities, including the in-house cinema ‚Äî something we‚Äôre already looking forward to returning to try.
Our room had clearly been prepared with care to mark our anniversary, complete with rose petals on the bed and a lovely couples dessert to greet us. The furniture was functional and well-kept, though a little dated in style, a theme noticeable across parts of the hotel. Still, it didn‚Äôt detract from the overall comfort or atmosphere. The shower, set over a bath, was slightly awkward to use because of the space, but manageable.
Around the hotel grounds, the panoramic views over Cork city are stunning. The sunken gardens were beautiful for a short stroll ‚Äî I can imagine they are even more impressive in full bloom. The quirky artwork and statues dotted around the grounds added a fun and interesting touch.
Accessibility seemed well considered throughout the hotel, with lifts to different floors and ramps connecting most spaces. However, the designated accessible parking bays at the front felt somewhat tight and perhaps better suited as a drop-off zone.
The spa experience was a real highlight. We were greeted by name upon arrival, which created a very welcoming start. Carla provided an excellent Five Element Aroma Massage, both deeply relaxing and effective for the muscle areas I had mentioned beforehand. She also offered great aftercare advice. Despite my initial doubts, the salt room session proved incredibly beneficial ‚Äî I left after twenty minutes feeling clear-headed and noticeably decongested.
Dinner at the restaurant was another standout moment. Luana, our waitress, went out of her way to make our evening special, acknowledging our celebration and chatting warmly throughout the meal. The live piano music and city views created a wonderfully romantic setting. The oysters were among the freshest we‚Äôve had, and the dessert menu offered some pleasantly unexpected and creative options ‚Äî a nice touch for a hotel restaurant.
After dinner, we visited the Glasshouse Bar, a stylish and relaxed space separate from the main restaurant bar. The signature cocktails, many made with locally produced spirits, were both inventive and reasonably priced.
Breakfast the next morning continued the high standard, with a good selection of ‚Äúfrom the kitchen‚Äù dishes ‚Äî including eggs Benedict, Royale, or Florentine ‚Äî alongside a well-stocked buffet. Even arriving around 9:45 (with breakfast served until 11), the area never felt particularly crowded.
Overall, The Montenotte combines thoughtful service, beautiful views, and a welcoming atmosphere that make it ideal for a romantic or restorative getaway in Cork. While a few design elements show their age, the warmth of the experience more than makes up for it, and we look forward to returning soon. || Honestly, the best most sincere welcome in a hotel ever from Ken at the door.
The  hotel was just spectacular in every way. The bar area and gardens were exquisite and what a view!!!
We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment which had everything we needed to cook our own meals. The layout was great for a family of 4 however I would have liked a larger bed in the master bedroom. The only thing missing in the whole apartment was a mirror beside a plug socket for styling hair...I had to wing it without a mirror which meant I had a questionable hair style for the duration of our stay!
The pool, jacuzzi, sauna and steam room were fabulous.
We walked and bused it into city centre, bus is 5 min walk away or city centre is a 20 min walk. My advice, walk in and bus it back as its a steep climb up to the hotel.
Get train to Cobh for an afternoon out  or drive to Kinsale 40 mins away, it's beautiful!
We hope to return to this little gem  of a hotel in the future. Thanks so much Montenotte Hoyel! || A wonderful stay at the Montenotte hotel. From the moment you arrive the staff make you feel welcome. The door porter, Kevin - I think is his name was friendly and made you feel right at home. The staff in the hotel are what make the hotel and add to your stay. They really are a credit to the hotel. The rooms are lovely, food in the restaurant is delicious and the breakfast options are extensive. Would highly recommend if you are staying in Cork. || Lovely 4 star hotel with really stunning gardens and a great view over Cork city. We had a very nice  dinner in the restaurant followed by cocktails and live music in the Glasshouse which was sublime. We  recovered the following morning in the gym/pool which is good as hotel gyms go. We had a standard room which was comfortable but the bathroom was a bit on the small side and the wardrobe space was minuscule with too few hangers.
What The Montenotte does best though is customer service. All the staff were well presented, attentive and super engaging, nothing was too much and you felt comfortable asking for what you needed when you needed it. It‚Äôs really obvious that management here have invested in staff training and motivation as they are all excellent communicators and all very friendly. There is none of the starchiness you get in some hotels, especially 5 star ones, just a genuine  and friendly welcome. Great resort hotel with a buzzy atmosphere and I highly recommend.

name: Wild Atlantic Sauna Dooey
address: Dooey north, Dooey, Lettermacaward, Co. Donegal, F94 WF54, Ireland
reviews_text:
‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê 5/5 ‚Äì An unforgettable Donegal experience!

We booked the Wild Atlantic Sauna with Mags (25th October 2025) and it was honestly one of the highlights of our entire trip to Donegal. From the moment we arrived, Mags made everything feel so welcoming and personal ‚Äì you can tell straight away that this isn‚Äôt just a business, it‚Äôs something she has poured real passion into.

The setting is breathtaking ‚Äì a cosy barrel sauna tucked into the dunes, looking straight out onto miles of untouched beach, rolling waves, and the Donegal mountains in the distance. Sitting inside the wood-fired heat, watching the Atlantic through the panoramic window, felt like something out of a travel documentary.

The cold-water dip in the sea between sauna rounds was a total buzz ‚Äì we had a mixture of seasoned dippers and first-timers in our group, and every single person came out beaming. The contrast between the freezing ocean and the crackling fire inside the sauna is addictive, and somehow you come out feeling lighter, calmer, and completely recharged.

What makes it even better is the little thoughtful touches ‚Äì the relaxing scent of the timber, the bucket and ladle for l√∂yly, the essential oils and Mags‚Äô warm hospitality. Nothing felt rushed, nothing felt commercial ‚Äì it felt like being hosted by a friend who knows and loves the area.

We had three generations with us ‚Äì from swimmers in their 20s to a baby wrapped up in a carrier ‚Äì and everyone got something out of it. It‚Äôs the kind of experience that stays with you long after you leave.

If you‚Äôre anywhere near Portnoo, Ardara, or Narin, book this. Don‚Äôt hesitate. It‚Äôs the purest way to experience the Wild Atlantic ‚Äì sea, heat, salt air, and total switch-off time.

We‚Äôll 100% be back ‚Äì see your next time mags üòÉ || Highly recommended, an incredible experience on the coast of the chilly Atlantic ocean, that offers a welcomed cold dip from the heat of the Finnish sauna with fantastic views of Dooey Beach. We had to visit twice over the course of our week‚Äôs holiday. If you are in this part of the world I can‚Äôt recommend the sauna enough. Mags the owner is so lovely and responsive, we‚Äôll see you next time. || Gorgeous sauna with a stunning view of Dooey beach. We booked an hour slot in the sauna and had an amazing time. Mags was lovely and recommended a couple of coffee and food spots for afterwards. Will definitely return. || I‚Äôd been wanting to try a seaside sauna and this did not disappoint. Highlight of our trip to Dooey beach, would 100% do it again next time we‚Äôre there. The views were incredible, and the whole experience so relaxing. Loved trying the essential oils and Mags was so friendly and accommodating. Can‚Äôt recommend highly enough! || An absolute gem! Booked for an hour for my mum's 70th birthday and it was fantastic.
Mags is the best host, and the sauna is incredible. The view from the window is breathtaking, the temperature inside was nice and hot, and it's only a few yards to the sea when you need to cool off ü•∂!  Mags provided lots of different essential oils, extra wood, and there were a couple of changing rooms so we could dry off out of the wind.
Will definitely be back again when we're in the area, it's unmissable!

name: Sliabh Liag Sauna
address: Pier, Rinnakill, Teelin, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews_text:
My partner and I booked a 30-minute session at the Sliabh Liag sauna on a Sunday evening in early October 2025. It was during Storm Amy, so it was the perfect way to warm up while waiting for better weather to go hiking. I only went into the ocean up to my hips because of the waves, but it was still invigorating. Afterwards, we had a beer next to the turf fire at The Rusty Mackerel. Awesome experience! || We knew we'd enjoy this, but had no idea HOW MUCH we'd enjoy this. A wonderful end to a day of hiking (and a night of pint-ing previously), leaving us both relaxed and energized. We also played around with the best order of things, which might be worth sharing:

1. 15 min sauna
2. Jump in the ocean
3. Outdoor shower
4. Cold plunge

... amazing spot, idea, staff and execution - a must for anyone who visits Teelin! || Had a wonderful experience here , guys were great, very easy booking process. Lovely location and the guys got it up nice and hot for us. Thanks guys will definitely be back to ye. || I was so happy to find this spot while on holidays in Glencolumbkille this week! Location is gorgeous and the view from the sauna is 10/10. The cold  bath was a lovely addition and then being able to get in for a swim too was great! I‚Äôll definitely be back next year - thanks! || Absolutely amazing experience.
After a 13Km Sleive League hike a sea swim and sauna was the perfect end.
The lady at the sauna was very helpful and allowed us extra time
Very relaxed peaceful place.
A must do on your trip üëç

name: The Swilly Sauna
address: Main Beach Carpark, Rathmullan, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews_text: So relaxing and refreshing! The sauna is so clean and positioned perfectly on the beach with a stunning view of the sea. Ricky and Anna were so lovely too! || Visited the Swilly Sauna last weekend and it was amazing!! Rathmullan beach is the perfect place for a sea swim and a sauna session, definitely worth a try || Fantastic experience - what a brilliant idea. The sauna is clean and has a wonderful view out to the Swilly - you are provided with lovely oils to use if you want and the whole experience is invigorating and fun. Ricky was very welcoming and I cannot wait to use it again. Very highly recommended! || Ricky was the greatest host. Chatty, friendly and helpful. The sauna was heaven. Clean, hot with a wonderful view. The tide was out (would be better if not) so we were getting a workout also to get to the water but it was still a wonderful experience. Thanks Ricky! Fiona and friends üíö || Easy to book through Facebook. We do this every time we are in Donegal. Ricky took good care of us. The sauna is excellent and we, a group of four, alternated sauna and sea swims. I would highly recommend, even on a very wet day.

name: Rossnowlagh sauna
address: Rossnowlagh, Co. Donegal, F94 XW01, Ireland
reviews_text:
Amazing sauna! Beautiful location right by the beach with a cold bucket shower and plunge pools! Such a lovely addition to a beautiful destination and right beside the superb Brew Box coffee shop! || Top class spot, good privacy, plunge bucket is great with the portable baths as another option. Well run sauna & Neil is top class. Well worth it. || Amazing sauna right beside the beach, ideal for post surf or swim. Also has ice bath/bucket, so fresh! || Fantastic sauna. Great to pop in after a surf. Very friendly and helpful staff. || My wife and I used this sauna yesterday and and we had a lovely experience.
The sauna is absolutely spotless and the owner is a gentleman.
Can't recommend enough.

name: inishkeel sauna
address: Narin Portnoo Strand, Clooney, An Fhearthainn, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews_text:
What a great addition to Portnoo & Narin beach.   Wood fired sauna with a beautiful view of Inishkeel Island.  Perfect way to unwind on a cold winters day or post sea dip.  Sin√©ad is most helpful & the online booking system makes it simple; listing the times available that change with the seasons.  Looking forward to trying an exclusive hire with some friends.   Top tip:
combine with a hot chocolate at one of the nearby beach coffee shops.  Can‚Äôt wait to return. || Beautiful Sauna, really well located & reasonably priced. only problem was the sauna was not hot enough at only 70'c droping to 60'c. also bearly any water was provided for the steam. even when asking for more water very little was provided. honestly a very nice place but moore thought needs to be put into the temp. || Fab sauna in a fantastic location. Sinead was so lovely and really looked after us during our slot. üòä Cant recommend enough! || Fantastic experience. The sauna is spotless and beautifully maintained. Sin√©ad went above and beyond to help with my booking and questions. The complimentary water and electrolytes were a lovely, thoughtful touch! || Amazing sauna! So new, clean and cosy! Sinead is a great host and sets the temperature just right for the client. Brilliant view of the beach when in the sauna also! Great price. Can be booked via website for 20 euro per person or can pay cash if you wish! Can book a slot also for a group. Lemon water to cool down and towels if you forget to bring one. Sinead can do hen do's and other events also. Great to work with! So relaxing and made me feel so at ease snd had a great sleep that night! 5 star all round! Would recommend! üßñ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüßñ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏èüíôüíôüíôüíõüíõüíõ

name: The Hot Box Sauna Rosses Point
address: Deadman‚Äôs point, Rosses Upper, Sligo, Ireland
reviews_text:
We had a wonderful Rosses Point Sauna experience. Everything was clean, comfortable, and well maintained. The atmosphere was calm and relaxing.
Special thanks to Declan, he was friendly, attentive and professional.
Thank you very much for the excellent service ‚Äî we will definitely come back and highly recommend this place.
Best wishes, Liudmyla || What a wonderful place to relax. Two hot saunas, wooden fired a a beautyful view on the north atlantic. You can book 45 minutes sessions and in this time you can cool down in the ocean.
Cabin for 8 people and a warm atmosphere.
We will come back, thank you for the nice time we had ‚ù§Ô∏è || We absolutely loved The Hot Box Sauna ‚Äî it‚Äôs a true gem on the ocean‚Äôs edge. We came as a group of four and the atmosphere was just perfect: cozy, peaceful, and unforgettable.

I‚Äôm currently going through rehabilitation after a skiing accident and two surgeries, so I was on crutches ‚Äî yet I managed everything without a problem thanks to the thoughtful design and, most of all, the kindness of the staff.

A special thanks to Cillian, who constantly helped me open the door and even brought me water since I couldn‚Äôt get into the cold barrel. He joked he‚Äôs not as handsome as Cillian Murphy, but honestly, I think he‚Äôs very wrong. Someone should tell him he absolutely deserves an Oscar for his human qualities alone.

This place is pure magic. Highly, highly recommend. || This was so much fun!

What to bring:
1. Drinking water and electrolytes to stay hydrated
2. 2 towels: one for the sauna and another to dry yourself after you are done
3. Slippers or beach shoes

To note:
- Leave your valuables in the car because there are no storage boxes
- Make sure you do not need toilets because the nearest are 5 minutes away || I went for an early morning sauna recently and was delighted with the experience. Two clean and HOT saunas. Plus a cold dunk pool. A water fountain keeps you hydrated. Lovely views while you sweat it out. There is a unisex change room but no toilet. Be warned. A faultless sauna with friendly staff.

name: The Wellhouse
address: Rockhill House, Rockhill House Estate, Rockhill, Letterkenny, Co. Donegal, F92 R523, Ireland
reviews_text:
The Well House at Rockhill Estate in Letterkenny is a hidden gem! When visiting family in Letterkenny, I usually book an overnight to the Shandon but hadn‚Äôt intended going to a spa this time. However, I decided last minute to indulge in some pampering but didn‚Äôt fancy driving too far and Google threw up The Well House which I had never heard of. We got booked in for a back massage each and I am so glad we did. The spa is just beautiful, the staff are amazing, and the treatments are fabulous. Leah on the desk couldn‚Äôt have been more helpful. Shauna provided one of the best hot stone massages I‚Äôve ever had and Colleen, the spa manager, is just so friendly. As someone else posted, The Well is up there with the best and I found it more relaxing than the Monart.
The only minor criticism I have is that the locker configuration is quite close together for getting changed and while there are stools in the changing rooms, a wee bench would be handier to get changed at rather than at the basins and stools. The Spa could also do with a insta tag - I could only tag the Rockhill Estate when I posted!! Full marks for providing shampoo AND conditioner in the showers as well as body wash. The Ishga products are fab.
I will definitely be back for a treat meant and hopefully one of the day spa packages. Will be recommending to my friends! || Most relaxing time spent at The Wellhouse Spa at Rockhill, warmest welcome and spoilt on arrival for an afternoon of bliss, in beautiful surroundings. Would highly recommend, a real treat.  Thanks to Colleen and Melania, and the other lady can‚Äôt think of her name,  lovely staff. Will be back soon ‚≠êÔ∏è || A wonderful, peaceful haven in Donegal. Shauna was a wonderful and attentive therapist. The facilities are clean and beautifully designed. I'll definitely be back! || This was the first time of us visiting this spa and we were not disappointed, the booking system online was difficult to navigate but we were able to get this resolved efficiently before our visit. We were greeted by really lovely staff and walked through very carefully our visit and how everything worked, which is helpful for first time visitors. We had the entire facility to ourselves which did make this a very private experience. The staff regularly checked in on us to ensure we were okay which was highly appreciated. The facilities were amazing and plenty to do. The changing areas and entire place was incredibly clean and very high quality. We would definitely visit again. || I will never go to another spa again! Good and all as the others may be, they will not be a patch on this amazing place. I was welcomed by Christine personally and who welcomed me by name...star no.1.  She welcomed me with such warmth. I was shown from the beautiful reception to my dressing room. Stunningly designed with natural wood, stone tiled floors, shower and toilet..all for me! Spacious too. Beautiful robe and flip flops supplied. I changed into my swimsuit, robed, Conor brought me through the first part of the spa. Again, beautifully designed and very organic in it's feel. Soft music playing throughout. Conor showed me into the 'wet' area. A big massage pool in the centre, flanked by a steamroom..gorgeous, a sauna and a thermal suite. Showers and toilet there too. I tried the thermal suite first. It was lovely. Heat on my sore back was so relaxing. I then went to the steam room. Dark with blue pin lights on the ceiling. A small personal shower at every seat. I loved it. I stayed in for about 10 mins, showered and climbed into the ample massage pool. One side hits your neck, shoulders and back. The other side, for lower back and calves. I was in there 3 times! It's fabulous. Through the huge windows you see a garden complete with 2 hot tubs, a yert, seating area and a rain shower for the brave! Which I was! I sat in the 40 degree bubbling hot tub while listening to the breeze in trees and the soft unobtrusive music. I lay on one of comfy loungers outside..it was very mild today! The yert is very special and you can relax there too. I went back inside for another water massage..definitely recommend the power head..brace yourself! It's amazing! I dried off and sat in the relaxation room..still looking out over the lovely garden, and a bar..drank lemon infused water, and swung gently on the seats hanging from the timber beamed ceiling. Now, let me tell you. This is just the pre treatment 90 minutes! By the time Christine came to get me for my ACTUAL treatments, I could have just slept! The lovely thing I found, there was no sense of urgency. There was no rushing. I've been to quite a few spas, there was always a sense of time being of the essence..it probably is, but you don't feel it. On my arrival, I filled in a form. Standard practice, but it was read. Christine brought me to, again, a beautiful, peaceful treatment room. She sat with me and the first thing she said, that she was so sorry for my loss. For the first time on a form I have seen, there is a box for grief. I lost my hubby less than a year ago and it has been especially raw in the past couple of weeks. Christine empathised, was not uncomfortable with my unexpected blubber and just got it! Again, no rushing me. It felt like I owned this spa! Only there for me! I wish! I had booked the Signature Massage and the 24ct facial. All of it was 24ct. The massage was second to none. Firm, never uncomfortable. And again, slow. Never rushed. And the smells..omg. Beautiful. It seemed to last forever...and just when you were sad it was over..it wasn't!! Joy! And then the facial!! Omg...hot towels, massage, oils..it was Heaven. I truly never wanted it to end. When it did, sadly, I was brought a cool lemon infused water and allowed to just relax. I got up and Christine brought me to another beautiful relaxation room..exposed stone, soft lighting, soft music. And bless her, due to having been in water for 90 mins, my robe was damp!! She brought me a dry one, gave me a menu of beautiful herbal teas..and I sat, relaxed further. Now nearly fluid, I poured myself back to my dressing room. Had a wonderful shower changed and was ready for the off...I found Christine and hugged her. This is a very special place, with VERY special people. Empathy is a huge part of being Therapists, and they have it in spades. Rockhill played a huge part in our lives, myself and Pat, and I am sorry it took so long for me to visit The Wellhouse. My advice, go! 5 hours of wonderfulness. Thank you all. ü•∞ü•∞ü•∞ü•∞ü•∞

name: OM Saunas
address: Rossnowlagh Beach, Rossnowlagh Lower, Golf View, Co. Donegal, F94 X7X3, Ireland
reviews_text: This was my second time trying a beachside sauna and I really enjoyed my afternoon at OM Saunas! The owner was so lovely and chatty. The sauna was the perfect temperature and we were provided with essential oils to pour over the hot rocks which added to the experience. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a relaxing time spent by the beach! || What a special sauna experience! Sauna parked up right on the sand facing the waves and Mat provided a perfect service. Sauna was new and clean and I was lucky enough to have the whole thing to myself for an hour. Bliss! Made the sea dips among the rolling waves even more incredible. Thank you üôè || Sauna is very clean and the view of the sea is amazing. A very relaxing spot to unwind. The sea is very shallow as you walk out perfect for anyone who might be a bit of a nervous sea swimmer. || OM Saunas in Rossnowlagh, Co. Donegal, offers a truly unique and rejuvenating experience with its wood-fired sauna right on the beach. The serene coastal views combined with the soothing heat create an unparalleled relaxation environment. Maciej was incredibly welcoming and helpful, ensuring we had everything we needed for an enjoyable session. His warm hospitality and attention to detail made our visit memorable. If you are to looking enjoy a unique wellness activity, OM Saunas is the perfect spot. Highly recommended for a refreshing and restorative experience. Thank you Elaine & Keith. || Wonderful tranquil experience in the hot sauna at sunset looking out at the ocean. The owners Matt and Elizabeth were so kind and efficient and made sure our session was perfect. We were able to dip in the ocean to cool off too. What a treat!

name: itSaunatrailer
address: Marble Hill Ct, Clonmass, Letterkenny, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews_text:
One of the most scenic saunas I‚Äôve visited - didn‚Äôt catch the owners name but lovely guy who was really helpful about things to do in the area. Highly recommend! || Beautiful sauna, loved the lavender infused water!! View was incredible and the owner was super friendly and kind. || Everyone needs to visit itSaunatrailer!

Shane and Skye are such great hosts and made the whole process so easy, from the moment we booked to arriving they were lovely!

Absolutely nothing better then a warm sauna after those freezing cold Atlantic waters!

Im going again this weekend :) || We went for a dip at Marble Hill beach and stopped by at ItSaunaTrailer afterwards. Skye and Shane were so welcoming and it‚Äôs the perfect set up with amazing views. Perfect way to end our sea dip. You guys made our day out in Marble Hill perfect. HIGHLY highly recommend, will be coming back again soon || What an amazing experience! A combination of my two favourite things, sauna and the beach üíØ Such lovely and friendly staff.

Highly recommend.

name: Sauna
address: Letterkenny Retail Park, Paddy Harte Rd, Letterkenny, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews_text: Amazing, just amazing. I loved it. Like really loved it. 15% more than I loved other Saunas. Thank you.

name: V Spa at the Villa Rose Hotel
address: Main St, Ballybofey, Co. Donegal, F93 C2CF, Ireland
reviews_text:
Great spa, worth to give it a try!
The massage is a relax one though you have 3 levels to select from - mild, normal or firm.
There's a small free car parking in front of the hotel.
At the end you get a wee treat in the relax room, be it a cup of tea or an ice cream.
Overall a wonderful experience! I left the spa fully relaxed . || Gemma was amazing at the full body massage. What a brilliant therapist. Excellent at her job. Thanks again || What a fabulous Spa. My treatments were superb, the setting and facilities are fantastic and customer service was unreal. One if the best for sure. Looking forward to getting back soon. || Can't speak highly enough about this spa experience. The thermal suite is small but due to same its quieter and you get to really enjoy your hour pre treatment. Its warm, tranquil & what is there is lovely. No sauna which I did miss but that's a small loss for the overall space. The treatment itself was the star of show. I got the Summer glow package which was divine. Usually I am only relaxing near end of a treatment but my therapist Frances had me switched off & zen in 5 minutes. Her massage technique was perfect & she had my skin looked refreshed post facial. My friend also said the same thing about her therapist & treatment so clearly the excellence is across the board.  Highly, highly recommended!!!! A Deserved 5 stars üåü || I visited V Spa on Friday, 7th July, for the first time. From entering the door, I was pampered, I had an exfoliating body treatment and a pedicure. Both were exceptionally good. Rochelle did my pedicure, and I could not recommend this lady highly enough, I never felt a thing as I had an ingrowing nail. My feet never felt this good, I'm a nurse on my feet ++. 10/10 for this spa.
Thanks, ladies, I will be back.

name: Wood Ya Be Well Sauna
address: Streedagh, Beach, Co. Sligo, Ireland
reviews_text: Pumping hot Sauna in beautiful Streedagh beach. The owner is really friendly and it‚Äôs an amazing unique hand built sauna. My favourite one in Sligo because it has plenty of space compared with some others! Thanks Wood ya Be well team || Tried the new mobile sauna on the beach and loved it. I aim to go 2 or 3 times a week now if I can. Great vibes, super relaxing, and the location is perfect. Nice spot to unwind and do something a bit different! || Beautifully made sauna in a gorgeous location. Makes popping into the sea so easy‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.even in winter!!  Looking forward to regular visits. || Beautiful sauna in the most idyllic location, a real gem can‚Äôt wait for my next visit! || Couldn‚Äôt recommend this sauna experience more! Spacious, clean, and cozy sauna built by Eoin who runs it and is so helpful.

name: Shandon Hotel & Spa
address: Marble Hill Strand, Parkmore, Dunfanaghy, Co. Donegal, Ireland
summary: Stylish hotel featuring dining, bay views & a sleek spa, plus a bar offering live music.
reviews_text:
Spectacular views.  Location is right by Sheephaven Bay with a beautiful beach within walking distance.

The Shandon Spa was exceptional and I would highly recommend.

Great breakfast, lunch, afternoon tea and dinner. Would also recommend special events.  We were there and attended an ABBA tribute night.  Dinner and dancing with a great band. || This is a fantastic hotel!
Warm, friendly & helpful staff. Spacious rooms with great views, it has beautiful beach, just a short walk from the hotel. Spa treatments, amazing as was the thermal suite. Delicious food with plenty of choice! We had a very chilled & relaxing weekend here. Highly recommend it! üëå || Room was very warm in Dec to point had trouble sleeping ,
We done the santa experience our 3 rd  time here.
Definitely  worth doing santa experience Mrs clause is the same one we have always seen ,and she is fabulous, she spoke to girls & said how big they got, they thought it was amazing she remembered  them , bless there we hearts.We have had the same santa for couple of yrs he was great , and there presents were decent too. || lovely staff, great facilities.  need car to get to a shop, but slightly remote location is part of the appeal - the nearby beach is hard to beat.  as per many hotels the rooms can be unbearably hot and hard to temperature adjust. || We attended a wedding here of a couple where the groom chose it because his family had been coming here for 35 years.  It is at the other end of Ireland from New Ross, but we were blessed with great weather and, as with all of Donegals beaches and coast, it's absolutely fabulous when you have the weather for it. Seemed to have lots of good restaurants around and speaking with people who know the area, there is an amazing amount to do and see around the area. The beaches were thronged with cars and visitors. Lots on NI cars around - apparently they have a lot of holiday homes around.

name: Ballyliffin Lodge & Spa
address: Ballyliffin Lodge & Spa Hotel, Shore Rd, Ballyliffin, Co. Donegal, F93 XR25, Ireland
summary: Unfussy rooms, a formal restaurant and relaxed bar, plus free breakfast and reduced golfing fees.
reviews_text:
Everything was perfect till 10pm then the music started, ok its a wedding but it went on till 2am and the base drum banged out 180 beats per minute like a rave only it was country music mostly then, people chatting and laughing till after 4am.

Other than that is was wonder with beautiful views friendly and efficient staff more than ample parking fantastic spa and gym suite || Have stayed here a few times. Lovely hotel. Only few minutes walk from beach. Staff were excellent. Efficient & friendly. Especially Emily, Antony and Stephen.
Definately worth a visit. || An absolute gem of a hotel, away from everything, the food, the ,rooms, the staff, the surroundings are all wonderful, our happy place if we need to get away for a few days.
Words can't describe the Ballyliffin Lodge Hotel and Spa,  it's a must go see for yourself.  You won't be disappointed. || Very nice venue. Reception, breakfast, and dining staff very friendly and attention to guest requests excellent. Bar very inviting, but only for one staff member, who we found rude and unprofessional, this person could spend moore time with the breakfast team!!! || Sharon the receptionist was a delight from the moment we walked through the doors what a lovely warm welcome my wife loved the hotel so much we booked it again holly the waitress was lovely I would definitely recommend this hotel but I nearly want to keep it a secret  breakfast was fabulous dinner was fantastic I forgot the gentleman that got me the bucket off ice the place is just beautiful can't wait to go back

name: Sauna S√°sta
address: Dunmoran, Strand, Co. Sligo, Ireland
reviews_text: We had a fantastic experience, with a lovely welcome at the sauna. On a very windy cold December day. After 3 nights in Sligo checking out the fantastic pubs we felt great after the sauna and running down the sand to the sea. Very invigorating. Then headed to The Beach Bar 5 minute drive away for lunch and a Guinness. We would recommend!! || Never did I ever ... think I would willingly go into the sea in December but as part of the Sauna S√°sta experience it was just amazing. Jacky's whole offering - fantastic sauna, fabulous location and warm welcome are out of this world. Next time will be for a full moon üåùüòÅ || An absolutely unforgettable experience. The wood-fired sauna was incredible, and the sea view and sea dip made it truly special‚Äîso peaceful and rejuvenating. On top of that, the owner was fantastic: welcoming, kind, and genuinely passionate about making sure we had the best time. I couldn‚Äôt recommend this place more. || We had a wonderful family sauna experience on Christmas Day! The sauna was spotless, beautifully maintained, and perfectly heated. It felt relaxing from the moment we stepped in. Jackie even made a lovely video for us to remember. Will be back soon. || Absolutely incredible experience! I have been during the summer a number of times which was beautiful but today was my 1st winter experience and oh my god we were blown away. The sauna is fantastic and Jackie is an absolute legend and the locationis the cherry on top.... cant wait too return

name: HotBox Benone
address: 39 Benone Ave, Limavady BT49 0LQ, UK
reviews_text:
Absolutely loved it. Was a really cold day, but was soooo refreshing. Was first time for must of our group, but will most definitely be back again. Anna was great, so professional. The box was immaculate and so hot. A real Swedish sauna experience üëèüëè with a brilliant Irish Sea view. || Super friendly staff met us on arrival and stayed nearby the whole time in case of any issues. The sauna was sitting at a great temperature when we arrived. It was very clean and the lemon water for hydration was a very nice touch. We absolutely loved it and we‚Äôve already booked our next session! || Absolutely loved the hotbox sauna! The facilities were spotless and modern. The staff were so friendly and welcoming ‚Äî they really made the experience relaxing from start to finish. Left feeling completely refreshed. Can‚Äôt wait to go back. || Amazing as always!

A group of us have been a few times over the years and we all absolutely love it! Anna & Carl are lovely, the beach is ideal, the sauna is perfect and the sea is fresh and cold. The whole experience is invigorating and rejuvenating and everyone leaves with happy faces || We loved the sauna! We were late for our booking and were generously accommodated. The window in the sauna made the experience quite singular. There is nothing like the feeling after a few ocean dips and some sauna time. We recommend Hotbox Sauna to anyone visiting Benone Beach! ‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è

name: Redcastle Spa
address: Inishowen Peninusla, Redcastle Hotel, Carrickmaquigley, Redcastle, Co. Donegal, F93 Y660, Ireland
reviews_text:
Had a gifted Japanese head massage. Wow. I felt very relaxed and my hair was glowing afterwards and still is. Would 100% recommend Suman my massage therapist who made me feel at ease and check in often with regard to pressure. The whole set up at the redcastle spa is wonderful. Relaxation room was blissful and I enjoyed the refreshments on offer. The sauna, pool and steam room very clean and enjoyable. Wish I could return here more often. Felt very welcomed by the receptionist Katie who explain the process and made me feel at ease! Hope to return soon. Thanks all again! || I can't fault the staff here. Service was good and food fab.  I seriously would not recommend the hotel room. They have removed the fridges from the rooms. You only get a fridge in your room if you book a suite. There is no tv in the rooms.  Well, technically, there are tv's in the room, but you can't watch tv on them. The mattresses in my bedroom and my friends bedroom,  in my opinion, are 6 years past their best. On a positive note, the spa / pool is fab. || I had a Japanese  head massage. It was an amazing experience  felt very relaxed revitalised. Thank you to my massage therapist, Katie.
Thank you also to Katie the receptionist  who made us feel very welcomed and explained everything  we needed to know. || Had a great time at the pool yesterday. Lots of fun in the jets. There was a small problem with my locker key and the spa receptionist Katie dealt with it very helpfully and professionally. ||

name: Lough Eske Castle
address: Lough Eske Castle Hotel, Lough Eske, Lougheask Demesne, Co. Donegal, F94 HX59, Ireland
summary: Elegant hotel in a restored 17th-century castle with a spa, an indoor pool and fine dining.
reviews_text:
On first arrival, we were delighted with the castle exterior and the friendly concierge who parked our car and took care of the bags.
Most staff were genuinely warm and friendly, especially in the Gallery bar.
Our dining experience in the hotel restaurant (apart from very good breakfasts) was very disappointing. The dining room is large, soulless, and functional. The food was tasty -although for 2 small pieces of seabass and some side vegetables - vastly overpriced. My partner's rack of lamb at 48 euro was tasty but portion size was small.
Our bedroom was large and very comfortable and warm. The only downside was the fact that the toilet door was missing and bathwater luke warm!
Checkout was very pleasant but the bill was incorrect. 97 euro had been overcharged to us, but refunded as soon as we discovered the error. However a friend of ours had visited and treated us to 2 wine, and a small beer (paid in cash at the time), which had also been added to our bill. It wasnt  refunded as we couldn't provide proof of payment.
We had really looked forward to a full 5 star experience but felt - at best - it is 4 star || Expectation vs Reality:
Upon arrival to the hotel everything was lovely. The staff were very friendly and welcoming. We made our way to the room which was lovely and spacious and appeared very comfortable. We had lunch and dinner in the bar. It was very nice. When it came to sleeping, the bed had some strange dips in the mattress that were rather large and uncomfortable, but in the grand scheme of things was not nearly as uncomfortable as the levels of dust from the canopy, which I was violently made  aware of after sleeping in the room one night. I woke up struggling to breathe, my throat was sore, my eyes were watery, and my nose was congested. This was due to the copious amounts of dust that lay on the canopy above our bed. The allergic reaction caused by the dust meant a trip to the pharmacy (not once but twice). I could not wait to be out of the room! The room itself appeared very clean. However, the decorative piece above the bed was ultimately holding a lot of dust and was not clean. Quite an awkward thing to clean in all honesty. We frequented the outside for breaks from the room. The antihistamines did not combat the dust, nor did the vapour showers relieve the symptoms caused by the room. Ultimately we contacted front desk about changing the room. We swapped rooms, but still i had inhaled so much dust that it did not help. Sleeping was a nightmare. It felt as if I could not breathe clearly, although much much better than the previous room it did not totally alleviate anything. I spent the night counting down the hours to checkout. We spoke to a very nice lady at the desk she was very apologetic and nice she took the lunch bill off the room and gave us a little box of chocolates. Lough eske seems to pride itself on comfortability, but truthfully I was the most uncomfortable I‚Äôve ever been in a 5 star hotel. I was hoping for a relaxing time but now I am suffering the after affects of a dusty canopy. It‚Äôs an incredible shame, because everything else was easily highly rated. For example the food was gorgeous which is why we didn‚Äôt feel the need to spend our money elsewhere. Unfortunately I won‚Äôt return to this establishment based on this experience, nor shall I recommend it to people. It was quite the expensive disappointing experience. || Lough Eske Castle is a hotel that we will return to time and time again. The service alone makes it feel worth every penny - you're welcomed at the entrance, brought inside and then guided to your room without having to lift a finger to carry your own bags. The staff in both restaurants are lovely, reception staff are always warm and helpful and the cleaning staff greet you along the corridor. Gerard at the front door is particularly friendly!

We've been fortunate enough to be upgraded on a number of occasions, but even the standard courtyard room is cosy and luxurious. Food is fab, cocktails are well-made and the fires being lit in the various seating areas just adds to the overall cosy vibe throughout the hotel. Lovely walks around the lake too and there's always umbrellas to hand if the weather doesn't cooperate. We've been to several 5 star hotels in Ireland and this is the one that we keep coming back to, to the extent that it's becoming a yearly tradition. || Truly 5 star. From the doormen to the bar staff everyone is looking to be of service. Rooms are huge. The spa is lovely. We got the hot tub experience which was super on a winter evening.  Books and pints by the fire in the Red Room.  Not packed in January. Beautiful grounds. Exceeded expectations || Wow, this is a special place! The grounds and castle are stunning in every regard. The room was gigantic and all of the staff were delightful and very welcoming. We went on the half hour horse and cart with Theresa the horse, and highly recommend doing so. It‚Äôs incredibly scenic and calming, traversing through the beautiful forest listening to hoofs clip-clopping. Dinner at the restaurant and breakfast the next morning were both excellent, and cocktails at the bar were scrumptious - get the bramble! There is a spa on site as well, and option to book outdoor jacuzzi‚Äôs in the gardens. We were very sad to leave such a magical place.

name: Finn Valley Centre
address: FINN VALLEY CAMPUS, Millbrae, Stranorlar, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews_text:
Great leisure facilities. Very clean and spacious. Great value for ‚Ç¨6.50 swim inc. Sauna, Steam & Jacuzzi.

The jacuzzi wasn't working when I visited (26Jun24). Water was hot which was still nice but wasn't making bubbles as the button was broken.
Note: You need ‚Ç¨1 coin for the lockers. || We had Sunday lunch in the Finn Valley centre and it was excellent the food was excellent, the service was second to none and the staff could not do enough for us. We will certainly be returning. || A great leisure centre with plenty of facilities and very friendly staff. It is always well presented and clean and if you go at the right time of day, not too busy. Prices are reasonable but the membership makes it even more cost effective. Great for kids birthday parties, too. || Was at a 21st birthday party in the centre on Saturday night, the food was excellent. Great venue for a party. The only downside was the lift it didn't work properly for my mother who can't do stairs. But it's still a great venue. || Just an all round amazing restaurant. The food is just gorgeous and taste Fantastic. staff are just the best so friendly. There is a kids zone and it keeps them occupied during the food. My son has autism and everyone is so understanding and patient. I highly recommend it.

name: Barnesmore Wellness
address: Cullionboy, Barnesmore, Co. Donegal, F94 H92D, Ireland
reviews_text:
I recently had a facial treatment at Barnesmore Wellness, and it was such a lovely experience. The setting is surrounded by nature and has certainly has  a sense of peace. Catherine has such a calming presence,  that instantly puts you at ease. What makes it even more special is that she uses her own handmade skincare products, which feel luxurious and natural on the skin. My face felt refreshed, nourished, and glowing afterwards. Such a relaxing and rejuvenating experience. I highly recommend || I had wonderful experience in beautiful Barnesmore Gap Wellness. Catherine is a therapist with a golden hands. She creates such a nurturing and deeply healing space. She is so skilled professional and her techniques, knowledge, calming voice and relaxing music, coupled with a beautiful and peaceful environment of Barnesmore Gap, scented with a delightful blends of aroma during the treatment has made my visit an absolute pleasure.
Thank you Catherine for such a wonderful experience of fascial and back massage. I am already looking forward to my next visit. || Barnesmore Gap Wellness is fantastic, easy to find and so relaxing. Catherine is such a kindhearted, calming person and is so knowledgeable. I was genuinely devastated when the massage ended because it was so good. Would recommend to anyone to book in! || Absolutely recommend Catherine had a beautiful facial and back massage recently it was like a little piece of heaven in her beautiful calm surroundings and where she is situated in the countryside brings even more tranquility for the treatment, can not wait to get back . Thank you Catherine || Catherine is so talented at what she does and how could you not relax in such a beautiful setting. I cant recommend enough

name: The Sauna Shack
address: 162 Glenpark Rd, Omagh BT79 7SU, UK
reviews_text: Amazing place. Fantastic sauna and cold plunge facilities. So tranquil and in beautiful forest settings. I have been going with my partner for about a year and it‚Äôs just been made even better by a new hot tub next to the river. Really kind owner. 10/10 || Fantastic sauna in tranquil location. Perfect after mountain biking across the road in the forest park. Super hot followed by cold dip in the plunge pool or river flowing by. Handy changing are close by. Highly recommend! || Attended with a group booking. The setting was idyllic. The sauna was rocking hot and to be able to hop into the cold plunge in between was exhilarating. We even had a dip in the stream. Fynn even provided us with a nice cup of tea to finish us off for the night. || Lovely wee spot in a picturesque location. One of the best designed saunas I‚Äôve ever been in. There‚Äôs a river, cold plunge and overhead bucket for cooling down between sweats || I went with my 2 daughters for yoga stretching and sauna. We had a great time. The site is beautiful with the stream running through, it was all so relaxing. I would definitely recommend it.

name: Pyramid Holistic Training Centre & Spa
address: Dernacally House Dernacally, Dernacally, Carrigans, Co. Donegal, F93 AO97, Ireland
reviews_text:
When we arrived at Pyramid Holistic Training Centre and Spa the first thing we noticed was how beautiful the surroundings were, it was so peaceful and the perfect place to relax.
We started the morning with some yoga in the upstairs space, it had lovely views and was so cosy.
We then had tea before making our way to the spa, were I used the infrared sauna before taking the plunge into the huge jacuzzi, it was so warm and relaxing.
We finished with a steam sauna then a quick shower which was so refreshing.
The owner Antiontte is absolutely amazing and couldn't do enough for us, she was so warm and friendly and really cares that her guests have a great time.
Pyramid Holistic Training Centre and Spa has everything you need for a healthy and relaxing break, beautiful scenery, large jacuzzi and steam room as well as an infrared sauna.
We'll definitely be back! || I had sent an email of enquiry to Pyramid Holistic Centre about doing the diploma in massage as it was something I was thinking of doing.  Luckily for me the course was starting soon and was also pretty close by.

From the first contact Antoinette has been helpful and explained everything in detail.  Clear instruction was given on what was required for the course. Both tutors, Sarah and Karen, are very knowledgable. || Fabulous course and wonderful patient and knowledgeable teachers .Karen and Chantel Thank you for everything.You both made classes interesting and amazing! A wonderful bunch of classmates who made it also an amazing experience. Antoinette thank you too for your advice ,patience and ongoing support.I have thoroughly enjoyed learning Reflexology and can't wait to start out on my own. Loved the centre, such a beautiful setting and it was so relaxing.I would highly recommend Pyramid Holistic centre for the high standards and support in such a wonderful course. THANK YOU!! M.Finn. || I loved every minute of my time at Pyramid Holistic Centre, my tutors were fantastic, always guiding & supporting me every step of the way & always there to help when I needed them! I was nervous starting off but with their knowledge & expertise I am now about to become the therapist I have always wanted to. I met some amazing people along the way & it was such a wonderful experience from start to finish. || I‚Äôve just completed by reflexology training with Pyramid Holistic Training Centre and it has been such a positive experience. The tutors Chantel and Karen, as well as our coordinator Antoinette, were wonderful. Chantel passed on the passion she has for reflexology right from the start and I enjoyed our Sunday training sessions so much‚Ä¶honestly, they have been life changing for me. She also provided me with so much encouragement as there were times I was giving up. Karen is also very knowledgeable and made the Anatomy and Physiology Training as interesting as could be, breaking it down into parts that made it a lot easier to study. Antoinette also provided encouragement and praise when it was needed, as well as at times being tough, in order to bring us to the required standards.

I‚Äôve also made some amazing friends along the way, which is a fantastic bonus :)

There were a few administrative / communication frustrations throughout the course; however, my overall experience was so positive that I still feel it deserves 5 stars.

I am now a fully qualified reflexology therapist and I can‚Äôt wait to get my own business up and running. Thanks to all the wonderful people who helped me get this far!

name: The Looking Glass Spa Therapy & Self Catering Accommodation

reviews_text:
A total gem of a location and an unbelievable treatment. From the first welcome to the farewell, your tranquility, dignity and experience is top priority. An extra special touch is a relaxing tea on arrival and a ten minute infrared sauna to prepare your body for the treatment. I‚Äôll be better organised on my next trip and book in more treatments. Thank you Aoife. || August 2024
It was so good to be back. Thank you Aoife for sharing your skills and making Gracie and I feel so well looked after. We enjoyed our treatments (full body and back massages and moisturising facial) immensely. With Aoife you're in great hands and combined with her warm Donegal personality, it's an experience like no other. Highly recommend. See you in 2025.

22 August 2019 Enter the Looking Glass for a magical experience. No visit to Rathmullan would be complete without a visit to the wonderful Aoife and one of her rejuvenating facials or massages. She is a consummate professional with a very down to earth and personal touch. A real holiday treat not to be missed. We'll be back for more of the same. || Aoife was so warm, welcoming, and professional. I had a full body massage and by the end, I was melting into the table. I hope to return whenever I'm back in the area. || Yet another exceptional treatment at the Looking Glass, thanks to Aoife's dedication, care and professionalism. Truly in a league of her own.

DEFINATELY  worth a visit. || Best beauty treatments I have ever enjoyed. Aoife is a fabulous therapist. I give her my highest recommendation.

name: Thermal Garden
address: Bay Rd, Londonderry BT48 7SE, UK
reviews_text:
Outstanding sauna, ice bath, and jacuzzi experience in Derry. The sauna was powerful and perfectly heated, the ice-cold plunge was intense and refreshing, and the jacuzzi was the ideal way to relax and recover between sessions. The hot-and-cold contrast therapy setup here is excellent.
The entire space is clean, peaceful, and thoughtfully designed, with a premium wellness atmosphere. Everything is well maintained and professionally run, which really shows in the overall experience.
If you‚Äôre looking for a sauna in Derry, an ice bath, jacuzzi, or a complete wellness and recovery experience in Northern Ireland, this place is a top choice. Highly recommended‚ÄîI‚Äôll definitely be back. || Had a great time at thermal garden! Sauna hot showers cold showers plunge pools fire-pit area plus a hot tub all included!
Best sauna in Derry, such a lovely atmosphere and the owner is a really nice welcoming guy, had such good conversations with the locals. We felt very rejuvenated after. Definitely come if you‚Äôre looking for a pick me up and a nice cosy evening. || Excellent sauna and ice bath experience in Derry. The sauna was hot, relaxing, and extremely well maintained, and the ice-cold plunge pool was intense and invigorating. The contrast therapy setup at Thermal Garden is ideal for recovery, stress relief, and overall wellness.
The space is clean, calm, and thoughtfully designed, creating a premium outdoor sauna atmosphere. Everything runs smoothly and feels professionally managed.
If you‚Äôre searching for a sauna in derry, cold plunge therapy, or a high-quality wellness experience when staying near Malin, this is one of the best places to go. Highly recommended‚ÄîI‚Äôll definitely be back. || Such a lovely spot! The whole experience is class and the owner couldn't be nicer. Great addition to Derry and can't wait to come back soon! || Amazing spot, lovely saunas and great atmosphere, cured my hangover.

name: Magherabeg Leisure Centre
address: Magherabeg, Downings, Co. Donegal, Ireland
reviews_text: First time here. Gym wouldn‚Äôt be the most equipped but you‚Äôll get by. Pool, sauna, steam room and jacuzzi is excellent. Nice  and clean. Good changing rooms and showers. || been coming for years and it‚Äôs always been brill but came today with a newborn and it‚Äôs really gone down hill. the changing room floors were actually disgusting, the floor on the shower was literally yellow my toes were curling felt like i needed a shower after it. was a weird smell as well. the pool was foggy and the tiles looked like they hadn‚Äôt been cleaned since the cease fire not even joking the tiles were brown. we left the pool after 20 minutes because we didn‚Äôt trust it with a newborn. you have to wear shower caps in the pool for hygiene but the pool was rotten? we put a towel on the floor in the changing room to avoid standing on the floor and the towel came up black after it. just to reiterate my dirty feet were curling i was so turned.  pool was cold as well || We had a nice time, the changing rooms and facilities were nice.
