And A great gym which Has everything you need There is a steam room a sauna.And a Jacuzzi The staff are very pleasant. I would recommend This place to anybody

name: Hot tub sauna Ireland
address: Rose Cottage, Dunfanaghy, Co. Donegal, Ireland

name: The Outcast Sauna
address: 55A Prussia St, Grangegorman, Dublin 7, D07 HXW6, Ireland
reviews_text:
Loved this sauna experience! such a cool, laid-back vibe and super relaxing. Everything was really well done and the sauna felt amazing. Left feeling refreshed and chilled out. Highly recommend and will definitely be back! || amazing experience!! incredibly relaxing environment and super clean facilities as well. great decor too!

first time at a sauna and already ready to come back! || Beautiful sauna experience here! Always clean and friendly people working there. Location is amazing and lovely food court and pub just outside too || I had high expectations based on all the glowing reviews but unfortunately, my experience didn‚Äôt quite match the hype. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, the female staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming, creating a great first impression and making you want to return. However, whoever is managing the overall operations needs to reassess the maximum capacity.

With nine people crammed into a hot sauna, it felt overcrowded and uncomfortable. Reducing the limit to seven would make a significant difference. The decor and rustic nature-inspired ambiance were well done, but the experience was dampened by the noise level. In the pod we chose, a group was talking loudly, laughing, and shouting which wasn‚Äôt the relaxing atmosphere I had hoped for, especially for my first sauna experience (in Ireland).

To make matters worse, when two people left for the plunge baths, seating naturally shifted due to the tight space. When they returned, one of them expected his original spot to still be available and tried to squeeze in, making another guest visibly uncomfortable to the point that she got up and left. His reaction was ‚ÄòI didn‚Äôt do anything‚Äô. üö©üö©üö©üö© This situation only highlighted the issue with the overcrowding in these pods.

My partner enjoyed it more once the crowd thinned out after this incident - but for me, it was enough to put me off returning. I did notice they offer Silent Nights and Ladies‚Äô Nights, and I imagine a Silent Night would be a much better option for those seeking a peaceful experience. A safety factor that could be considered in the future are safety toggles, wrapped around the wrist when pressed it alerts the staff to check the pod out. ‚ö†Ô∏è something to ponder on of course. || Always a great experience here. Sauna is nice and hot, plunge is nice and cold. Friendly helpful staff. The barrel sauna has a high enough ceiling that the heat is pleasant. Stop for a coffee and a treat in Pan Eile in the courtyard when you are done. Rafa will look after you.

name: Helios Sauna
address: 4 Main St, Dundrum, Dublin 14, D14 V977, Ireland
reviews_text:
Perfect place to relax,like a haven, hot tub perfect!! And tried iced bath for the first time in long time feels refreshing and great! And good quality coffee.
One suggestion,time went too fast,maybe time could be extended to 1h :) || Really nice setup, two large saunas, multiple cold plunge barrels, a cold plunge pool at 3 degrees, and a hot tub. Coffee dock with some nice pastries too, and a really relaxed atmosphere - i really enjoyed this place - 100% recommend üëå || Lovely sauna / plunge / hot tub experience. All the staff were so helpful, was my first time there so was really nice of them to take the time to show us around. Will definitely be back again || Stopped by for some coffee and treats. Did not try the sauna. Service was excellent and coffee was delicious. The croissant was a ok, probably would try something different next time. Lovely location in a nice day! || 31st Finnish sauna review. These saunas are both great. Temperature was a minimum of 90c entire time, ranging up to 110c. Wood fired was 110c down to 90c, electric was a flat 105c. Humidity was 10% in both.

IMO the ash pan in the wood fired stove was kept open way too long and a bunch of the heat was being lost as the timber was being burnt through too often, leading to inconsistency.

Feedback to help with the culture; tell people when they attend to go in/out quickly and don‚Äôt keep the door open. Too many people didn‚Äôt seem to know about the importance of the door lot of good heat was lost.

The bucket and ladle in the electric sauna could/should be upgraded from plastic to wooden - hot plastics are bad.

The bench height in the electric sauna was perfect, law of l√∂yly maintained. Also the first time seeing the rounded rocks in person. They do give off a smoother l√∂yly, which is lovely. That combination has that experience being one of the most perfect saunas I‚Äôve visited. With the rocks hot as they were the l√§mp√∂massa was on point, unlike others. This was a sauna I didn‚Äôt want to leave. The wood fired sauna‚Äôs temperature was variable based on how the fire was being fed, combined with the ash pan being open and it was a bit more hit and miss. Combined that with sitting a bit lower (law of l√∂yly not observed) and it didn‚Äôt quite pack the same punch. Still a good experience, but not next level like the electric. The electric was the star of the show! Both heaters were Harvia heaters so quality.

The cold plunges were spot on, the coldest bath felt close to 0c and there was around 4-5 other baths with different temperatures.

Would love a warm shower to heat up afterwards before heading out, but that doesn‚Äôt take away from the experience. Will be back when next in Dublin. Thank you!

name: The Hot Box Sauna Inchicore
address: Goldenbridge Industrial Estate, Tyrconnell Rd, Inchicore, Dublin, D08 EWK2, Ireland
reviews_text:
Wow, what a fantastic experience, just a hop, skip, and a jump from Black Horse LUAS! Parking can be a bit of a challenge, so it‚Äôs best to hop on the 13 from the city, Clondalkin, or the LUAS.

The ‚Ç¨19 for an hour is totally worth it! It‚Äôs a super enjoyable experience, especially with the saunas being regularly topped up with wood. The other patrons there are also lovely and enjoying the facilities. If you‚Äôre feeling adventurous, the coldest plunge is definitely your only question! || First time visiting here the other day and I will definitely be back! The space is big enough to cater to quite a large group of people without it feeling over crowded. The saunas and women‚Äôs changing areas were really clean and well kept, and they have a dryer for your bathing suit which is so handy!! One of the saunas also had a eucalyptus scent which was gorgeous. || It was my our second time to be here and it gets better and better. It was a fine sunny weather, but it made the experience better. We were able to maximize all the saunas, nice temperature. Clean facilities, nice staff, very cozy environment. Will definitely be back. || Absolutely 5 stars for Hot Box Inchicore! I've been to a lot of saunas, but this one is hands down the best. The variety of sauna styles is incredible ‚Äî there's even a silent sauna which I loved for total relaxation. The three different plunge pools are amazing: one icy cold, one mild, and one that feels like a hot tub ‚Äì perfect for whatever vibe you‚Äôre after. The place is spotless, so well maintained, and the staff are genuinely some of the friendliest I‚Äôve met. You can really tell they care. Highly recommend for anyone looking to unwind, reset, and feel amazing after! || Fantastic location with 5 different saunas and a walk-in plunge pool. The saunas are a mix of wood fire and electric and there‚Äôs a silent sauna for some peace and quiet. Facilities are were very clean and the staff are really friendly. Would highly recommend! Will definitely be back

name: Saunos Ballsbridge
address: Ailesbury Grove, Ballsbridge, Dublin, D04 HF60, Ireland
reviews_text:
We had a wonderful experience with Saunos! The sauna was clean, well-maintained, and had a very relaxing atmosphere. The temperature was just right, and the interior design created a cozy and peaceful vibe. The staff was friendly and helpful, making sure everything was perfect during our visit. I left feeling refreshed and recharged. Highly recommend Saunos to anyone looking for an outdoor sauna experience! || This sauna is great! Super easy to get to and the atmosphere is peaceful and inviting, with a warm, cozy, wood-fired aesthetic.

The team is genuinely kind and attentive and it's very clean. The sauna is super hot and feels amazing, and the ice baths are sharp, refreshing, and incredibly revitalizing. Can't wait to come back! || Great Sauna in Dublin and lovely welcome from the owner. If you are looking for resourceful and healthy activities to do the weekend. That‚Äôs the things to do after your working week :) Quality and social spa. || I've visited twice. The facilities are cozy, and the sauna maintains a comfortable temperature of 90‚Äì100¬∞C. However, the plunge pool area is limited, only three baths, which isn't sufficient when there are 6 to 8 people. The 45-minute session feels too short for plunging, as you often have to wait your turn. Also, there are no essential oils in the water buckets, which is a missed opportunity, especially since most saunas in Ireland overlook this detail. || Fabulous sauna. Excellent temperature at 100 degrees, tubs are nice and cold. Good location and lots of parking. Completely perfect

name: The Barrel Sauna Dundrum
address: Rear of Uncle Tom's Cabin, Dundrum Rd, Dundrum, Dublin, D14 W895, Ireland
reviews_text:
5 stars! From the moment you step into the Barrel Sauna in Dundrum, you're greeted with the calming scent of incense and beautiful zen artwork that sets the tone. The seating areas are super comfy and perfect for relaxing before or after your session. The saunas themselves are stunning, and the cold barrels‚Äîwhile intense‚Äîare totally bearable and so worth it. Just remember to breathe! All in all, a truly special and peaceful space. Highly recommend for anyone needing a reset. || We go here about once a month for a early sauna. The place is always spotless and well laid out, with a properly hot wood-fired sauna and plenty of cold-plunge pools to choose from. Everything felt spacious, from the main areas to the large relaxation spaces. The changing rooms are clean, and there are lockers available -  just remember to bring your own lock.

The staff are always friendly and welcoming. There are lots of chill-out areas to unwind between sauna sessions.

Parking was easy, and the overall value for what you get is excellent. Really worth a visit. || Simply the best sauna - the entire vibe here is relaxed and very well run. Changing facilities are excellent and there‚Äôs loads of space to unwind after || Great experience. The area is spacious and sheltered and the Staff are very welcoming. Price is decent. Plenty of options for cold plunges ranging in temperatures and lovely artwork in that area. Lockers are provided for belongings with your own padlock and car parkings available right outside. || Top class sauna and plunge pool experience!
Really great facilities and exceeded expectations.
Will definitely be back!

name: The Wood Fired Sauna
address: North Beach Tourist Caravan & Motor Home Park, Rush, Co. Dublin, K56 HN63, Ireland
reviews_text:
Beautiful sauna , baths , cold plunge - amazing access to beach (we picked a time when the tide was in, so it was brilliant being able to dip into the sea mid sauna session).
Big down side was no changing areas, no sheltered area at all, and one portaloo. It wasnt raining heavily when we were finished up and trying to change out of swim gear, changing out in the open in rain is not ideal. Would be nice to have a small bit of privacy when changing in front of lots of strangers, yikes.
Walk from local car park, so access to car is 5 minute walk away.
Will return, but will allow for lack of changing area. || Great view and setting overlooking the ocean! The wood fired sauna is lovely and big. I didn't try the plunge barrel but the two ice baths are lovely and clean. Great spot for groups or individuals. || Highly recommend visiting the Wood Fired Sauna in Rush.

Each session is 45 minutes which gives you enough time for 3 sauna/plunge cycles. There are 2 ice baths, a barrel plunge, and a private path to the Rush North Beach for when the tide is in.

Fresh running water available and changing rooms are nearby. || Highly recommend this place, fabulous experience, totally invigorating and relaxing at the same time! Always have the best night's sleep after a visit to the Wood Fired Sauna. || Brilliant sauna located in an amazing spot just off Rush North Beach. The sauna is always pipping hot and the staff are lovely. Amazing way to spend a fun and active weekend or just to relax after work on a weekday afternoon. The freezing cold ice baths offer well needed recovery whilst the sauna offers a spot to meet new people and sweat it out!

name: Fad Saoil Saunas Dublin
address: Fad Saoil Saunas, Ardee Rd, Rathmines, Dublin 6, D06 FK18, Ireland
reviews_text:
Fantastic experience at Fad Soil Saunas!
Matthew, the lad working there, was absolutely lovely super friendly and really helpful throughout. The dressing rooms were private and well-kept and the saunas themselves were modern and comfortable. Loved the setup with the three plunge pools at 4¬∞C, 6¬∞C, and 8¬∞C perfect for a proper cold exposure session!

A couple of tips: bring a towel to sit on in the sauna and there‚Äôs free parking on-site which is a big plus. Highly recommend for anyone looking to unwind and recharge. || 2nd sauna to review in Dublin!

Welcome to Fad Saoil, the sauna home of BMO running club! I was introduced to the sauna because I signed up for the run club‚Äôs long run series (and recovery thereafter) in preparation for the Dublin Marathon 2025.

So overall, Fad Saoil is pretty decent for a sauna place. They have 2 hot boxes (1 normal and 1 for silent sauna), 3 cold plunge tub with 3 different temperatures, shower area, changing rooms and a toilet. Fad Saoil can accommodate 16 pax per time slot.

I would say that it is a good value for money both for sauna members and non-members and they have packages for frequent visitors.

Staffs are so nice and accommodating but I won‚Äôt suggest to do walk-ins though as Fad Saoil gets busy too. Make sure you book online before visiting. üòÇ

Definitely visiting again!üôÇ || Hands down the best sauna experience I‚Äôve had in Dublin, I was introduced to the place by the BMO running club and have since became a regular both for recovery after runs and just to relax.

The staff is amazing and the vibe is so friendly and welcoming that it feels like someone‚Äôs living room. The location is ideal as well when it‚Äôs easy to get to (and also accessible to go for a run before your session).

I‚Äôm from Finland and grew up going to the sauna several times a week. Since moving to Dublin almost four years ago the thing I miss most has been a proper sauna - with the proper heat, cold plunge and atmosphere to go with it. So glad I finally found this place! || Small, but good setup & clean. 2 saunas on site & 3 cold plunges. This was my first time going there & it didn‚Äôt disappoint. There are numerous changing booths but no lockers for your belongings, only shelves to store them on. Would be great to see them get some lockers there for safe storage down the line. Picked up a sauna hat from them for 15 quid on the way out which I will be using on my next visit! || Cute little "grotto" tucked in the hustling and bustling of Rathmines.

The saunas are fantastic, they heat up very quick, especially the silent sauna, which you can essentially burn your ears off if you so choose to.

the plunge pool or plunge pods or whatever you want to call them are also really nice, although I wouldn't mind having a larger communal plunge so more people could join.

overall this is a great concept and honestly a fantastic setup that you can have great meetups or experiences with your friends and co-workers or whatever!

also if you can bring your own drinks so that's pretty cool.

I would absolutely go here again, and definitely recommend any of their locations.
apparently their greystones location has a scenery to die for, so I will be checking that out due to my great experience here!

thanks again!

name: The Hot Box Sauna Bolands Mills
address: unit 7 building 2, Bolands mills, Barrow St, Dublin, D04 KA9P, Ireland
reviews_text:
When we first came to The Hot Box Sauna Sona, we‚Äôre huge sauna lovers and honestly expected it to be an outdoor sauna. So, out of habit, we brought towels, big robes, everything to keep warm. You can imagine our surprise when we discovered it‚Äôs actually an indoor sauna ‚Äî modern, stylish, and incredibly well designed.

And the cherry on top: every two hours they host different sauna rituals, which makes the experience even more special and immersive. We absolutely loved it. We‚Äôve already been three times in January, brought friends along, even bought a gift voucher for my nephew ‚Äî and we‚Äôre planning to get a membership for ourselves too.

Safe to say, we‚Äôre beyond happy with this place. Highly, highly recommended! || Great central location, pristine state of the art facilities and super friendly staff. I stayed for one of the guided ritual sessions and it was absolutely fantastic, you can tell the guides are really passionate about what they do. Will definitely be back || Wow is all I can say after experiencing the new facility at Bolands Mill. I took part in one of the rituals with a guest expert from New York and it really took the experience to a new level. I slept so well last night. It is a bit more expensive than the other saunas but you get so much more - complimentary herbal teas, cold water, towels and to top it all a hot shower afterwards with amazing shampoo/conditioner and body wash and then Dyson hairdryers . Cannot recommend highly enough. Keep up the good work lads || Had an amazing experience at Hot Box Sauna, Boland Mills. The sauna ritual with Otis was the highlight ‚Äî expertly guided, calming, and incredibly restorative. Otis creates such a welcoming, focused atmosphere and clearly knows his craft.

The facilities are excellent: modern, spotless, and very well maintained, with cleanliness at a really high standard throughout.

Brilliant value for money for the quality of the experience. Highly recommend and will definitely be back üî•üßñ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è || An absolutely brilliant experience. Special mention to Otis and Maria. Maria‚Äôs aufguss ritual was exceptional, honestly worth the visit for that alone. The staff were all incredibly friendly and welcoming, the place is immaculately clean, and the atmosphere is calm and restorative. It felt like a real treat on a cold, rainy winter‚Äôs night. Everything you could possibly want in a sauna. Highly recommended.

name: The Barrel Sauna Tallaght
address: Unit GB1, Sitecast Industrial Estate, Greenhills Rd, Tymon North, Dublin 24, Ireland
reviews_text: Good facilities with two saunas, six cold plunges, cold showers, a cold tap, lockers (broken) and ample changing facilities. However our sauna was only around 75 degrees, and it wasn't that busy. A regular who had the same booking commented that it is usually hotter. It was also slightly messy on the day with logs, wrappers and a saw on display. A nice experience though and I left feeling refreshed - good value at ‚Ç¨15 and it does not feel like they were watching the clock. || Great set up, plenty of Changing rooms, 6 plunge pools, sauna was nice and hot, lots of parking. Everything you need for a nice recharge and refresh! Paul was so accommodating and helpful, would go back again. One of the best Ive been too! Brilliant job by the people at The Barrel Sauna üôèüèª || Tallaght Barrel Sauna is absolutely brilliant, the hottest sauna around paired with the coldest cold plunge. The contrast is unreal and leaves you feeling refreshed and recharged. Love it here every time. || Loved the sauna session in Barrel Sauna Tallaght. Great set up with two huge saunas and the coldest plunge pools I‚Äôve ever been in. Very nice changing space and lockers. I will definitely book back in. || Brilliant experience start to finish. Went up with Stedfast United after our game and was perfect for a post match recovery. Looked after from start to finish. Will definitely be back soon!

name: Sauna Heaven
address: The Village Store, Main St, upper, Newcastle, Co. Dublin, D22 XV50, Ireland
reviews_text: Great experience. Ive been a few times now. Staff are very helpful. || Fantastic experience! Great place and highly recommend. || Lovely experience I will recommend to my friends || Fantastic experience well worth it || What a place! Staff are lovely. Was a great experience. Will definitely be back again.

name: Riverbank Sauna
address: Mill Ln, Palmerston Lower, Dublin 20, D20 DY26, Ireland
reviews_text:
Riverbank Sauna in Palmerstown is a brilliant little escape by the River Liffey, offering a calm, scenic setting that feels miles away from the city. The wood-fired sauna is clean and well run, the atmosphere is relaxed and friendly, and the hot-cold experience is perfect for switching off and unwinding. || Love this place. Was there second night it opened and again the following day. Superb facility, well thought out. Roomy changing areas & hot showers too. Plunge pools are excellent.
You‚Äôd never think you‚Äôre so near the city.
Lovely staff, idyllic venue üëçüèº || Little hidden gem in a beautiful riverside location. Great facilities, a small sauna for about 8 people, two plunge pools, and outdoor showers, with the option to dip directly in the river.

I had the sauna to myself on Saturday afternoon, and the staff were very friendly and welcoming. I‚Äôll definitely be back! || Really enjoyed my first visit here today. Lovely relaxing setting which made for a refreshing cold dip and the sauna is so cozy. Also a bonus that coffee is served on the premises. Will be back soon || Gorgeous location! Brilliant facilities with lockers for storing your valuables, everything was very clean and a lovely cafe on site for coffees and food. Staff were very friendly and welcoming, will definitely be back!

name: The Sauna Society
address: St Marys College RFC, Templeville Rd, Templeogue, Dublin 6W, Co. Dublin, D6W X652, Ireland
reviews_text:
I was there 3times.. first time was perfect. Second time the cooler for  ice tube didnt work and was just  normal cold water in summer. And today water was so smelly not clean at all... and lump of hair floated there. So i wont came back... || The Sauna itself is nice and clean, and the staff are friendly.

There needs to be an over 18s policy to stop loud obnoxious teenagers ruining the experience for others. Its not fair to expect staff and customers to police what should be a relaxing experience. || The Sauna is very clean and friendly staff. Made sure the heat stayed at a good temperature the entire session.
Highly recommend. || Such a great sauna in a really great space. The fire pit and trees make it a lovely, relaxing space. Very clean & well taken care of. Woodfire sauna is always my fav. || Best sauna and plunge pool iv attended. Sauna is kept at the highest temp and water is extremely cold money well spent definitely be returning.

name: Spir Sauna Sandyford
address: 22 Spruce Ave, Sandyford, Dublin, A96 N620, Ireland
reviews_text:
It was our first visit to Spir Sauna in Sandyford, and we had such a positive experience with the ice baths and saunaüßñ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è.

The staff were incredibly helpful, and the whole place was very well kept.

We can‚Äôt wait to go back! || Came to Spir sauna for a recovery day- it has such a nice set up, it‚Äôs very clean, a drinking water station( don‚Äôt forget your water bottle ) . The owner Jamie is so friendly and will answer any questions you have .

You need to go through the gym to get access :) || I recently visited Spir Sauna for the first time, and it was a truly amazing experience! Jamie, the owner, was welcoming and took the time to introduce me to how everything works, which made me feel comfortable and at ease right away. I had never been to a sauna like this before, and I absolutely loved it. The atmosphere was relaxing, the facilities were clean, and the whole experience was so rejuvenating. I‚Äôve already returned a few times since that first visit, and each time has been just as wonderful. Highly recommend Spir Sauna to anyone looking for a top-notch sauna experience! || The Staff‚Ä¶ Quality. The Environment‚Ä¶ Quality. The Sauna its self‚Ä¶ Quality.
Serious Serious Business, I can‚Äôt recommend it enough. The Best Sauna experience you can have. Jamie and the staff are top tier. Simple as that my Guy || I loved the sauna, will definitely go again!!
It would be lovely if there was background music in the sauna and some essential oils on the water to pour on the rocks.

name: The Blaze Sauna
address: Kirkfield Cottages, Clonsilla Rd, Blanchardstown, Dublin, 15, Ireland
reviews_text:
I‚Äôve been going to Blaze Sauna in Clonsilla since the very start ‚Äî nearly five months now ‚Äî and Jaysus, I think I‚Äôm officially addicted.

The cold plunge? It‚Äôs like being slapped in the face by a frozen salmon. You jump in, forget your own name, and come out feeling like you‚Äôve been baptised by the Holy Spirit himself.

Fair play, though ‚Äî it works wonders!
The sauna? Always roasting ‚Äî hotter than a Dublin bus in July, I swear. Sit in there for five minutes and you‚Äôll be sweating out sins you didn‚Äôt even know you had.

Dan, the man himself ‚Äî sound as a pound. Always up for a chat, keeps the place spotless, and makes everyone feel welcome.

You can tell there‚Äôs gr√° (that‚Äôs ‚Äúlove‚Äù in Irish!) in every corner of the place.
Honestly, Blaze is a little slice of wellness heaven right here in Clonsilla. Whether you‚Äôre in for the health benefits or just trying to survive the ice bath without screaming ‚Äî you‚Äôll leave feeling like a new person.
Go raibh m√≠le maith agat, Dan ‚Äî you legend. üî•‚ùÑÔ∏è

Highly recommend. Just bring a towel, a sense of humour, or your courage and maybe a stiff drink for after the cold plunge! || Lovely evening spent at Blaze Sauna. Nice and very clean. Very nice staff also. Great eve overall, will be back || First experience here was absolutely fantastic, the host is really friendly and approachable, the set up is great, really user friendly and tranquil. The sauna itself was perfectly suited for the size of the group. The different temperature tanks were really accessible and kept clean. The cold shower was strong and pressure. Good sized lockers too. I will definitely be booking to visit again. || Great location, easy to get to and fits my sunday 'relax day' plans perfectly!
3 visits later - love that lads keep a higher temperature than the usual 80ü•∂
Met a friendly staff each time I've been there. || Myself and my sister went in this morning and it was our first time trying a sauna and a could plunge and we loved the experience. The set up was really nice, the changing area was nice and simple but all you need, the sauna itself was great and as were the cold plunges and showers. Overall really nice Saturday morning and we‚Äôll definitely be back soon ! Super friendly staff and really happy to have us and to help with anything we needed. Would really recommend !

name: The Sauna Donabate
address: Balcarrick Road, Balcarrick, Donabate, Co. Dublin, K36 V064, Ireland
reviews_text: Absolutely incredible experience! It‚Äôs the perfect place to reset both physically and mentally. Highly recommend to anyone looking for recovery, relaxation or overall wellbeing. Special shout out to Jen who made the overall experience even better! üßòüèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è || Lovely experience out in the sauna, gorgeous place, made very comfortable and special by Jen. Thank you üòä || Came here for an evening sauna to relax and did just that. The place is so chilled and the view is gorgeous. The girl running the place is so friendly, vibes were great. Will be making this the new regular sauna spot || Such a gorgeous day here, host was fab and explained everything exceptionally.. we were lucky to catch the whole sauna to ourselves with the freezing cold ice baths . Separate shower and changing room, even table and chairs to sit down on to sip water if the sauna got a bit much. Will definitely return || Me and my friends had an incredible experience at the sauna and cold bath facility !! The space is beautifully designed, spotless and perfectly positioned with a breathtaking sea view that makes the entire visit feel truly magical. Jen is the most pleasant and helpful lady I ever met. She was welcoming and attentive, ensuring a smooth and relaxing visit from start to finish. We highly recommend the sauna in Donabate, it‚Äôs an absolutely must visit!!!

name: Sl√°inte Saunas
address: Clanna Gael, Sean Moore Road, Sandymount, Dublin, Ireland
reviews_text: Great Sauna Experience in Dublin and you can stay 01h00. The Owner is really welcoming, facilities are great with Ice Bath. Highly recommended to destress there after a long work week. The Sauna is really high quality and lovely time spend. Social people as well ;) || Big sauna, 3 cold plunges  and 3 cold showers. Lovely place to sit in the sun too and good changing facilities || Great place! There is no toilet (need to walk to GAA hall 2 mins away) and the facilities are raw and basic but does the job. It would be great to have at least 1 running shower in the changing area with a toilet. Locks on the lockers wouldn‚Äôt work. || Absolutely 5 stars across the board. This place is a heaven. An aesthetic atmosphere, with a super hot sauna. I also think it‚Äôs special that they offer 1hr sessions, you really feel the benefits with that kind of time. There‚Äôs fires around the lot which make it a great hangout outside of the sauna. The playlist is always so good. But, most of all, the staff is incredibly kind. || Fantastic sauna, retains heat and stays hot throughout the session without the need to constantly add water. Cold plunge was one of the coldest I‚Äôve experienced, they had ice when we first arrived and ice was also added during the session! Plenty of parking too! ü•≥ Great experience, we‚Äôll definitely be back! üòÅ

name: Sallynoggin Saunas & Ice Baths
address: Peterson House, Pearse St, Sallynoggin, Dublin, A96 PX22, Ireland
reviews_text:
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
Absolutely amazing experience! The sauna and ice bath session was exactly what I needed ‚Äî relaxing, energizing, and incredibly refreshing. The contrast between the heat and the cold was perfect and left me feeling both calm and recharged. The space is clean, well designed, and has such a great vibe. The staff were friendly, welcoming, and made the whole experience even better.

I walked out feeling lighter, clearer in my head, and with my body totally renewed. I honestly loved every minute of it and can‚Äôt wait to come back. Highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a unique and revitalizing wellness experience! || I would love to give this place a 5 star but I cant.
It really is a little oasis and they have set it up wonderfully, and it looks great in every aspect BUT they need to work on the temperatures of their sauna's. The two wood fired saunas were over 120 degrees when i went in, and you could barely breathe. So then I tried the electric ones, and one was only 40 degrees, and the other was a perfect 80 degrees but when I tried to sit down the wood was so hot it burnt me. I dont know why, I think they may have used the wrong wood in this sauna? Because ive never experienced that before, and ive been to a lot of saunas. I even tried with my towel, but wherever I touched the wood it was like seriously burning so I couldn't relax. I told the staff but they didnt seem to care, and just offered me a towel. Which made me wonder why I'd been using my towel and hadn't been offered one from the start if they had towels for customers.
I ended up going back to the wood fired one, leaving the door open till the temperature came back down below 100 and this was quite nice, but overall not the relaxing experience you want from a sauna.
The place looks fantastic and the ice baths are an awesome touch, and by all accounts the place should have been packed, yet there were maybe 2 other people here, which begs the question why?
Also in the whole hour or longer I was in the sauna (which started out at over 120 degrees) the staff did not check or do a single round to see if people were ok? There were two of them just sitting there chatting and I think maybe their time would have been spent better checking on the saunas and ensuring the temperatures were kept within a certain range.
The idea is great, the place itself is great and you've almost got an amazing experience, but temperature is so important in a sauna, and you need to work on yours a bit. If you fix that, you'll have a wonderful place ‚ú®Ô∏è
Also do not like the plastic water bottles. If you're going to operate a sauna a water bottle refill station is a non negotiable! || So pleased to have this gem of a spot so local to us. Impressive set-up of an array of wood-fired and electric sauna options, different temp. cold plunges and crucially proper shower facilities for after. 10/10. Love visiting Sallynoggin Saunas! || The experience is incredible. If you‚Äôre thinking about coming, just come it‚Äôs absolutely worth it. Everything was very well explained by our Brazilian friend Ivan. Top-level customer service. || Really fantastic sauna,And Ivan looking after the place is a real Gent.

name: Urban Sauna Co

reviews_text:
Great facility! The sauna was very clean and well-maintained. It was a comfortable and enjoyable escape . Absolutely loved it! My muscles felt so loose and I walked out feeling revitalized. What truly sets this place apart is the staff and how easy it is to book. They were incredibly friendly, welcoming, and attentive throughout my visit, making the whole experience even more enjoyable.

name: Sauna Snug at Flynn Park
address: Courtlough, Balbriggan, Co. Dublin, K32 N884, Ireland
reviews_text:
Beautiful spot for a sauna, first visit I used the sauna on the right which was extremely hot like it should be, the door handle was broken which was difficult to get in when wet.

Next visit I used the sauna on the left which doesn‚Äôt seem to be as hot or else there wasn‚Äôt as much wood on the stove.

The lake is very refreshing for a dip.

Review edit July2025: the experience you get really depends on who is working, I went last week at 7pm and when I got in the fire was out and I had to ask the person working to relight it. 20 minutes of the 1 hour session spent heating the sauna up from scratch. Probably won‚Äôt use it as much as it is unreliable compared to other local saunas where the fires are tended to frequently. || I loved my time down at the Sauna Snug. Firstly it was so peaceful and has a beautiful view of the lake. Secondly the Sauna was at a really warm temperature üå°Ô∏è not too hot but not to tepid. Then to be able to take a nice short walk down to the lake and jump in, and it was freezing ü•∂, like crazy cold which obviously feels amazing.
There just something about the Sauna Snug that works I'm sure when you go down and try it you'll know what I mean.
I've been to other Sauna places where you can feel how wellness and saunas are being used in Ireland to replace traditional social settings, you can feel how they're set up to make money, and you feel rushed. Even though I came to relax but at the Sauna Snug the blue sky's, birds flying over the lake, the trees, and the peace and quiet was fantastic üòä || I love the saunas here they are clean spacious and have the best views of the countryside especially great at sunset. The lake is clear, beautiful and fresh for a dip to cool off its a great way to unwind and clear your head. I highly recommend the Sauna Snug I go regularly now and look forward to it every time. || I‚Äôve loved the place. I tried different ones during this past months, and I just felt this one is amazingüòç || Really lovely experience at this sauna. It's a beautiful setting and dipping in the lake is a real treat. Changing facilities are excellent. Will be back here regularly.

name: Saunos Sandycove
address: 49 Sandycove Road, D√∫n Laoghaire, Dublin, A96 A2H2, Ireland
reviews_text:
Absolutely loved visiting Saunos!  The location is super convenient, and the staff couldn‚Äôt be friendlier. They even have an adorable dog most days to welcome customers.

The ice baths are freezing and really clean and the sauna is brand new and really spacious. It‚Äôs nice they play music in the sauna too as a change from the usual quiet. Would definitely recommend.

name: The Sauna Village
address: FQ3J+HX, Barrysparks, Swords, Co. Dublin, Ireland
reviews_text:
Had an absolute amazing experience at The Sauna Village today. The facilities are exceptional, great selection of saunas, all cold plunge pools are perfect to cool down and reset. Staff were so friendly and helpful. And in the heart of swords, what more could you want! Can‚Äôt wait to visit againüëçüèº || Absolutely amazing. My new regular favourite spot. I buy the incredible 12 bundle deal the guys have !
The sauna village is an incredible experience from start to finish. Each sauna has its own unique character, and the entire village is thoughtfully designed to create a peaceful, relaxing atmosphere. Everything feels clean, well-maintained, and intentionally laid out so you can truly unwind and take your time moving from one space to another. Each sauna has it's own unique vibe ..
The attention to detail really stands out‚Äîfrom the warmth and quality of the saunas to the calm, welcoming vibe throughout the village. It‚Äôs the perfect place to disconnect, slow down, and fully relax. The staff guys are super friendly , bang on, always floating around throwing logs into the fires of each sauna.
Cold plunges... cold showers, hot tub all fab! The women's changing room is soo cosy, really warm lovely fairy lights, and creams.
Whether you‚Äôre a regular sauna-goer or trying it for the first time, this place offers something special. I left feeling refreshed, relaxed, and already looking forward to my next visit. || I had a lovely experience at Sauna Village Swords. The staff were welcoming and gave me great guidance as a first timer. Everything felt calm and unrushed. I liked that there are multiple saunas and the cold plunge was spotless. It has clean comfy changing areas, and a really relaxed vibe. I came away feeling great and properly looked after. Big thanks to the team who were especially kind, as a first timer I was a little nervous going in. I‚Äôll definitely be back and would recommend to anyone. Also, free parking was a bonus! || Fantastic Sauna near Pavillion Swords. They have variety sauna's (traditional and electric). With cold plunge pool, shower and changing room. I can go with many rounds of sauna & plunge however i like. The staff are friendly. Parking is free. Near restaurant incase you feel hungry after. Walking distance to bus stop. Prices are much the same with other sauna's. Open daily on your preferred time. Highly recommend. || Check out The Sauna Village at Swords Pavilions. Lots of space and 5 üí´ cleanliness top notch. Extra cold plunge pool & an awesome jacuzzi! Nicole & the guys were very helpful! Will be back soon

name: Eden One
address: Number One Ballsbridge, Shelbourne Rd, Dublin, D04 Y3X9, Ireland
reviews_text:
I had such a nice experience on my first time in Eden One. I used a voucher my friends got me for my birthday and I did a massage and facial treatment. The massage was amazing and the facial left my skin glowing! I was also able to use the spa facilities, everything was spotless and it felt very relaxing. I chose the steak and chips for my lunch and it was delicious. Thank you so much for the amazing day :) || Went with a friend and we had a great day. We started our morning with a full body massage and a facial. Magda was the therapist, she is super professional and kind.

The staff at reception and the restaurant was amazing too, very friendly and helpful. Food was great. Overall a lovely experience. || By far the nicest gym I‚Äôve been to.  It has everything you need for weight equipment and cardio machines. A variety of classes are offered daily, all day long. All of the trainers are professional and bring their own style to the classes they teach.
The spa area is without equal, with a pool and jacuzzi as well a both a steam room and two saunas.
I‚Äôve been coming here since it opened, and it‚Äôs maintained it‚Äôs level of quality through the years || Words cannot describe the luxury and kindness offered by the staff, masseurs, and especially the concierge, Kate. With the Himalayan salt sauna, the hydrotherapy bath, the endless pool for laps in place, and the high-quality restaurant, this is the best place to spend six hours on your last day visiting Ireland. End your visit with a cocktail on the complex roof with the best outdoor view in Dublin. I must return to this place again, or I will be unsatisfied with my existence on this planet. || Pure relaxation!! the spa package we got which included lunch really hit home! The massage was out of this world along with the cocktails! The food was sublime! Great way to spend a wedding anniversary. And the heated pool was great to chill out and have a chat about where the year has gone!

name: Sauna In The City
address: D2, 50 William St S, Dublin, D02 DE93, Ireland
reviews_text: Great new idea for the city Center. Plenty of gyms without a jacuzzi or sauna congrats on all your successes . || Amazing üëè

name: The Mindful Yard Sauna
address: Crostick Alley, The Liberties, Dublin, Ireland
reviews_text:
We had booked 2 sauna sessionÔºà19-.20-Ôºâ for two in advance, but when we arrived, the facility seemed to be closed and no staff were around. Since payment is made in cash on the day, we hadn‚Äôt paid yet, so there was no issue regarding the fee. Still, as we had travelled from quite far, we were a little disappointed.

I‚Äôm sure there must have been an unavoidable reason, but if the facility ever needs to close unexpectedly, it might be helpful to have a way to notify customers with reservations. We would really appreciate that for future visits. || Absolutely the best sauna in Dublin! Convinient location & Great crew. You get to know folks from close BJJ gym that share sauna sessions with you. || This is an absolutely amazing place right in the heart of the liberties staff are great realy friendly I was like a reborn man when I left the  sauna and ice baths
Keep up the good work lads || Hands down the best sauna experience in Dublin. Everyone you meet here is so genuine, caring and welcoming. It‚Äôs easy to lose track of all sense of time and find yourself relaxed in deep conversations with a friendly community around you. || My favourite sauna in Dublin by a mile. Low key, hot sauna, and cold showers perfect. Not a Insta spot so nice mix of people. More down to earth type of sauna. Taking pictures isn‚Äôt the ‚Äúvibe‚Äù. In the heart of the Liberties. Love love love!!

name: The Hot Box Sauna Killiney Beach
address: The White Cottage, Killiney, Dublin, A96 KXE6, Ireland
reviews_text: My friend & I were in the female changing room when my earbud fell out of my case. To our horror we realised that there is a large cavity between the floor and wall (see pictures below) - a huge health & safety risk. The cavity was around 5cm wide in parts so we flashed a light and were unable to see the earbud. I spoke to Amy at the reception who said that she would look with a rubbish picker and offered nothing else. She also explained that this happened already with a customer who dropped their keys but ‚Äúthe guys‚Äù were able to get them. I stated my concern for the health & safety cavity in the floor directly under the ladies changing benches to which she said ‚Äúwe‚Äôre not open that long and we‚Äôve already fixed the roof and that it‚Äôs up to the guy who owns the building not the enterprise renting?‚Äù I replied that I didn‚Äôt think it was good enough, she  offered no compensation or apology.  A half an hour later she found us in the sauna while she was adding blocks to the fire, and said she tried but couldn‚Äôt see anything and ‚Äútaking the floor boards up would be tricky‚Äù I asked if that was an option she said no. . So I asked for a pair of gloves to search myself her response was her arms/ hands were too lanky but someone like my with smaller hands would be better for the job‚Äù, her solution was that we could stay in the sauna a bit longer? Allowing a customer to even go near the cavity filled with sharp nails, dirty socks is a health violation in itself. We entered the changing room about 10 mins later, & we saw Amy had left the picker there for us to use to no avail.  I had to then with my friends assistance to lay on the floor searching with a plastic bag over my hand, I wasn‚Äôt able to search for long due to the rusty nails sticking outwards. We decided is wasn‚Äôt worth searching for given the dirt. My friend had hung her coat and bottoms on opposite coat hangers, which were soaked right through - so the roof repair clearly wasn‚Äôt up to par. As we left, I asked Amy to process a refund for today, her face squirmed in disbelief. I said it‚Äôs a health & safety risk, you‚Äôve not offered up any compensation, and showed her the coat that was completely soaked through on the hook (see in picture). Her response was sharp, ‚Äúthat‚Äôs what the lockers are there for when it‚Äôs raining‚Äù I said you don‚Äôt have a sign up stating that you have a leaky roof under both the areas where my friend hung her clothes? Same with the floor there should be a sign to be careful for the gap. She reminded us that they aren‚Äôt open that long, to which I said the hot box group have been running for a long time & we‚Äôve been loyal customers and secondly, this issue has happened in the past so why haven‚Äôt they sorted the cavity from a health and safety point of view. I asked for her name & asked her to confirm that she didn‚Äôt think my refund request was fair due to the shock on her face. She said she‚Äôd be happy for me to add all of my concerns into a Google review instead. || Everything was perfect, staff is delightful and the place is stunning! I am leaving 4 stars only because there is no toilet available but: will definitely be back :D lovely. || 43rd Finnish sauna review: location is simply stunning. 2 wood fired sauna on the Irish coast. Each sauna was around 98c. 2 level of benches. Harvia stoves. The stove is well sized for the sauna, allowing 8 or so people per sauna. The l√∂yly is soft, but based on the small sauna size doesn‚Äôt mess around either. The ladle was unique; allowing a good scoop of water but allowed  gradual stream into the rocks, helping with the soft feeling. The team kept the stove well fed throughout the session. Very short walk to the ocean. Great location, great experience. || The Hot Box Sauna in Killiney is an absolute must when visiting the area. It‚Äôs a truly unique and refreshing experience. The setting is spectacular, with panoramic views of the coastline that make it feel extra special. The sauna itself is beautifully maintained, and the option to cool off with a sea swim or outdoor shower is invigorating. A special shout out to Amy and Otis, whose warm hospitality make the experience even more enjoyable. They are attentive, welcoming, and clearly passionate about ensuring everyone has a memorable visit. Highly recommended! || We visited for the first time this week. It was so great. From the moment we arrived Otis was a great host, made us feel very welcome. The location is perfect, the ocean crashing outside the large sauna window helps to draw you into a state of relaxation and reflection. We will definitely be back. Thanks Otis!

name: Fad Saoil Saunas Clontarf
address: Castle Ave, Clontarf East, Dublin, Ireland
reviews_text:
Perfect Relaxation Spot
Absolutely loved my visit! The saunas were clean and perfectly heated. The staff were friendly and made me feel welcome from the start. I left feeling totally refreshed and will definitely be coming back! || Kept really hot which is good. Single person inflatable ice baths x 2, nice and cold, about 5 degrees. Cold showers too. Emmet and other staff are very friendly. Easy to book; several package options.  Free car parking in the rugby/cricket club, except before 8pm on Fridays in summertime. || Spent a highly enjoyable morning here with a few friends in Fad Saoil Clontarf. The sauna was amazing and stayed extremely hot even with people coming and going. The ice baths were freezing and set me up energised for the day. The loyll was also a nice touch in the sauna. üôå || Nice spot and very nice staff, although equipments could be better.
Also, no way to reach the business. I sent multiple emails to ask about lost items left with no response to date. I am glad I didn't forget my passport and had to fly. || The best Sauna I‚Äôve been to in north Dublin and so hot. The ice baths are so clean. All the staff are lovely a lad called Emmet really helped us out would defo recommend!!

name: Unique Day Spa
address: 9A, Fashion City, Ballymount, Dublin 24, D24 H6EH, Ireland
reviews_text:
Totally unasuming from the outside until you are greeted from the main door right up to main reception with style and every ounce of what you would want a Spa to look like. Offered us warm & cold refreshments while we waited. We treated ourselves to a couples Japanese Head Spa. The practitioners were very welcoming and walked us through the whole concept of what was going to happen. Everything was lovely and relaxing. The warm water bar was fab and totally eased the busy mind. The treatment was finished with a complimentary neck, shoulders, arm and hand massage. We got to see the after effects on our scalps and was a visible difference. Feeling relaxed and sqweaky clean. Great way to start the New Year with a treatment. They gave us a tour around the whole spa. Very impressive. Shall be back with girls, minus the husband üòÖ  Thank you || Soooo love this place. I‚Äôd consider myself a regular customer at this stage! Walk in the door & feels like you‚Äôve been transported to somewhere special. Today, 90 min full body massage for me, followed by couples hot tub experience with himself. The room also includes a sauna & steam room. Decor is gorgeous & place is immaculately clean & maintained. Highly recommended! || We booked a ‚ÄúUnique Spa Day‚Äù in Dublin and it was by far the worst spa experience we have ever had. We paid over ‚Ç¨300, and almost nothing worked.

The electricity was broken, the jacuzzi was not working, and the sauna was out of order. A spa without a functioning jacuzzi or sauna is simply unacceptable. The facilities were poorly maintained and the whole place felt chaotic and unprofessional.

To make matters worse, staff tried to charge us extra money on top of what we had already paid ‚Äî despite the fact that the advertised services were not even available. There was no proper apology, no real attempt to fix the situation, and no compensation offered.

This was not relaxing, not luxurious, and absolutely not worth the money. It felt like a complete waste of time and honestly like a rip-off.

Do yourself a favor and stay far away from this place. Save your money and your nerves. || The atmosphere was warm, clean, and truly relaxing, exactly what I needed. The service was exceptional, with clear communication, great care, and a calming energy that makes you disconnect from the outside world.
I left feeling refreshed, lighter, and extremely satisfied. It‚Äôs definitely a place I would highly recommend and one I can‚Äôt wait to visit again‚Ä¶ || We had a 60-minute couple body massage with my fianc√© Ionut and had a wonderful experience. The reception was very welcoming, the staff was attentive, and the service was excellent. We were very satisfied and will definitely come back again. Highly recommended!

name: The Boilerhouse
address: 12 Crane Ln, Temple Bar, Dublin, D02 DR72, Ireland
reviews_text:
I was very badly treated by an employee as soon as I arrived. I asked him where I could leave my things, and he said something I couldn't understand. Then he yelled at me to go inside. I said, "Why are you yelling at me?" Then he threw my money back at me and went inside. The employee was definitely under the influence of drugs. I'm 20 years old, and this was my first time going to a gay sauna, and I was treated like an animal. They shouldn't allow an employee to use drugs in the workplace. || Little gay paradise in Dublin. Absolutely loved the new design of that place after its re-arrangement, especially the new area opposite to the reception on the ground floor beside entrance, it has that laid back night club + cruising vibe.

There are different things on each floor makes it even more diverse and fun. All the different places were clean and well maintained. The popular jacuzzi area is still under refurbishment, I'm sure it will be even better once it is been completed.

I went on one of the Thursday night and Friday night, staff were welcoming and helpful, there were lads in all ages and shapes. I enjoyed my time on Friday night as it was a weekend and tends to be busier than other regular weekdays without overwhelminglly full. I will definitely return again once jacuzzi re-opens.üëçüëçüëç || Boilerhouse currently under major refurbishment. I went twice in the last fortnight. Entrance staff did not advise that it was essentially a building site. Noisy, dusty and cold. No access to sauna, jacuzzi or steam room and still charged full price. I telephoned this morning to find out when the remodelling would finish. Phone rang out 23 times (set to redial) without being answered. Management and staff show no regard for regular customers. Dublin needs a professionally run sauna, not this shambles. || I'm considering visiting this weekend but very concerned about the reviews I have read. It's not very clear if your establishment has all the facilities in place, and in good working order. Equally, are men of colour welcome here and not treated with prejudice? As a global blogger, I'm interested to see if this established brand lives up to its reputation || Review ‚Äì The Boilerhouse Dublin
I would like to raise a concern regarding the conduct of a staff member named Filip (identifiable by tattoos).
During my visit, his behaviour towards customers was unprofessional, impolite, and lacked basic respect. While on duty, he appeared distracted and more focused on socialising for personal enjoyment rather than carrying out his assigned responsibilities. This behaviour created an unprofessional atmosphere and negatively affected the overall customer experience.
Customer-facing staff should maintain a high standard of professionalism at all times. Unfortunately, this standard was not met on this occasion.

name: The Spring Saunas
address: Coolmine, Saggart, Co. Dublin, D24 N282, Ireland
reviews_text: Amazing place!! Sauna is great!! Jack is very welcoming person!! Thank you so much!! Will back very soon!! || I absolutely loved my stay! The staff were friendly and professional, and the service was outstanding. The outdoor sauna surrounded by nature was a dream ‚Äî peaceful, clean, and beautifully designed. I left feeling completely relaxed and refreshed. Highly recommend!üòä || Im delighted that I decided  to try spring saunas. The lads working there are very helpful and really help you get the most from  your visit. || Had a lovely evening here facilities are great the natural pool is fantastic will 100% be back great to have a sauna in saggart finally || What a find!! name: Fad Saoil Saunas - Greystones
address: Marine Rd, Rathdown Lower, Greystones, Co. Wicklow, A63 V406, Ireland
reviews_text:
A really nice location for a sauna, there's no denying that, but it's lacking a few basic bits that would bring it to the next level. First and foremost, there's no shower facilities, the only way to cool off is in the sea, and you cant have a proper wash when you're finished. Make sure to bring plenty of water with you as there is no tap.

At the same time, it's only ‚Ç¨15 during peak hours, so that's very reasonable, and the lad working there didn't make you feel like he was watching the clock so that was nice too.

This one is very much about the location, and if manage to get a sunrise there you won't regret it. Plus there is loads of nice caf√©s etc within walking distance, and a little coffee and gelato place next door.

We really enjoyed the experience, and the sauna was nice and hot, with a few little improvements I think it would be hard to beat. || This was a wonderful sauna experience. I loved the sense of community that the staff are able to create. The employee ‚ÄòSean‚Äô was very helpful and gave great recommendations on where to eat in Greystones. I backed a bread41 pain au after. Incredibly enjoyable sauna with even better views of the sea (especially at sunrise ü§§). 10/10 would recommend. Ps see photo attached üòçüòù || Don‚Äôt talk to me until I‚Äôve had my morning sauna üßò‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è üî• üêª. Always a 10/10 experience down at fad saoil. Toast yourself in the beautiful wood burning sauna, and immerse yourself in the Irish sea after to cool down üåä. A delight to the senses each and every time. Jack and Ross are wonderful hosts! And don‚Äôt forget to pop into Rise cafe for your cup o‚Äôjoe after! ‚òïÔ∏è ü§ó || Spacious sauna with an incredible view. Would recommend trying it at sunrise because the dips between sauna sessions were amazing. The staff were really welcoming and made the whole experience for us. Great coffee next door at Rise. We‚Äôll be back soon! || I went for a sunrise sauna. Lovely view, atmosphere, and friendly staff. Would recommend to anyone looking to relax and reset. Spotless and perfectly clean sauna.

name: Loyly Sauna

reviews_text: I had a great experience using the sauna here. It‚Äôs small, but everything is new and easy to use. I was lucky that there were only a few people there on Friday evening. The sauna is located in the paddle club, and if you‚Äôre a member, it only costs a few bob, for everyone else the price is 15‚Ç¨. The staff are friendly and helpful. The only thing I‚Äôd suggest is adding a hook and a lock in the changing room.

name: Recovery Room Dublin
address: Junction 6 leisure centre, River Rd, Blanchardstown, Castleknock, Co. Dublin, D15 EA43, Ireland
reviews_text:
5 stars concept and services, got hosted by Cian, a top lad and very welcoming person, made me feel home straight away. Paid 25‚Ç¨ for a hour time which included Ice Bath(around 3 degrees) , then a hot and super comfortable Jacuzzi, a Sauna, and to finish 20 minutes of leg compression. Definitely worth the price ( as it was not so busy at my arrival I also got allowed longer time than what I paid for), I will surely be back anytime I‚Äôm in Dublin to compete. If you‚Äôre looking for a recovery place, here you go. Thank you || Had been coming here for the last 3 years and loved this place. Showed up yesterday with my partner who is new to this stuff and reception person could not have been less interested. No intro, instructions or even show us to the tub we were supposed to get into. Water was unusually low in ice bath, knee height which isn‚Äôt a big issue. Saunas were off when we got in. When we asked about it we were told to wait in there while they heated up which seems pointless as this ate into our time, about 10 minutes.They never heated up, we then asked to just use the leg compressions for the remainder of the time. || Been here a few times due to its locality. Poor recovery room  inproper changing rooms, hot tub was room temp and lady told us to hop off the recovery boots not even 5 mins into using them due to a team coming in and the team didn‚Äôt even show up. Wouldn‚Äôt recommend especially as a professional footballer || Clean, comfortable, private, relaxed, calm.
I‚Äôve been to saunas all over Dublin in recent times and this one is up there. It may not be the biggest but the atmosphere is lovely.
I‚Äôd love an early slot on a Wednesday or Thursday. || I received an email after making a booking that my slot had been double booked by accident, so was offered a full refund as well as rescheduling my session. Really impressed with this excellent customer service from the get go, and went on to really enjoy my free session! Facilities were spotless and staff very helpful and friendly. Will definitely be back again :)

name: Fire & Ice Recovery

reviews_text:
Had a great experience at Fire and Ice. Niall runs a great business very chatty and made feel very welcome. Place is spotless. Sauna, cold dip and warm bath all perfect for your experience.

Thanks Niall will definitely be calling back || Very good set up and friendly atmosphere!! Its clean and well kept with insisting on showering in between the sauna and ice bath which you don‚Äôt see in a lot of places. Very happy with my experience and look forward to coming back :) || If you haven‚Äôt tried Fire and Ice you need to start today, the set up is first class, if your a first timer or a regular you will feel right at home, everyone is so welcoming, fantastic little community, you will feel a million dollars after a session, what are you waiting for .. get your togs on and get in the ice || Went to Fire and Ice for the first time and it didn't disappoint! Niall is very welcoming and the place is very well-run. The perfect place to unwind and re-charge in a friendly atmosphere. Would highly recommend! || Very impressed. Very clean and insists on showering between sauna and cold plunge/ baths. Niall was really friendly and welcoming. 100% recommend for recovery.

Beautiful scenery,

name: Chillin Like A Villain

reviews_text:
This place is definitely worth a trip. Everything you need in a relaxed environment. Sauna and ice baths amazing. Spotless clean and a great welcome vibe. The vibe is amazing, the woodfired sauna is spacious,  the ice baths are loaded with ice at each session and the woodfired hot bath is so so relaxing.. || Absolutely love this place definitely worth a visit,  firstly the decor is second to none gives a real fun yet relaxing vibe, a real treat if you‚Äôre looking to unwind by yourself or chill with the lads. Secondly, it is exceptionally well kept, clean and maintained and so professional. Finally, the staff are exceptional, just a really nice bunch of people. I couldn‚Äôt recommend it more highly. || This is an amazing spot out the back of the best gym in the area.
If you're into your training and your recovery, you need to give this place a try. Piping hot woodfired sauna, 2 genuinely freezing cold ice baths and a hot bath like Shreks swamp.
The staff are lovely to deal with, always happy to help and always up for a laugh, and the cherry on top of it all is the good tunes they've always got playing in the background.
Highly recommended!! || My favourite place in Dublin for an oul recovery session.
Facilities are class, sauna is proper roasting. Friendliest and warmest welcome you'll get around. Gym facilities are unreal too boot. Kill 2 birds with one stone.

name: D7Sauna

reviews_text: Lovely experience.  Clean, hot sauna. Nice to meet Josh and Jan. Even got my phone charged. || Can't rate this place highly enough. The memberships are at a great price, better than almost any other sauna I'm aware of in the city and occasionally there are even better offers available on the Sacred Sauna instagram. || What a place hidden Oasis in the middle of city amazing once you go inside you could be anywhere in the world no noise. When we asked for a line voucher they refused.  It's a pity they're not more customer oriented. The sauna itself is fun. || Really relaxing and peaceful experience at good value. Would 100% recommend. My husband was also in for. Massage and he rated it one of the best he has had. || An absolutely wonderful experience here today. The staff couldn‚Äôt have been more helpful and my massage was amazing! The thermal spa was much more than I expected and even has a pool! A really nice hidden gem in the city centre. Will be back and can‚Äôt recommend this spa enough. || Had an amazing experience at Velvaere Spa. We booked the Cosy Escape Package, and from the moment we arrived the staff went above and beyond to make our day extra special. The facilities are amazing and absolutely spotless. Luna gave me the most amazing back massage and followed with a great facial. I have acne prone skin so previous facials have resulted in breakouts from heavy creams and oils, but Luna did a thorough consultation and my skin felt amazing and super fresh afterwards with no irritation or clogged pores. She was truly amazing. Gillian was also so attentive and warm. This spa is such a hidden gem and I‚Äôve been recommending it to everyone since, thank you again ladies!

name: Sauna

reviews_text: There are two cabins here: a steam bath and a Finnish sauna. I find it a bit odd that many guests don't put a towel underneath the Finnish sauna, and instead sit directly on the wood in wet swimwear. Signs or staff intervention could help here. ||  ||

name: Royal Recovery Rooms
address: Kylemore Park S, Kylemore, Dublin, D10 NW01, Ireland
reviews_text:
It was absolutely amazing! I particularly wanted to commend the lad at reception. He was incredibly friendly, helpful, and made a positive impression. It's clear that the business is in safe hands with him. Although I don‚Äôt know him personally, his professionalism and demeanor were noteworthy.

Thank you again for a wonderful experience. I look forward to future events!

Best regards, || Booked the room online for an evening last week, when I arrived I was told that it's not open on Wednesdays, which is not noted on the website or Google opening hours.
