Just done a session. Excellent service from the staff. The facilities were second to none . Perfect for anyone that works out or anyone just looking to invest in themselves.  I be defo making a return.

name: Obsidian Sauna
address: Stradbrook Rd, Mountashton, Dublin, Ireland

name: Aquasun Endless Pools & Hot Tub Store
address: No 6, Mulcahy Keane Industrial Estate, Greenhills Rd, Walkinstown, Dublin 12, D12 EE62, Ireland
reviews_text:
I bought a sauna, plunge pool and chiller from
Aquasun a few months ago. I dealt with Maria in the showrooms and she was a pleasure to deal with. Post install I had a couple of minor issues. Once I informed Aquasun of these , they were,  on both occasions resolved promptly and with the highest level of customer care. The post sale customer care that Aquasun provide is exceptional and the professionalism of their staff is a credit to them all. In a time where great customer service is not always a given Aquasun are certainly a fantastic example on how it should be done. Well done Aquasun! || First encountered Aquasun at a show in the RDS years ago.  I was impressed with their professional knowledge and non pushy sales approach.  I said if I was going to buy a tub I'd call in.  So this year we did exactly that.  Ronan, our sales guy, spent plenty of time with us.  He showed us everything they had in stock and explained all the pros and cons of each tub.  Finally we settled on a Hotspring Flair.  In these strange times delivery, like everything else was uncertain, but Ronan said end of July was realistic.  The tub arrived first week in August, so that's pretty much spot on.  The installers came and they had a difficult task getting the tub to its final place in the garden, but they did it efficiently and quickly with absolutely no damage to the decking, not even a tiny scratch.  One of the guys stayed behind and commissioned it and a day later we were using the tub.  I've since been back into the store for some top up chems and Debbie spent more time with ironing out a few small water quality questioned I had.  I'd highly recommend Aquasun if you're in the market for a tub or pool. || We were looking for an outdoor sauna suitable for our back garden. Nathan was great and showed us loads of different ones but we fell in love with the barrel sauna and chose to go with the bigger 3.5m barrel sauna. It only took about 10 weeks to arrive...from Lithuania üá±üáπ..and delivery and installation was superb. The guys were brilliant and didn't mind us filming everything. It was so cool to see it being put together.  Our electrician came a few days later and sorted that out for us and we were up and running that evening.  Its so easy to operate and so relaxing. The bigger size was worth it as it meant we had the changing room 1st so on wet or cold nights we could pop from that to the sauna room and back without coming outside. A beer..a glass of wine...and some relaxing music...and a good hot sweat...heaven. Thanks a million to Nathan and Debbie and all the gang. Would definitely recommend this to anyone who would like their own private garden spa. ü•∞ || Great people to deal with. They do what they say and do it when they say they'll do it. Their after sales is exceptional... I sent an email with a problem with one of the clasps on my hot tub cover - they replied by return. I sent a follow up email, and they responded almost immediately. At 8.15 the following morning, a solution to the problem was delivered to my front door! Now that's service. I have no hesitation in recommending them.
PS. The hot tub is great too!
Philip
Westport || We recently bought a flair hot tub and a 4 man infrared sauna from Aquasun. We were extremely pleased with the products , but in particular with the service and care on site when installing this for us was important with such a purchase . We would be very happy to recommend aqua sun to anybody.

name: TIGH‚ÄôN ALLUIS - Irish Sweat House
address: Adventure Park, Ballybetagh Rd, Glencullen, Co. Dublin, D18 Y673, Ireland
reviews_text:
It has to be a 5 star review for these guys! Definitely the best in the business! I picked the most perfect of winters days with Pete & Karl delivering the most perfect of experiences. Love your work lads. I‚Äôll be back üîú || Amazing experience. So therapeutic! Loved the barrel sauna and the yurt! Highly recommend trying out both & going for a dip in the lake / ice buckets afterwards. The lads are really sound and made the experience very comfortable and enjoyable! Will definitely be coming back soon || Fantastic experience. After half a day of riding bikes at the GAP we popped into the barrel sauna to recover and relax. The setup is brilliant, views from the location are splendid and the staff are extremely helpful and friendly. Cold plunge in the lake is a must! We will be back. || I booked TIGH‚ÄôN ALLUIS Irish Sweat House for my birthday and I can honestly say it was one of the most incredible experiences I have ever had in Ireland.

Nestled in the foothills of the Dublin Mountains the setting alone is breathtaking. The views are insane the kind that make you stop breathe and feel unbelievably lucky to be exactly where you are. It felt remote peaceful and deeply restorative yet still so accessible.

The service was genuinely on par with a five star resort. Every detail was thoughtfully considered every interaction warm professional and welcoming without ever feeling forced. You are made to feel completely looked after from the moment you arrive in a way that feels personal rather than transactional.

And the cleanliness wow. Immaculate does not even begin to cover it. Every space was spotless serene and clearly cared for with pride. If I could shout one thing from the top of the mountains surrounding this place it would be how impeccably clean and beautifully maintained it is.

TIGH‚ÄôN ALLUIS is not just a sweat house it is an experience. A perfect blend of nature luxury calm and care. Booking this for my birthday was the best decision I could have made and I will be recommending it to absolutely everyone. A true hidden gem in the Dublin Mountains üåø‚ú® || The sauna at Tigh an Alluis is a thoroughly enjoyable experience. The wood fired barrel sauna is always spotlessly clean and you can choose a quick dip in a barrel ice bath or in the lake the sauna overlooks - both as refreshing as you can imagine! The owners Karl and Pete are a wealth of knowledge and are so helpful from start to finish. It won't be long before I'm back again,  it's my favourite spot in Dublin.

name: Ireland Home Sauna Span Jacuzzi Steam Room
address: Slaney Cl, Dublin Industrial Estate, Dublin, Ireland

name: The Spa & Salon at The Shelbourne
address: 27 St Stephen's Green, Dublin 2, D02 K224, Ireland
reviews_text:
Myself, my mother and sister visited the Shelbourne Spa on a Sunday to celebrate a significant birthday for my mother.
The whole experience was diabolical to say the least. We could list off at least 20-30 points of issues (no exaggeration) the experience was that bad we couldn‚Äôt leave with anything being unsaid.
We arrived to a reception that was unwelcoming (staff standing behind a desk talking amongst themselves) and two maintenance men on a ladder fixing the ceiling.
We arrived in the relaxation room where we chatted before our treatments. Three young male therapists walked in to collect us(we were never asked upon booking nor asked upon check in if we were ok with a male therapist) it is a standard that this is asked. They even confirmed this later that evening during our complaint.
The staff had only arrived in Dublin one month ago. This was apparent as there was clearly no training carried out and if there was there was no supervision of a senior staff member to confirm that they were competent to carry out the treatments. The treatments we had were not as described in the brochure. The massages were mediocre and the staff were clearly not trained in facials, it was a series of applying creams then removing with dry cotton pads, at one point it felt that the fluff was coming off the pads and left on face, my therapist kept alternating between face/shoulders it was so inconsistent. Any facial I had before left the shoulder massage until the end of the treatment, I am almost certain my therapist was on his phone at the beginning and mid treatment probably to check the steps of what he was doing. Our mascara was still on after the facial had ended and face felt sticky and unwashed. The product was not applied to our d√©colletage.
My mother had to stop the therapist half way because it was obvious that he was not trained. Everything about the facial was wrong, having had many facials across many spas in many countries you are aware of the common steps regardless of what brand or products are used and she just knew this was not right. She called for a manager, a female therapist came to discuss what was wrong. No solution was offered.During this time my sister was having her massage treatment which she left feeling extremely uncomfortable due to the consistent conversation/questioning by her therapist. Questions such as ‚Äòwhat music do you like‚Äô, ‚Äòhave you been to Japan‚Äô, ‚Äòwhere he was brought up and holidayed with his parents‚Äô completely unrelated to the treatment. Upon leaving the treatment she was met by the senior therapist on duty in the treatment corridor who informed her she would be charged 50% cancellation fee as she was not having a facial. This was something we informed the therapist at the beginning and were told that was no problem.  This was completely in appropriate timing and extremely pressurising.
Upon returning to the relaxation room we learnt of each others experience and the female therapist that had been dealing with my mother came to discuss the matter with us, we then explained again what happened. After 20minutes the male senior therapist came to the relaxation room to listen to our complaint. We should not have had to repeat ourselves a second time (a third time for my mother)
All we were told was that they will have to speak to a manager but that they may not be able to get in contact with one.
Upon leaving the spa one hour after the original complaint the therapist on the reception took out her mobile and said ‚Äòoh your leaving, I just have to call someone‚Äô. At this point we were leaving and not waiting for a solution, I had informed the therapist that I would accept a call that evening if there was someone on duty if not then I would expect a call the following morning. I received an email at 8pm that evening from the receptionist to apologise again and that the spa director Margaret McCallum would appreciate the opportunity to discuss the matter on Wednesday.  I am still awaiting a response and it‚Äôs Friday!! || I was given a gift card of a Luxury Spa massage and facial treatment. It was wonderful!
Do go 15mins. before your appointment time to allow for filling in the forms.
The Spa entrance is 3 doors down from the main entrance to the Hotel, on the right hand side.
In the reception lounge I was offered a tea of my choice while I filled in my details.
You can choose the type of massage, Thai or hot stone, and  whether you want it done lightly, medium or firm etc.
Also, depending on your skin type you can tailor your facial to your particular needs.
You can choose to use the swimming pool and sauna area before or after your massage if you wish.
I was then introduced to my masseuse, a friendly, professional Thai lady who spent 90 mins. on my massage and facial.
The heated massage table, the use of aroma therapy oils and the relaxing music enhanced the whole experience.
After a shower, sauna and a dip in the pool I snuggled up in my cosy dressing gown and slippers and relaxed in the private lounge room overlooking St. Stephens green and read from a choice of glossy magazines while I drank a cranberry juice and later a sweet berry tea. Each person has their own couch with a wrap around silk headboard for added luxury and privacy.
I can totally recommend this luxury spa experience. See my photos of the areas I have described. Enjoy! || My son treated me to a spa day which cost 335 euro in total.
Changing into my robe I was given a pair of flip flops. One a size 5 approx and one poss a size 8. The full body massage was reasonable but not memorable. The facial was a series of creams applied. Creams removed. Creams applied‚Ä¶ Perhaps 4/5 times. I‚Äôm not sure she knew what she was doing. Marianna the tattooed masseuse then moved on to my head massage. Very poor show. She proceeded to endlessly tangle my hair and no real massage technique.
She then showed me to the relaxation room with a few other ladies.
It was only when I went to the toilet that I saw what state I was in, in the mirror. I had large panda eyes where my eyemakeup had not been removed properly and my hair was an outageous bouffant of a birds nest. I felt humiliated and embarassed. This spa is at best a 2 star set up. The Shellbourne would be best to close it down rather than damage the hotels reputation further by associating with it. || I may have booked the wrong treatment, but I wanted to share my understanding of what a pedicure typically includes. For me, a pedicure is not just about having polished nails, but about achieving healthy, well-groomed feet ‚Äî free of corns, excess cuticles, and other issues.

In my case, the treatment mainly included nail polishing and some moisturizing. One of the nails ended up crooked, which I didn‚Äôt notice during the procedure as I trusted the specialist to shape the nails correctly without my oversight.

I believe a pedicure should go beyond cosmetic care and include proper attention to foot health. It would have been helpful to know the scope of the treatment in advance to ensure expectations were aligned. || I had the pleasure of having a facial with my best friend on Tuesday.

The staff in the shelbourne are so professional üëè they made sure our visit was very luxurious. We had the use of all the spa facilities which we thoroughly enjoyed.

Irmak carried out the most beautiful relaxing uplifting facialü•∞using amazing products. I felt as if I was walking on air for the day.

The wonderful staff then proceeded to introduce us to a beautiful quiet room to relax  where they served us beautiful fruit and champagne.
I would highly recommend a visit.
A huge thank you to all the staff .

name: NebulaSpa - Home Saunas | Jacuzzis | Freestanding Bathtubs (ONLINE STORE)
address: 14-4 Shrewsbury Rd, Sandymount, Dublin, D04 C2C8, Ireland
reviews_text:
Great product and works perfectly for a great price but note review as follows;

After extensive research online and going into showrooms around Dublin (Ireland), I decided to order from Nebula Spa as the price was by far the best but it didnt not include assemply/installation which local companies could. The order was delayed and took a bit longer to arrive as I ordered when Trump announced his tarriffs and the logistics market when into meltdown. It only resulted in a two week delay which I was fine with but Nebula Spa sent me some gifts in the meantime which was a very nice touch.

I ordered the Nordic Bliss 2 (2 person) Traditional Electric Sauna and it came in flat back packaging which were heavy to move upon delivery. It took me around half a day to assemble the sauna myself and it wouldnt be feasible to assemble by someone without some strength as the parts are big and heavy. The instructions were not very clear so it took a bit longer but I managed to figure it out as there were no screws or drilling involved, just assembly of the various large sauna component parts.

Once fully assembled, I noticed the heater needs an electrician to install. This was were I came into difficulty as it was hard to find an electrician to take on the job or one that knew how to hardwire a sauna heater. The heater has to be connected directly into fuse box so you cannot do it yourself, unless you're an electrician. Eventually I got an electrician in and he found the instructions difficult to read and follow so it was a more difficult job than anticipated.

The installation was the hard part and I would probably have considered ordering an infrared sauna as this is plugged into socket so easy installation. The electrician cost was not cheap and it was a full days work given the sauna was not set up in the house so it added onto the price of the sauna itself.

Regardless, the sauna is working perfectly now and I'm very happy with the product, just be warned that the Traditional/Electric sauna needs work and a strong person to assemble and also an electrician to hook up the sauna heater which incurs an additional cost. || It would be nice if they had a phone service but their email service is really good. Ordered the Crystal Sauna and waited just over a week and received an additional gift. It‚Äôs nice the way delivery is free || Absolutely Brilliant customer service, I‚Äôve been looking to purchase a jacuzzi for the summer and I couldn‚Äôt have found a better place to do it. The employee gave me the best choices to pick from to satisfy my needs. He was also very generous with the deal that he has given me and the delivery service was effortless. Will definitely be recommending to my friends. Perfect in time for the warmer season! || At first I was sceptical the way it's an online store and I thought they are realitvely new on the market. I was worried about the delivery and quality of the bathtub and sauna I ordered not being best quality as advertised. However I was very nicely surprised as the sauna's and the bathtub's build quality was exceptionally good and I received both in less than two weeks after ordering, also I received a little surprise gift from the company. So overall I am very happy with my experience with Nebulaspa and most likely will buy a hot tub soon. || I recently had the pleasure of shopping at Nebula Spa and I couldn't be more satisfied with the experience. The website is user-friendly, offering a wide range of high-quality bathtubs and jacuzzis to suit every need and budget. Customer service was exceptional, providing prompt and knowledgeable responses to my queries.

name: Align Wellness
address: Unit 1, Elmville, Harold's Cross, Dublin 6, D6W EH77, Ireland
reviews_text:
Tried out this lovely sauna and ice bath for the first time today and was really impressed. The space itself is gorgeous and it was a very calm, relaxed atmosphere. Seafra made the experience so enjoyable with his upbeat, positive and friendly demeanor. He regularly topped up the sauna with different scents and made it such an immersive experience. Going between the ice baths and the sauna was incredible. I had a wonderful time and will definitely be back again very soon! || Very nice sauna facility, relaxed atmosphere, not overcrowded. Super clean and spacious. Tea on arrival is an extra touch to add to experience and the essential oil change every 15 minutes was amazing. The lady working there was absolutely lovely and nice to deal with. Will definitely return and recommend to friends. || Had a lovely experience last week doing the 1 hour sauna and ice bath session at Align Wellness. From the moment we arrived, Ayeesha was very friendly providing us with hot tea & information about the sauna and ice baths. The venue is very clean and calming and I will definitely go back when travelling back to Dublin again for a visit. || This sauna delivers a near-perfect, impeccably clean, and well-kept experience that‚Äôs easily 5-star worthy in facilities and service. Will definitely come back. Hot tea greets you on arrival for a warm welcome, and the oil infusions in the sauna create a luxurious, aromatic highlight. The attendant stands out as amazing.

Dropping to 4 stars because there‚Äôs no clear signage or reservation notes enforcing silence or minimal voices - crucial for true relaxation, disconnection and recharging in a sauna. It‚Äôs often ruined by pairs of gals besties gossiping loudly like it‚Äôs Sunday brunch, filling the space with chatter for the entire hour and it had me leaving with a headache. Signs stating ‚Äúkeep silence‚Äù or low volume would help with guest behaviour without blaming the business. || Align is like nowhere I've been before. The whole experience of the guided sauna session with Katie was absolutely magical. Every little detail is thought of, from the cup of tea to the lighting in the sauna, the essential oils, the ice. The facilities are just incredible. I will definitely be back!

name: Urban Day & Medi Spa
address: First floor, Sportsco, S Lotts Rd, Dublin, Co. Dublin, Ireland
reviews_text: My experience at Urban Day Spa was absolutely outstanding. From the friendly, professional staff to the relaxing atmosphere and top-quality treatments, everything was exceptional. My massage was easily the best I‚Äôve ever had and gave me instant relief from lower back pain. I was pleasantly surprised to find free parking, especially given how close it is to the city centre (a big plus!) I couldn‚Äôt recommend Urban Day Spa more highly. || I had an amazing massage with Ketut at Urban Day Spa. She is Balinese and you can really feel her experience and training in traditional Balinese techniques. She has incredible intuition and seems to naturally know where the body is holding tension, working through trigger points with care and confidence. The whole experience felt very holistic and grounding. I left feeling relaxed, lighter and properly looked after. Highly recommend. || I have super sensitive skin but the therapist really listened to all my concerns and suggested a facial that had lovely results and was a lovely and relaxing experience which was exactly what I asked for. Great experience, will be back again || Great time getting a mani-pedi at Urban Day Spa! Fantastic customer service and very talented nail technicians who took great care of us. Will definitely be back! || My visit to Urban Spa for a massage was fantastic, largely thanks to Martina. She was incredibly professional and gave one of the best massages I've ever had. Martina really focused on my problem areas and left me feeling completely relaxed and refreshed. I highly recommend Urban Spa for anyone looking for a great massage.

name: The Buff Day Spa
address: 52 King St S, Dublin 2, D02 HP68, Ireland
reviews_text:
The ‚ÄúPause‚Äù treatment was hands-down the best body/facial treatment I‚Äôve ever experienced‚Ä¶ from start to finish and left me feeling like I had been taken care by nothing short of an angel!! Maria gave me a facial and arm/neck and shoulder massage that was simply the best I‚Äôve ever experienced. I cannot recommend it enough and my skin simply glowed for days after!! It‚Äôs a MUST!!! || I was kindly invited to the buff day spa for a customised facial. The staff were friendly, helpful and professional. Maria really took the time to listen to my skin concerns. She also gave me advice after my facial for my at home skincare. Since then my skin has improved drastically. I suffer with acne especially around my chin area. I enjoyed relaxing in the tranquility room after my facial. || I and my girlfriend had the pleasure of visiting this wonderful spa and was warmly welcomed from the moment we arrived. The staff were genuinely friendly, and we were shown to a private suite, which immediately set the tone for a relaxing experience.

The Swedish oil massage was exceptional‚Äîdeeply relaxing and expertly done. We also made full use of the sauna and the Tranquility Room, which was especially calming with its gentle, ASMR-like waterfalls. A glass of prosecco, along with soothing tea, added a thoughtful touch.

The entire experience felt unhurried and well worth it. I would highly recommend this spa and will absolutely be returning. || I had the Pause Ritual at Buff Day Spa and it genuinely exceeded my expectations. I loved every minute and left the spa glowing ‚Äî the results were visible straight away. Maria, the senior therapist, has truly magical hands and made the whole experience so relaxing and personalised.

She recommended the Dermalogica NeuroTouch Symmetry Serum afterwards, and even though it‚Äôs on the pricier side, it‚Äôs packed with advanced ingredients and you only need a tiny amount. It really helped maintain the lifted, smoother, more balanced look in the days after my treatment.

I‚Äôll definitely be returning and purchasing the serum. Highly recommend! || A calm oasis amidst the craziness of Dublin, perfect for treating yourself!

If you like medium to firm massage pressure, I can wholeheartedly recommend Brooke and Nico - they are exceptional. Brooke also does really nice facials and so does Florentina! But honestly, all their staff is good, so you'll have a good experience no matter what!

name: David Lloyd Dublin Riverview
address: Beech Hill Rd, Clonskeagh, Dublin, D04 AF10, Ireland
reviews_text:
I joined thrilled and excited with the facilities at the time(1 year ago) but as I travel a lot with the work there is absolutely no leniency on membership unless you‚Äôre sick and have a doctors note. Which I did provide at one point - and was one day late with asking them to extend for one months and they were having none of it- so I ended up paying just under500 euro (2 months membership) for a sauna- and at that the sauna at this stage was in awful shape, at one point I reached back and grabbed a load of dust/sweat black stuff from around the wooden planks. There are now a lot better facilities with better prices and more understanding to different life styles.

Probably most suitable for families.. || I had a tour of the club with Alex from the sales team, great guy by the way. He showed me the whole facility and it honestly looks amazing: the gym floor, the sauna, and the pools are all top class. It was Friday afternoon and a bit busy, but the space is big enough that it didn‚Äôt feel crowded at all.

My main reason for checking the club out was the padel courts. I had high expectations because I thought three of them were indoor or at least covered, but it turns out only one is. That doesn‚Äôt make much sense considering it rains most of the time here. So I‚Äôm still on the fence about joining.

That said, shout out to Alex, he did a great job showing us around and even acted like a mentor to his colleague during the tour. Really professional and welcoming || I recently attended a fitness class at David Lloyd and was really impressed by the high-end facilities and overall atmosphere. What truly made the experience stand out, though, was our incredible coach, Sakou. Training a group of moms, he struck the perfect balance between pushing us to work hard and making everyone feel supported and capable. His motivation, encouragement, and genuine positivity created a fantastic energy in the class. I left feeling challenged, empowered, and eager to come back!!! || We recently attended the Dinklicious event held at the David Lloyd court facilities and Wow! what an experience. Right from the moment of walking up to reception and the warm welcome and helpfulness from the staff up until the very end of the day and tournament. Thank you for hosting the event and for helping make it such a great success. The facilities you have are brilliant and we are really looking forward already to coming back to attend hopefully another tournament very soon. You've spoilt us for what we want to now play on.. Hands down the best experience so far. üëèüèªüëèüèªüëèüèª || I enjoyed a lovely day at the pool and Spa today. As a newcomer Hayley at reception was very friendly and helpful showing me around with great enthusiasm. The pool was lovely but no flags so backstroke was a bit of a problem. Very clean spa and changing areas. üèä‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüëå

name: Flow Recovery Lounge Dublin
address: Unit 13 Canal Walk, Park West Industrial Park, Dublin, D12 Y177, Ireland
reviews_text: Absolutely amazing place. Atmosphere is amazing. Staff were so nice, highly recommend. Really enjoyable, the facilities are incredible as well. They have tv‚Äôs set up around the place for you to watch as well as your in the cold plunge or doing compression boots. Highly highly recommended || I‚Äôve been to a few sauna / plunge pool places around Dublin but this one takes the trophy. The atmosphere inside is great and the staff were so nice and helpful. The facilities they have are really good quality, especially for the price! I‚Äôm prone to swelling in my ankles in hot weather or after flying and I noticed a difference in my legs the next day after the compression boots, I‚Äôd really recommend coming and giving it a try || Great place for a recovery feel much more focused and energised, the staff were great aswell a tremendous help on showing me what to do when getting in the ice bath. Would reccomend to anyone. || Great place for recovery and resetting. Came in with a stiff body and sore joints after a tough session and felt brand new leaving. name: Saunair, Mobile Sauna Hire / Rent a sauna

reviews_text:
I hired the sauna for my 40th Birthday camping weekend which saved us from some very un-seasonally stormy weather in August! Mark & Joni were quick to respond to my last minute booking request and were so helpful and accommodating. The sauna itself was really easy to operate and heated up incredibly quickly. Plenty of space for 6 inside and the shower & ice bath were a great bonus. Wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to recommend this company, if I could give them more than 5 stars I would! Thanks again guys :) || We hired Saunair's cute little mobile sauna for the bank holiday weekend in August 2021 when we had a big group of friends staying at our glamping site Blackdown Yurts. It was really easy to light the fire and keep it going to achieve a nice sauna temperature. The interior was really clean. All in all a great experience. I hope more of our guests might hire Saunair as they are really local to us and saunas are really good for you. I'm hoping to book a session when Saunair is in Branscombe this Spring to enjoy a sea plunge and a sauna to get the full hot/cold experience. || Phenomenal Sauna! We had the pleasure of adding Saunair to our weekend event at One Tree Farm & it was super popular!

It‚Äôs genuinely one of the best sauna‚Äôs i‚Äôve experienced & the process of arranging was smooth and easy, would highly recommend and definitely use again! üôèüèΩ || Amazing experience hiring the sauna. Joni was extremely professional, the set up was quick and efficient. Joni explained everything to us really well and was really flexible with timings. The sauna was the perfect way to spend a hen weekend, so relaxing and atmospheric. Thanks so much for everything! || We had a great weekend with the barrel sauna - accommodates 6 comfortably and is really easy to use and quick to heat up. Great service from Joni at Saunair‚Ä¶he delivered on a Friday afternoon and collected the following Monday afternoon for the weekend hire. name: Saltee Sauna

reviews_text:
Such a relaxing experience every time! The sauna is in a great location, so close to the water for a dip. Ideal activity for a small group. The storage & changing rooms are very handy. Also, Conor is very welcoming & helpful. Looking forward to our next visit! || Conor has the sauna experience mastered

Great location, friendly and informative service and sauna with a beautiful view

Can‚Äôt wait for return visit || Incredible views from the sauna . Beautiful beach. One of the best outdoor saunas I‚Äôve been in. *photo of the beach not view from sauna || Beautiful setting, really lovely and well maintained sauna. Would highly recommend! || Fabulous sauna - great location, spotlessly clean & great coffee just beside it !

name: Sweathouse.ie
address: Gurteen pier, Gorteennaglogh, Rinvyle, Co. Galway, Ireland
reviews_text:
I‚Äôve been going to this sauna at Gurteen pier for a few years now. The sauna uses a wood stove and it heats up nice and hot. The smell of the burning wood makes it extra special. The views of the sea and mountains are just breathtaking. On top of that, it‚Äôs located right next to a small beach and pier, which is quite sheltered, perfect for the cold dips. Enjoy it during the busy summer times, and even more when they open during the winter. The craic is always mighty and I always feel very welcomed. Chris and Dan are fantastic hosts. Just the best place to wind down after a stressful day at work. || I booked the sauna for private use for my birthday at the end of September. We were blessed with the weather & the water in the small Harbour was a chilly 11 degrees but crystal clear and calm enough that even my 7 year old was leaping in off the steps in the Harbour wall.
The Sauna was roasting hot and the smell of the wood was beautiful, our group aged 70 down to 17 all enjoyed using it & Chris was a pure gentleman running the show and making sure we were all comfortable & giving us advice on the best way to cold dip after.  We loved the chats and hearing all about the Sauna and life on the wild atlantic way.
I cant wait to go back for a cold dip on a rainy day and sit in the warmth looking out over the mountains - theres no better place than Connemara when its moody out. 10 out of 10 from all of us & we will see you again! || Fabulous wood-burning sauna, right by a slipway straight into the sea! Great location. Good parking around. Fiachra and Chris were excellent hosts, really friendly and informative. Would return again! || This place is heaven on earth. A phenomenally beautiful spot, clear water, fantastic sauna. Just amazing. I thought I wouldn‚Äôt be able to swim in the cold water but I did it and surprised I wasn‚Äôt cold - the sauna heats up your bones! Daniel was playing his guitar and offering us tea after. Don‚Äôt hesitate, just go! üíô || We have a had good and bad experiences here. Our recent visit was uncomfortable as 7 strangers were squeezed in to one side as the owner used the other empty side with a mate. The inside smelled bad, not just because of the cows outside and the cracks are literally showing. This sauna has seen better days. At ‚Ç¨18 per person it‚Äôs no longer worth it.

name: Skellig Sauna @ Cuas Crom Beach
address: Cuas Crom beach, Over The Water, Emlagh, Cahersiveen, Co. Kerry, Ireland
reviews_text:
Loved the gorgeous yoga & sauna session at St. Finians Bay over the Easter bank holiday, and it was such a treat to do yoga outside and in such a gorgeous location. Dani included a sound bath at the end of our yoga session, which was a lovely surprise. I felt so grounded after the yoga practise and then got to enjoy some lovely swims and sauna time afterwards.
I also recommend the skellig sauna at cuas crom, which is also a gorgeous location. It's a great activity on a sunny or rainy day, it really doesn't matter the weather.
I love how friendly the sauna community is, I'm truly hooked! üåäüî• || We attended a fabulous summer solstice ritual with Dani and then had a swim and sauna. Colin runs a professional, clean, efficient and friendly sauna - a must do activity when visiting the area || Absolute must do in south kerry! The sauna & sea dip with Skellig sauna is a bliss key activity to a perfect day. The saunas are professionally run by Colin on st finians bay , Ballinskelligs bay & cuascrom. The website is so easy to book so don‚Äôt be hesitant. They have the most stunning views in Ireland , spotlessly clean & well kept. You can also do solo drop ins, it‚Äôs a great way to meet new people & have a chat, I urge you to tie in a yoga class with rewild dani pre sauna also to energise your mind. Colin is a gentleman & will help you with any information you need aswell as his helpful assistant Victoria ! Thankyou Colin for bringing Skellig sauna to SK! || Visited Skellig Sauna @ Ballinskelligs beach whilst on holiday last week. Absolutely one of the best saunas we have been in - great location, very well made, doesn't try to cram in too many people, pleasant owner, gorgeous essential oils in the water, and the main thing is that the owner keeps the wood going and the temperature is kept right up as it should be (have been in so many where they scrimp on the wood and as a result the temperature is never hot enough). We booked two sessions back to back and were so glad we did! We're coming back through this area in September so will be hoping to get booked in again. Thoroughly recommend! Absolutely wonderful, thank you so much ‚ù§Ô∏è

name: Urban Recovery
address: Verona, Grove Rd, Blanchardstown, Dublin, D15 WK79, Ireland
reviews_text:
By far the best sauna I‚Äôve ever been to. From the moment you walk in, the friendly and welcoming staff make you feel comfortable and relaxed, and that feeling carries through the entire experience. The facilities are consistently clean, well maintained, and thoughtfully laid out, with plenty of space in the changing rooms so it never feels cramped or rushed. The saunas are always spotless and reliably hot, while the cold plunges are clearly a favorite constantly in use, refreshing, and kept impeccably clean. Having access to the hot tub and jacuzzi is an added bonus, with warm, clean water every time, making it easy to fully unwind. Everything about this place feels cared for and intentional, creating an atmosphere that keeps me coming back again and again. || ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
Urban Recovery Sauna is an absolute gem for anyone serious about recovery. I‚Äôm a big lover of spas and saunas, and this place is simply perfect.

If you like real heat that gets deep into your bones and helps your body properly recover after training, this is the place to go. I‚Äôve been training here for a while, and finishing a session with the sauna has become a must for me.

It‚Äôs the best way to relax, reset, and prepare both physically and mentally for the next day. Top-quality experience every time. Highly recommended. || Urban Recovery Sauna offers a top-class wellness experience. From the moment you walk in, you feel calm and looked after. The sauna and cold therapy are incredibly refreshing and great for both physical recovery and mental reset. Everything is clean, modern, and thoughtfully set up. A must-visit for anyone serious about self-care and recovery! || I‚Äôve been to all of them, and this is by far the best sauna and cold plunge spot in the area. The saunas are spacious, feature double doors and multi-level seating, and there are also two large hot tubs. The staff consistently clean and monitor the hot tubs, cold plunges, and saunas, which really shows. There‚Äôs also a large parking lot right in front, so parking is never an issue. || Good saunas and hot tub, but changing facilities are poor: no lockers, no hot shower, no toilet, nowhere to fill a water bottle and the plunge pools felt unclean. Not very pleasant.

Reply to owner response: The review was an honest reflection of our experience. The intention was to make other customers aware, as we would have appreciated this information before our visit.

The showers and toilet in the adjacent gym being open for use for sauna users - were absolutely not mentioned to us at sign‚Äëin. We were told that one of the three cold plunges had been emptied that day; the other two were, unfortunately, not pleasant to use.

I also didn‚Äôt mention that two lads were using the facilities in their boxers. That may not bother some people, but it wasn‚Äôt pleasant for us.

As noted in my review, the saunas and hot tubs themselves are good. I appreciate you‚Äôre running a business and not all customers will care about the points I raised‚Äîbut some will, which is why I felt the review was worth posting. It wasn‚Äôt intended to cause damage, just to inform.

Good luck with it.

name: Anantara SPA Dublin
address: Grand Canal Quay, Grand Canal Dock, Dublin 2, D02 CK38, Ireland
reviews_text:
Lovely spa experience with one small noteüí´

I had a very pleasant experience at Anantara Spa in Dublin, visiting with my daughter.

The staff were warm, professional and attentive. We were welcomed right on time at 2:15 pm ‚Äî always appreciated when you value good organisation.The spa facilities are beautiful: jacuzzi, saunas, calm atmosphere and a truly relaxing massage. The relaxation room afterwards was the perfect finishing touch. Also, special mention to the gentleman at reception for his excellent service.

Just one small note from a very relaxed (but attentive) guest üòä
I had booked a one-hour massage, but because we were kindly invited to use the bathroom and allowed to take a few videos before starting, the massage itself lasted around 40 minutes, finishing exactly at 3:15 pm. Had I known, I would have saved those ‚Äúpre-spa rituals‚Äù for later ‚Äî timing matters when you want to enjoy every minute.

Overall, a beautiful spa, skilled professionals and a very enjoyable experience.
Highly recommended ‚Äî just keep the timing in mind to make the most of it ‚ú® || I love coming here, especially due to Efi, the massage therapist. She is truly amazing! I keep coming back cause her massage is both relaxing and very effective, she works my muscles really well and I always leave feeling completely refreshed and moving better due to less tension in my muscles. She is also great with adjusting to my individual needs especially cause I have had some past injuries, she is very attentive and she always knows what to do. If you want to truly relax, book a session with her! The facilities are also great and really help before and after a session to fully unwind and relax || Booked this hotel for the misfits event, it is expensive but worth every penny!

Our room was huge, modern but classy. The mattress, Pillows, Sheets were incredible one of the best nights sleep I‚Äôve had in ages.

We visited the spa on multiple occasions, sauna was great, steam room was great, pool is huge! Hot tub could do with some improvements as the jets were quite weak especially around the back area but other than that honestly 9/10. If you‚Äôre after a dark moody spa where you can really just relax this is the spa for you!

Treatment! We decided to book in for a couples massage the 30/30, 30mins Back.. 30 mins Facial, and it was incredible, genuinely one of the best massages I‚Äôve ever had! And I wasn‚Äôt pressured into buying products after, they took us to a relaxation room with electric beds that are to die for! Oh and I forgot to mention the massage bed was heated!

Everything included 10/10 recommend this spa if you want that luxury get away feeling! || Update:
After complaining to the spa, the manager was prompt and arranged an alternate massage with their most skilled therapist. Thank you :)
‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî-I'm incredibly disappointed with the massage I received. For 200 EUR, I expected a far more professional and skilled experience. The therapist seemed utterly inexperienced, lacking any knowledge of pressure points or massage techniques. The entire session felt like my body was simply being rubbed with oil. There was no rhythm, no flow, and the pressure was uneven on both sides of my body.

The back massage was almost non-existent, and the hot stones were literally jammed into my neck. The head massage was the worst part - it felt more like scratching than an actual massage. My scalp started burning after 20 minutes, forcing me to ask her to stop. Despite my attempts to provide feedback, the therapist seemed unable to adjust her technique.

I have never had to stop a massage halfway through before, but this experience was so subpar that I had no choice. I strongly advise against booking a massage with this therapist. || Perfect, the complex is very beautiful and pleasant, just like the staff. name: Oileanra Seaweed Baths and Sauna
address: Maumeen, Lettermullan, Co. Galway, H91 FY52, Ireland
reviews_text:
I recently stayed at Ole√°nra Camper Van Parking Area & Sauna and was very satisfied with my experience. The owner is an extremely courteous and kind person, always helpful and welcoming.

The area has a rustic and spartan style - the parking is located behind some containers - but this adds to the authentic charm of the place. Don't expect luxury, but everything you need is there: electricity and water are available, and the restrooms, though chemical toilets, are functional.

What makes this place special are the extra services: the possibility to use the sauna and take seaweed baths is a real plus, along with the small bar where you can relax. The surrounding panorama is truly splendid and worth the visit alone.

The value for money is excellent: 25 euros per night is really affordable considering the prices of other campsites in the area. For those looking for an authentic experience, essential services, and great scenery without breaking the bank, this place is perfect.

Recommended for camper enthusiasts who appreciate rustic atmosphere and genuine hospitality! || My favorite seaweed baths!! The location is wonderfully peaceful, the seaweed baths are beautifully warm and clean and I could really feel the oils in the water. The sauna is gorgeous with a view right onto the water. Friendly, quiet and overall a very special and relaxing way to spend an hour and it gives you such a sense of wellbeing and rejuvenation. || Had such experience at Oileanra this afternoon. Miche√°l was very welcoming and was great to chat to. The facilities were great and were located in a beautiful area. Highly highly recommend. || Seaweed baths as they should be...no walls or manufactured music or sound effects, just a view of the ocean and the rugged connemara coastline and the sound of the waves and the seabirds....don't miss this experience on the wild Atlantic way....absolute bliss... || Love, love, love this place.  Beautiful views, gorgeous sea close by.  Noel and staff are very friendly and helpful.  I've been going almost every week since January and couldn't recommend it enough.  Parking, changing rooms, shower, seaweed baths, sauna, coffee/water and beautiful, clean ocean - what  more could you need!

name: Salt Float & Recovery Suites
address: 62A, Briarhill Business Park, Galway, H91 T0H7, Ireland
reviews_text:
Amazing experience with floating and massage. Very welcoming , Everything was so relaxing, especially the tea afterwards, Thank you ‚ú®üåü || I won a fabulous prize on Instagram of infra sauna and float at Christmas.  Today I used my voucher, half hour infra red sauna to start followed by 1 hr salt float, im still floating!! It was a great way to reset for 2026. Beautiful setting , friendly greeting, very clean, soft towels, great products.  I will be back. Thanks again Nicola, Salt Float & Recovery Suites || I've been going into Salt for a little while to Infra Red Sauna which I find very beneficial if I feel the onset of a cold or flu, pains or aches. I had a go at the pressure therapy along with the Infrared Sauna about two weeks ago and that gave me great results as I was going through the mill with different health problems. It enabled the body to detoxify through the pressure given from the tips of your toes and fingers right through the body. .
This weekend I decided to try the Floatation tank for the first time, what can I say other than I was blown away by the experience. I didn't have great expectations of the treatment, but after this, I will be floating every chance I get. It was the most relaxing thing I have every experienced. You have the feeling of being absorbed in weightlessness in there. The experience was like an induced mindfulness session, I fell asleep and was so refreshed when it finished. I stayed in for the full hour and enjoyed every minute of it.
I thought first I would like the music and lights on, but decided not to. The darkness and quiet was just what I needed.
I couldn't recommend this experience enough to you. if you √†re toying with the idea of trying it out, go and do it, you will be pleasantly surprised as was I. üíÉüíÉ || I did a flotation followed by deep tissue massage. It‚Äôs just fabulous. Have done this combo a few times now and it is such a treat.  I feel great. Highly recommend this place, the people and the treatments! || Got given a Float session as a gift from my friend. Was apprehensive at first as I'm a bit scared of water! The staff were great and the facilities are immaculate. Took me maybe 5 mins to settle in to the pod and then I was fully relaxed. I put my back out the week before and am stressed at work. My aches and pains floated away and I had the BEST nights sleep that night!
Will definitely go back again!

name: Sauna Bhaile
address: Kilbeg, Kilbeg Pier, Co. Galway, H91 WP93, Ireland
reviews_text:
Sauna Bhaile is the best way to start your Sunday. Situated by Lough Corrib on Kilbeg Pier the scenery is breathtaking. The Sauna is best I've been in with temperatures in the wood fire burner consistently at 100 degrees nice and hot. James couldn't be more accommodating. || Perfect sauna set up with 360 degree views of the lake, the setting is absolutely stunning. You can comfortably fit 10 people inside so it's great for a big group. James is incredibly friendly, a great host and makes you feel so welcome, the delicious coffee is a nice bonus too. Great way to relax at the weekend, would recommend to anyone. || The sauna is in the most stunning location looking out on lough corrib. The sauna itself is clean and spacious with fantastic heat and scent from the wood burning stove. Booking in couldn‚Äôt be easier. Felt amazing afterwards 10/10. || Best outdoor sauna I‚Äôve been to in Ireland. üôå

Sits 10-people very, very comfortably. Super spacious and clean.

Top-notch hygiene standards, and the sauna smells great (between the natural wood & essential oils).

Epic views from inside the sauna of both Lough Corrib and of Connemara‚Äôs various mountain ranges in the distance.

The location is unmatched. If you like to take a genuine cold-plunge (and not a cold ‚Äòwalk-out-into-the-water‚Äô) - you can literally step out of the sauna and jump into 8-feet of lake water.

There‚Äôs also a ladder (with nice wide steps that don‚Äôt hurt your feet) that you can use to plunge in a more ‚Äòcontrolled‚Äô fashion!

James & The Team are great hosts. Very friendly, very knowledgeable; - and they‚Äôll always have the kettle on for any sauna-goers who fancy a hot drink. || I am blessed to live close to Lough Corrib where Sauna Bhaile pitches up at Kilbeg pier on Sunday mornings - with the possibility of some changes to the time and day for the summer months. James the sauna owner is just the best. He is concerned to provide the optimum experience for his customers and he achieves this. The location is great, the heat generated by the wood burning stove coupled with the use of lovely essential oils is perfect. And James is on hand with free coffee and chats.  I cannot recommend Sauna Bhaile highly enough.

name: Wild Irish Saunas
address: Unit 1A, Headford Rd, Galway, H91 KC6V, Ireland
reviews_text:
A really reliable company to deal with. Very efficient in everything that was asked for and quality was evident. The second such company I have dealt with but only one I would recommend. || Brilliant company with excellent customer service. Most importantly excellent quality. Finally someone easy to deal with. || Absolutely fantastic!
The Wild Irish Saunas Infrared 1 person hemlock sauna has exceeded all my expectations. It's a game-changer for my wellness routine. The hemlock wood construction gives it a beautiful aesthetic, and the infrared technology provides deep, penetrating heat therapy that leaves me feeling rejuvenated after each session. The compact size fits perfectly in my home. I highly recommend this sauna to anyone looking for a convenient way to relax and improve their overall well-being. || Great product,  great customer service and great value. üëç || Great service and great products. Reccomend highly

name: Honest Wellness Spa and Aesthetics
address: Unit 2, Tower House, Tuam Rd, Galway, H91 EFX2, Ireland
reviews_text:
10 out of 10 - My partner and I just walked out the door from the Honest Wellness Spa and honestly couldn‚Äôt recommend it highly enough. We both did a session in the flotation tank (separately) and absolutely loved it ‚Äî a deeply relaxing, very calming experience.

After that, I had a Japanese head massage and mini facial with Eleanora, and they went far beyond my expectations. The treatment was incredibly relaxing and worked wonders for the tension I tend to carry in my neck, arms, and face. I genuinely came out floating on air.

From start to finish, the whole experience was just perfect ‚Äî professional, and soothing. Truly above and beyond what we expected. Highly recommend.

Ps. Receptionist Jessica is a dote and the premises and facilities were top notch! || Its such a brilliant little hidden gem! The staff are brilliant, so friendly and helpful-  you can tell that they really care about your experience.

I have gone for a float here a few times and each time everything has been perfect- every detail thought of! Also shampoo & cond provided is actually really nice (rare for spa experiences!)

Very much looking forward to trying the head spa too! Would recommend here for anyone and great for gift vouchers! They package them so nicely as well!! || I was delighted to have discovered Honest Wellness Spa. It is certainly an oasis of peace and tranquility. The Float Therapy was a wonderful experience which I will certainly try again. I was warmly welcomed by Jessica who explained all that I needed to know about this treatment and it‚Äôs benefits. This Spa is very well managed and is spotlessly clean. The little touches like a welcome card, bottled water and a friendly atmosphere made my first visit very special. || Honest Wellness Spa are professional and  focused on making the session as relaxing and healing as possible. I left feeling, refreshed, and deeply relaxed.

If you‚Äôre looking for a skilled therapist and healer who truly understands how to tailor a treatment to your needs, I highly recommend booking with Elanor. I‚Äôll definitely be returning! || I wanted to share my experience because it genuinely made a difference. I had a total knee replacement and worked with Honest Wellness both before and after surgery. Their contrast therapy (alternating hot and cold) helped me manage swelling and stiffness and kept pain surprisingly low.

Before surgery, sessions prepared my body and mind ‚Äî I felt stronger going in. After surgery, the team tailored each visit to where I was that week. The combination of heat/cold, gentle guidance, and clear home tips meant I was sleeping better, moving sooner, and relying on less pain relief than I expected.

Everyone at Honest Wellness is professional, kind, and genuinely invested in your progress. If you‚Äôre facing a knee replacement or rehabbing an injury, I can‚Äôt recommend them highly enough. I had very little pain throughout, and I credit a big part of that to their contrast therapy and support.

name: HQ Recovery Suite & Spa
address: N17 Business Park, N 17 Galway Rd, Kilmore, Tuam, Co. Galway, H54 DC44, Ireland
reviews_text:
State of the art facilities here and well worth a visit at this gym. It is the perfect finish to a hard work out between the sauna and steam rooms. Also great selection of health food and coffee in the gym too. 5 star üåü || HQ Recovery Suite offers a fantastic recovery experience. The facilities are top-notch, and the staff are welcoming, professional, and attentive. You can really feel the care and passion they put into what they do. || Great facilities, very lucky to have something like this in Tuam, I try to get here once a week for recovery, very relaxing hour, the staff are excellent, the place is spotless, it‚Äôs a great experience, highly recommended HQ recovery suite || I visited HQ Recovery Suite & Spa for a sauna, cold plunge and jacuzzi session. Everything was absolutely fantastic! It was such a relaxing and refreshing experience from start to finish. I'll definitely be back soon! || This place is absolute heaven! It has a great variety of equipment, all working in different ways so you can stack them to maximise your recovery. There's a lounge-style area with recliner chairs for using with the compression boots, and newspapers and magazines provided too.

The spa area has a dry sauna, LED sauna, ice baths, and hot tub. It's well-maintained and very clean. You bring your own towel.

The atmosphere is cosy and relaxing, it's like a sanctuary for physical and mental wellness.

You have to book slots in advance so the place won't ever be over-crowded. There aren't lockers but HQ has the personal details of all clients, so it's quite safe. Alternatively, you can bring a small bag into the spa if you want to keep your valuables in sight or you could use the lockers in the gym.

name: Oak Smoke Sauna
address: Long point, Knockanima, Loughrea, Co. Galway, Ireland
reviews_text:
Booked a sauna on Friday and was messaged less than an hour out on Sunday to say they weren't operating that day... might be a scam operation as my family loving locally have never heard of them?! It took a lot of planning to get that time together and a babysitter so very disappointing. || 1. It's a beautiful setting;  both by the Lake and at the Slieve Aughty centre .
2. Feel invigorated and relaxed at the same time  afterwardsüî•‚ùÑÔ∏è .
3. A lovely way to meet 'like minded' people.
I give it 5 ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê || A brilliant addition to long point. Really relaxing. I love the music, and the smell, and meryn is very friendly. Highly recommend it! || Such a lovely experience. Stunning location whether at Loughrea Lake or the Slieve Aughty Centre. Couldn‚Äôt recommend enough üî• || Love using the sauna. Always a nice way to relax and wind down and you feel brilliant after it!

name: Sauna Cr√≥ga
address: pier, Cornamona, Co. Galway, Ireland
reviews_text:
Just amazing!
All 10/10. The spot, the views, the lake, the host and of course the sauna!  Very well taken care of, and with nice details like essential oils, music...
There is also a coffe truck there with the best iced matcha,üçµCorrib Coffee || Cant recommend Sauna Cr√≥ga high enough, Johnny took great care of us üôè  beautiful spot for a sauna and it's ideal for kayak rental/tours and coffee all to be located on the same pier. Will definitely be returning || Sauna Cr√≥ga is a beautiful Sauna set in a stunning location on Loch Corrib. The Sauna itself is top class and well maintained!
Overall, Sauna Cr√≥ga is a fantastic asset to the area, providing a wonderful escape for both locals and visitors alike! || Adding a new dimension to the area at evenings and weekends. Nothing better than a sauna / swim combo. Great set up! || Fantastic location with stunning lake views, a very spacious Sauna right on the pier for easy access to the lake for a dip.
