name: The Spa at The g
address: the g Hotel & Spa, Old Dublin Road, Galway, Ireland
reviews_text:
I booked a package of thermal suite and afternoon tea for my husband and me. I cannot fault the afternoon tea, but the thermal suite was not up to a five star hotel standard. Everything was broken. Door handles, lockers, various thermal jet buttons, toilet flushers, and the chairs in the relaxation room were all broken. The thermal suite itself is dark, which made me feel ick due to wondering if it was clean. The layout of the thermal suite is poor because you can't relax in the pool while someone else is getting hit by a jet stream of water that splashes everywhere. It was all in all a very underwhelming experience. The only positive was the sauna. For the price to use even the thermal suite, don't waste your money. Skip this experience. || Edited: Honestly... don't bother. Seriously overpriced and pretentious. You would get far superior treatments at your local beautician.

Total marketing nonsense.

The treatment I had was very expensive, and not a patch on what I would get from my small local beauty salon. ESPA is very overpriced and pretentious.. it was like having a young one doing a fetac level 5 course, in the midst of the work experience module giving me a massage. I was not happy, a drop of Eucalyptus in a bowl under a massage bed is not an aromatherapy massage, the oil used to massage was basic, cheap, (non aromatherapy) and has affected my skin. "Guided breathing" was also the terminology used in the advertisement of this massage, I was told to take 3 breaths into the bowl of Eucalyptus at the beginning of the massage.. and this is what constitutes to aromatherapy and guided breathing here.

My treatment had also advertised a scalp massage with rose quartz crystals, when my "massage" was over, I had no scalp massage. When I asked why, she said "oh, I don't normally do it in case it messes the ladies hair", I told her I was looking forward to it so she gave my scalp a little scratch and I went on my way. I told the lady at the desk that I was looking forward to the rose quartz scalp massage which I never got, and was supposed to be in with my ‚Ç¨155 massage to be told that this treatment isn't given due to covid ü§£

I was also charged for using the thermal suite when it advertises that it is free with treatments over a certain price (which mine was).

It states the sauna and steam room are not open due to covid, I was disappointed with this, but when I went in they were actually open, although other facilities in the thermal suite were broken. E.g., ice machine, the "tropical" and "artic mist" showers which are supposed to have aromas of flowers and mint do not.. as they are advertised, when I asked could they fix this I was looked at like I had two heads. I was also told we couldn't use the 'ice fountain' because of covid, which in my opinion is ridiculous. The steam room and sauna pose more risk theoretically.

Someone also stole my bra out of the changing room. I didn't even bother to tell them.

I would not go here again, or recommend ESPA to anyone, it's all for show. Looks the part though! || In desperate need of a renovation, the G Hotel Spa has totally lost its luster and is on its last legs. Several lockers are broken in the women‚Äôs changing room, towels were as scarce as hen‚Äôs teeth and the walls of the thermal suite are filthy. Plus they‚Äôre renovating guest rooms so the sounds of drilling and hammering permeated the treatment rooms‚Ä¶ felt like I was having a facial in a dentist office. My esthetician was lovely and she‚Äôs the ONLY reason I gave the spa 2 stars. Don‚Äôt waste your money going there until the spa gets a full makeover!!! || Booked expecting a five-star spa, but it felt more like a tired hotel gym with candles. Overpriced treatments, rushed service, and staff who didn‚Äôt seem to care. Left more stressed than when I arrived. Definitely not worth it. || the thermal room was nice and relaxation room. I booked a spa treatment, the bespoke facial. The facial was not as expected, of course cremes on your face but very minimal and no true facial & shoulder massage. I believe it was cut short as it takes a bit to ask questions in the beginning. At the end therapist had left said she would return & after 10 minutes treatment ended. it was probably 40 mins & did not meet my expectations. Unfortunately Would not pay that much for treatment again or return

name: Spirit One Spa
address: The Galmont Hotel & Spa, Lough Atalia Rd, Galway, H91 CYN3, Ireland
reviews_text: My daughter and I had a lovely relaxing deep tissue full body massage at Spirit One Spa today.  Both maria and Ibtissam were amazing! Couldn't recommend them enough. We got to chill out afterwards in the lounge with refreshments . Lovely atmosphere and very professional.  We will certainly be back! || Had a great experience at the Spirit One Spa from start to finish. The receptionists were very welcoming, the relaxation area (before you go for your treatment) is lovely and there is drinks and snacks for you to help yourself to. Sarah was my therapist today and she was brilliant, she made the experience all the more relaxing. The pool and thermal suites were lovely for after the spa, you could enjoy that space for as long as you wished. Didn‚Äôt use the gym but it‚Äôs very well equipped || Thank you Orla what a fantastic therapist you are I had such a fabulous afternoon in the spa . I had a dry floatation which was absolutely amazing  including a mini facial & head massage . I feel so relaxed but energised at the same time . I will be back very soon. Sarah Mason || We spend very good time with my husband! I always have the best massages here! I leave feeling so much betterüòá Agnieszka is amazing, very professional! Thank you so much ‚ò∫Ô∏è We came back soon. ü§© || I was looking forward to a massage here at spirit one spa as a hotel guest, as the thermal suites and relaxation rooms were lovely before the massage itself, it is a bit awkward that you have to use the upstairs gym changing rooms that can only be accessed via a lift, but the staff at reception were absolutely lovely and welcoming. however, the real let down was the massage, for the price it was, was a dreadful experience. The masseuse I was with talked for the entire duration of my massage which lasted an hour, about very personal things in her life  that were in no way appropriate for work environments and customer to client basis, it left me feeling extremely uncomfortable and  with no music either playing in the treatment room it was far from a  relaxing experience. It was a shame as it was a real let down from the rest of the experience at spirit one spa.

name: Sauna B√≥ Finne
address: 1 Sauna, Cloonamore, Inishbofin, Co. Galway, H91 X9PC, Ireland
reviews_text: OMG what an amazing sauna and hot tub, the setting is just simply stunning and Bronwyn and Dave are super hosts. If you go to boffin you cannot miss this. It‚Äôs a wonderful experience. Book it now !! || Beautifully set up sauna right on one of irelands best and cleanest beaches. Wooden stepped trail will see you walk straight into the tide after a good hearty sweat. Hot tub and plunge pool on site also. Dave and Browyn go the extra mile to make sure it is a memorable experience. || I'm in my opinion the best sea sauna in Ireland. Perched on the edge of East End Bay on the beautiful Inishbofin where the sand is white, the water crystal clear and the view of the 12 Ben's mountain range is unreal. I love the energy of this place and the gorgeous touches like the beautiful seating area and the little wooden boardwalk across the stones to ensure a pain-free walk down to the beach. The owners are so warm and friendly. I can't wait to visit again. || I Highly recommend sauna b√≥ Finne - it has the most beautiful view and the beach in front is amazing for a dip. The sauna is in great working condition, nice and hot & comfortable to enjoy. || What an amazing experience, beautiful location! Try the sauna or sauna and hot tub, we all had the best time. Thanks so much Bron and Dave for hosting us, we all enjoyed it so much! Definetely recommend, 10 out of 10!

name: Shore Island Spa
address: Lough Rea Hotel, Galway Rd, Cosmona, Loughrea, Co. Galway, Ireland
reviews_text:
We had a lovely day at shore island spa . greeted from a lovely receptionist  Jessica she was so nice and helpfull explained  everything made me a cup of tea jury my stay, My therapist  Charmian was very professional and great at her work we will be back || Travelled one hour from my home for a spray tan only to be told when I got there that they couldn't do it because I had my daughter with me. I had checked the website for any stipulation regarding same but there was no policy so I assumed there wouldn't be any issue.
I didn't argue the fact with staff as they had already been vocal in front of my daughter that she was the issue and I didn't want to further upset her so just left. Very disappointed and wouldn't recommend. || My sister and I booked in for the couples relaxation package. It was fabulous. The therapists were so professional and we really enjoyed our treatments. The thermal suite beforehand were so peaceful and well kept. Will definitely be returning to try out other treatments. A hidden gem in Loughrea. Recommend it highly. || Giving 2 stars simply as the therapist I had was a lovely person. Found the spa grimey and very lack luster for the price of it. I had a very very expensive facial and " extraction " in a very dark room. Let's just say I could have and did do a better job of cleaning my skin when I got home. Absolutely abysmal service for the cost of it. Very disappointing over all experience and will never be returning. There are many other spa's and salons in the galway area everyone should check out before considering throwing money down the drain here || Absolutely fantastic! The thermal suite was beautiful and so clean. My therapist Abina was superb.  I'll definitely be back.  Kelly on reception was super friendly &professional.  Thanks to all at Shore Island Spa for a great morning.

name: The Galmont Hotel & Spa
address: Lough Atalia Rd, Galway, H91 CYN3, Ireland
summary: Modern rooms in a stylish waterfront property with a posh spa & an indoor pool, plus 2 eateries.
reviews_text:
Spent a family reunion in Galway and decided to stay at the Galmont. Turns out there was a poker tournament on in the hotel. We had not be told about it even while talking to reservations on the day of arrival. Rooms were dated and run down. We found items from the previous guests including medication. Food was sub standard, simple low quality but expensive. The hotel entrance was a large smoking area meaning our kids and erderly parent had to inhale second hand smoke. Gym is run down, with showers not working and a steam room the is broken weekly apparently. Car park is covered in dust and abandoned cars. This is not the 1000 welcome Ireland is known for. You exist the hotel to two bus terminals and a clinic. You are on the wrong side of Galway city. Food quality and dining experience are not worth the money. If you have to stay there head out including breakfast. Off peak the hotel was expensive, I am surprised this is a 4 star. The Radisson Blu used to be a jewel in the Galway crown. || We stayed on sat 24th January, arrived and checked in, room looked beautiful,  on closer inspection,  the door to ensuite wouldn't close properly,  and the toilet wouldn't flush properly,  the door was repaired very quickly,  we had dinner in the restaurant,  for a 4* hotel we found the food average at best. Had a great night's sleep,  used the pool facilities,  all very good, clean well maintained.  Went for breakfast,  a buffet,  some of the food was dried out, very disappointing as the hotel was very busy for breakfast. So overall a pretty disappointing experience, || It‚Äôs my second time staying in this hotel & I love everything about it. However, this time I want to draw particular attention to Yolanda (I‚Äôm not sure if I spelt it correctly sorry!) but she works as a therapist in the spa & she is an excellent therapist. I have been a massage therapist myself for ten years & have worked in well established 4 & 5 star hotels. It is very hard to find a therapist who will give a decent massage & Yolanda‚Äôs massage is absolutely outstanding. I arrived with severe back pain & I walked out of the treatment room feeling like I had a brand new back. I could not recommend her enough & she is fantastic at her job! Thank you so so much, I really needed that. || Hotel has a large lobby and plenty of sitting area. Check in is slow and can be busy if you check in at a busy time.  At times I saw a line that was 5 to 6 people deep.  Luckily, the line was short when I got there around 1 pm.  Hotel gets a lot of big bus tourists as well due to proximity to dt and bus/train station.  If you are unlucky to check in around the time a big bus pulls in, you could be in a very long queue.

The rooms are spacious as well and if you are lucky, can get a room with ocean view.  However, the bathroom is small.  The shower has a deep tub but the standing shower requires you to stand basically right next to the wall.  There is also not a tub door, just a small glass for the first quarter of the tub.  While this prevents shower water from rolling out easily, the bathroom still gets wet from the shower.  If you are standing and showering, water will splash everywhere.  I had to leave a towel on the floor parallel to the tub to soak up water that splashes out.

The breakfast is large and includes most options you would want.  I am glad I paid the 15 euro for bfast as it's a reasonable price for the quantity you get.

This hotel is known for its spa.  You will find a lot of locals here on a staycation as well.  I never used the spa but you do have to go down to the spa to use the gym.  This is where I was most surprised and disappointed with the hotel.  While the gym is on the spa floor, its entrance is separate.  Even with this, the gym hours are whatever the spa hours are.  On weekdays, gym does not open till 7 am.  On weekends and Bank holidays, gym opens at 8 am.  This is surprising bc 7 am is quite late for business clients.  I was here for business and it made for very tight mornings as I had to be down there by 7 to ensure I get a proper bfast, come back up to shower and get ready, and grab bfast before I need to be at work by 9.  The only connection to spa is the elevator you have to use (which is locked outside those hours) and you have to sign in at the spa desk.  I strongly recommend the hotel reconsider this policy.  If it could open the gym earlier, it provides flexibility to the guests and follows standard practice across most hotels.

Speaking of gym, its a very long gym that seems to have expanded over time.  The first 'room' is the biggest and has most of the machines you would want.  It also includes treadmills.  Once you past this room, you come to the free weights room and two other open space rooms. The free weights room is extremely out dated.  It looks like they took equipment that people were throwing away and bought it for free.  As you can see from the pictures, the equipment looks very rusted. They need to refresh this equipment.  The initial room doesnt have this issue; most of the equipment there is new or looks fresh.  However, there are a couple where the cushions are ripped and need to be replaced.

Overall, I give the hotel a 4. It has a nice restaurant, lobby, and spacious rooms.  But they lose a star for bathroom and most importantly the gym timing and quality of free weights. || The staff were nice, breakfast was good and the room was fine.
Unfortunately the function room below us was in full swing and no consideration was given to any of the people asleep in the rooms above. The noise level was so loud and the DJ definitely turned up the volume at 12:30 so to ensure that everyone above or near the function room was not going to get any sleep.
Not a place I would return to anytime soon.

name: Ocean Fitness Leisure Club
address: Salthill Hotel, Salthill, Galway, Ireland
reviews_text:
Love the classes and instructors at Ocean Fitness.  The classes are very popular and getting a spot may be an issue but the waitlist facility is very handy.  Great pool, great sauna and great facilities upstairs.  And I love the location as it is so close to the sea! || Top class facility in Ocean Fitness.  Something to suit everybody in relation to individual needs and abilities.
The staff are more than willing to help, and indeed, often go above and beyond their remit.
I always find them friendly,  and bearing in mind the early start and late finishing times, it should be appreciated. || Lockers difficult to use for anyone with vision difficulties and apparently some women think it's ok to enter the mens changing room just cause their husbands and kids are in there... no it's not ok, do better. || Disappointing experience overall.
The facilities are below the standard I‚Äôd expect, and staff interactions have often felt unwelcoming. Being asked to leave before the advertised closing time is frustrating, and repeated issues with the car park barriers add to the inconvenience. The gym does not live up to the premium price that you pay for membership. || Awful customer service, they have two of the rudest receptionists I have ever come across on front desk, the dark haired girl that was there today and the mixed raced lady that is there on other occasions.  Have been in there numerous times, not a hello, goodbye, thank you, throw the card at you when validating car ticket and leave you standing at the dest and maje no eye contact. No interest in discussing gym options. Awful. They need to take a leaf out of the blonde guy's manner who works with them who couldn't be nicer. There are plenty of jobs elsewhere for these two girls who should be not facing the public and iam not the first person who had said so. They surely can't be having a bad day every day.

name: The Seaweed Centre
address: Lettermullan, Galway, H91 CH7X, Ireland
reviews_text:
Sarah is a wonderful welcoming host. We had private access to the steam room and seaweed bath room. Loved the attention to detail and care. Had lovely a facial and massage.  and left the centre feeling incredibly relaxed. Will return again and definitely recommend this lovely little place a visit. || We had a brilliant experience at the Seaweed Centre. Sarah was so nice and friendly and we would reccomend anyone to give the seaweed baths a go! A very relaxing experience and our skin felt lovely afterwards. || What a delightful experience. The rooms are gorgeous, everything is immaculate, Sarah is a  gem of a host and wonderful source of local knowledge. From the steam room start, to the calming bath waters, to the delightful post bath snack, it was all perfect.
Don‚Äôt miss out on this lovely Connemara experience. || Sarah was such a delight and made our experience perfection! This experience was incredible from start to finish. We enjoyed the steam room, the nice, warm baths full of seaweed, and the delightful (and unique) fruit salad after! It was such a relaxing afternoon, and I‚Äôm eager to go again! || We spent a weekend in Clifden this January and were disappointed to find that most seaweed bath spas were closed‚Äîuntil we stumbled upon The Seaweed Centre, and what a hidden gem it turned out to be!

We rang on the day, and Sarah was incredibly friendly and accommodating, fitting us in for the last appointment at 5 pm. After a day of hiking Diamond Hill, this was the perfect way to unwind. From the moment we arrived, Sarah made us feel so welcome, and there was absolutely no rush.

The experience itself was fantastic‚Äîthe steam room was the perfect way to start before plunging into the rejuvenating seaweed bath. We soaked for a full hour, completely relaxing and letting the seaweed work its magic. Afterward, we were treated to a delicious fruit salad, a thoughtful touch that made the experience even more special.

Sarah also shared some great recommendations for places to explore on the island, adding to our adventure. I would highly recommend The Seaweed Centre to anyone visiting the area‚Äîit's a must-do for relaxation and well-being!

name: Leisureland
address: Upper Salthill Rd, Galway, Ireland
reviews_text:
Fr John Misty brought us here. Great Gig, Leisureland Is a great venue, plenty space for parking, staff nice and it's a very safe spot. Only conplaint I have is, the Air Con. Could be so much better. Everyone was sopping by end of night. Otherwise, toilets clean, easy if you are in wheelchair. || Went here today with my young family. The kiddies pool was closed, slides closed and no aquapark,  but no mention of any of these closures on their website before we went there. The water in the pool was freezing, had to bring my smallest child out of pool after 40 mins due to blue quivering lips from the cold water and what seemed like no heating on in pool or changing areas.
I would not be going back here. We were so disappointed. || Super day out with the kids. Good size family changing rooms. Kids loved the waterslide. Not to busy. ‚Ç¨32 for a family of 5 (2 adultd & 3 kids) Nice little coffee shop.
Parking is ‚Ç¨2 per hour or ‚Ç¨12 for the day. || I rarely leave negative reviews, as I understand mistakes can happen‚Äîbut this really needs to be addressed.
We visited the swimming pool for the first time in a long while, and our kids were so excited. Unfortunately, the excitement quickly faded when we found out that half the pool was closed due to maintenance. Fair enough‚Äîwe still paid full price, which we didn‚Äôt mind, assuming everything else would be up to standard.

But what shocked us was the level of dirt and neglect throughout the facility. The floors, changing rooms, and bathrooms were all visibly dirty, and there was a strong smell of urine that made the experience both unpleasant and unhygienic. It raises serious concerns about cleanliness and potential health risks.

This place clearly needs a deep clean and better ongoing maintenance. Really disappointing. || We skated, it was horrible! The skates are rusty and dull. The rink is all scratched. No one even cleans it! We expected the best, I don't recommend it!

name: Aran Seaweed Baths and Spa
address: Lighthouse Road An Fhormna, Inis Oirr Aran Islands, Inisheer, Co. Galway, H91 VH56, Ireland
reviews_text:
I highly recommend the seaweed baths and a full body massage! I feel absolutely amazing after my treatments. Annette is so friendly and professional. A gorgeous chill out area as well. I‚Äôll be definitely back again soon. Thank you Annette :) || Absolutely magical hidden gem on the lovely inis oirr. Annette is in a league of her own, best massage I‚Äôve ever had. Had the best time at the new sauna, hot tub and cold plunge area. Sensational views that just ease any stress on the mind. Come out a new woman every time. Will be back again soon || Managed to DM and get in for a seaweed bath!!!   This is a must while you‚Äôre on the island, so make it easier on yourself And book ahead!   I will now look for a seaweed bath at every opportunity!  My husband and I both loved the experience!!! || Two visits during our stay on Inis O√≠rr to Annette‚Äôs wonderful spa.
I was very pleased to enjoy a 60 minute Swedish full body massage from Mabs on both occasions, which was excellent and good value.  Mabs applied exactly the right pressure using excellent grape oil.
I enjoyed a post-massage sauna on the first occasion and a relaxing herbal tea overlooking the beautiful O‚ÄôBrien‚Äôs Castle on my second visit.
I highly recommend the experience and hospitality from Annette and Mabs. || Exceeded my expectations! This place is a total gem on Inis Oirr ‚Äî highly recommend it. I had an excellent Swedish massage from MABs, who was very attuned to my numerous knots and sore muscles. And my complexion is glowing after a facial from Annette. Annette has recently added a stunning addition to the spa, with a wood-fired sauna and hot tub, cold plunge tub, lounge area, and changing rooms. The level of finish throughout the entire spa is extremely impressive. It was a wonderful way to spend a rainy afternoon on the island. If you‚Äôre visiting Inis Oirr, definitely put this on your list!

name: Seaweed Leaf Baths
address: Barna Rd, Ahaglugger, Bearna, Co. Galway, H91 Y3KA, Ireland

name: Sunset Sauna Kerry & Beara (Coorna Cafe)
address: Coornagillagh, Tuosist, Co. Kerry, Ireland
reviews_text: Delighted with the experience, especially Trevor, he was very nice and gave us tea üíú Thank you so much, 10 out of 10. He gave us really good recommendation for dinner and sleep. I hope will gossip with him again ü´∂üèº Up the rebels ‚ù§Ô∏èüí™üèº || Such a lovely experience! The sauna was set up with hats, water and everything we needed. Felt so nice to dip in the ocean. Alice was so helpful and friendly - thank you! || A group of us seized the last day of 2025 with a very enjoyable session spent alternately poaching in the sauna and dipping in the bracingly cold sea. We loved it! It was by parts relaxing and exhilarating, and it really set us up for the day. Cannot recommend it enough! We‚Äôll definitely be back when we‚Äôre next back in Kerry, and will be recommending it to friends and family who live nearby. Thanks Alice for a great experience! || So happy we visited this beautiful hidden gem just outside Kenmare. Enjoyed a lovely sauna with stunning views. The delicious food and coffee afterwards are a must have. Alice and Adam are lovely and welcoming people. This place should not be missed when visiting Kerry! || Alice was so warm and welcoming! Sauna was warm, clean and had towels on seat! 10/10 worth the spin out!

name: Kingdom Sauna Kerry
address: Derrynane Beach, Darrynane More, Caherdaniel, Co. Kerry, Ireland
reviews_text: Great sauna and beautiful location. Would highly recommend to anyone in the area || A fabulous experience in an incredibly beautiful location.  I was very lucky with the weather, blue skies and a flat calm sea, but whatever the weather Kingdom Sauna is a must. You will be amazed how good you feel afterwards. Simply Stunning a must visit.  I will definitely be backüëèüëèüëèüëè || Great experience, clean, friendly , lovely scenic views and a stone throw from the cold ocean dip. Couldnt ask for more! || A great addition to the area! Really enjoyable experience overall - easy to book and a very relaxing sauna session. Can‚Äôt wait for another one! || Great addition to derrynane beach. Thanks Katie for looking after us today. We‚Äôll be back!

name: Fenit Lighthouse Sauna
address: Fenit Within, Co. Kerry, Ireland
reviews_text:
Fenit Lighthouse Sauna is a uniquely charming experience. The wood-fired heat sauna is wonderfully soothing after a cold dip, (make sure you go to the sea first)and the views of Fenit Lighthouse and the Bay are just magical, making it a perfect spot to unwind, and enjoy the views, staff are so friendly and it‚Äôs extremely well run, make sure to bring flip flops or shoes going down to the sea and get a coffee afterwards! Would highly recommend || I had the loveliest experience at the Fenit Lighthouse Sauna. The location is just magic  just heavenly. The sauna itself is spotless, high-end, cosy and welcoming, and you come out feeling completely refreshed. The mix of heat and sea swim is just unbeatable. The staff were so friendly and made the whole visit really relaxed and easy. I‚Äôd highly recommend it to anyone visiting Kerry such a treat and something I‚Äôll definitely be back for. || A friend recommended trying the Sauna and sea dip combination a couple of months ago and it is absolutely amazing. The view from the sauna is breathtaking. The owner Maryanne and her daughter are so nice and helpful, guiding us, so as to get the best out of our timeslot. I had never swam in the ocean when the sun wasn't shining, yet the sauna/sea dip combination is something that is enjoyable in sunshine and in the rain. A cold outdoor shower is provided if you don't want a dip in the ocean. Large buckets with lids are provided to store your belongings while you're using the Sauna.
Sauna hats, small towels to sit on and swim shoes are available to use if you forget to bring your own. Watch the time while in the ocean, as your time slot can slip away while enjoying the ocean. Truly amazing. || I visited Fenit Lighthouse Sauna with a group of my friends over the weekend for the first time. We really enjoyed the experience and was only sorry that we didn't go for an hour instead of the half hour slot. The owner Maryanne was so kind and even gave us sliders to go down to the water as we forgot ours.
Would highly recommend! || I booked Fenit Lighthouse Sauna for a recent work event and it was a great success.  MaryAnn was great to deal with, efficient and professional.  The setting is beautiful and I would highly recommend this experience for individuals or groups.  A wonderful experience for all, thank you!

name: Happy Days Sauna
address: Beach, Banna, Co. Kerry, Ireland
reviews_text:
I‚Äôd be lost without happy days sauna. It‚Äôs part of my weekly routine! It gets me out and ready for the day such a lovely way to socialise especially now the colder weather is coming more reason to enjoy a HOT sauna ‚ò∫Ô∏è Darren and the team are all so welcoming and up for the chats! Never seen banna beach busier and so many people in the water üåä
To top it off it‚Äôs a massive way to improve mental health so many benefits !! || My first time at the sauna last weekend and absolutely loved it. Went at high tide and lovely to be able to dip into the sea in between. Lovely sense of community here too. Very disappointed to hear the sauna may not be able to operate during the winter months , as this is the time of year people would really benefit from such an amenity || A Beautiful and impeccably clean sauna in Banna, with the best view! A wonderful addition to the beach adding to the well-being of locals and visitors alike. Selfishly hoping the sauna-wellbeing culture takes off in Kerry like other counties! || Banna is in my opinion the best beach around and the addition of this sauna has made it even better. Great sauna and really friendly and welcoming people running it. Looking forward to using it over the winter... || Absolutely loving it! A fantastic addition to beautiful Bana Beach ‚Äî it‚Äôs been a long time coming, but well worth the wait. Delighted to finally have the opportunity to visit over the weekend and leave feeling completely relaxed ‚Äî both body and mind. Highly recommended.

name: Rossbeigh Sauna
address: beach, Rossbeigh, Co. Kerry, V93 YY26, Ireland
reviews_text: It's a personal relationship with nature, yes it breaks my heart too! I want to learn as much as possible of how great Our Creator is. Amen. || I absolutely love it here! I have been visiting nearly every week since they opened, and each session leaves me feeling completely rejuvenated. The staff are incredibly friendly and welcoming, always making me feel right at home. The coffee is delicious, adding an extra touch of delight to my visits. I've also participated in the yoga retreats, which felt like a fabulous mini holiday right on my doorstep. This place has truly become a cherished part of my routine. Highly recommended! || Especially great service.Excellent place for relax and have a good sauna time.Even I was  late they gave a small  bit extra time.I‚Äôm so satisfied and happy.Thank a million üëç || Great experience. Having 2 ice baths, cold shower and a changing area was a great bonus! Can‚Äôt wait to return again! Lady working there was also super helpful! || Amazing experience, great views, extremely friendly and helpful, ice bath and sauna is a great combo and a cabin for hot/cold drinks and snacks is an excellent addition too 10/10

name: Inch Sauna - Both√°n na Mara
address: Inch, Inch Beach, Co. Kerry, Ireland
reviews_text: A lovely experience. Great place and great people. A few thoughtful touches  to make us feel very welcome. We will be back. Ed || Absolutely great experience and I'll definitely be back. Beautiful location, really friendly & helpful staff and clean and comfortable. Overlooking Inch Beach, this is such a great way to spend 45 minutes. || A very well run sauna. Nice and clean. Perf temp, amazing views, lovely owners. Thank you! || Love this Sauna, best one I have ever been to! Great owner! Beautiful location! Will be back! || Great location right next to the beach, very friendly staff :)

name: Aqua Dome
address: Aqua Dome, Tralee, Co. Kerry, V92 T6TW, Ireland
reviews_text:
Really loved this place. There are four different types of saunas. You can also get a six-month membership ‚Äî very good family prices. That‚Äôs what we‚Äôre planning to do next. The pools are great, and it‚Äôs an excellent place for families with kids as well as for couples. We liked everything. || Absolutely horrible experience!

Place is old and not really well maintained, lockers are tiny and won‚Äôt fit everything you might have, showers are filthy with no hair dryer and freezing arctic air around pool area.
Spa area looks nice and you have 2 saunas and 2 steam rooms, but it is not a quiet area at all, as advertised by the many signs there. || My dad took me here countless times when I was a kid and we were on holidays in Tralee. Now I take my young family when we're in Kerry. Its very well maintained especially considering how long its been going! We were just here most recently on New Year's Day and the kids had a great time as always! || Nice place to relax with kids, wasn't very busy anytime we were there. Beside the pool there are few different saunas plus cold pool to dip in after sauna. Easy drive from Ennis/Limerick or Cork. All day adult ticket cost 18 euros, family discounts available. || Aqua Dome Tralee: A Chilly Trip Down Memory Lane ü•∂

Visited today‚Äîit's still stuck in 2015s. One tiny slide, 15-minute wait in Arctic air. Pool so cold I was grateful for my shortie wetsuit yes! I remembered it used to be freezing out there!. Showers: lukewarm roulette wait time 10 min. Lockers a complete joke you hardly can fit one bag into it. Drying area: chaos. Hand dryers mounted like booby traps‚Äîkids nearly scalped. Everyone huddled around one socket like it‚Äôs the last campfire on Earth.

Only win? The rapid river and wave pool‚Äîkids loved it. But honestly, unless you're a penguin or a socket-hunting parent, there's not much to stay for.

Verdict: Time to defrost and invest.

name: The Spa at Muckross
address: Muckross Rd, Dromyrourk, Killarney, Co. Kerry, V93 NH5W, Ireland
reviews_text:
I brought my Dad to the Spa on a very wet day in Killarney. It was a last minute booking so we were delighted to get in out of the rain and enjoy a morning of pure relaxation. Thank you to the lovely reception staff. We both agreed that the treatmets were 5*, my therapist Fillipa did a Portuguese type back massage and it was probably the best I've ever had. The serene surroundings of the vitality suite were so beautiful and calming also. The only reason I didn't give this 5 stars is because I think it was a little bit too pricey for Killarney, but that is a management issue and the floor staff in the Spa itself were all amazing! I would highly recommend it and I know they do Spa Day deals from time to time too that might bring down the regular pricing. || I can't express strongly enough how wonderful this spa is!  The entire place was super calming and peaceful.  Between the excellent massages my husband and I got, the refreshments served right after and the vitality suite amenities, we were in pampered heaven.  Best spa experience EVER!!!  Wish I could add photos but it would have been so wrong to take any in this soothing atmosphere.

The brochures and online site are great but it's even better in person.  Loved it and wish i could give them extra points!!! || Had an absolutely fabulous time here. The setting is perfect, I was treated like royalty from the moment I walked through the very impressive lobby. The spa is immaculate and superbly maintained. I got brought into a beautifully decorated room where I filled out the mandatory form and given some lovely herbal tea,  from there,  I was shown the changing rooms, which were in excellent condition from top to bottom. I was then brought to the vitality area where I could avail of many relaxing and soothing activities including hot beds, ice shower and saunas. I then met Maryanne, an extremely professional therapist who brought me to the treatment room and talked me through everything and asked me was there anything I would like to know. I felt very at ease throughout and had the best massage I have ever received. Afterwards,  I was brought to the relaxation area and given refreshments including a lovely lemon gelato. During my visit, I was made feel extremely appreciated and I look forward to going back. I would recommend the spa to anyone visiting the Muckross Park. || 5 Star service in every way. Beautifully  appointed bedrooms, suites & The Presidential  Suite on our latest stay 16th March 2023 3 nights . Quiet room. Huge for special  occasions just perfect.
Truffles, red & white wine, chocolates, macaroons welcome note all a lovely surprise  as always. The fine dining  & casual dining amazing . Such an excellent t choice of menus. Food flavours and fusion exquisite and presented amazingly.
The team are just so personable from Front of house to restaurants, bars and housekeeping. So much to see and do near by. Muckross Abbey, Park.
The Spa here is a santuary a haven and rest feom the hustle and bustle. Great team here also who genuine  care.
Thank you Muckross Park Hotel.  Susan  & Dermot || Had a wonderful Spa day at Muckross. Very relaxing. Possibly my favourite spa in Kerry. A big thank you to Michelle for being so welcoming and kind to my husband and I. We certainly recommend coming here.

name: Sneem Seaweed Baths
address: Goldens Cove, Drimna Beg, Sneem, Co. Kerry, Ireland
reviews_text:
Our seaweed bath was one of the highlights of our trip to Ireland! From the moment we reached out to book, everything was so personal and easy. The website directed us to email Brendan to arrange a morning, afternoon, or evening session. We mentioned we‚Äôd be driving the Ring of Kerry and might arrive a little late, and he couldn‚Äôt have been kinder‚Äîhe even encouraged us not to miss the stunning Kerry Cliffs before heading over. It turned out to be perfect timing for a sunset soak!
When we arrived, the wooden barrels were already filled with perfectly hot water, ready for us to slip in and relax. We were greeted enthusiastically by Milo, the cutest dog in the world, which made the welcome even more special.
Brendan himself is genuinely one of the nicest people you‚Äôll ever meet. We had such great conversation with him‚Äîhe used to be a tour guide, so he had amazing recommendations for the rest of our trip. His warmth and passion made the whole experience even more memorable.
This was truly an unforgettable experience and an absolute must-do if you‚Äôre anywhere near the area. Watching the sun set from a hot seaweed bath, surrounded by Irish scenery and good company, was pure magic! || If I could have one hour of my Wild Atlantic Way trip again, I'd take this one.

Despite it being January, I watched an otter splash around the emptied harbour and a wading egret. Behind them, the rolling mountains, sprinkled with sunspots.

All I had to do was I sit in wooden barrel of warm water with seaweed.

For a whole hour.

It was the best bath I ever had. || This place is honestly a hidden gem‚Äî not just for the price & experience, but for Brendan & Milo too! Our group of 4 had such a lovely time lounging in the baths overlooking the estuary, and Brendan was so accommodating when we ended up running behind schedule. In addition to the luxurious seaweed bath, we got to play with Milo who loves to try & catch water splashes. When we were first getting set up, Brendan was so chatty & cheerful asking about our itinerary and plans for our trip, and telling us about the process of collecting and soaking the seaweed. He went out of his way to provide recommended changes to our plans and even drew us a map of how to plan out our time. All of his recommendations were top notch and made our trip that much better. I would make the Sneem Seaweed Baths a habit if they were closer to me, and would definitely recommend anyone traveling to that part of Ireland stop in at least once for a soak! || What a wonderful way to spend an hour; in a seaweed hot tub overlooking beautiful bay and scenery. Invigorated and silky ! Thanks to Brendan for giving us great trip planning advice and Milo for playing with Trevor whilst we bathed ! || I will go back here EVERY time I‚Äôm in Ireland! The seaweed bath was incredible and the views were breathtaking. Most of all Brendan is a class act! He gave us a ton of advice and recommendations that helped us with the rest of our trip. Very friendly and personable. His assistant, Milo was too! üêï Also, Sneem is a hidden gem of a town! It is definitely worth a visit.

name: Skellig Sauna @ Ballinskelligs Beach
address: Ballinskelligs beach, Castlecross, Ballinskelligs, Co. Kerry, V23 YT54, Ireland
reviews_text:
I got in touch with Colin about making a group booking for a special occasion. From the first email he was friendly, prompt and communicative. He also went above and beyond to help us organise a yoga class at The ReWild Studio. He recommended local eateries and points of interest to help us make the most of our trip - the ones we visited were brilliant.
His sauna at Ballinskelligs beach is clean, well-maintained and located right beside a caf√©. It was perfect for heating up in after a dip in the sea!

name: B√©al Geal Sauna & Coffee (Splashsports)
address: Magherabeg, Castlegregory, Co. Kerry, Ireland
reviews_text:
A must-do when you‚Äôre in Castlegregory!
An absolutely fantastic sauna experience ‚Äì breathtaking views from the sauna and incredibly relaxing.

The sauna was spotless, and the fresh water shower was a bonus. We also loved how easy it was to access the beach for a cold water dip ‚Äì so refreshing!

Booking was simple; we reserved our spot online through the SplashSports website.

We 100% enjoyed the experience and can‚Äôt wait to return.
Thanks to all the fabulous staff at B√©al Geal Sauna! || Went to Beal Gael Sauna today for the first time.  Had already been a few times this week for their delicious coffee ‚ÄúPonaire‚Äù.  But had yet to try the Sauna.  What can I say ‚Ä¶only fantastic!  From the minute we arrived we were so well looked after by Charlotte and her team.  The sauna was lovely, and a great view of tralee bay.  When you need to cool down you can go in the sea a few short steps away, or in the refreshing shower directly outside.   Can‚Äôt wait to go back for more coffee and Sauna ‚òïÔ∏è || The sauna is beautiful and staff so so friendly. There‚Äôs a shower to cool down and also a pier to jump off if you‚Äôre feeling braver. Overall I couldn‚Äôt fault it! üî• || ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
Did the new sauna at Beal Geal Saunas in Castlegregory today while the kids were off enjoying the trampolines ‚Äî absolute bliss! The whole place was spotless, and the freshwater shower afterwards was incredible. Such a peaceful, rejuvenating experience. Can‚Äôt wait to return tomorrow! The staff are amazing so friendly, I hope your new business is a massive success üôå ||

name: Skellig Sauna @ St. Finian's Bay
address: St. Finian's Bay, Rathkieran, Ballinskelligs, Co. Kerry, Ireland
reviews_text: The Sauna is always spotlessly clean and in a stunning location with a great view. I‚Äôve been a good few times and it never disappoints. The sea is a hop skip and a jump away maybe 2 when the tide is out.  10/10 || I've been to many saunas around Ireland but Skellig Sauna tops them all. St Finian's Bay is one of the nicest beaches in the country with clear water, white sand and the Skelligs in the background. The sauna is right on the beach so you can take in the view while relaxing inside. Colin and the team keep the sauna in great condition and regulate the temperature perfectly. A must do if you're in the area. || One of the best sauna views and locations in the country! We Popped up to driftwood afterwards for dinner and drinks

name: Tide Side Sauna
address: Sandhill Rd, Ballybunnion, Ballybunion, Co. Kerry, Ireland
reviews_text: A must visit if you are visiting Ballybunion! Unreal location and amazing view from inside the sauna! It‚Äôs right next to the beach and the marine! The sauna was lovely and hot, and the cold plunges are kept at a nice temperature. Plenty of parking nearby also! Great service and sauna experience üëè || Gorgeous sauna experience, really clean, nice and hot! And a lovely community spirit really friendly :) would highly recommend! || Fantastic sauna in a great location! Views are spectacular at sunset & easy to go for a sea swim during the session || A fantastic sauna experience in ballybunion with Tide Side Sauna would highly rec ! || Perfect!

name: ESPA at The Europe
address: 3C8H+G2, Fossa, Mahony's Point, Co. Kerry, Ireland
reviews_text:
ESPA at The Europe Hotel is truly a world-class wellness experience.
From the moment you walk in, the atmosphere feels calm, luxurious, and deeply relaxing. The facilities are exceptional, the treatments are top-tier, and the staff are incredibly professional and welcoming. Whether you‚Äôre visiting for a quick escape or a full spa day, it‚Äôs the perfect place to unwind and rejuvenate || Great spa, but the upstairs area is gender segregated . I got the Half Day Ritual with Eleanor, and she was so wonderful!! So friendly, kind, and a hell of a masseuse! 10/10 || I had a fabulous massage at the Europe today. The facilities and service is top class. My massage by Emily was perfect. She was very professional and felt very comfortable with her. She gave a great massage || Emily is an amazing massage therapist. I recently had a baby and had the aromatherapy massage, I left feeling refreshed and like a new person. There‚Äôs a relaxation area, sauna, steam room and thermal pool (upstairs, not the one on the same level as the pool) which is refreshing to use. || Great spa, but the upstairs area is gender segregated

name: Parknasilla Resort & Spa
address: Derryquin, Co. Kerry, V93 EK71, Ireland
summary: Antique furnished rooms and suites offering fine dining, a 12-hole golf course and a luxe spa.
reviews_text:
Superb stay here for a couple of nights in October. The grounds are very nice and the location is close to Sneem which Is ok to venture in to check out in an evening for a dinner/drink. The best Negronis I‚Äôve ever tasted in the bar in the hotel but A bit short staffed at times. The room was very comfortable. If I had one complaint it would be the breakfast was average and needs improving to match the rest of the stay. || A short but memorable stay...enjoyed delicious food in Doolittle bar with cocktail üç∏ and music. Room while small was very adequate and staff are truly amazing. Breakfast options are simply amazing. Hotel was extremely busy but every guest matters. The Infinity pool is truly a wonderful way to both start and end the day. || We had a lovely stay for my Fianc√©'s birthday. Service was outstanding- especially Igor in the restaurant he always had a big smile and made us feel very welcome. There was plenty of relaxing activities available at the hotel and in such a scenic setting. We loved the spa and infinity pool || Staff on arrival were very friendly and helpful. Room was clean and comfortable. Spa was relaxing and my therapist was very friendly and polite. The dinner and breakfast was very nice came out very quick and was hot and fresh. Facilities were lovely. Beautiful scenery. Will definitely be returning soon. || Pros:
Beautiful historic hotel in a very scenic location by the sea.
Lots of great trails to explore the property.
Easy on site parking.
Great restaurant for breakfast and dinner.
Infinity pool has great ocean view.
Sauna and pools were very clean.

Cons:
No air conditioning.
No elevator to the room we stayed in.
Pool and spa closes by 8pm. So it is hard to do both dinner and enjoy the pool after checking in. You are forced to stay for 2 nights to really enjoy the pool and spa facilities.

name: Ventry Bay Beach
address: Unnamed Road, Cantra, Co. Kerry, Ireland
reviews_text:
Fantastic white sandy beach. Unfortunately a lot of erosion of beach and sand dunes over the years with nothing being done about it  but great for swimmers , walkers , kite surfers, canoeists and kayakers || Very nice long beach with lovely sand and easy step to water.Lifeguard on duty clean toilets and shower at the entrance/exit  to the beach.Just the car park is not the biggest so in sunny day could be a problem to park. || Ventry beach: Ceann Tr√°
First timers here at this Blue Flag beach (Tr√° le Brat Gorm). It is a semicircular sheltered picturesque sandy family friendly beach in a Gaeltacht area near Dingle with lifeguards on duty in summer months, outdoor Shower, bins and public toilets as well as a caravan holiday park. We secured parking but it was very busy when we were leaving and we noticed an overspill carpark near the road enroute to continue our Slea Head tour. We hit a glorious rare day here (best day of our 2 week stint in Kerry in July and August) which colours positively your view of a beach significantly but my family (husband and 2 kids under age of 5) thoroughly enjoyed their dip, building sandcastles. My husband and I tagteamed so that we could both savour a lone walk in the sunshine with views of the Iveragh peninsula and the glistening Atlantic ocean. Would definitely return when in the environs again and a must stop on the Slea Head drive . || Nice little sandy, shallow warm water and swimming option near a caravan park. || Amazing beach for swimmers. Miles and miles of golden sand. Top beach for swimming - no big waves most of the time.

Don‚Äôt bother with the village entrance of it is busy. Continue West until you reach Paudie O‚ÄôSheas pub and park down the side road. Large car park at church and 5 minute walk to the beach.

name: Caragh Lake House and Lakeside Sauna
address: House, Glannagilliagh, Caragh Lake, Co. Kerry, V93 R2C8, Ireland
reviews_text:
Flawless vacation: from panoramic views to cozy evenings by the fire.
We stayed at this guesthouse for New Year 2026 celebration and were absolutely delighted. This place is a rare find where modern comfort and nature merge into one.
What especially impressed us:
Atmosphere and coziness: The house has chic panoramic windows, through which the pine trees and lake seem part of the interior. In the evenings, we lit the firepit ‚Äî it created the magical relaxing atmosphere.
Outdoors and leisure: The territory is magnificently designed with barbecue area. Sitting by the open fire in the evening viewing pine trees and the lake is a special pleasure. There is absolute silence around, disturbed only by the sounds of nature.
Attention to detail: There really is everything for comfort here; every little thing is thought out, from kitchen utensils to convenient bathroom amenities (robes, slippers, towels, etc.)
For children: There is a lot of free space for children, they were always busy with outdoor activities, including inside and outside golf.
Service: The host is very attentive and hospitable, was always in touch, and made sure our vacation was perfect.
Conclusion: After the sauna, walks by the lake, and evenings by the fireplace, we feel completely rested. I definitely recommend this place for a family vacation or a reset! || A beautiful house in an amazing location. Just back from a memorable weekend with friends. We went Kayaking followed by a sauna. The rooms were very comfortable, wine and supplies left by Ettiene, a great host!! We had an incredible meal in Carrig house on Saturday evening, and lunch the following day in Bunkers bar in Killorglin, watching Man U beat Liverpool on Sunday which really topped off a great weekend!! And we returned to the house on Sunday evening to be greeted by 2 wild deer in the garden!! || This is a truly special place to stay. The house is stunning, as you would expect; even moreso are the grounds, with the lawn sweeping down to a long strip of rocky lakeshore - spend some time down there surrounded by trees, rocks and the sounds of the lake, taking in the extraordinary views, and feel the weight lift from your shoulders. Kayaking is a really important part of the experience here, the lake seems very safe and it's so easy to spend a few hours paddling around the nearby island and inlets , using the wetsuits and kayaks provided. Jump in for a quick swim afterwards and then relax in the sauna, which is excellent, as good as you'd find in any health club. We had some plans for Carauntoohill but the property was so nice we spent all our time there, and on the lake, instead. The whole setup, with the panoramic views and the lakeshore, is a bit like having your own private version of the Europe hotel. Carrig House nearby serves amazing food in a beautiful old-style dining room. Etienne was an unfailingly brilliant host, you couldn't ask for more. Hope we'll be back! || We just had an incredible weekend at this unique and special place. It was the perfect venue for our birthday celebrations and both the adults and children had a wonderful time. Lots of activities, games, and books. The attention to detail, flowers, food snacks on arrival made us feel very special. Ettienne is a thoughtful and generous host. The views are stunning with the scene changing constantly. Cannot recommend enough. || This is a beautiful quiet location  wonderful views very comfortable for a large family. There is six bedrooms beautiful dining room barbecue area..

2  yoga  mats
3 kayaks
A body board
A sauna that takes 6 people comfortably but could fit 8

name: B√° Fh√≠on√°in /St. Finian's Bay
address: Rathkieran, Co. Kerry, Ireland
reviews_text:
This is a wonderful place! We were here on January 1st. There were a lot of surfers, some were just getting ready to leave, others were in full swing. A great bay for surfing and just swimming. I'm looking forward to summer and warm water))). || Not a must stop but its very beautiful if you like the beach. Amazing waves from the wild Atlantic and its a good view. || Lovely spot for swim and sauna. Two eating options across the road but both closed mid week in October || Small beach but with great view || During the filming of Irish film "The Cathach of FIONN√ÅN" Our visit to St. Fionn√°n's Bay was nothing short of magical, as we had the privilege of witnessing the filming of scenes before heading out to the iconic Skellig Michael. Tucked away along the rugged coastline, this hidden gem held a special significance as the location of St. Fionn√°n's holy well of healing.

As we arrived at St. Fionn√°n's Bay, we were immediately struck by its ethereal beauty. The crystal-clear waters shimmered under the golden rays of the sun, while the ancient cliffs loomed majestically in the background, their weathered faces bearing witness to centuries of history and legend.
But it was the holy well of healing that truly captured our imagination. Nestled amidst a grove of ancient trees, its waters were said to possess miraculous powers of healing and renewal. The air was thick with a sense of reverence and awe as we approached this sacred site, knowing that we stood on hallowed ground.

For filmmakers, St. Fionn√°n's Bay provided the perfect setting to capture moments of wonder and mysticism. From the tranquil waters to the lush greenery that surrounded the holy well, every aspect of this magical location seemed to radiate with a sense of otherworldly beauty.

As we watched the scenes being filmed, it was clear that St. Fionn√°n's Bay held a special place in the hearts of all involved. There was a sense of reverence and respect for the ancient traditions and legends that permeated this sacred landscape, infusing the film with a depth and authenticity that was truly captivating.

Our visit was a journey into the heart of Irish mythology and spirituality. The beauty and magic of this special place left an indelible impression on us, and we were grateful for the opportunity to witness its splendour firsthand. As we prepared to depart for Skellig Michael, we carried with us the memories of St. Fionn√°n's Bay, knowing that its sacred waters would forever hold a place in our hearts.

name: Treehouse Sauna
address: LIFFEYVALE NURSERIES, Osberstown, Naas, Co. Kildare, W91 F2N0, Ireland
reviews_text:
Definitely the best sauna setup I've experienced in Ireland. Lovely setting with panoramic windows overlooking the Liffey, all wood, stone and incense - very nice.
A lot of things being done properly here that aren't always done elsewhere in Irish saunas:
- properly hot saunas
- proper warm changing rooms
- Very clean everywhere
- Staff telling patrons to sit on towels and shower between saunas (basic but too many people won't do basic hygiene without being told to).
- properly cold plunge pools
- nice hot jacuzzis

Good value too. Keep up the good work! || Best sauna experience I‚Äôve had in Ireland so far while visiting from Australia.
Option to have a silent or social sauna when booking. The views are amazing of the river and it‚Äôs actually cleaned between sessions which is something I haven‚Äôt seen much of in Ireland at other saunas.
The cold plunges and jacuzzi are great and the sauna is hot at around 95 degrees celcius. The staff are also welcoming and very clear on instructions when you adrive and tell people to shower after the sauna each time (something else I don‚Äôt see much of in Ireland)! Loved my session here.
Highly recommend and can‚Äôt wait to visit again. || Five stars doesn't do Treehouse Sauna justice.

Two saunas, two hot tubs, three cold plunges, two cold showers. It has everything you want. It is a little bit out of the way, but it's such great value at the same time.

One of the nicest saunas... actually the nicest sauna I've visited in Ireland. It's so clean, relaxing and aesthetically spot on. Can't recommend highly enough- i will keep on coming back üíØ || Absolutely phenomenal!

10/10 for quality of sauna and pools. If I lived here I would definitely go on a regular basis. || Such a wonderful place to relax and recharge!
The sauna is always clean, cozy, and perfectly warm. The atmosphere is peaceful, and you can really feel the stress melting away. The staff are friendly and welcoming, and everything is well taken care of. It‚Äôs definitely my favorite spot to unwind after a long day ‚Äî highly recommend!

name: Float Well
address: Main St, Celbridge, Co. Kildare, W23 W9W0, Ireland
reviews_text: I cannot rate this therapy and business highly enough. My first time using it and it won‚Äôt be my last. My Float session was a beautiful experience. It‚Äôs like you are free of your body and mind and in the safest place you‚Äôll ever be. I felt so calm for days after and think of the feeling of freedom I had quite often since. Look forward to my next session . Barry is a really nice guy who puts you at ease and talks to you like a friend. || Fantastic experience at Floatwell in Celbridge. The space is calm, and beautifully set up. The float itself was incredibly soothing and left me feeling refreshed and clear-headed. The staff are warm, welcoming, and explain everything clearly. Highly recommend to anyone looking to switch off and recharge. || That was my first time to experience floating and it was AMAZING! It was so relaxed that i never been before! I was drifting somewhere between dreaming and waking state. I was a bit all over the place at the beginning but after a few minutes i adjusted totally... Following the facilitator instructions i put a halo under my head just to adapt and reduce stiffness in ma neck as my body was still in "protection mode" but after few minutes i took the halo out and i let my head to float freely... Then i completely drift out... There was no body, no mind and no time to estimate how long this state last, split of a second or maybe longer... And there was, and even one day after, still is, calmness and peace whithin i never experienced before, even useing different modalities like : meditation, reflexology, aromatherapy, acupuncture or even "mighty" breathwork! I will recommend Float Well to everyone who required a little bit of relaxation for the nervous system and maybe even more for your body and soul. Defenetly i'll be comming back very soon for another great experience! Thank You so much FloatWell for being near! || Really loved the Salt Therapy today. A great way to clear the sinuses and relax at the same time. 45 minutes well spent. Thanks Barry for explaining everything beforehand. I will definitely be back. . || I did a flotation tank session last night and it was really refreshing and helped relieve me of some pain in my neck and lower back. I've bought another session for a future date and I really enjoyed myself last night. Barry explained everything and I'd recommend anyone to visit his business for some self pampering!!

name: Carton House Spa & Wellness, A Fairmont Managed Hotel
address: Carton House, Carton Demesne, Maynooth, Co. Kildare, W23 TD98, Ireland
reviews_text:
Gym not tidy despite being the morning. Well equipped for a hotel gym however. Air con made the right noises but certainly didn‚Äôt feel like it was on. Not a lot of loungers around the pool, no tables to go with the seats either so not the most comfortable to relax. The loungers had rolled up towels in the morning but this didn‚Äôt seem to be upheld throughout the day making it unclear which were free.

The sauna could do with new wood given it was very visible that it had absorbed several thousand people‚Äôs sweat with warped wood
The steam room had rusty light fittings and broken tiles.

I appreciated the window out to the pool from the steam room as I could watch people steal my lounger.

Only one flooded jacuzzi area, an outdoor space to cool down but nothing more.

On the way out, I looked for a swimming costume drier only to find none and given the lady at reception didn‚Äôt have spare robes I had to just walk back to my room damp.

Overall very tired and felt more like a local gym and spa than one at a world famous 5 star golf resort. || Very dissatisfied with a recent visit getting a couples message. I had Katie and she was amazing, 5 stars. They had a new girl in training and she was very underwhelming, no way she had any message experience. You shouldn‚Äôt be training personal on clients at the price for this experience. She didn‚Äôt ask my wife for any feedback regarding pressure. Basically paid for her to rub oil.  This isn‚Äôt the first time either. This is our second experience where my wife‚Äôs message was very poor. No opportunity to give feedback on our experience. How will they even know if new staff is any good? What was supposed to be a highlight for our trip from the states is now a big regret. Tried to treat my wife for the second time and disappointed again. || It was an awesome wrap-up to my  birthday with a treat to a full body massage. Had been to Carton twice before for a massage, but this visit was by far the best.
It was very welcoming and was extremely well looked after by Ciara.
Her attention to detail, professionism, and friendliness was 2nd to none. Best massage i've had in years. Listen to and tailored the massage to my needs.
Will definitely be returning. Lovely treat to a glass of prosecco as a birthday treat. The relaxation suite was a great way to chill afterwards. Refreshing sourbet and drink. Fresh fruit and plenty of flavoured water nice and cold available as well.
Leisure and pool were brilliant too. Spottless and really well laid out.
Finally the reception staff also need to be mentioned. So so important as the first and last person you see. Felt I was really being looked after with a warm friendly service. 10 out of 10. || From the momemt  we arrived we were greeted by a lovely gentleman who took care of our bags and welcomed us with a big warm smile.

The food was absolutely delicious and being able to watch the chef in action added a special touch.The staff were fantastic but in the restaurants and bar.

The spa was nice and I really enjoyed my seaweed massge.I think the pool area could maybe do with a revamp. Its a little dated. While myself and my sister in law were  unwinding, the boys played golf and came back raving about the course. They loved it!

Carton House is the perfect mix of luxury and warmth. Great service, stunning surroundings and walks, and plenty to do. We'll definitely be back! Highly recommend. || I visited the spa with my mum and sister-in-law as a special treat, and the whole experience was nothing short of exceptional. We each had a fantastic time and left feeling completely relaxed and looked after.

For me, I had an Indian head massage, and I can honestly say it was the best massage I‚Äôve ever had. Natalia was truly exemplary ‚Äì a kind, sweet-natured therapist who went above and beyond to ensure I felt comfortable and completely at ease from start to finish. Her attentiveness stood out, not just in the massage itself, but in the thoughtful little details ‚Äì checking that the window was open for fresh air on a warm day, while also making sure I wasn‚Äôt too cold.

She created a calm and caring atmosphere that made the whole experience feel so personalised and special. It was clear she genuinely wanted me to have the best experience possible ‚Äì and she delivered. Natalia is a true gem, and a big reason why I can‚Äôt wait to come back !

name: Sl√≠ Beatha Float House

reviews_text:
I had wonderful experience.  Everything went very smoothly and the welcome, explanation of how to get the most from the Float experience, and getting set up was excellent. name: Killashee Spa
address: House Hotel, Kilcullen Rd, Killashee, Naas, Co. Kildare, W91 DX34, Ireland
reviews_text:
My husband bought me a ‚Ç¨109 spa voucher in 2021 as a birthday gift, valid for five years. The advertised voucher clearly states it included one 60-minute treatment and one 30-minute treatment. When I used it last weekend, I was told I could only avail of one treatment (60-minute) due to time constraints, and I was asked to pay an extra ‚Ç¨6 because the treatment price had increased. I also wondered if I am also entitled to the second treatment.

This was disappointing, as the voucher was pre-paid and advertised to include both treatments. Even though the massage itself was good, I left feeling the experience did not match what was originally promised. || I visited today with two friends.
We booked the spa and afternoon tea package.
Everything from start to finish was perfect!

My therapist was Shan. She was phenomenal. She put me compleatly at ease and proceeded to give one of the best back massages I've had. Followed by a gorgeous Elemis facial.

After this we had some time in the relaxation area and thermal suite. Both just as beautiful as the other.

Following this we went for a walk around the gardens before heading back into the main hotel for afternoon tea.
The selection was great, food was all delicious.

The staff are fantastic, super professional and all round lovely people to deal with.

We will absolutely be back and I highly recommend a visit. || Killashee Spa & Afternoon Tea Package ‚Ç¨119.

The offering was fairly priced.

The staff was lovely.

The main hotel - food was delicious with generous portions with excellent customer service.

The decor of the spa and tea room was gorgeous.

We loved the hydrotherapy pool.

The massage area had an electric blanket, which was lovely and warm on the joints.

Why I provide 4/5 stars due to the masseuse - amazing technique but I asked several times to have a firmer massage my skin is quite sensitive and I reacted to the products used. (My masseuse was aware that I had sensitive skin). The 'relaxation' room - other guests were continuously talking.

But overall I enjoyed my experience and would return. || We tried the couple‚Äôs package and had such a lovely experience. The spa is very clean and peaceful, which made it easy to relax right away. Our package included the Rasul room and dry flotation, and I really liked that everything felt private, we didn‚Äôt have to pass by a lot of other people in between sessions, so it was just the two of us enjoying the time together. Everything finished off with afternoon tea, and the staff were super accommodating with our preferences, which made it feel even more special. I‚Äôd definitely come back to try their massages and facials for the full experience! Overall it felt very luxurious || I recently had the pleasure of visiting Killashee Wild Cherry Caf√©, and I must say, it was a delightful experience! Nestled in a beautiful location, the caf√© boasts a warm and inviting atmosphere that instantly makes you feel at home.

The menu is diverse, offering a fantastic selection of delicious dishes made with fresh, locally sourced ingredients. I particularly enjoyed their specialty coffees, which were expertly brewed and perfectly complemented my meal. The homemade pastries and desserts are a must-try; I couldn't resist indulging in a slice of their decadent cake, and it was absolutely divine!

The staff at Killashee Wild Cherry Caf√© were friendly and attentive, providing excellent service throughout my visit. They took the time to ensure that every guest felt welcome and well taken care of.

Whether you're looking for a cozy spot to enjoy breakfast, a leisurely lunch, or a sweet treat in the afternoon, Killashee Wild Cherry Caf√© is definitely worth a visit. I can't wait to return and explore more of their delightful offerings!

---

reviews_text:
Lovely Sauna in the heart of Castlecomer. Right beside The Avalon.

Good size sauna that would comfortably fit 8

2 cold plunges - we were informed there were 4¬∞
2 drop buckets that are also very cold and one cold shower

New hot tub/ jacuzzi added that easily fits 4.

Good size changing rooms and clean toilets onsite.

Pros - clean, friendly, amazing viewing, great facilities, free parking, very professional and organised. Sauna was the perfect temperature.

Cons - ‚Ç¨15 and you are only allowed 45 minutes. Most allow you the full hour for that price. Maybe have a tap for drinking water also

One of the better saunas I‚Äôve visited. || Great sauna, ice baths and jacuzzi. The location is lovey right by the river Dinin. The sauna was at 95degrees which was a nice heat. Ice baths are brilliant everything is clean and well maintained. One down side is the changing rooms are a bit on the small side on a busy time slot 4 adults fit comfortably more than that is hard to manoeuvre especially if a person with disability. || Beautiful  setting  and the sauna  and ice bath just  fantastic  and great  facility. || Brilliant setting really professional job and in night time setting is nice üëå top class ü§ü || An unforgettable experience! 5/5 stars
I visited this gorgeous sauna today, located right on the riverbank. I found an extremely relaxing atmosphere here, full of peace, which completely disconnects you.
It is truly something special to be able to enjoy the heat of the sauna or the relaxation area while looking directly at the river. A creative and special place!
I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for an oasis of peace and relaxation. I will definitely be back!

name: The Watershed
address: Bohernatounish Rd, Gallowshill, Kilkenny, Ireland
reviews_text:
Just joined the Watershed this last week and i have to say the Staff were very helpful. As for the Watershed itself it's a well equipped Sports Complex. The only thing is that it could do with an update in a few areas like the pool and Gym. Other than that I have no complaints. The Car park like any busy sports complex can be a bit busy during peak times. Its clean and nice and cosy warm during these winter days. || I never leve comment but this place got to me in too many ways.

- called the place over 13 times to no anwser, later when i came i see the phone ring and staff just ingore. But whatever.

- I ask staff about membership deals and offers, but lady at desk i feel like is kept againts her own will after 2 question just throw paper with details at me any any further question is anwserd by all is writen there again cool.

- can i go see try out gym ? No we don't do you need pay 11‚Ç¨ i mean that's a high price i think for a single entry buy sure,
And i think i know why u cant see before you pay. Most of equpiment is very heavily used, rusted, pads torn, not taken care of at all. Teenagers being very distruptive playing around at one machine for over 1h
No gym staff present for 2h i was there, to even report this.

-Male change room is poor condtion too smelly dirty, and good few happy nude granpas.

-On the way down insted of exit i went from gym to swiming pool no one checks i felt for what i paid it should be included,
And again rather dissapointing very dirty floor peoples hair everywhere, dirty underwear found in lockers.
The pool was actually okay nothing special, sauna and steam room was poor at best not very warm no option to pour water in dry sauna and very mild steam in steam room, only one jacuzi again filled with ultra happy teens.
Overall its an old decrepit place not worth its price in my opinion, with poor hygenie standards proably only in bussines because not many choice in town of kilkenny. For swim is ok but gym is 110% bot worth it. Not to mention the very good and helpfull part time robot staff. || Unfortunately all the school kids has lessons so only a very small area left for public. Very very noisy decided to use steam room and sauna lovely but jacuzzi was out of order which was disappointing.  The jacuzzi was not working last 2 times I have been . || I used to be a member here for 4 years around 7 years ago. I remember the gym being pretty well maintained. Now, the majority of it looks like it has been salvaged from a scrap yard. The few new pieces of equipment that i saw were all cheap or poor quailty. Yeah, you can say things are old. I think this place was built around 2010. But it's just pure maintenance, a little w40 every month. New pads every 6 months and deep clean costs a few hundred ‚Ç¨ at most.
And it would make a world of difference.
In conclusion, I'm sad to see this place fall down so much and would recommend any other gym in kilkenny. || I‚Äôve been a member of The Watershed club in Kilkenny for over three years and usually have a great experience. However, during a recent badminton session, we extended our play by 30 minutes and were spoken to very loudly by receptionist ,as if we were being scolded. She insisted we should pay first before booking and her tone came across as unnecessarily harsh, which was disappointing. This is the first time I‚Äôve encountered this type of behaviour here.

The swimming pool is a great size and the sauna, steam room and jacuzzi are great to finish off your workout üëçüèº || We always go to the pool as a family, we usually take a family package for ‚Ç¨24.50. This Sunday, as usual, anywhere not in a hurry came. However, after a while, a member of staff approached us and told us that we should leave the pool already because our time was up. They could not explain anything to us at the reception desk, we were not informed or warned about anything before the purchase.
At the same time, there were few people in the pool, it was quiet and not crowded. Very disappointed with this attitude and unprofessional approach.
At the same time, there were two more families with us, our acquaintances, with the same colored bracelets, who arrived at the same time as us.  Nobody didn't even say them anything about their time. We are all amazed by this service in that day.
If you have now such rules, why did you leave others in the pool with the same color bracelets? Why did you make my children feel violated in their rights and opportunities. || We always had a good time in the pool with the children, but this last time, we didn‚Äôt even have time to swim properly when we were asked to leave because the time had run out. name: St Hugh's Sweathouse
address: Unnamed Road, Cleighran Beg, Co. Leitrim, Ireland
reviews_text:
This immaculately kept shrine is as restful a place to visit as it is a beautiful place.

Sweathouses were small stone buildings. The fire within would make the place very warm and people would sit inside to burn their fevers away. They were an early form of sauna in one way but with a definite medical intent.

The bulk of these are now to be found in the northwest of Ireland but it is likely that they were common everywhere at one stage. This one is in remarkably good repair.

Access is fine if you can handle bad-signposting. The walk itself is a bit steep, the part is a bit rough so not ideal for people with difficulty walking on uneven surfaces. There is a place to pull a car in but no formal parking and no disabled parking either || Cool hidden gem along sli liatroma. Tight hill climb if hiking/running/biking. Nice rest+picnic area with carpark at foothills with beautiful panoramic views over Lough Allen and the Arigna valley. || Mystic water hole cures some ills
