name: The Spa at Radisson Blu Limerick
address: Radisson Blu Hotel & Spa, Ennis Road, Limerick, Co. Limerick, Ireland
reviews_text:
Thank you Crina and the staff in Radisson for looking after us so well.
I was delighted to partner with you for our Aqua Yoga Christmas session. Our group had a wonderful time from start to finish. Relaxing in the sauna, steam room and outdoor hot tub prior to our Aqua Yoga Class. We had a lovely meal in the restaurant afterwards and we look forward to repeating the experience. Many thanks,
Dolores and Aqua Crew. || Visited the hotel spa twice and was disappointed both times.

The main issue is with the online booking system ‚Äî it‚Äôs poorly designed and causes a lot of confusion.

The first time, I arrived at my scheduled appointment and was asked to wait for my therapist in the relaxation area. Then I was asked to wait again‚Ä¶ and again. In the end, I waited more than 45 minutes before the session started, which completely ruined the overall experience.

The second time, my friends and I organized a visit to celebrate a special occasion. We spent quite some time choosing the right time slot online to minimize waiting. One of us was a breastfeeding mother, so the timing was especially important. However, when we arrived, our reserved time was simply ignored ‚Äî we were told to come at another available slot because our original time was given to other guests. This completely disrupted our plans.

The front desk communication was not friendly and felt somewhat pressuring. Instead of the three treatments included in our package, we only had time for two, as everything got delayed again.

The online booking system definitely needs a serious overhaul.

That said, despite all the technical and communication issues, I‚Äôd like to highlight therapist Mandjela ‚Äî the massage itself was truly wonderful. || Hotel was great. Nice big room with plenty of space.
Has a small gym, pool and sauna.

Small bar called Quench which was pretty good with quick service and good food.

Recommend here to rest your tired legs and eyes after driving all day. || The staff were so nice, lovely calming experience and very relaxing. I went for a taster session of the back, neck and shoulder massage and the taster facial. Definitely would recommend. || Great Hotel
Very Friendly staff
Great Spa, Great  food  in the Brasserie Restaurant
Overall  We had an exceptionally 3 night stay here .

reviews_text:
We had the most amazing, relaxing experience. We felt an absolute high and would recommend this experience to everyone. Thank you so much for everything. Al was absolutely fantastic. We will definitely be back! || First time floating/ attending phoenix and all I can say is wow!
Al, our greeter, was very welcoming and showed us everything we needed to know.
The facility was spotless and the temperature was perfect for walking around.
We did the sauna and the float pod, and everything was magnificent. They have loads of products and handy little adds as a bonus (towels, flip flops, creams, soaps, bag for wet clothes, ect) and a lovely shower. Hair dryers also available.
To end the session we had a cup of herbal tea and a sweet treat. All I can say is if you are a first time goer, or a pro, this was an incredible experience. || First time floating and will definitely be back. The set up is great, the place is spotless and the owner was very welcoming and spent time ensuring you knew what to expect from your experience. You really need to bring nothing with you as towels and all toiletries are provided. They even have individual disposable combs to use with the hairdryers.
The therapy itself was very relaxing and I would definitely go back to this particular place for another session. || Excellent place to disconnect and unwind without the need to leave the city.
Great place to detox your body in the sauna and your mind while floating in the pod.

The lounge room, with a cup of tea and a nice selection of books, was a pleasant addition to my already great experience.

Don‚Äôt worry if you forgot something, you‚Äôll find creams and all other kinds of cosmetics provided. || The place is cozy and welcoming, clean tidy and spacious.
Alvaro was really helpful, nice and patient.
The experience was perfect, relaxing and calming.
Real meditation experience

reviews_text: Absolutely fantastic experience. Place was very clean and well maintained by staff. Music and the dark paint and floors made for a very relaxing evening. She made sure to explain the best way to split up our hour while keeping us honest and hype us up for getting in the ice bath. A raise is definitely needed for her as she made the 5 star experience. Highly recommend for anyone going through sports recovery, or honestly just needs a wellness break. Very relaxing, lovely staff (like Denise), and great prices. Kieran is also very helpful and friendly and greets you with a warm welcome.

reviews_text:
Reva‚Äôs Spa is such a gorgeous treat from start to finish. The rooms feel really luxurious, and the thermal suites are amazing ‚Äî especially the sauna and the outdoor hot tub.
My therapist, Magda, was fantastic. She gave me a full body scrub and massage, and my skin felt super soft afterwards. The relaxation room after the treatment was so peaceful, and the little treats they give you were delicious ‚Äî we honestly could have stayed in there all day.
The changing rooms are pristine too, with great showers, hair dryers, and big mirrors for getting ready afterwards. From the moment I arrived, everything was seamless: a warm welcome, a calming atmosphere, and a genuine sense that every detail had been carefully thought through.

The therapist was exceptional, intuitive, skilled, and completely focused on my needs. The pressure, flow, and attention to detail were perfect, leaving me feeling both deeply relaxed and re-energised.

It‚Äôs rare to find someone who combines such technical expertise with genuine care. I left feeling lighter, restored, and already looking forward to my next visit.

Highly recommend!

name: Energize Health Club
address: Limerick Strand Hotel, Ennis Rd, Stonetown, Limerick, V94 03F2, Ireland
reviews_text: The staff are very friendly and helpful. It's a popular club as I was on a waiting list to join. But the cold water pool is heaven. || This swim and exercise club does have access from the street,  and also a dedicated Hotel Elevator for hotel guests. Well run and friendly staff. || I am extremely dissatisfied with the state of the steam room at this gym. Not only is there no visible steam in the steam room, but sometime there's also a weird smell that makes it unbearable to stay in there for even a few minutes. What's worse is that some patrons go straight from the sauna or the steam room into the swimming pool or Jacuzzi without taking a shower first, and the management seems to turn a blind eye to this basic hygiene violation. It's extremely disappointing that such a basic level of cleanliness and hygiene is not being upheld in this gym || On October 5, 2024, at 16:30, I realized that I had forgotten my towel at home when I arrived at the gym. As I was leaving, I saw another person entering the gym who was given a towel. I was confused by this discrepancy.

name: A Room Outside
address: Eastlink Business Park, Unit 54 Ballysimon Rd, Monaclinoe, Limerick, V94 HA24, Ireland
reviews_text:
I bought a single person infrared sauna from these guys about 18 months ago. I wanted to wait for a while before leaving a review. I‚Äôm a big sauna enthusiast, so I was unsure about say the infrared for example, being lower heat. If you, like I was, are looking at purchasing a sauna from here wondering if this is an extravagant purchase that won‚Äôt be justified, let me tell you that this sauna is the best thing I own. I use it every day, both my partner and I, sequentially. We run it for 90 minutes, it‚Äôs up to heat in about 15 minutes. You are right beside the emitter, so the heat, even though it‚Äôs slightly lower than the wood fired sauna, is ample. I cannot do more than 30 straight minutes. And I‚Äôve tried. It has worked flawlessly, takes up less room in my bathroom than the shower base, costs a negligible amount to run, and it makes me happy every time I use it. This business were brilliant in helping me select it, they were really helpful and patient with my questions and requests. I can‚Äôt say anything about aftercare because it‚Äôs worked flawlessly, but I have confidence they‚Äôre a great company.

Here‚Äôs my advice, buy the sauna. You won‚Äôt regret it. || I had absolutely amazing experience from start to finish with A Room Outside.  Very professional,  helpful, knowledgeable, and friendly  staff with the patience of an angel to answer all my questions, even the silly one.  After consideration of our options, we picked an infrared sauna, which was recommended to us. Delivery was extremely fast, which was an amazing surprise.  Assembly was perfect, with all the explanation of how to use it correctly, too. After one week of daily use of our sauna, I can honestly say that that was the best purchase ever! We both love it! My only regret is to not get one sooner.  I can not recommend Aroomoutside enough! Definitely 10 out of 10!!! || Great store, very friendly staff. Excellent product selection and great value. || I am impressed with the speed of shipping and delivery and the way of contacting the customer. Thank you and best regards to the team. || This is the best BBQ / Braai / Outdoor cooking place I've visited in Ireland. They have a truly wide range and not just a select brand. More importantly than anything they are genuinely good folk. Knowledgeable, helpful and very nice people. I'll certainly be back  and definitely recommend popping in or going online and picking up some great gear.

name: Salt Cave Paradise - Salt Therapy
address: Convent Ln, Tankardstown, Balbriggan, Co. Dublin, K32 CY94, Ireland
reviews_text:
This place is amazing! A truly hidden gem. I did the salt cave and jacuzzi experiences and both were great. The salt caves have 3 warm/hot pools and two cold ones, free clay masks, saunas, massage chairs, and red light therapy. The jacuzzi area upstairs has less to offer (jacuzzi, sauna, and cold pool), but is privately booked for the same price as downstairs, and comes with a free bottle of processco!

As well as the excellent facilities, the staff were lovely. When myself and my partner were leaving, we couldn‚Äôt find my jacket. The receptionist Shauna helped us look everywhere, but it seemed to be lost. She took my name and phone number and said she would call other customers who had been there the same time as us and see if someone took it by mistake. Later on the same evening she texted me that the jacket had been found in the changing rooms, and she would keep it safe until I could come back. Very kind and considerate. Highly highly recommend. || Highly recommended! The lady at the reception was very welcoming and kind. We arrived at 5pm and the place was empty so luckily we had all the place for ourselves. We are a family of four (two adults and two toddlers). The place is exactly as per website pictures. Kids had a great fun playing at the family room (plenty os toys) myself and my partner enjoyed a lot the massage chairs while watching kids playing. It was very relaxing. Definitely we will be back!! || We had a lovely time here we did the 3 hour experience and was fab I was nervous after reading some comments, I can agree with the comments about the clay mask used by all also the cold plunge pools were dirty ( one even had a plastic cup and others had dirt and leaves in them )and as others have said maybe bring 2 towels or would be brilliant if they supplied towels, but we had a lovely time. Thank you for a lovely experience || We had a nice experience at Salt Cave Paradise. It‚Äôs a great place for families ‚Äî there are two separate rooms, one where adults can relax with calm music, and another where kids can play and have fun without disturbing the quiet area.

The staff were friendly and welcoming, which made the visit even more pleasant. A lovely spot to relax while the children stay entertained. || The girl on the desk was lovely and welcoming and explained everything as it was my first time. Bring two towels because you shower before entering the pool area and you‚Äôll be left with only a damp towel to dry yourself with otherwise. The clay mask was lovely but the area you sit in to let it dry on the reclining chairs was freezing. Good selection of cool/warm pools filled with salts, herbs & essential oils, it smelled amazing. I only used the warm pools as the place was so cold. The massage chairs are very relaxing and comfortable. The pools themselves are very small so you can‚Äôt actually swim in them. You can only float. I wouldn‚Äôt go on a busy day as you‚Äôd have no room to move. It would be better to have separate male/female changing areas. Don‚Äôt shower for an hour after your visit to allow the saltwater to do its magic & definitely don‚Äôt shave before you go or it stings! The hour passes quickly. It was good to experience something new but I wouldn‚Äôt return due to the coldness and how small the pools are plus the price is too high for one hour. You can get two hours in a thermal spa in an upmarket hotel for the same price.

reviews_text:

This made my already bad gym anxiety very bad and I could not finish my workout with how negative the environment was. We kept towels in our bag which was carried on my partners back to prevent being a trip hazard and we were told we were inconsiderate for this. When asked for a complaint form or a refund they said‚Äùwe don‚Äôt have complaint forms because our facility is perfect‚Äù as someone who travels and competes in gyms all over Ireland and UK this is the worst gym I‚Äôve experienced, outdated equipment with very rude members of staff who have no people or customer service skills whatsoever. name: Salterstown Pier
address: Unnamed Rd,, Salterstown, Co. Louth, Ireland
reviews_text:
Great swimming spot for the sea. If you're lucky the sauna guy will be there too! || Nice spot but nobody gets naked and the park is terrible üòÇ || Only went for some photos but it was packed with people swimming and watchers so limited shots taken, gdpr and all that!
Will go in winter when less popular (hopefully)
It‚Äôs certainly one of the great piers or slips for a seascape shot but the sun and tide have to be on the right places and some sea mist would be most helpful! || Well known & nice sea swimming area based just outside Annagassan town.

The main sea pier is accessed via a circular loop road which is generally advised as a one-way route.

The pier itself is surrounded by a stony beach area.

This area can be busy on good days.

There is also a local coffee van nearby if you wanted to get a hot drink after your swim or while you go for a walk around the pier. || Beautiful coast ‚ò∫Ô∏è

name: Big Dipper
address: Big Style Atlantic Lodge, Killadoon, Louisburgh, Co. Mayo, F28 DA31, Ireland
reviews_text:
Had a lovely time at the Big Dipper, very well set up, clean and such fabulous views, it was a real treat and a lovely way to relax and unwind with friends. The sauna was fab, looking out over the Atlantic Ocean.  It is a little slice of heaven on the edge of the Atlantic and I would recommend anyone to give it a try for something different! I will definitely be back. || Absolutely stunning and unique location for a wonderful sauna experience. The sauna was lovely and toasty and the views out onto clew bay are amazing. It was a wild and windy day which just added to the whole experience. The jacuzzi was not super duper hot due to the weather conditions but still a great afternoon had by all. || Words can't describe this experience!
What a place, what a view. Could have stayed all day!
The sauna was a dream with those big windows!
Will definitely be back. || An incredible experience! My friends and I absolutely loved the Big Dipper. Not only is the scenery a beautiful blend of the rolling green hills and nearby ocean, but the landscaping and flowers surrounding the hot tub and sauna are gorgeous. The staff was what really made the experience so great. Paddy was so helpful and welcoming, and he even shared his tips for the day of driving we had planned for the next leg of our trip (his recommendations were great!). I am already dreaming of when I can get back to enjoy this beautiful oasis! || We had a wonderful time. The views are just amazing. The staff are friendly and welcoming. First time doing a cold plunge and I have to say I loved it. I'll be returning soon.

name: Sabhna Saunas Dugort Beach
address: Beach, Doogort, Co. Mayo, Ireland
reviews_text: Visited last week, in the last slot of the day. Such a highlight. Relaxing in the sauna as the day turned to dusk, with a beautiful view of the sea and Slievemore. Please don‚Äôt miss if you are in the area. || A perfect activity on a rainy day. Lovely & personable staff and the view from the sauna onto the beach is gorgeous. Super clean, easy to use and staff are on hand should you need anything. We loved our sprint to and from the sea! || Sublime! Views of Atlantic coast and Achill, wood-fired heating, and the ocean right beside for a plunge. An unmissable Irish beach experience. || It was so nice to get into this sauna after an ice-cold dip in the sea a few metres away. Thanks || Best customer service and so clean.  PAUL was so nice to move our booked slot to another dare as my partner was sick.  Paul was so nice understanding and helpful.

name: Sona Sauna Belmullet
address: Shore Rd, Belmullet, Toorglass West, Co. Mayo, F26 TY48, Ireland
reviews_text:
Was lucky enough to get here at end of Sept. Generous sized sauna, clean and lovely experience. Despite being on a road, the views are pretty much uninterrupted and stunning! Also it's great that no matter the sea tide level the pool is always full! Beautiful spot, I'll be back! || A really great addition to Belmullet, perfect after a swim in the beautiful wild Atlantic Ocean. There today at high tide and it was so refreshing to swim and have a (very hot) sauna after. Perfect start to the weekend. Richard is very friendly and has invested in a very spacious Harvia wood burning sauna || What an experience! We booked the Sauna for an hour and combined it with quick dips in the tidal pool which is adjacent... I feel completely renewed, mentally & physically... The sauna is easy to book, great value, spotless, hot and easy to access... We're in Belmullet for two nights & are booking in again for tomorrow morning... Highly recommend... we'll be back!! || What a great experience! We were welcomed by Morgan who was so friendly and helpful. The sauna itself is very clean and plenty hot - necessary for the brisk dip in the tidal pool nearby. We had a great morning & we'll be back! Thanks guys! || Such a stunning spot by the tidal pool! Delighted to have Sona Sauna in Belmullet ‚Äì a brilliant addition to the area. Love pairing it with yoga, and it‚Äôs become a favourite weekend ritual for me and my students.
totally recommended for locals and visitors alike !

name: Pontoon Sauna
address: R318, Irishtown, Foxford, Co. Mayo, Ireland
reviews_text:
Beautiful experience,  whether its early morning, or night time Sauna and Lake Dip under the full moon.
Very peaceful location, wonderful Holistic appreciation of the local countryside.
Mark is always helpful and informative, from the temperature of the lake or the Sauna and the choice of essential oils just adds to the experience.
Views from inside are spectacular and can't think of a nicer place to be while appreciating it. || Excellent sauna and refreshing dip in the cool waters of Lough Cullin - backed by picturesque views. Mark is most friendly and welcoming, setting up everything for you to enjoy the experience. Thank you and we'll be back again if we're in the area! || Would definitely go here again. The sauna is top notch - proper hot, super clean and with great views and access to a shallow lake for a cool dip. There are some special touches  to make the experience really great. || My partner and I had an excellent time at the sauna. Having grown up nearby, he couldn't believe there was such a beautiful new way of interacting with the lake. A gorgeous sauna with essential oils available to infuse the steam, an unbelievable view out of the large back window, right next to the water, and there were even water shoes available so you could comfortably get in and out of the lake easily throughout the session. Mark had thought of everything. The perfect spot! || Absolutely love this sauna, it‚Äôs in such a peaceful picturesque spot and the set up is top class thanks to Mark, everything is really nicely laid out and well presented.
I will definitely be back, highly highly recommended

name: The Chill Spa
address: The Ice House Hotel, The Quay Ln, Quignalecka, Ballina, Co. Mayo, F26 Y9E8, Ireland
reviews_text:
I went for a maternity massage and had Catriona, it was absolutely divine, I enjoyed it so much. She really put so much effort in to make sure everything was perfect. I appreciated the comfortable positions of the massage and the adjustments that were made. I went in thinking it wouldn‚Äôt be as good as a normal massage, I was so wrong.

All of the staff were lovely, so friendly. A very inviting place.

I was also very happy that there was a few areas I was able to use in the spa being pregnant unlike some other places I researched. I didn‚Äôt feel like I was missing out at all. I could use the aromatherapy room, dip my feet/lower legs in the outdoor jacuzzi and rest on the heated loungers with the most beautiful river views.

The sorbet and tea afterwards was the cherry on top.

I was so happy with my experience and it was a great treat that put me in such a good state of mind, I‚Äôm going to go back again when I‚Äôm in a later pregnancy stage. || Oh what a gorgeous treatment I got. I must have hit the jackpot cos Mia was just brilliant. I got the bank neck and shoulders and Mia was just a whizz at unknotting the tension. Sometimes, i can be a bit sensitive but as tough and all as it was, i was like butter leaving the therapy room. Anyone in the west, head to Mia , I‚Äôm gutted I don‚Äôt live closer. || Beautiful hotel, gorgeous food and cocktails. The staff are brilliant. Highly recommend! || Venturing into The Chill Spa, I was immediately struck by the warmth and friendliness of the staff. It felt like being welcomed into a friend's home ‚Äì if your friend's home included impeccable cleanliness and a zen atmosphere. Seriously, the place is so spotless, you‚Äôd think they have a magic wand for cleaning!

But the real gem is the outdoor experience. The hot tub on the deck, with its stunning river views, is nothing short of magical. It‚Äôs like sitting in a warm, bubbly throne while nature performs its best symphony. And the river, oh the river! It offers such a mesmerizing view that I found myself contemplating whether I should just pitch a tent there and live in this tranquil haven. Whether you're a spa enthusiast or a newcomer to the world of relaxation, This is a destination not to be missed. Absolute bliss! || Lovely spa with an amazing outdoor setting. The outdoor jacuzzis and baths were particularly fantastic, and my wife's massage was apparently amazing too. Loses one star as unfortunately our visit wasn't the most tranquil due to 80% of the other guests having their phones out for the entire time, despite this going against the "spa etiquette". Some guests were literally having phone calls in the jacuzzis, along with playing music/watching videos in the relaxation rooms and having photoshoots the entire time! Would be nice if phones were completely banned from settings like this.

name: Daymaker Sea Sauna
address: Beach View, Doogort, Dugort, Co. Mayo, Ireland
reviews_text: wX

name: Delphi Spa
address: Delphi Resort, Tonatleva, Leenaun, Co. Mayo, Ireland
reviews_text:
I stopped here on my way from Cleggan to Westport and I'm so glad I did. I had an amazing massage with Chris, he really worked the knots out of my back and I left feeling very relaxed. I was also able to use the thermal suite before and after the massage and the Jacuzzi, steam room and sauna were all great. The relaxation area is nice as well and, had there not been a wall of fog, I expect the view would have been nice. I hope to be back! || I visited the spa while on holiday in Connemara and it exceeded my expectations. The thermal spa was wonderfully relaxing and a perfect start to the spa experience. I then enjoyed a seaweed bath, 50 min Swedish massage, and a facial. All were just incredible and I felt so rejuvenated after. Barbara was a skilled and attentive technician for both the massage and facial. A perfect pampering experience! || The spa in Delphi really exceeded my expectations. The staff are so friendly and experienced. I had a superb massage and facial from the therapist Christian. I feel fantastic after it! 10 out of 10! || Tucked away in the most amazing scenery, lovely staff, really amazing food. Highly recommended for a much needed switch-off from the hustle & bustle. || Had a spa here back in March. On the day there was construction work going on. Which is okay if we were notified! But we weren't. While trying to relaxing (was very hard to relax) in the relaxation room, we had construction workers looking at us as they were working. The drilling noise was extremely loud when I was having a "relaxing" bath. I ended up getting out early. .
If I was notified about the work going on I'd understand, having this booked since before December. I'm sure they could of emailed to let me know. Was extremely disappointed.
The spa itself is very outdated.

name: Spa Sula
address: 25 Sraid Caisl√©anan an Bharraigh, An Cheathr√∫ Bheag, Cathair na Mart, Co. Contae Mhaigh Eo, F28 P3K8, Ireland
reviews_text:
We had the most lovely experience here this weekend. The team there were very accommodating and friendly. The thermal suite was gorgeous with lots of options and all the group really enjoyed their treatments. It ended up being very good value for our small group and everyone left glowing and happy and I think we will be back! || Fabulous massage today, lovely environment, very relaxing afterwards to be taken to another room to lie down and not be rushed out. Thermal suite is good, especially the foot spa. Would be great to have something like a cold plunge pool added for in-between sauna etc || Had an amazing bamboo 80 minute treatment at Spa Sula by Victoria.  First experience of that type of massage.  I was so relaxed I had to spend time in relaxation room afterwards.   I would describe it as between gentle and firm.  Stones and oil quite hot.   My feet, ankles,  calves, thighs, back, shoulders and even my scalp were massaged.   More than I would pay at home but it was 130 euros well spent.  Highly recommend. || I just had  the Lymphatic massage this morning with Victoria.
I can‚Äôt recommend her enough.
Best massage I had in a long time.
Feeling so good!!
Thanks again! || It is always a pleasure to come back here and have a massage with Roberta. The thermal suite is a great place to relax and complete your treatment after a long week of work. The staff are very friendly and the service is exceptional.

name: Spa Veda
address: The Quay, Cloonmonad, Westport, Co. Mayo, Ireland
reviews_text: I had a lovely experience from start to finish. Realy lovely atmosphere staff were very helpful & friendly. I had the warm oil abhyanga massage which I would highly recommend. My therapist Siobh√°n was brilliant very efficient and maintained perfect pressure & contact throughout the treatment. Very relaxing experience i will definatley by back again. || I had a full body massage at Spa Veda and it was amazing, Grace was my therapist, very skilled, attentive, and ensured every tension point was addressed. The massage left me feeling completely relaxed and rejuvenated. The thermal suite is well-maintained and the ice fountain is a cherry on top. I had a great spa experience overall, I highly recommend! || I had an amazing experience with Grace at Spa Veda. She was absolutely fantastic, the pressure was perfect throughout. It was deeply relaxing from start to finish, and honestly one of the best Swedish massages I‚Äôve ever had. I left feeling completely refreshed and would highly recommend her to anyone looking for a top-quality massage. || I recently had two treatments in the one day! First Kasha gave me the most amazing massage; she got alot of the stress out from my back and had a very calming way about her. Then Kayla gave me a file and polish for my toes for going on holiday. Three weeks later and they are still perfect. These two therapists are both amazing and I will be asking for them every time i go to Spa Veda (which is my favourite in Westport) || Elena has such a gentle, intuitive touch. From the moment you arrive, she creates a space that feels safe and soothing.  The massage was more than just relaxing ‚Äî it felt healing. I left feeling calm, open, and quietly restored. She brings such warmth and care to what she does. Truly grateful. Thank you

name: Spa Salveo Westport
address: House Hotel & Spa, Knockranny, Westport, Co. Mayo, F28 X340, Ireland
reviews_text:
Today, I visited the spa and was looked after by the very kind & friendly Beatrix.
I opted for the Lavender Dream Experience treatment due to 3 reasons:
1) I have sensitive skin.
2) I haven't had a massage for a couple of years, so I felt I could probably do with more than 1 hr. This treatment is 90mins.
3) Warm healing stones sounded very inviting.

The treatment in its entirety is truly divine... from the beautiful smell & texture of the organic Turkish scrub, the wonderfully soothing & relaxing Lavender body oil (warm & also organic) on the skin followed by the feeling of the smooth & warm stones gliding through one's tense muscles.

Beatrix applied just the right amount of pressure on the stones & also worked with her hands & forearm incredibly skillfully. She always checked if the pressure & sensations were ok or if I needed more.
She finished the head to toe treatment with an Indian head massage, which provided the ultimate tension release & relaxation. I felt I could have drifted to sleep in seconds.

After the treatment, I was led into the relaxation room where a shot of orange juice, small joghurt, some water & a lovely pot of herbal tea waited for me.

I cannot recommend the spa enough. It was my first time here and I'm certain I'll visit it again if I'm in Westport the next time. And I'll be looking for Beatrixüëå
Thanks so much! || It seemed kind of dirty to me - especially the floors in the steaming rooms. There was some black, grey and green stuff swimming around underneath your bare feet. The pool was very cold and smelled of urin when entering. The people used the sauna and steaming rooms in bathing clothes and with no towels to sit on. When splashing the water in the pool, it produced some kind of foam on its surface. And finally, after using the massage jets in the pool, I got a weird kind of itching rash on my back skin. After 10‚Äò I left the spa again looking for a clean shower‚Ä¶ || Just had a beautiful massage with Matilde. One of the best in my life‚Äôs.

The whole SPA Treatment would be more than perfect if the pool would be a little warmer, but overall, please come and enjoy here || I had a wonderful experience with the team at Spa Salveo. I received an amazing facial combined with neck, shoulder and hand massage but what really won it for me, was how Carol and the team went ABOVE AND BEYOND for me when I lost my Invisalign in the locker room (which was going to leave me out of pocket). They did multiple searches for me without me asking and they actually found it even after I had accepted it was gone. I'm so grateful to them. So genuine and caring. Will definitely be back next time in Westport. Thank you to the team (Apologies I cannot recall the names of the other women that helped and my amazing masseuse.) || Lovely relaxing spa treatment and a wonderful therapist. Also thanks to the kind lady on reception who managed to find an appointment on short notice.

name: Sweatscape Sauna
address: Pairc Ui R√≠s, Piltown Road, Pilltown, Bettystown, Co. Meath, A92 XP60, Ireland
reviews_text: Authentic sauna experience. The heat was intense in the best way, and you can tell they use proper birch wood‚Äîthere‚Äôs that clean, warm scent that fills the room as it burns. Everything felt genuine, from the steam to the atmosphere. Definitely worth it if you want a real, traditional sauna. || Really lovely time in the Sauna, the plunge pools are amazing. Class set up, and lovely staff! || I had a grand experience! The sauna and cold plunge were perfect. I'll be back again || Had the most relaxing time here the girls are so nice such a cosy atmosphere wishing them well for the future will definitely be back ||

name: Farmfield Spa Escapes
address: Bloomsbury Rd, Oristown, Kells, Co. Meath, Ireland
reviews_text:
We had a lovely experience at Farmfield Spa. It‚Äôs a beautiful outdoor spa with great facilities like the sauna, jacuzzi and cold plunge, all set up in a really calm, relaxing space. We tried the seaweed bath this time and absolutely loved it, and we‚Äôre already looking forward to coming back to try some of the treatments as well.
The facilities are spotless and well maintained, with a rustic feel that still feels modern and comfortable ‚Äì the fireplace is such a nice touch. They also offer refreshments, fruit and sweet treats, which made the whole experience feel even more special.
The staff were genuinely lovely and welcoming throughout. And a special mention to Pepper, the spa kitten, who is incredibly cute and friendly and completely stole the show. Highly recommend for a relaxing escape. || Thank you Ciara and Team.
Had the most relaxing 3 hours in Farmfield Spa last Saturday. Beautiful setting, ambience, facilities, treatment and refreshments with fruit and cakes. Well worth a visit. || The place is magical, the nature, surroundings and the whole design just makes it extra special. Love the thermal area - very relaxing and well taken care. The massage was also amazing. Would definitely recommend || A quiet, peaceful,relaxing little haven tucked away from the chaos of everyday life. We went here for a girly day and loved it from start to finish. We were able to properly catch up without feeling rushed out the door afterwards. I've been to the Galgorm and hated how busy it was. Obviously Farmfield is a smaller place but the fact that theres not people shuffling through like a conveyor belt makes it so much nicer and more relaxing. We will definitely be back. || We had the most amazing experience. The grounds are stunning. The staff are friendly and very helpful. The treatment rooms are beautiful and the masseuse was first class. We enjoyed tje massages,the facials snd use of the thermal facilities. The treats and drinks were excellent. We will definitely be back. Thank you,Ciara and your fabulous team.

name: Contrast Wellness (Sauna & Cold Plunge)
address: Contrast Wellness, Grace Park Rd, Loughanaskin, Athlone, Co. Westmeath, Ireland
reviews_text:
Love heading to Contrast wellness - solo or with friends. Eamon and Graham, and the team are the best. The sauna is always toasty, and the cold plunge is fab - love that it's big enough for us all the brave the cold together. Would recommend to a friend! 5 stars || I have been to contrast wellness Athlone, 3 times now and everytime, I have always been made feel so welcome. The standard of the sauna and cold plunge is the best I have experienced to date. Recovery for powerlifting is made that much better having this facility in Athlone. Highly recommend üëå || As always we had agreat experience at contrast wellness. The sauna is spotless and the location in Shannonbridge is not only picturesque but perfect for jumping into the cold Shannon to cool you down or sit in the ice bath with an fantastic view. We couldn't recommend it highly enough and of course we will be back. As for the hosts Graham and Eamonn you couldn't meet 2 nice people, who have the craic and advise you on anything you need to know. Thank you. || I‚Äôve had this experience in a number of different locations, and I must say the Contrast Wellness location at House Fitness in Athlone really stands out. The space is well lit and kitted out to a very high standard. All of the staff are friendly, welcoming, and inviting. || We booked Contrast Wellness Sauna and Cold Plunge for a private event at Lion's Breath Yoga Studio. Graham was extremely professional, providing us with an e-book on the benefits of hot and cold therapy in advance of the event. Both men were very reliable and a pleasure to deal with. Graham arrived well in advance to set up for the afternoon. Right away, I could tell this was going to be an elevated experience. He chose the ideal location for the cold plunge and even brought water in his van to speed up the filling process. Graham also provided ice blocks.

The sauna was super slick (black in colour) which included essential oils to add to the hot stone. It was also spotless inside, with a footpath before entering. He set up astroturf beneath the steps to the sauna and in front of the cold plunge to zone off the area and enhance the feeling underfoot. We were thrilled with the overall experience they provided and have booked them again. They were incredibly reliable and professional, very friendly to deal with, and I would absolutely recommend them.

name: Seoid Spa
address: D, Dunboyne Castle Hotel & Spa, Castlefarm, Dunboyne, Co. Meath, A86 PW63, Ireland
reviews_text:
Pros: The staff here are so friendly. Lovely thermal spa. Himilayan salt sauna is great. Many saunas and steam options to try out. Very nice decor, relaxing atmosphere even if there are lots of people there. 2 relaxation rooms, one warm, one normal temperature for reading or napping. There is water, tea, fruit to refresh you. Changing rooms are clean and spacious. The price for 2 hours in the thermal spa is good value and will relax you.

The cons: The jets in pool and jacuzzi are not ideally placed where they would reduce any back or neck tension. The new "waterfall" has barely any pressure either, so you will need to pay for a massage treatment to reduce any true stress held in your neck and back. You also need to activate the sensors about every 30 seconds - 1 minute, so this detracts from the experience a bit. The outdoor jacuzzi isnt very hot.

Cons aside, it is definitely worth a visit and paying for a massage treatment if required.  You will leave refreshed! || Today me and my boyfriend we have had a pleasure to come in your spa.
Hotel situated in the middle of the nature, and the position is really good.
We have really appreciate the service of your staff also the price.
We will definitely be back. || after covid this place went 90% down...what spa relax experience you have if: sauna - not working, both steam rooms - not working, outdoor jacuzzi not working... wait so what is actually working? for what I pay if I go there without warning that 90% of facilities is out of order? downhill very bad...except many others issues, here dusty showers and changing rooms. üëé || Unfortunately not so great. I have been a regular visit to the Dunboyne and we have been going for years.  I wasn't too sure if we could use the new spa facilities being spa guests and felt uncomfortable from the start. Form that you sign were an embarrassment and half the information was missing. Should never have been put out. Very poor first impression. The spa is looking better and  I would say it will be nicer when it's done.  I don't intend to return. I didn't enjoy my treatments. Clothes to take off the facial products were so rough. Two different therapists did my treatments. I would rather have got the back massage first as my face was sore after the facial. I wish I would have asked for Rachel my usual therapist. Pity her details were not against my notes on the booking.  Food isn't the lobby has also gone up quite a bit. Only 1 option for jam with our scone. I just don't think the lounge boy wanted to look to be honest.  All in all such a disappointment. We were so looking forward to it. Two stars, one for the spa upgrade and the other for the lovely Rachel. I just want to mention that Gabriella did her best with my back massage and was so lovely, but I really just wanted to leave at that point. || First off the treatment was lovely, as was the staff and treatment rooms.

The big disappointment was the thermal area.
The outside tub was out of order, as were some of the steam/heat rooms, a significant number of jets in the hydrotherapy pool were not working.

The showers were quite mouldy and a lot of lockers in changing room were broken. There were no slippers left when I arrived and the robe had no belt.

The staff advised it's being renovated,  so maybe things will change, but at present don't go with high expectations of thermal area and you'll be alright.

name: Valdas
address: M93G+PV, Harristown, Alexanderaide, Co. Meath, Ireland
reviews_text: Best place üí™ || Best place for sauna || It couldn't be better;)

name: Mercury Sauna Portmarnock
address: Portmarnock Beach North Car Park, Burrow, Portmarnock, Co. Dublin, Ireland
reviews_text:
For me, the idea of stepping out of the sea and into this tiny spot is the perfect way to reset. I tried the sauna a few days ago, and I think the real game changer was the blend of herbs the owner added. I absolutely love that unwinding, almost healing feeling‚Ä¶ you clearly know what you‚Äôre doing.

Well done! || I wish more people knew about this wonderful sauna. Even on the coldest day you can warm up there and enjoy the scent of meadow herbs, and afterwards you can take a walk to the seaside to cool down or even take a dip in the sea. || Amazing sauna experience right by the sea- spotlessly clean, great heat, and a friendly and chilled atmosphere. Perfect spot to unwind and enjoy the coastline with dips between rounds! Definitely recommend! || Beautiful sauna in a gorgeous spot. Dmitry is so welcoming and friendly, and the sauna's perfect after a sea swim in Portmarnock - I'll definitely be back! || We called today, Sauna is good quality, very hot, near the sea if looking for water, may bring your own bottle of water or refreshment, host is experienced with saunas.

name: The Spa at The Johnstown Estate
address: The Johnstown Estate, Johnstown, Enfield, Co. Meath, A83 V070, Ireland
reviews_text:
What a pleasant experience! From the moment I walked in,  I experienced a warm and welcoming vibe. All the staff were truly professional and accommodating.

I was went in for the ‚Äòmum-to-be‚Äô spa experience and the staff were super helpful on which of the facilities were appropriate for me.

Facilities were kept clean and tidy. Every detail felt thoughtfully designed with comfort in mind, which made it easy to fully switch off and enjoy the experience. It truly felt like a safe, peaceful haven for mums-to-be.

A special shout out to Alem, who delivered my treatment with such care, professionalism, and warmth. She took the time to explain everything, made sure I was comfortable throughout, and tailored the treatment perfectly to my needs. It was incredibly relaxing and I felt completely at ease in her hands. I couldn‚Äôt have asked for better.

I would highly recommend this experience to any mum-to-be looking for a truly relaxing, thoughtful, and luxurious treat. ü§ç || To describe the Spa at the Johnstown Estate in one word, I have use an Irish word ‚ÄúSuaimhneas‚Äù{ pronounced  Soo ‚Äì in -ness} which means Peace, tranquillity, rest and quietness. If that is what you are looking for, this is the place for you. Everyone needs a treat during our dark and dull winter. We started off in the rooftop jacuzzi and then went into the thermal suite ( I love the tropical showers). Then we floated off to our treatments. My favourite treatment is the Elemis Facial. We ended the day with a yummy lunch. All the staff there are top class (Reception staff, Therapists and Waitresses). Jessica at Reception was very helpful and made our half day there feel like a holiday.  We were there last week for facials with Naomi and Rosa who were excellent. We were also there twice in Autumn for treatments and our therapists were Nora, Vita , Katia Z and Ana Marija, who were top class. Go raibh maith agaibh go l√©ir {thank you everyone }‚Ä¶for giving us ‚Äú Suaimhneas‚Äù. Nollaig Shona Daoibh { Happy Christmas} See you all next year. || Excellent Facilities, everything was very clean. The full body massage was something else.
Staff super friendly helpful and explained every step in details.
I highly recommend and can't wait to be back. || I spent three hours at the SPA, choosing the full-body massage and lunch option. I recommend this place to everyone. The place is fantastic, and the service is very helpful and friendly. From the reception, where I was greeted by two wonderful women, Jemma and Allanah, who explained all the details and patiently answered my questions. To the fantastic full-body massage given by Maggie, who took care of every detail and the atmosphere in the room. Finally, I enjoyed the incredibly friendly service when choosing lunch and the restaurant, where Jenny and Maya took care of everything. I will definitely be back. || Fantastic Spa. Thermal suites have all the usual facilities, the only thing it's missing is an ice area. A couple of more clocks wouldn't go astray as there is only one in the hallway and it would help when trying to manage your time pre treatments . Plenty of water stations. All doors and dressing room lockers work with a wrist band. The outdoor area is lovely, has a hydro pool, two jacuzzis, showers and seating area. The treatment rooms are lovely. Every area was spotlessly clean and doors and windows were being cleaned every now and again .I had the signature massage and would highly recommend it. All the staff were very nice. Separate relaxation area near the treatment rooms with water beds. Not essential but herbal tea or sorbet would be a nice offering post treatment. You can keep the flip flops and spa bag when leaving. There is a Cafe area at the Spa reception, plenty of people were eating there and having afternoon tea.

name: The Johnstown Estate
address: The Johnstown Estate, Johnstown, Enfield, Co. Meath, A83 V070, Ireland
summary: Traditional rooms in a Georgian manor house, with a spa, 2 restaurants and conferences facilities.
reviews_text:
Spend an overnight here. Lovely hotel in lovely surroundings. Staff very friendly and professional. Rooms are very clean, beds confortable. You can eat in bar or restaurant. We ate in bar as menu suited us better.
After dinner, either have a drink in the bar or the many alcoves available.
The Leisure Centre was excellent, good sized pool, with Sauna and Steam room separate. Hot tub outside, which I had all to myself.
If you want to treat yourself, do a 1 or 2 night day.
Nice walk around the surrouding woods. || We had a truly wonderful stay at The Johnstown Estate Hotel. From the moment we arrived, the staff went above and beyond to make our time special.

Alex and Keri at reception were absolutely fantastic‚Äîwarm, welcoming, and incredibly helpful over email before our stay. Their kindness and efficiency made everything feel easy and well-organised.

The pool reception team were also very friendly and inviting.

The cleaning staff were consistently friendly in the hallways, and our room was spotless, comfortable, and beautifully kept.

We thoroughly enjoyed our time here and will definitely be coming back. || Such a lovely hotel. The staff are so friendly. From the front desk to the restaurant. The service was impeccable. Especially from Emma and Sarah.
I had a massage with Naomi and it was honestly one of the best I've had.
My only negative is that Netflix doesn't work in the bedrooms. || We had a wonderful time at this hotel with my loved one.
The rooms were clean and well maintained, with coffee and tea available. A very pleasant surprise was the birthday greeting left in the room ‚Äî a handwritten card and sweets, which added warmth and attention to detail.

The staff at every level were polite, attentive, and highly professional. The SPA area was a whole separate experience ‚Äî clean, peaceful, incredibly relaxing, and truly at a top level. In the relaxation room there were fresh fruits and chilled lemon water, which was a very nice bonus.

We would also like to give special thanks to the massage therapist Julia ‚Äî the massage was done very professionally and with great care.

Another pleasant surprise was the restaurant ‚Äî everything we ordered (soup, smoked salmon salad, chicken wings, and steak) was tasty and well presented.

Overall, this is a wonderful place for rest and relaxation. We truly recommend it! || Staff and service at the Hotel were lovely we had a very nice meal in the Coach House and were served by Nixon who is a great asset to the Team there we had a nice chat with him. The room we allocated was on the ground floor courtyard level and the room was fine except for it was way too hot the radiator was on non stop and the thermometer in the room doesn't seem to work so we opened the window to discover that the noise from the Leisure Centre Boiler was extremely loud.  The TV in the room just had basic channels couldn't use the Smart TV function when we checked with reception they told us it was old technology on the TV. I know that other rooms haves Smart TV's that work because I have stayed here previously. We were staying for a night away after myself and my partner recently had bereavements in our families so we were there to relax and use the facilities it was just a pity about the TV in the room. Used the pool and leisure centre thermal suite all very nice and the outdoor hot tub was not busy either on Sunday morning which was great. The hotel is lovely and staff are wonderful it's just a pity about the room not being what we would have expected.

name: Navan Natural Health And Spa
address: Navan Natural Health & Spa Centre, 19 Brews Hill, Abbeyland South, Navan, Co. Meath, C15 VX06, Ireland
reviews_text:
absolutely amazing place, been going for a good few years now and would highly recommend and always recommend to anyone that will listen,  even random interactions with people üòÇ, cant stress enough how everyone would benefit going, john nos his stuff and a very pleasant man to deal with, i always have great results for whatever element i go with, and very reasonable with the price ‚ò∫Ô∏è,  mandy || John is brilliant so professional I get my tonics here regularly || My husband and I had a fabulous afternoon using the spa (sauna and  whirlpool) and getting hour massages from John. Definitely recommend! || John is excellent when dealing with natural health. Ive been going for years and always found his products amazing.
John has helped me in many ways and just recently I had a nasty chest inf, I rang John who knows my medical history and he organised a bottle for me and it did the trick, within a few days my chest was so much clearer. || After constant illnesses and trying many doctors I visited John as a last resort‚Ä¶ I wish I visited him first‚Ä¶ he understood exactly what my issues were and even better‚Ä¶ he cured them!! John is very approachable, friendly, knowledgeable and experienced! My partner and daughters all go to him too‚Ä¶ we have not been sick since we have been to John üòä

name: Tribe Saunas
