reviews_text: I had such a fantastic experience with Tribe Sauna. Ian was incredibly knowledgeable and made the whole process so easy. Nothing was ever too much hassle for him, and he took the time to guide me through their wide selection when I wasn‚Äôt sure which one to choose. His advice and expertise made all the difference, and I couldn‚Äôt be happier with my decision. I would 100% recommend this company to anyone looking for quality products and outstanding service. || Cannot recommend Tribe sauna's enough seamless process from contacting Ian initially to getting the Sauna installed! Ian is a wealth of knowledge and guided me down the right path for the correct sauna to suit my needs, I have been using it 3/4 times weekly since purchase over a month ago and I cannot believe the positive impact it has had already on my overall health and well being. Highly recommend! || Delighted with my sauna! Tribe were great to deal with - very informative and helpful as I wasn‚Äôt sure which one to go with || Got an Athens 2 delivered and assembled, the guys where super helpful and knowledgeable! || Bought an infrared sauna and the whole process was just a pleasure. The lads know the products inside out!

name: Fad Saoil Sauna Blackrock
address: Rock Hill, Blackrock, Dublin, Ireland
reviews_text: Really fantastic sauna in a prime time location opposite the train station,great energy there from Oscar and an all around very positive experience. || Honestly one of the nicest setups. A bougie sauna experience, and the staff are really sound. Great addition to Blackrock! || Was at the blackrock venue this evening and it was amazing. I was greated by Thomas who was extremely accommodating and kind showing me the facilities. the place was super clean and pleasant to be. 10/10 would recommend. And another thank you to Thomas for being so pleasant || Such an amazing space. Clean, beautiful and truly restorative. I love that they have an option for The CUINIS Sauna And also THE PUB Sauna. Gorgeous facilities. Lovely friendly staff. A great community. Five stars all the way üôåüôåüôå || Out of all the saunas I‚Äôve visited recently this is defo one of the best. Tom was great, showing me around the two saunas, spacious changing area and plunge pool. Lovely set up overall üòÑ

name: Restore Wellness
address: Coast Rd, Carrickhill, Portmarnock, Co. Dublin, Ireland
reviews_text:
Absolutely love it at Restore!! It‚Äôs such a treat to warm up in the sauna after a dip in the cold Irish sea. To add to the experience, the view is second to none, especially at sunrise!! üåÖ‚ú® there‚Äôs a small changing area where you can leave your stuff and the car park is so handy! I can‚Äôt wait to go back! üßòüèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüî• || Fantastic and new little place just off of portmarnock beach that gives you the ability to jump into a sauna after an ocean swim, sauna, then immediately jump into an ice bath.

What more could you want?

A fantastic addition to the growing number of options at hands length from one of the best beaches in all of Ireland || This place is a little gem. Across from the beach, and with a large sauna (with stunning views) & cold plunge pool.. whats not to love. Don‚Äôt hesitate & book a slot! || Lovely sauna itself, but the additional features are odd.

Sauna itself is really large with an amazing view. Covered changing area handy in the rain.

Unfortunately it's very hard to access the beach, especially within the sauna time, so they have plunge pools. Very very cold which is good, but they're chlorinated which is quite unpleasant and not matching the relaxing sauna vibes. There's also only two plunge pools, and the sauna fits 10 so not ideal as most people take breaks around the same time. || Just back from yet another lovely experience at Restore Sauna. The sauna is perfectly Located with a view out over the sea and they now have ice baths and a shower for your use. You can park beside it in the hotel car park and they also have a small changing room on site. It‚Äôs close enough to the beach to run over for a couple of quick dips during your hour in the sauna. The staff are really friendly and always helpful. Always a fab experience. We will be back soon

name: The Wood Fired Sauna - Skerries
address: The Captains, Townparks, Skerries, Co. Dublin, Ireland
reviews_text:
We had brilliant experience here in Skerries my wife and I are regular sauna users and decided to give it a try. Charlie the chap  working here showed us everything we needed to know about the sauna and was a nice friendly and approachable person.
We had pre-booked  into the session and felt so refreshed after it and Great value for money.
Definitely we will come back regularly. || We had a wonderful time yesterday.
The sauna was gorgeous and hot and made the sea dip even more enjoyable. The view was spectacular. Very easy transition from the previous booking to us. We were a party of five, but there was loads of room for 8. Well worth the money. || Great Sauna experience in Skerries every time we go. Water is Baltic but sauna is toasty warm. Very helpful  and friendly chap looking after us. Its a great way to spend an afternoon, would highly recommend The Wood Fired Sauna both in Skerries and Rush. || On Sunday last arrived down for our usual swim and was delighted to see The Wood Fired Sauna parked at the Springers.  We were delighted that we were able to use it even though we hadn‚Äôt previously booked.  Paddy was lovely and very obliging  - he explained everything to us. We booked online and was able to go ahead and use it.  Definitely will be using it on a regular basis for the next six months. || Rainy day last  Saturday but we had a fab time in the sauna. Started with a swim in the Springboards and had 2 further dips during our 45 mins in the sauna. Great views of islands and friendly staff. Definately would recommend. Hope you can continue for the winter months.

name: Coral Leisure Monaghan
address: Coral Leisure Monaghan Ltd, Clones Rd, Mullaghcroghery, Monaghan, H18 A384, Ireland
reviews_text:
Very good gym with modern and clean facilities, ample parking with all possible amenities. In addition to the gym, there is a specific area for spinning, martial arts, tennis and an environment where various physical activities are scheduled throughout the week. 100% recommended. Honest prices. || I visited earlier this week and was very disappointed. I‚Äôm currently on holiday in Ireland from Australia for a few weeks, and I was charged ‚Ç¨13 for access to the gym and pool l, even though the sign out front clearly advertises it as ‚Ç¨10. That extra ‚Ç¨3 felt very misleading.

The gym facilities felt like they were 30 years old. The equipment is extremely outdated and worn out, with very little variety. Back in Australia, I pay the equivalent of ‚Ç¨13 per week for unlimited access to modern, high-quality gym (and pool) with brand new equipment,  so this was a major letdown.

The pool itself was nice, but the jacuzzi was lukewarm at best, and the steam room wasn‚Äôt great.
The changing rooms were also disappointing,  about half the lockers were broken or in poor condition, and I even had to pay extra to use the hairdryer - and it was not modern to say the least.
On top of that, you lose 50 cents each time you use the lockers.

Overall, a very underwhelming experience. If you‚Äôre going to charge these kinds of rates, the facilities should be up to date, and the pricing should be clear and honest. || When we get home from abroad, we always venture to Coral leisure with our children and their cousin. It is  a great facility. The staff is very friendly and attentive. There is one lifeguard (of course we didn't get his name!) but our son will remember him  fondly for a long time to come. He chatted to him about his swimming skills and gave him goggles as he forgot his. He also volunteered to throw our son in on several occasions. All of the children loved being around him and he is a real asset. We hope to see him again when we return!! || Was pleasantly surprised at how clean and well-kept the swimming facilities are.  The kids had a brilliant time going up and down the slide and the place wasn't overcrowded. The girls at the front desk were really nice and the staff at the pool kept the slide open for ages to the kids could enjoy.  Will definitely be back. || I have been to a lot of swimming pools in my life and this is the only one that changes you money to use a locker.

name: An Bosca Te - Banagher Sauna
address: The Marina, Curraghavarna And Portavolla, Banagher, Co. Offaly, R42 WY65, Ireland
reviews_text:
Great sauna was super hot and a fresh dip in the harbour or barrel for cold. Did 1hour 15min on heat followed by cold. Felt like I was reborn. Highly recommend, well run and a great coffee afterward. || What a fantastic experience! We had this little slice of paradise to ourselves for a full hour, in disbelief nobody else was there enjoying this beautiful place!Donna is a brilliant host,lovely coffee shop right beside and access to river, we will be back‚ò∫Ô∏è || Lovely little Sauna on the banks of the river Shannon in Banagher. Lovely clean set up with a view of the river short walk down the pier to dip in the river to cool off. || Fabulous experience !!!
Thoroughly enjoyed it and really looking forward to returning
Perfect Mother‚Äôs Day gift üéÅüíê || Such a relaxing experience, and so nice to have one in the Midlands

name: The Sauna @ Lough Boora
address: Lough Boora Discovery Park, Lea Beg, Blueball, Co. Offaly, R35 K2E7, Ireland
reviews_text: Brilliant setup with peaceful beautiful views. Lovely staff. Coffee/food nearby aswell. Lovely walks around park. Great spot || Nice hot sauna with scenic view of the lake and 3 plunge pools || Amazing sauna and lovely setting.

name: Sauna Castlerea
address: Cloonalis, Clonalis, Co. Roscommon, F45 N400, Ireland
reviews_text:
Inspiring. Peaceful.
Amazing little organic shop. The best gluten free bakery, home made, ever. The home made chocolate with marzipan inside is mind blowing. The home made jam, biscuits, scones, bread, are all delicious and impressive. It is a gluten free paradise and it tastes even better. Castlerea is lucky to have you. ‚ù§Ô∏èüå∑ Lovely couple.
Soon massage will be offered. || We have just had the most relaxing afternoon here! The location is perfect, only a couple of mins from Castlerea but very quiet setting in the woods. Gorgeous views from the sauna and the afternoon tea was so delicious. Highly recommend a visit! || Had a wonderful time having afternoon tea after a cold plunge & sauna. It was a great experience & something different to do for a catch up with friends. The food was amazing & felt so good after the cold plunge & sauna. || Really enjoyed the sauna and cold plunge great way to relax for an evening. Highly recommend || Had an amazing couple of hours between the gorgeous sauna and the cold plunge followed by a beautiful Afternoon tea which was delicious. Definitely be back to fo it again soon ‚ù§Ô∏è

name: SauNua Athlone
address: Barry More, Hodson Bay, Co. Roscommon, N37 KH72, Ireland
reviews_text:
We LOVED our time here! Top quality saunas & hot tubs - nice to have a dip in the lake too! Great that there‚Äôs changing facilities and a coffee shop also! Thanks to pierce for providing the water with lemon & limes in it too - it‚Äôs the little things! üòç Would highly recommend! || Amazing spot! While the kids had a blast at Ireland's largest inflatable water park, the wife and I finally got some much-needed relaxation in their brand new wood cabin saunas. The views are stunning, and the atmosphere is so peaceful. And dont worry‚Äîno pesky otters causing any trouble here!
The reception team was incredibly pleasant and helpful, making us feel right at home. Everything was spotless and well-kept. A must-visit for families and anyone looking for a great mix of fun and relaxation! || Such a gorgeous setup and setting! Had a lovely time at SauNua the past two weekends. Water and essential oils provided and the staff are so accommodating. Will definitely be back. || Just visited SauNua at Baysports in Athlone, and it‚Äôs amazing! The sauna and jacuzzi have a breathtaking view across the lake‚Äîsuper relaxing. The space is modern, clean, and well-designed. Perfect spot to unwind with friendly staff to top it off. Highly recommend! || Such a wonderful experience at Saunua!! Scenic location with incredible staff and amazing facilities!! Can‚Äôt recommend it enough and will definitely be returning!!!

name: VOYA Seaweed Baths
address: Shore Rd, Carrowbunnaun, Strandhill, Co. Sligo, F91 FYW3, Ireland
reviews_text:
A visit to VOYA Seaweed Baths is a truly special and unique spa experience that perfectly captures the spirit of Strandhill. It's a place where you can unwind and indulge in a luxurious yet affordable treatment that feels deeply connected to the local environment.
The main event, of course, is the seaweed bath, which uses locally and hand-cut fresh seaweed. There are several options available, and we highly recommend booking the twin room with the Atlantic Ocean view. It's an absolutely stunning setting‚Äîthere's nothing quite like lying in a warm seaweed bath, looking out at the ocean and the sky through the window, with a gentle breeze coming through. This option also gives you access to a quiet relaxation room where you can unwind with the same incredible view.
Regardless of the room you choose, each one is a private sanctuary equipped with its own small shower and steam room. The staff recommends a few minutes in the steam room before your bath to open your pores and maximize the therapeutic effects of the seaweed.
Beyond the baths, VOYA offers a variety of other treatments, including massage and reflexology, all delivered by a well-trained, attentive, and polite staff. The whole experience feels incredibly professional and relaxing from start to finish. You can also purchase their own range of seaweed-based cosmetics, which are a great way to take a piece of the experience home with you.
VOYA Seaweed Baths is more than just a spa; it's a place of tranquility and rejuvenation that feels luxurious without being pretentious. It's a place we are already looking forward to returning to. || Seaweed baths are simultaneously relaxing & enlivening & I love them. I‚Äôve been to Voya numerous times over the years & intend to go again whenever I‚Äôm in the west. The Baths are set back from Strandhill‚Äôs beautiful beach. The staff are warm & friendly & the rooms are clean & unfussily functional. You leave feeling great. 3 quibbles. The steam in the mini sauna beside the bath automatically cuts out halfway thru your 50-min session unless you remember to ask to have it reset & the person you ask remembers to do it. The shower in the mini sauna doesn‚Äôt have an ice-cold option. (Why?!) And the seaweed-derived products on sale are insanely expensive. But still: just having a seaweed bath is such a pleasurable experience. üôÇ || We were helped my Ciaran. His customer service was top notch and made our experience extra special.
My mom and I shared the Knocknarea view and it was incredible!!!!
Can‚Äôt wait to do it again x || An Unforgettable Escape: Pure Bliss at Voya Seaweed Baths!

From the moment we stepped into Voya Seaweed Baths, we knew we were in for a truly special experience, and it absolutely delivered! Our visit was nothing short of 2+ hours of pure, unadulterated bliss.

We had the immense pleasure of indulging in a wonderful seaweed bath in the exquisite Atlantic Seaview Suite. This twin room offered breathtaking panoramic views of the vast, calming ocean, creating an immediate sense of tranquility. Submerging myself in the warm, mineral-rich seaweed was an incredibly unique and deeply relaxing experience ‚Äì my skin feels amazing.

Following the bath, I was treated to a massage by Megan, who is, without a doubt, a phenomenal massage therapist. Her expert touch melted away every last bit of tension, leaving me feeling completely renewed and profoundly serene.

The journey of relaxation continued in the inviting relaxation room. It was everything one could wish for: warm, cozy, and adorned with the same stunning ocean views. The soft glow of scented candles, the luxurious feel of fluffy robes (available in multiple sizes!), the sparkling cleanliness of the space, and the perfectly curated spa music all contributed to an ambiance of ultimate peace.

Voya Seaweed Baths truly offers a sanctuary for the senses. Every detail is meticulously crafted to ensure a deeply restorative and unforgettable experience. We left feeling pampered, rejuvenated, and already dreaming of our next visit to Ireland. This will be on the itinerary. Highly, highly recommend! || Voya spa is amazing, I had fabulous seaweed bath and bespoke bliss treatment there, the hot oil back massage was absolutely unbelievable - thanks to Megan, no words, I highly recommend, I will be back

name: Icon Spa, Castle Dargan Estate, Ballygawley, Co. Sligo
address: Castle Dargan Estate, Castledargan, Ballygawley, Co. Sligo, F91 F2DN, Ireland
reviews_text:
We both had a great time at the SPA and top quality massages. I really recommend Sarah, she is a great therapist and a lovely person. The facilities were very clean, the service excellent and lovely staff. The Icon Spa is cosy, quiet and very relaxing. I will book again. || Gorgeous spa with loads of facilities. The sea weed baths are outside which I throughly enjoyed on the windy and drizzly day that was in it. I got a Swedish full body massage from a lovely lady called Natalia and it was honestly the best massage I ever had. Would highly recommend her! The castle and grounds itself are beautifully kept , will deff be back again ! || Worst experience ever! Was booked in at 5pm for treatments so used the thermal suite before hand, very basic.

After our treatments the therapist just left the room without saying anything and we weren‚Äôt brought to the relaxation room just straight to the changing rooms. I had a shower and whilst blowing drying my hair, a worker barged into the changing room while my friend was getting changed and told us to ‚Äúhurry up they close at 6 and we don‚Äôt get payed‚Äù was extremely rude so I left with wet hair.. do not take bookings at 5 if you can‚Äôt fit people in. If I could I‚Äôd rate it 0 stars || Don‚Äôt go here! Today my party of 6 were met with a cold, unwelcoming arrival by each staff member in the icon spa. A lot of the facilities advertised were not working or working poorly. The steam room was off, the heated seats were cold, the relaxation room had no hot water for tea, I asked for some and it took 35 mins to be brought in, the outdoor ‚Äúhot‚Äù tub was reading 36 degrees and I went inside to ask staff could it be turned up higher and they said that it was just the weather that was making it cold. I paid for a scalp, face and shoulder massage however the staff member doing it was completely inexperienced, I‚Äôve had a few of these treatments in other spas and I know that this was totally not the way it should have been done it was actually painful and uncomfortable at times. Also in the treatment room I was only covered up by a single towel on the bed rather than a warm blanket. When the treatment was finished the staff member told me she‚Äôd wait for me outside the door which she didn‚Äôt. I was eventually taken back to the relaxation room which was untidy with used cups and unfolded blankets not fixed from people that had previously used it. The chairs in the relaxation room also looked dirty and stained. When we finished and went to get changed I tried to use the shower but the water was cold, I informed a staff member and asked could I use the golf club changing rooms instead and she didn‚Äôt even apologise and just told me ‚Äúthose showers are probably the same‚Äù, no alternative given, she acknowledged the water was cold and didn‚Äôt even apologise for it. We also had an issue with the way the manager spoke to one of my party guests which actually made her feel anxious and uncomfortable to continue with the treatment. This was resolved however the manager handled this situation totally unprofessionally. She also informed us that one of her colleagues cut one of our party‚Äôs treatment short and told us to ‚Äúwrite a review and mention his name on it‚Äù which was totally unprofessional. In summary, a number of issues arose during this experience and staff were cold, unapologetic and completely unprofessional. We are a group of hard working individuals who were here as a treat for one of my friends birthday. This was also mentioned upon booking and written by 3 party guests on our consultation forms and not one member of staff acknowledged this. I will never be returning here and I will recommend that friends and family do not attend here. || Has a full body massage and facial with Lauryn this afternoon, and I can't praise her enough. I told her at the beginning that I prefer a good hard massage and that's exactly what I got.
The massage was excellent and the facial was so relaxing that I almost fell asleep. Had the relaxation area to myself before and after, and love fresh fruit and herbal teas. Been to the ico and few times over the years but its definitely improved.

name: Natural Swimming pool
address: 5 Blackrock View, Rosses Upper, Rosses Point, Co. Sligo, F91 XD91, Ireland
reviews_text: Was incredible finish the fay here just beside the Wild Atlantic Way point in Rosses. A lot of people enjoying of this amazing place watching de sunset. || Beautiful location weather was really warm good coffee shop and food nearby || Come down for the Christmas Day swim at midday on Christmas Day. || Great spot for a free sea swim.  Most suitable for competent swimmers only due to tides. || Great location. If the tide is in ,you can hop off the pier.

name: Kilcullens Seaweed Baths
address: Cliff Rd, Carrowhubbuck South, Enniscrone, Co. Sligo, F26 D729, Ireland
reviews_text:
What an absolute treat, I feel like a refreshed young Victorian man. I was entering the unexpected other than rave reviews of what the seaweed can do for you.

The steam cupboard was a great addition.

I look forward to returning soon. || We absolutely loved it here. The vintage and old-fashioned style to this longstanding bathhouse is still in tact, which really makes you feel like you've stepped into an exciting time machine that is specifically designed to pamper you. Pricewise, I really feel like it's a bargain. Genuinely half the price of other seaweed bath places with twice as much character. || This was the highlight of our week long trip around Ireland. The most relaxing, unique experience in a time capsule. The reception also gives history about the building and the tubs. I cannot recommend this experience enough, I already want to take another seaweed bath! || This place is an amazing gem of a spot, takes you back in time with the Victorian vibe, also the water and steam are hot with the sea water being the perfect mix of relaxation and relief. 1000/10 wish I could could give more stars. The lads who worked there were wonderful to boot. || Loved this experience completely. It was wonderfully authentic and super relaxing. We rented a room with a single tub and steam box.
I would highly recommend this if you need a quiet relaxing hour after a long hike or cold surf.

name: Soak in Wellness
address: 6 ox view, Knockaculleen, Dromore West, Co. Sligo, F26 W564, Ireland
reviews_text:
We introduced Soak to the spa at Delphi Resort earlier this year, and it‚Äôs been such a fantastic addition. From the very start, working with Karen, the founder, has been a joy, she‚Äôs so friendly, passionate, and helpful.

The products themselves are gorgeous, made with natural, Irish-grown ingredients and beautiful aromatherapy blends that our clients absolutely love. We also really value that everything is recyclable and the candles are non-toxic, which fits perfectly with our eco values.

We‚Äôve also added Soak‚Äôs luxurious body and bath rituals to our treatment menu, and the feedback has been amazing. Guests are loving the experience, and so are we! || I had the pleasure of gifting a box set for my dear Aunty for Christmas. She is a huge fan of natural salts and candles. Suffice to say she was delighted with the lavender Shower Ritual Set. Beautifully packaged and all the more special given its hand made with passion and care. || I have been using the Soak Bedtime Bliss body scrub and I cannot recommend it enough. Firstly the lavender aroma is so calming and relaxing and most definitely puts a busy mind at ease and secondly I have noticed the salts and other contents of this particular scrub have moisturized my legs the most and any dryness that was there before is quickly moisturized with just one use of this scrub. Aswell as all that,the presentation is just excellent.From the boxes to the jars.Definitely get yourself one of these Scrubs. || I really enjoy using the Bedtime Bliss scrub with lavender! This is without a doubt the best body scrub I have tried. It leaves my skin soft and smooth after use. Can definitely recommend! || The lavender salt scrub smells divine and my skin is glowing after it. The little lavender flowers swirling around the water are so pretty too.  Really relaxing

name: Rosses Point Beach
address: beach, Rosses Point, Co. Sligo, Ireland
reviews_text:
Stunning views, magical lighting, good place for a swim. Even has its own Sauna - The Hot Box - and lots of walks. || Beautiful clean beach. Lots of Cold water swimmers come here for their dip. Lots of gorgeous places for a hug in a mug afterwards too. || Stunning scenery and beautiful clean beach. We were there on a 23 degree day and there was plenty of space on the beach, though the car park was busy. Plenty of other parking options a bit further along though.
Great path to the beach for my wheelchair and for prams and buggies.
I took a star off as there were no open toilets and my radar key did not fit the standalone accessible/disabled toilet. || Stunning beach and views. Great for a nice walk. || One of the best, safest and most scenic beaches in Ireland. With amazing views of Coney Island, Knocknarea and the backdrop of Benbulben you also have three different types of beaches to choose from. Choose them all. And the people around here are lovely. Go to Austies for a sneaky one on the way home. Dog friendly

name: Poll Gorm
address: Easky, Co. Sligo, Ireland
reviews_text:
Went for a swim with my 6 year old son. It was an overcast but mild day out, but the sea was fierce. We loved swimming here. It was sheltered, calm, quiet and beautiful. I look forward to visiting again. || The water was clear as day and cold. The scenery was beautiful. || This was a great find for a swim in the recent heatwave (Jul '21)!
You need to go at low tide to swim. Lots of rock pools to keep kids entertained too. || What a treat- fresh sea water pool in among the rocks just by the roadside, accessed by a small set of steps. Looking closely the rocks are imprinted with fossils!! || Lovely little stop to go for a dip ü•∞ not very big or deep but nice nonetheless less

name: Dunmoran Strand
address: Dunmoran, Co. Sligo, Ireland
reviews_text:
Lovely place , there's lots of dog walkers can access a beach bar on other side of beach , however one car  drew up took dog for walk came back with the obligatory poo bag left by side of car , put dog in car and drove off ,great place to surf few people went into swim ,there are two portaloos but no bins , || Lovely secluded sand beach, ideal if you have a camper. Very quiet and clean chemical toilets available on site. || Lovely linear walk along the beach with great views across to the cliffs of Donegal. And dog friendly! || Beautiful place with not many waves if you want some surfing. Very good for a families and little kids. Awesome place overall, just very little parking! || Beautiful place...
Just wish the portaloos where there all year .

name: Radisson Blu Hotel & Spa, Sligo
address: Ballincar, Rosses Point, Co. Sligo, F91 XW7Y, Ireland
summary: Sophisticated hotel with modern quarters, plus a spa, an indoor pool & stylish dining.
reviews_text:
We had a really lovely stay here post Christmas. Couldn‚Äôt fault the hotel in any way. Each member of staff we encountered were so friendly and nothing was too much to ask. The ambience was gorgeous and cosy. We ate in the hotel the first night in Waves bar and it was delicious. Service was really efficient. The room was spotless and very comfortable. I‚Äôd highly recommend this hotel. || My partner and I booked this hotel as we were in Sligo for a friend‚Äôs engagement party and wanted to treat ourselves. We‚Äôd booked just a standard room with a double bed but unfortunately when we went into our room there were 2 single beds there. The lady on reception last night (27th Dec) couldn‚Äôt have been more apologetic for the mix up and promptly organised a new room! She was so kind and even gave us an upgrade to a much better room! The room was gorgeous and had beautiful views, we didn‚Äôt want to leave! Fabulous hotel with incredible staff. We will definitely be back to enjoy the hotel and all it has to offer in the future as this was just a quick visit. || We stayed for two nights over the New Year and had a very enjoyable stay. The hotel was nicely decorated for the Christmas period with a huge Christmas tree in the lobby.
Our room was spacious, clean, quiet and comfortable.
Food was superb with a buffet breakfast, room service and meals availble to order throughout the day. You must book the Brasserie restaurant for evening meals
All staff were very attentive, friendly, helpful and professional.
The Radisson is conveniently situated close to Sligo town and is a good base for exploring the surrounding area. || Really nice hotel but let down by breakfast. We had a really lovely stay and were given an upgrade to a suite which was fantastic. Amazing views and great facilities. Breakfast in the morning was a dissapointment. We arrived at breakfast 15 minutes after service started so were expecting fresh food..... fried eggs were solid, bacon overcooked and hard, scrambled eggs cold and dry. Despite the bad experience at breakfast it was a really nice stay with friendly staff and a warm welcome. 5 Stars for Hotel, facilities and staff 3 Stars for breakfast || Recently had one night at the Raddison in Sligo. Receptionist on check in was fabulous. Checked us in early and gave us lots of info on local spots and the ammenities within the hotel. Room was fantastic, clean and comfortable with a king sized bed. Pool and spa ammenities were great. Now, being the only restaurant/bar in the local area, we didn‚Äôt have any other dining options so we headed to the main bar of the hotel. We were excited to order some of the monthly cocktail specials and sit at the bar. Unfortunately the service was so bad that we were left laughing in utter disbelief. Hungover, inattentive and disinterested and still convinced the bartender didn‚Äôt put any alcohol in our cocktails. The food was awful especially given the price. If you are staying here please make other dinner arrangements! Otherwise a great spot for accommodation.

name: 4 Star Sligo Southern Hotel & Leisure Centre
address: Strandhill Rd, Rathedmond, Sligo, F91 EW24, Ireland
summary: Refined 1928 property featuring a genteel restaurant, an indoor pool & a gym, plus a snug bar.
reviews_text:
Great that they offer some dog-friendly rooms!
I really appreciated that we could stay with our dog.

However, the pool and spa area felt a bit disappointing.
It didn‚Äôt feel particularly luxurious.

Vegan food options were the biggest issue.
The hotel said they could provide vegan meals, but unfortunately the breakfast wasn‚Äôt a genuine vegan option. We were charged full price for a breakfast that was essentially:
‚Ä¢	Plain bread (no vegan butter provided)
‚Ä¢	Baked beans
‚Ä¢	Cooked tomatoes

It felt more like items removed from the standard cooked breakfast rather than a thoughtfully prepared vegan alternative. Because of that, it didn‚Äôt feel fair to be charged the same price as a full breakfast.

Overall:
Lovely that they welcome dogs, but the spa and vegan food options need improvement. If the hotel says they can cater vegan meals, a proper, considered vegan breakfast would make a big difference. || We stayed here while on a tour. The hotel itself is conveniently located, and the main areas were well kept. My room was clean and decent sized, if a bit dated. Being that it is an older hotel, unfortunately there were limited plugs close to the bed, so I would recommend having an alternative charging method for your devices.

Now, onto the areas for improvement: We had dinner in the dining room, and although the staff were kind, there just weren‚Äôt enough servers and they looked stressed while rushing to assist everyone. Secondly, the biggest area for improvement is lack of communication. Backstory: Due to an incident with my chronic illness, I overslept and was rushing the next morning, resulting in me leaving some items behind (my fault). However, I contacted the hotel via their ‚Äúcontact us‚Äù page on their website within the hour. I then followed up 3 days later with an email in hopes of me paying to ship the items to family in London. It has now been over a month since I contacted them and no one has responded in any way.

I‚Äôve personally worked in the hotel industry and I would expect better from a ‚Äú4 star‚Äù hotel. || I had a wonderful stay at Sligo Southern Hotel. The rooms were spacious, clean, and very comfortable, making it easy to relax and feel at home. The food was absolutely superb, with a great variety and delicious flavors that really stood out. On top of that, the service was excellent ‚Äì the staff were warm, attentive, and always willing to go the extra mile to ensure everything was perfect. Overall, a truly enjoyable experience and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Sligo. || We stayed for one night. The hotel website says it is dog friendly but when we checked in they had not allocated us the right room so we had to wait while the staff made another room ready and we had to pay an extra charge. We then came down to the bar for a drink, but our dog was not allowed in the bar. The room was spacious and comfortable. Breakfast was very good but our dog was not allowed in the restaurant. Sligo Southern Hotel you really need to sort yourself out and make the rules clear for your guests. || I stayed here for an overnighter. The food was excellent and the room was lovely. The added touch of a packet of tayto crisps and water was fantastic.
Great service, the staff were so friendly and accommodating.

name: S√ìL√ÅS SPA
address: Ballincar, Co. Sligo, Ireland
reviews_text:
I recently visited Solas Spa for their Christmas event and I honestly couldn‚Äôt fault a single part of the experience. From the very first interaction, the booking process was seamless and welcoming. A special mention has to go to the receptionist, Claire, who truly went above and beyond - she was so friendly, helpful and made us feel looked after from start to finish.

The treatments themselves were amazing. The therapists are extremely thorough and professional, taking real care to ensure everything was tailored and relaxing.

The thermal suite and relaxation area were also outstanding - such a calm, beautifully designed space that really allows you to switch off and unwind.

Overall, Solas Spa is definitely one of the nicest spas in Sligo. Everything felt well thought out, luxurious and genuinely relaxing. I‚Äôd highly recommend it and will absolutely be returning. || Myself and my daughter Emma went to a spa evening and we had a fabulous time .The receptionist Claire was so welcoming and friendly .I would highly recommend a visit to the  Radisson solas spa . || Solas spa at the Raddison is definitely a place for a treat.   From the minute you enter the spa,  there is a warm welcome from the staff and a beautiful calmness , it's immaculately clean with a great selection of treatments available, the relaxation suite is just a perfect place to relax and enjoy some quiet time with a variety of healthy treats.   I enjoyed a fantastic Elemis facial with Katerine.  I have no hesitation in recommending the Solas Spa and already planning my next visit. || Love this place ,brilliant staff that really make you comfortable and are lovely and friendly with any info and treatments I've had over the last few years of going here. Very clean with a lovely relaxation area also. ||

name: Enniscrone Pier
address: Carrowhubbuck South, Enniscrone, Co. Sligo, Ireland
reviews_text: Lovely town, on the atlantic, gorgeous sandy beach for miles. Close grocery store in Ballina, 10 drive. Seaweed baths in town. Really a lovely get away location. || The pier is a lovely spot in Enniscrone to view Killala Bay and the wonderful sandy beach. The views are beautiful. The pier is always buzzing with families and people of all ages, locals, and tourists. It is very safe to swim here, and if you're lucky, you may see the dolphins that are in the bay from time to time!!! Lovely place to watch the amazing sunsets over Killala Bay. || Such a beautiful spot.  Great to sit and watch the world go by, there is the coastal walk beside it and a great spot for swimming.  When the conditions are good there is nearly always someone there swimming, the hardy folks in their togs, some in wetsuits (the water is really cold in Ireland apart from the height of summer, and it's still fresh then!.).  Parking can be a challenge on a busy day but when it's quiet there is a car park across the road and a decent amount of on street parking, no charge.  There are showers and toilets but I'm not sure of opening times. || What a beautiful walk, very peaceful and some of the most beautiful scenery and beach views you could ask for, if you haven't had a walk along the pier you don't know what your missing just beautiful. Has to be one of my favourite beaches in Ireland, lovely seats all along the pier to just sit and relax || Nice good sized pier, many people come here to dive in for a dip and it's a good place to catch mackerel during the summer months.

name: Sligo
address: Sligo, Ireland

name: Clayton Hotel Sligo
address: Clayton Hotel Sligo, Clarion Road, Ballytivnan, Ballinode, Co. Sligo, F91 N8EF, Ireland
summary: Informal hotel dating from 1848 offering a spa, cosy dining & an indoor pool, plus free Wi-Fi.
reviews_text:
‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

I had a fantastic stay at the Clayton Hotel Sligo and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting the area. From the moment we arrived, the staff were warm, welcoming, and extremely professional, making check-in smooth and stress-free. The hotel itself is modern, well-maintained, and has a very relaxing atmosphere throughout.

The rooms were excellent ‚Äì spacious, spotless, and very comfortable. The bed was especially comfortable, ensuring a great night‚Äôs sleep, and the room was well equipped with everything needed for a pleasant stay. The bathroom was clean and modern, with good water pressure and quality toiletries, which is always appreciated.

The facilities are one of the hotel‚Äôs strongest points. The leisure centre is fantastic, with a well-sized swimming pool, sauna, steam room, and a fully equipped gym. Everything was clean, well organised, and easy to access, making it perfect for relaxing or unwinding after a busy day. The overall layout of the hotel makes it feel calm and enjoyable without being overcrowded.

Dining was another highlight. The food was of very high quality, with a great variety available at breakfast and in the restaurant. Everything was fresh, well presented, and tasty, with attentive staff ensuring a pleasant dining experience.

Overall, the Clayton Hotel Sligo offers excellent value, great facilities, comfortable rooms, and outstanding service. I would absolutely stay here again and would confidently recommend it to couples, families, or anyone looking for a high-quality hotel experience in Sligo. || I can't say enough good things about our trip to this hotel. The staff are wonderful. The food is excellent. The hotel was gorgeous. Sligo is a beautiful town. The scenic Rosses point is also close by. We had the most incredible weekend. The staff at the Clayton are incredible. || Was such a wonderful location and everything so nice and the staff very welcoming. Beds were nice if a bit over firm to my liking. The separate entryway door to bath and bedroom was an odd thing but fine.
Only real complaint was how stuffy the room was especially since the window was child locked and could barely open. I get that it's a safety thing but we were two grown adults would have been nice to have the option to close it.
Food was nice especially the main courses though nothing mind blowing and one dish slightly under-seasoned but was still good. Breakfast was very tasty and plentiful for the buffet, exactly what we needed that morning. Though could have put a strainer on the scrambled eggs so they weren't so watery at the bottom.
We ordered room service late at night which I appreciated was available.
The pizza we orders was serviceable but no complaints as just a midnight snack level. They did seem to forget the pizza the first time as they only brought up a single drink then as it was getting a bit longer than expected we called and they said they'd be up in 5 minutes which was slightly longer with two new drinks with half melted ice and the pizza. This isn't really much of a complaint just something we noted and laughed at at the time.
All in all a nice stay with good amenities that most will be satisfied with just don't expect anything super mind blowing from anything but the location and buildings. || Lovely staff and the rooms were huge. Beds comfortable of course. Facilities were good as was the breakfast and the bar/restaurant served very tasty food in large portions. Price was only slightly higher than some of the top end eateries in the town.
The bar lacked a sense of comfort or style however and with no windows did feel a bit utilitarian.
My second room lacked bedside sockets which is kind of standard elsewhere for bedside phone charging. Final negative is some of the corridor doors had hard stops which meant lots of racket for people occupying rooms in those sections when other guests were passing to their own rooms. Mine was a 2 way swing so not an issue but I did make a lot of noise with the main corridor access door when first arriving and when I forgot.
In summary: food, staff, room size, comfort excellent.
Noise, styling and some utilities √† bit poorly thought out. || Absolutely amazing service throughout the hotel especially during breakfast. Served by Ewelina and she was Absolutely brilliant, she was so kind and helpful throughout breakfast service. She seated us and our young children where we had plenty of room, she brought out beautiful porridge to us and some croissants wishing us a happy anniversary.  Every time we seen her she had a big smile on her face and nothing was too much, I watched how she greeted everyone with the same friendly approach.  She is an asset to the hotel and is amazing at her job! Our room was lovely and clean and we loved the gym and swimming pool. Cannot wait to stay again! Thank you

name: The Heat Retreat
address: Townland, Townparks, Cahir, Co. Tipperary, E21 R966, Ireland
reviews_text:
The sauna is small but was nice and hot. The plunge pool was also small but I like the stainless steel. Changing rooms were very small and awkward.
For ‚Ç¨15 it was fine but now I see the price increase, although minimum (‚Ç¨1) puts me off returning when I can go to a place much larger and more comfortably with a jacuzzi for ‚Ç¨15.
Nonetheless, I enjoyed my experience there and the young guy in charge was very friendly and polite.. || Lovely welcome from Caidan, hot sauna, fantastic cold plunge pool. Nice shower and change area. I will definitely be back. Lovely energy and people there. || Super job making it feel secluded in a busy spot. Sound lads, very relaxed. Loved it! || Truly an epic experience. Finally something like this is available in Tipp. The quality of the sauna is incomparably top notch. I loved every minute of my time there. Eddie and Aaron were lovely to deal with also. Couldn‚Äôt recommend highly enough. Will def be back || Extremely pleasant experience!
Owned by 2 gentlemen who couldn‚Äôt have been nicer and made our group feel extremely welcome upon arrival and throughout our session.
Already looking forward to my return visit!

name: World of Wellness HQ
address: Cappagh, Cappaghmore, Cloneen, Co. Tipperary, E91 XR52, Ireland
reviews_text:
A brilliant service with so much to offer. I booked the full bull and it‚Äôs great value for money. Nice relaxed environment and the view of slievenamon even in October, was wonderful from the jacuzzi. Whether it‚Äôs one person or a group booking world of wellness caters for all. Thanks again Mark I‚Äôll call again. || Had an absolute brilliant start to 2025. Mark was amazing. Safety was paramount. Our cold dip was brilliant and the sauna was perfect.. followed up with hot drinks to end the session...
Can't wait for the next one. || ‚ú® Huge thanks to Mark for an incredible Flexibility & Wellness session this afternoon! üôå It was such a rejuvenating experience‚Äîexactly what I needed to feel balanced and refreshed. üåøüíÜ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

If you‚Äôre looking to prioritise your well-being and fitness, I highly recommend his services. üíØ

#WellnessJourney #FlexibilityTraining #SelfCare #HighlyRecommend #MindBodyBalance || Mark is so professional and he leaves no stone unturned. Great preparation and recovery for any team before a big match. World of wellness is one of a kind. ||

name: Abbey Court Hotel & Leisure Centre
address: Dublin Rd, Nenagh North, Nenagh, Co. Tipperary, E45 KA99, Ireland
summary: Classic rooms & lodges in a modern hotel with a steakhouse & a bar, plus a spa, a hot tub & a pool.
reviews_text:
I brought my mother in for food recently and we had a great evening. Feather blade of beef was one of the best meals I‚Äôve had in such a long time.
Fantastic Trad music played after dinner. Great attentive floor staff and the floor manager, Declan, was walking the floor and stopped to check on us twice and had a quick chat about local beer made in the Templemore brewery when I questioned him about what was on draught. A nice touch. Angela and Dan are a credit to the team. Really enjoyed our evening. || Popped in today for a little family drink to take in the Christmas spirit. The staff were so attentive and friendly and this really stood out as it was getting busy. Big compliments to the waitresses in the front bar on 23rd December at 1.30pm. Lovely atmosphere, the place was spotless and festive. || I had a wonderful night with my husband. The staff were really friendly and so informative. The room was very nice and clean. I loved the bathroom. The breakfast was very good too. I would highly recommend staying here and I will love to return to stay again. || Went here for dinner to celebrate my mams birthday, we were at the bar area. We reserved a table for 11 people. The food was beautifully presented, comforting, and flavourful. Highly recommend the steak sandwich and the beef.
The service was excellent. The staff - young and friendly, were extremely attentive that would rival any high-end restaurant. We were served by a lovely girl named Br√≥nagh, who was very polite and professional. Thank you for the amazing food and service!! || We Recently Got Married Here And All We Can Say Is Wow, From Start To Finish The Abbey Court Team Were Absolutely Amazing, Facilities Are Top Notch, Food Was Incredible! Our Day Was Perfect, Again We Thank You Guys For Everything x

name: Lakeside Sauna
address: VMXQ+FX, Youghalarra, Co. Tipperary, Ireland

name: Canon Hayes Recreation Centre
address: Avondale Cres, Carrownreddy, Tipperary, Ireland
reviews_text:
Very confusing prices for pay as you go customer
Last month I payed 8.50 for gym and sauna
And 2 months before that I paid 7 euro
Tonight I was told it was 12.20 for gym and sauna
Which led to disagreement.
Checked out website page for prices and says 17.50 for gym and sauna
Very expensive for pay as you go
Will travel  further for better || Local sport complex, its almost everything from gym with modren equipments, sports hall, sauna/steam room, outdoor tennis court, running track and much more! || I've only been a member for 2 weeks and I really enjoying using the facility. The staff are very friendly and professional and the facilities are clean. The separate strength and conditioning room from the main gym area is very useful. || This is a very nice place. I have been gyming here for around a year now. They have good machines and ample space. Prices are also fair. || Great place great staff there are 2 new gym coaches adding great variety in exercise and strength and conditioning classes The Astroturf pitch is a multipurpose surface suitable for all ball sports and is fifa approved, the tennis courts are just fantastic and all the other facilities squash court racket ball/hand ball court strength and conditioning room spinning classes just everything you need for all your sport and fitness needs all in 1 site too much for one post go and check it out and see how great it is

name: Sauna Social
address: Tramore Rd, Coolgower, Waterford, Ireland
reviews_text:
I‚Äôll be honest, I thought this was going to be one of those places just for athletes or really hardcore types, so I was a bit unsure about going in. Couldn‚Äôt have been more wrong. The space is amazing, the staff are absolutely sound, and the whole experience was unbelievable. I‚Äôm delighted I stepped out of my comfort zone and tried it. It‚Äôs such a warm, welcoming place and it‚Äôs for everyone ‚Äî I can‚Äôt wait to come back. || A beautiful oasis away from the business of every day life. As soon as you step in to the sauna social you feel like you are getting away from it all. The attention to detail in the aesthetic is outstanding. The saunas are the biggest around which allows for some personal space, while getting your sweat on. Two different temperature cold baths to choose from also cooling the body down between sauna visits. The 50 minutes allows for you to trully switch off and not feel rushed.
Will be back! || Such a beautiful set up and great attention to deatil from the min you arrive, the facilities are top notch and the place is spotless, the staff are very friendly and helpful , it's a little taste of heaven to relax and recharge || Amazing for relaxation or recovery. Top class facilities with state of the art equipment. Its an addictive feeling! Couldn't recommend it enough. || Fantastic facility,  very welcoming staff , great vibe , you just feel totally refreshed after coming out. Couldn't recommend it enough . 10/10.

name: Endorfin
address: Pier, Dunabrattin, Boatstrand, Co. Waterford, X91 PRR2, Ireland
reviews_text: Stunning location  Both Cillian and Yvonne are easy to deal with. Very helpful .      Great value It‚Äôs just a superb facility on our doorstep.  üê† Try it. You‚Äôll come back üòÑüëç || What a beautiful beach and man made harbour on the beautiful waterford copper coast. A word of warning to those who attempt to drive on to the pier when there are lots of people and or cars about because it's a nightmare narrow road. Better to park somewhere on the coast road then walk down. But it is well worth the visit. || Best sauna in waterford. Beautiful place and easy access to the water || Serious experience, great views and properly hot too! || Being using this a while, the endorfin sauna is great. Lovely heat, and loads of room inside. Lovely at night time in boatstrand pier. The staff are very friendly and very helpful.üëç

name: The Stove Sauna
address: lough (lower lake, Ballyscanlan, Waterford, Ireland
reviews_text: Absolutely beautiful patch of land right beside Ballyscanlon Lake. The 55 minute sauna sessions are perfect for mixing it up with some cold therapy whether that be the lake, barrels or rain shower. Highly recommend! || Gorgeous wee evening session.  The lake is very calm and the view out the window of the sauna is incredibly relaxing. The lads are very sound and helpful as well! || Fantastic experience super friendly staff amazing setting highly recommended || Best Sauna in Waterford - Slay ||

name: The Stove Sauna
address: The Pavilion, Tramore West, Tramore, Co. Waterford, Ireland
reviews_text:
Great welcome from Kevin, hot sauna and very clean.  1 minute to the beach with great views. || really friendly and accommodating staff!! the sauna was perfect temperature and about a 300 meter dash to the beach, but bring slippers to make the run less painful! we got lucky with the weather and the view was perfect from the sauna. lots of places to get coffee after as well! || Such a lovely sauna with amazing ocean views from the window! At high tide the water is so close, which makes it perfect for a quick dip after the heat. There are also cooling barrels if you don‚Äôt feel like running into the ocean. The only little drawback is there‚Äôs no proper changing room or locker for your stuff. The staff are super friendly though! || Great sauna, concealed changing room area so protected from wind, with cold baths too.

Only a short dash to the beach which is amazing. View from the sauna is so nice too! || Brilliant sauna, great views of the sea and convenient barrels for s cool off. Staff are very friendly and a great overall vibeüëç would definitely go back.

name: The Hot Pod - Kilmurrin Cove
address: Kilmurrin, Waterford, Ireland
reviews_text:
An excellently run service in one of the most picturesque settings in all of Waterford

Book online, no changing rooms, straight from the sauna into the sea. Slots are ‚Ç¨10 for 30 minutes. || One of my favourite things to do when I have the time. Sauna and swim. I love the hotpod here as its so close to the beach so you aren't walking miles to get to the sea for a tip before going back to the sauna. || The ultimate Karen runs the place, wouldn't recommend being around her || Great location at kilmurrin cove next to the beach only minutes from the water love going here regularly great sauna in a stunning location highly recommend || My favourite hot pod location!

name: The Hot Pod - Dunmore East
address: Lawlors beach, Dunmore East, Co. Waterford, Ireland
reviews_text: I love Dunmore, its such a love village then add a Hotpod sauna, swim and some coffee/pastries. What more could you want ü§î so relaxing || Great location, right beside the sea in the village. Really lovely staff! || Fabulous location for this unique experience. Hot sauna followed by a dip in the sea. What a way to start the day! || So good. Location handy.  Just be a bit early to park up. || Great experience, well run.

name: The Hot Tub Hut
address: Ballyquin, Ballinamona, Ardmore, Co. Waterford, Ireland
reviews_text:
Thoroughly enjoyed our visit. Facilities are spotless and temperatures were spot on. The hot tub is a great addition to the sauna, and the cold shower is ideal if you don‚Äôt want to go into the sea.

Thanks Jack, we‚Äôll be back soon! || The most beautiful setting I have ever been for a sauna. Gorgeous clean beach. Lovely owner so accommodating and helpful. Sauna its self is always clean perfect temperature and so spacious. I highly recommend || Brilliant service in Ardmore. Love going done to relax and have after our sea swim. I would highly recommend. The hot tub is an added bonus! Jack is also lovely and so accommodating. Thank you Jack! || Fantastic experience, hot tub and sauna the cleanest you‚Äôll find. Parking alongside, great views of Ardmore bay and a short hop to the water. Highly recommend it.

name: Bunmahon Sauna & Seaweed Baths

A loo is also a necessity. || Great Sauna sitting on the edge of Bunmahon Beach üèñÔ∏è

name: Project Sauna

Super friendly staff and lovely coffee. || Great for recovery and for a good challenge, lovely staff and coffee van beside it , great set up would deffo recommend üëçüèº || Project Sauna is a lovely addition to Athlone and Buccaneers! Brilliant facility and great coffee || Class spot

name: Elite Spa Gardens
address: Dublin Rd, Bonavalley, Athlone, Co. Westmeath, N37 W9E8, Ireland
reviews_text:
I bought a Red Cedar barrel sauna with panoramic window from Elite Spa Gardens about 18 months ago and have enjoyed every minute of it since then. I wanted to see how much use we'd have for it before doing a proper review. It hasn't disappointed ever. Early mornings watching the sun rise or evening as it sets are magical. Its my place of peace each morning and then when the family come to stay they all enjoy the beautiful heat and views. Couldn't recommend the Elite Spa Gardens more highly from initial installing to ongoing usage. Do it now don't wait and enjoy the experience. || I bought a hot tub from Elite Spa's last year. The delivery and installation were top class. There was absolutely no hassle or annoyance involved. Appointments were kept , all phone calls in relation to initial usage were returned. I would have to say I got a first class service. The hot tub is fantastic too and getting plenty of use. I couldn't recommend Elite Spa's highly enough. || Having purchased two Saunas (one for a client) I couldn‚Äôt be happier with the service and the product! Quick and seamless installation and working immediately! Nothing nicer than a sauna after a long cold walk & swim on beach than a divine hot sauna!!! It should be an essential on every new build!!!! We love it as do our clients! Thanks Colin & team.
Ruth || Excellent service, high quality products.  We could not be more delighted with our hot tub and sauna.  Highly recommend Elite Spa Gardens - if you are considering whether you will use hot tub or sauna enough to justify the investment - just go for it, you won't regret it.   Our family have used it every day since it was installed and we are left wondering why we waited so long.  Couldn't be without it now.  Thanks again for your excellent advice, help and service. || Definitely the best purchase for our good health, mindfulness and general relaxation.  Elite Spa Gardens have been excellent to deal with as a company, even if they are busy they get back to me, we have had the spa nearly two years now and its just as new as the day it arrived and works perfectly, I would highly recommend Elite Spa Gardens for your purchase .... then just enjoy

name: Bloomfield Spa
address: Belvedere, Lynn, Mullingar, Co. Westmeath, N91 HP8E, Ireland
reviews_text:
Typical large Irish hotel elevated by beautiful grounds and lovely staff.  Our room 412 was a bit tired, the water pressure was intermittently poor and the toilet would not flush properly.

The grounds are stunning but we often got an eggy smell from the septic tanks  outside.  The ground are good for kids, with a playground and outside games.

The food is just above average, the restaurant is tasty but the bar food was average.  The cocktails are weak and the white wine bottles ‚Ç¨30-60 were not refrigerated.

We understand the rooms are undergoing a programme of refurbishment, maybe we were unlucky.

Despite all of the above, the hotel remains a good venue for large get togethers. We will be back next year since they treated us so well. || This is a lovely friendly top class hotel. Excellent food and generous portions, no penny pinching here. The guests feel appreciated and I think the guests appreciate the hotel in return. Well done everyone || Went for a spa treatment Saturday room cold lights left on to bright for a massage loud Christmas music on not ideal for a spa treatment gym above the room a lot of noise  daughter treated me very disappointed || Not overly impressed with hotel. It is a very tired 4star? hotel. My room 205 must have once been a storage room converted into a bedroom. I object to paying a single supplement and being treated like a second class citizen just because I am by myself.  Plenty of staff and all helpful. Spa and swimming pool adequate. Lovely massage. I will not be rushing back. || Zeinab had magic fingers!! Thanks you so much for a great and relaxing massage. You made the tension in my neck and shoulders disappear.

name: Utopia Spa

An absolutely outstanding business.

I will definitely return to this business when I return to Athlone. || I‚Äôve had ongoing tension and pain in my shoulders, and this massage helped so much. Before seeing her, I lived with daily pain; now, I can finally enjoy life again. Oahn is a true professional whose deep knowledge of the nervous system has allowed me to move without pain.

When I receive treatment, my pain and movement issues disappear. Her expertise has transitioned me from daily suffering to true recovery."

I cannot praise her enough‚Äîshe is amazing at what she does." || I have the pleasure of being a valued customer for a number of years now . The staff here are excellent, the massage and the aroma of the place , and the attention to detail all add up to a memorable experience. name: Bloomfield House Hotel, Leisure Club & Spa
address: Bloomfield House Hotel, Leisure Club & Spa, Lynn, Mullingar, Co. Westmeath, N91 HP8E, Ireland
summary: Upscale rooms with free Wi-Fi in a refined country house, plus a spa, a fitness centre and a pool.
reviews_text:
We had a brilliant family stay at Bloomfield House Hotel. Everything was easy, relaxed, and staff welcoming.

The hotel is great for families ‚Äî loads of space, nice grounds for strolls by lake, and a really comfortable atmosphere. The room was clean, spacious, and ideal for us, and the beds were really comfortable.

Food was excellent, with plenty options for both adults and kid, Breakfast was particularly good !Staff were friendly, helpful, and throughout our stay. You never felt rushed or like you were ‚Äúin the way‚Äù with kids around, which makes such a difference.

Leisure centre and pool were great as well.

Overall, it was a very enjoyable, stress-free family break and we‚Äôd happily return. Highly recommended for families looking for a relaxing stay. || Booked the weekend here with my best friend and I have to say, the views are outstanding and the atmosphere was amazing.
The food in the bar was gorgeous and the service was good but not being able to charge anything to my room left me feeling untrusted and extremely disappointed. The staff did clarify that this stopped due to Covid and it just hasn't started up again which is fair enough. But I do believe this should've been mentioned before or when I was checking in. It left me wondering why does the hotel take my card details if i can't charge anything to my room? Especially since I'd already paid in full.
As for the room, when I first entered I noticed the stains on the counter underneath the TV. Not a very good first impression. There's no safe so I couldn't put any valuables or keys away. No mini fridge, lights full of dust, bedding not very fresh, under the beds not hoovered and the shutters don't close properly as they're missing parts and let the light in. The beds are comfy but not the duvets or pillows. I woke both nights with the cold, checked the radiator, heating not on, took the duvet off the other bed and threw it over me as well. The pillows are sweaty, small and hard. I couldn't use them.
In the bathroom there's no hand rail for towels at the sink. Clean towels constantly put for wash cos they kept falling off the toilet onto the toilet brush. The tap doesn't move so it was awkward brushing my teeth and the height of the bath is way too high for me as I'm only five foot nothing üòÖ I really struggled stepping in and out! üòÖ
The breakfast is definitely worth it. The staff are well organised and always on hand to help. || The staff are simply excellent. Nothing was too much trouble and they were really engaging with the kids.

Great value break - room are basic but clean / nice. Food was very good. The staff make this place really authentic - we'll be back. || I was really impressed with the hotel,  it was perfect for a family weekend. There was 17 in our extended group, and we were all impressed.  The food was really good,  the interior decoration was very quirky and I loved it. I've stayed in many beige hotels and I appreciated that this hotel went with a bolder style and did it well.

It was busy but there was lots of staff on and the service was excellent.
I loved the bedrooms,  again bold decoration but really well done.

We went for a walk on the Belvedere Estate and it is really beautiful and well worth a visit.
I will definitely go back and would recommend. || Very disappointing pamper day at the spa. 3 of us arrived to no member of staff to greet us. Had to phone hotel to get someone. Then it was the pool boy who didn‚Äôt know a thing to be honest about the area. Very disjointed and won‚Äôt be returning. I planned this as a nice relaxing day away for my friends and it wasn‚Äôt this. Very unsatisfactory.

The service was excellent, and the standard overall was top-class. Next time I‚Äôll definitely try the pizza and sauna evening, which is brilliant value at only ‚Ç¨22.

Well worth the trip ‚Äì highly recommend || Fab experience in Rosslare! Would highly reccomend, if you are thinking about it, just do it. From the moment we arrived until we left our experience of Monart was brilliant.  The staff were so friendly and helpful. Our room was really nice. We had a beautiful dinner in the restaurant and the Spa was so relaxing.  I would recommend Monart to anyone who would like a relaxing time away. || Monart is the most amazing experience from the moment you drive through the gates until the moment you have to leave. Mark, Lorna,  Mat√©e,  you have an amazing staff team, run a fantastic location. I plan on returning every chance I get. || Location and landscaping superb. name: Seafield Hotel & Spa Resort
address: Ballymoney, Seafield, Gorey, Co. Wexford, Y25 X2V0, Ireland
summary: Lavish rooms with views in a modern seafront property with elegant dining & a spa.
reviews_text:
We stayed in the courtyard suites as a group of 10, split across two. The suites themselves were fine in terms of basics ‚Äì the beds were comfortable and everything we needed was there ‚Äì but they are very dated and could really do with an upgrade. Simple improvements such as smart TVs, some fresh paint around the resort, and more practical bathroom features (e.g a shelf in the shower to put toiletries) would make a huge difference. The suites were also very hot, and there were no instructions on how to control the heating.

We enjoyed the spa. Although it was quite busy, the facilities themselves were good, and we were especially grateful to the spa receptionist who kindly helped us rebook a session on the same day after we realised we‚Äôd accidentally booked for the wrong month ‚Äì that was very much appreciated and handled brilliantly.

Unfortunately, our experience in the hotel bar really let the stay down. We were surprised to find that you couldn‚Äôt simply use the bar at your leisure, you had to book, give your name, room etc. When we visited in the afternoon (around 2pm), we were told the tables would be needed back at 5pm, which was absolutely fine. However, as 5pm approached we were repeatedly reminded, and at 4:55pm ‚Äì while we were finishing our drinks ‚Äì a member of staff came over and told us we'd have to leave, and when we said we were just finishing up and still had a few minutes, he made a snarky comment about us having already overstayed the two hours, despite us never being told there was a two-hour limit, only that the table was needed at 5pm. As a group of 10 who had spent a decent amount on food and drinks, the tone and approach made us feel very unwelcome. There were plenty of empty tables when we left, and no effort was made to relocate us - maybe they had bookings coming up but no one went in while we were sat in the lobby after (where we had to sit to finish the drinks). This interaction left a really bitter taste and unfortunately means we wouldn‚Äôt return. || I stayed for a one night bed,  breakfast and evening meal break with two friends. I have to say its been a long time since I experienced such amazing service. The staff couldn't have been nicer, so accommodating, they made us feel like our enjoyment was their top priority. Amazing experience || Had a really lovely one night stay including dinner. Check in was quick and friendly, the room was modern with a balcony and seating which would be ideal in the summer months. There's a short walk to a private beach which we didn't do due to the incessant January rain but the hotel more than made up for this.
The bar is busy but cosy for a few pre-dinner drinks. Food was lovely and 2 seats at the bar counter topped our night off perfectly. Fiachra the barman was a pleasure to chat to and watch in action, and he makes a wonderful Amaretto sour!
A huge and very comfortable bed for a good night's sleep followed by a buffet breakfast and a trip to the spa for a treatment the next morning was the perfect way to finish our stay.
We will 100% be back. || Booked to use the thermal suite for 2 hours. It was so overcrowded and the complete opposite of a relaxing experience. Couldn't find a free locker on arrival, put my valuables in my friends locker and my bag on top of the lockers. Afterwards we had to queue and wait for a shower - just way too many people booked in & the majority were not hotel guests. Greedy to be accepting that many people into a slot in my opinion. Would not recommend or return. || Came here for a friends wedding and they couldn‚Äôt have chosen a better place. Hotel is beautiful and surrounded by beautiful countryside. Rooms were very clean and views were great. Staff were fantastic and very warm and friendly. Had dinner with a large group at the Bar and Grill the night before wedding and all the food was superb if a little overpriced. Again service here was fantastic. Stunning beach with a great walk down. Came away with some great memories and would love to return at some point in the future. Also plenty of parking if a little scattered around complex.

name: Brandon House Hotel & Solas Cro√≠ Spa
