summary: Country house lodging offering casual rooms with free Wi-Fi, plus an indoor pool and spa treatments.
reviews_text:
My partner surprised me with a New Year‚Äôs Eve stay at the Brandon House hotel. The hotel itself is lavish and lovely with lots of comfortable little lounge spaces, a restaurant, a pub and other amenities. The room was comfortable and spacious while the bathroom had a great shower and was also lovely and clean. The only negative in the whole space is I wish we had a small fridge in the room. The spa itself was amazing, cozy and relaxing and had all the amenities you need. The spa was also surprisingly very affordable too. The hotel breakfast was absolutely amazing - the best hotel breakfast I‚Äôve ever had and had a massive array of offerings for vegetarians and meat lovers alike. Thanks Brandon house for allowing us to ring in the new year in the best way possible! || both me asd my wife stayed here for one night it is somewhere we have always wanted to stay.
upon entering the hotel you are welcomed in to a nice bright reception area and the staff made us feel very welcome,
we checking in and went to our room, upon entering the you could see that it was very clean if a little out dated but the thing that puyt us off was this room at sometime had a wall going through it and even tho they have attempted to remove it they didnt do a great job as we kept tripping on the footing of it hidden under the carpet, as i said the room were a little out dated and could have done with a coat of paint and some of the tyles in the bath room were chipped and missing bit leaving sharp edges which you could have cut you feet.

So we got settled and desided to go for a swim again the pool area could have done with a bit of a spruce up but it was nice none the less but the waterr was freezing cold, although at time we did feel a little imtimidated when we went to use the jacuzzi  because there was a few (lets say undesirables in there)
so we just left.

later we went to the restaurant for some food we were shown to a table given a menu and and asked if we wanted anything to drink we gave our drink order but had to wait 20 mins for thast to arrive we then ordered are food starters and main the starter came quickly b ut half way throught the starter our main course came the the gire had to takle it back to the kitchen once the starter was finished the main came out at you could tell it was clearly left under a heat lamp because my stake which i asked for raw was almost well done so i think there was a bit of a  break down in communcation in the kitchen but we had our meal retired to some cosy seatws for a few more drinks.

the next morning after a really good nights sleep we wenty down to breakfast and have to say this was the saving grace the breakfast was amazing and coulnt be faulted in any way.

on summery this is a nice hotel if a little dated and in need of some work the staff were all very kind and helpfull and made our stay pleasant and i would recommend this hotel || Lovely hotel, definitely family resort. Kids loved swimming pool and daily kidos activities. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. The buffet breakfast was excellent, plenty of choice. Including omelette or waffles. Staff supper friendly. We dined in the Library Bar on 2 nights and the food was delicious. I would certainly recommend this hotel and would stay again. || A gorgeous drive up and real handy and plentiful parking. Welcoming the moment you step in the door, there‚Äôs a big fire lighting and a gorgeous smell that draws you in. I had to ask the lovely receptionist what the candle was, so good!  Check in was really friendly, helpful and quick. room upstairs gorgeous, nice and quiet, really clean, really comfortable. We both booked spa treatments‚Ä¶. Unreal! Dinner was amazing, I had lasagna, my boyfriend had fish and chips. The service is fantastic and the staff are just lovely. Slept really well. Breakfast delicious, omg so much to choose from and lattes, flat whites whatever you want, the staff here amazing too. Honestly there is nothing negative I can say at all only that I didn‚Äôt want to leave! || We had a great night at the Brandon for my father‚Äôs birthday, 20 of us.  it‚Äôs been a while since I‚Äôd been but had heard from a few friends recently who were saying how lovely it was up there so we gave it a go. We were not disappointed, the food, the service, the atmosphere was really lovely. Warm and welcoming. We only booked last minute too but a lovely menu to suit all ages of the family was provided and a surprise birthday plate was organised for my dad. A lovely night was had by all and I would highly recommend.

name: The Wexford Club (Whites of Wexford)
address: Clayton Hotel, Abbey St, Townparks, Wexford, Ireland
reviews_text:
Very clean and spotless club with gym and Pool area with steam room and sauna and Jacuzzi. Male dressing room very clean and spotless including toilet area. Staff are very helpful including Maria a very helpful on checking in. Have met other staff extremely friendly. Would recommend a visit but do stick to the rules especially for adults Time and family time. Check out their membership rates. || friendly staff. everything is fine. the only thing that doesn't suit me: it's very cold in the gym because the air conditioning is constantly on... although it's winter and the room is already cold... I can stand being there for 10 minutes maximum and then run to the sauna to warm up üòµ‚Äçüí´ü§™
ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èIs it possible not to make the room so cold?üòÉ || Rust city-

Thread mills clink and clank when adjusting speeds and incline pretty unsettling. Exercise machines weights thick with rust outdated equipment. Real lack of reinvestment shown into the gym worrying signs of business performance.

The place needs a power wash with WD40 and would still need new equipment

Want that 2005 hotel gym experience you wouldn‚Äôt be far off

*Edit update 2025 now whites updating to 3 staff have been great machine faults still relevant || I give 3 stars only because your pool and steam room is good to use. Jakuzi is always cold :/ , and sauna is done for elderly persons only, i say so because it doesnt have enough heat :/  Gym could have a bit more equipment to use. Staff is mostly friendly (depends on who's working). || I haven't been here since June. And my opinion has changed. There are no water cups. I usually take my bottle with me, but I forgot. I asked if I could have a glass, please. The guy said we don't have it, but you can buy a bottle. No, thanks. I was a member of the club, but went on vacation, I expected to pay as a member of the club, but they took the fee as a non-member of the club. I will think about whether I will come back or not.

name: Ravenport Resort
address: Kilmacoe, Curracloe, Co. Wexford, Y21 WE0V, Ireland
reviews_text:
A lovely new hotel in Curracloe. The room was comfortable & spacious. The mini fridge for your own refreshments was handy.
Food in the restaurant was good (Dunes Bar was closed as it‚Äôs seasonal), Samphire breakfast room was great, excellent breakfast and a lovely lady called Kathleen greeted us. Anita on the front desk was really friendly & helpful. We didn‚Äôt use the spa or health centre but the pool area looked nice. Best wishes to the owners & staff going forward. The golf course will be an excellent amenity when it‚Äôs completed. || Lovely little hotel with a great spa. Staff were all fantastic.  Rooms are not huge but they are really well laid out which makes the space very comfortable.  Bar wasn't open probably because of the season which made the restaurant a bit mixed but the food was good. Very happy with veggie options. Feels very tranquil. || Nice hotel with friendly, helpful staff. Room is nice and spacious although it got very warm during the night. There is a fridge in the room and a coffee machine that is also used for hot water for tea. One of the mugs in the room was very badly cracked right though and again at the handle although the receptionist replaced it immediately when I told her. The leisure centre is clean but the jacuzzi is tiny, 3 people can just about fit in it. It was recommended that we wore the robe and slippers provided to the leisure centre. There were robes but no slippers. The receptionist did give me two pairs when I asked. They were quite small, fine for me but didn't fit my husband's feet. We had dinner in the restaurant which was nice but I was disappointed the vegan steak wasn't available and when I asked if there were any other vegan options the waiter had to go check and then came back and said there was a vegan burger which was fine but I had no details about it, what was in it etc or even the price. The breakfast buffet had a good selection of food. Although quickly resolved, for the price you are paying, you would expect things like mugs not to be cracked and slippers to be provided (especially when it says you should use them going to the leisure centre) which is why they lose a star. But overall it's a nice place to stay and I would recommend. || Lovely spacious room, appointed to a good standard. Nice and clean as you hope for. A very warm welcome by the manager who is very pleasant, friendly - he is a real professional.
Topped off with a tasty dinner - top marks all around. I would definitely hope to stay again and certainly recommend the hotel. Well done Ravensport - wishing you long term success! || Just had dinner.  Chicken wings to start (‚Ç¨13) really tasty. Chicken Supreme with mash n loads of veg (‚Ç¨22), OMG so  delicious. Top marks chef. It's ‚Ç¨7 for a pint of carlsberg (pricy I think).  Staff really friendly and hotel is really nice (if a little lacking in atmosphere).  Got a good deal on room price. Gym well equipped but small.  I was only one in it, so size was not an issue. Out of the way, ie 10km from wexford but here on business trip so ok for me..  I'd come again

name: The Apex
address: The Apex, Verosland, New Ross, Co. Wexford, Y34 X045, Ireland
reviews_text: Good place to swim with family. Pool could be a bit warmer. The staff are a mix.. some very nice, some not s nice. Prices are ok for what you get. Gym is basic..recommend off peak times. || I‚Äôve been attending Apex Gym in New Ross and have had a fantastic experience. My trainer, Paddy, taught me the basics with patience and clear guidance, making me feel comfortable and confident from the start. My mum has recently started trying it out, and Paddy has been just as helpful and encouraging with her. All the staff are so lovely and welcoming. The gym has an excellent range of equipment, plenty of space, and lovely views that make working out even more enjoyable. Highly recommend Apex to anyone looking for a friendly, well-equipped, and supportive place to train! || I have been to lots of gyms, and this is, without doubt the very best! The equipment is state of the art. The atmosphere is both welcoming and fun. There are no barriers to age, ability, weight or gender. Lastly, but definitely NOT least, is that the staff are so professional and delightful. They make everyone feel welcome and always do their very best to support each individual. If I could give them 6 stars, I would! Thank you so much for making such a huge difference, both to my life and many others! ü§óü§óü§ó || Great pool and great slide which runs on the hour every hour for 30 mins during open swim times. Lovely jacuzzi, sauna and steam room too. There's a separate pool for the smaller kids too. Showers and dressing rooms were nice and clean. Very impressed. Lovely welcome from the staff as well. Will definitely return. || Lovely warm clean pool with 3 separate sections suitable for everybody who can and can't swim also has a loopy slide (sorry I didn't give it a go)

name: Mist Wellness
address: Rathangan, Co. Wexford, Ireland

name: Helios Sauna Rooftop
address: 6 Strand Rd, Bray, Co. Wicklow, A98 C5D0, Ireland
reviews_text: Such a lovely sauna experience. Staff are so friendly. Lots of sauna options in Bray, but this one‚Äôs the most chilled and the most cosy. Lovely at night when it‚Äôs windy outside. Finished with a peppermint tea. Perfection! || Loved our little morning here. We were spoiled because we had the place to ourselves. Loved the views, plunge pool could have been a little colder but still enjoyed it. Changing rooms and chill out area set up well. Will be back || Such a gorgeous sauna! The plunge pool is big and you‚Äôve got the view of the whole seafront. Really nice being up high looking out over the sea. Staff were also super friendly :) definitely one of the better saunas I‚Äôve been to, highly recommend!! || it was really nice. you can have a tea prior or after the session there in the lounge in photo. view was great trough the seaside. || Gorgeous rooftop sauna overlooking the sea at Bray. Three cold plunge pools and a large warm water pool with beautiful views. Nice changing area, plenty of space, well maintained. And the lovely staff, with free herbal tea included in the spacious warm relaxation area is just the icing on the cake. Would highly recommend üíñ

name: Cro√≠ L√°n Sauna
address: The Bog Meadow, Monastery, Enniskerry, Co. Wicklow, Ireland
reviews_text:
Lovely atmosphere - nice and peaceful and really feel tucked away in nature.

Ice baths are freezing and the sauna is kept at a consistent heat.  The place is also kept very clean.

10/10 || My new favourite spot. Properly hot sauna. 2 cold plunge temps. Lovely cozy setting in the trees. Always available and free parking. And the guys are sound. Would Highly recommend checking it out. || I have been a handful of times since it has been open - the different setting sets it apart. Nestled away, cosy enough that you‚Äôre surrounded by the woodlands, the greenery and the tranquility of it all. The sauna, the view, the cold plunges, to the showers and changing rooms. The ambience as the evening sets and the lights come on against the wooded decor.

The simplicity is effective.

Would highly recommend. Sun, rain, hail and everything else. || Been a couple of times since opening - Most peaceful and relaxing setting placed right amongst overhanging trees. Couldn't recommend this place enough. Location,Staff ,Sauna and Ice baths are second to none!! || Lovely leafy setting, good wood sauna, nice cold tubs, highly recommend. Great watching the trees sway from the sauna. Very serene and easy to find. All the best!

name: Rainforest Spa
address: Summerhill House Hotel, Cookstown, Enniskerry, Co. Wicklow, Ireland
reviews_text:
Surreal experience from the moment I walked through the door. The reception staff was so lovely and accommodating and my therapist Anna was super. Thoroughly enjoyed the treatment and the amenities before - it was raining when I was in the hot tub so felt really magical and cosy! Absolutely recommend 11/10. || Had the most lovely afternoon here for my massage! My friend and I were able to snag two appointments but one after the other, and the staff was so kind as to let us sit in the lounge to read our books! The massage was heavenly and I‚Äôm already plotting when I can be back! || Overall, our experience was underwhelming given the price paid, ‚Ç¨185pp. Upon arrival, we were greeted by a friendly receptionist who appeared quite stressed and busy with opening the spa, which made the welcome feel a little rushed. Two guests warming themselves with a portable radiator caught my eye.

Unfortunately, some basic facilities were not up to standard. One of the toilet cubicles had no toilet paper, and the hand dryer was not working.

The sauna did not seem to heat properly. Although we were advised it would take some time to warm up, it never felt particularly hot during our visit.

The outdoor area was also disappointing. The jacuzzi appeared overly chlorinated; the strong vapour stung our eyes when we first entered. It also seemed to require a more thorough clean and general maintenance.

The highlight of our visit was the therapists who carried out the treatment. They were absolutely wonderful and truly made the experience for us, which is the main reason for the star rating given. However, the location of the changing rooms directly opposite the treatment rooms meant there was noticeable noise from showers, conversations, and hair dryers, which detracted from the otherwise relaxing atmosphere.

Lastly, we had to remind staff about the smoothie that was included upon departure. || I went to the rainforest spa on my own. I was the only one there at the time which was actually lovely. Saying that, if there was a lot of people attending I think the place would seem cramped. It‚Äôs small, staff are really nice. I will say the outside area is a bit underwhelming with only one hot tube.It did have a few leaves in it. But the view is nice.
Massage and reflexology with Kim was wonderful. Very informative.
The sign of the outside of the spa has a few letters missing which doesn‚Äôt give out a great first impression.
Also there are signs for the hotel when you turn but not the spa so initially I was a bit lost. Overall a good experience || Starting with the incredibly friendly Karen at the Rainforest Summerhill Hotel in Enniskerry, where I was greeted at the entrance with a warm smile and kind words, it was clear I was a welcome guest. Karen then explained in detail the services my wife and I could take advantage of. She arranged the hours as conveniently as possible so that my wife and I could arrive at the same time. Then came the massage itself, another new and incredible experience after what therapist Kim had offered. Overall, it was one of the best massages I've ever had. And the head massage was massage mastery at its finest... bravo, Kim, thank you. A beautiful place with an incredible view while enjoying the hot tub. The service and customer service, with empathy, warmth, and professionalism, definitely encourage me to return, which we certainly will. A 5+ rating for the place... a 6+ rating for the staff. Thank you and best regards.
Cezariusz Lee

name: Powerscourt Spa & Wellness
address: Powerscourt Hotel, Powerscourt Demesne, Enniskerry, Co. Wicklow, Ireland
reviews_text:
Absolutely a wonderful experience. The service was excellent, the massages great (Georgina and Niall are worth a mention), afternoon tea was tasty, and the setting and value itself are just made for relaxation. Even on a busy bank holiday weekend, the Spa itself did not seem busy at all.

I cant wait to go back || Treatment and therapist were fantastic - had a lovely massage, however, the booking process and communications re same were quite shambolic and there is a huge sense of disorganisation. In addition, my treatment time was moved so I could have a female therapist but then when I arrived, they tried to give me a male therapist again and as a result of all the faffing, the massage wasn‚Äôt a full hour. Finally, they gave me a champagne flavoured sorbet afterwards which is a very strange flavour choice for a wellness spa and even more bizarre for pregnant women - this was the only flavour they served and should be changed to something non alcoholic. || We had the most amazing spa experience in Powerscourt spa. I had the maternity massage and it was so relaxing. The food was delicious too. Would highly recommend || Brilliant spa. Would highly recommend for both males and females looking for a VERY relaxed and pampered experience, whether staying in the hotel or not.
Booking any treatments also gets you access to the ESPA's other spa facilities, so you can really make the most of your time there. If just getting nails or other small treatments, you have access to the upstairs thermal facilities. Or if having a massage, etc then you can also avail of the spa's pool and jacuzzi downstairs.
The staff are lovely and always very friendly. Arrive a little early for your appointment to ensure you have time to be given a tour so you know where everything is and make the most of your "you" time. || Great service, great staff. Nice place for a break. Spa experience is very professional. Afternoon tea in the spa cafe is served with good quality.

name: Helios Sauna Cottage
address: BOWDEN COTTAGE, 92 Strand Rd, Newcourt, Bray, Co. Wicklow, Ireland
reviews_text:
Myself and three friends had a fantastic sauna session at the Bray cottage location! Helios have created such a pretty and cosy space there and everything felt well taken care of. The sauna was clean and comfortable. Clean changing facilities too- would definitely recommend this! Also the staff were friendly and helpful. || This was such a rejuvenating experience. Really enjoyed every moment of my time at Helios. Always gives me a lovely feeling upon arrival and completion. Staff are lovely. || First time visiting the rooftop Sauna. What an amazing experience. A very spacious sauna (and changing room area!), and a lovely warm pool. The views are amazing: The sea and Bray Head. It was a very sunny day but I can't wait to try it out on a stormy day or a dark evening! A must-do when visiting Bray! || Helios Sauna in Dundrum is nothing short of spectacular! From the moment you step in, you're welcomed into a tranquil, rejuvenating environment that feels like a slice of paradise. The staff is absolutely amazing, warm, attentive, and genuinely committed to ensuring you have the best experience possible. The facilities are impeccably clean and thoughtfully designed, making every visit a true pleasure.

This place has quickly become one of my all-time favorites, and I can‚Äôt recommend it enough. Whether you're looking to unwind, recharge, or simply treat yourself, Helios Sauna is the perfect spot. 100% recommended you won‚Äôt regret it! || Quality everywhere. Sauna is beautiful with a view to the street. Cold barrels are great with different temperatures. The cottage is lovely as a changing space, and the the stone and paving in the shower area creates a great holiday like feel.
It really is such a great restorative space in Bray and the lads are brilliant to deal with.

name: Foxglen Outdoor Wellness
address: Donard Lower, Donard, Co. Wicklow, W91 RY84, Ireland
reviews_text:
The best sauna ever. There is everything you could dream of: river dip, ice bath, ice buckets, hottub etc etc.

Such a relaxed enviornment. The sauna was perfect temperature. Everything so clean and well designed. Great changing rooms and refreshing water on tap.

The people working there are so friendly and happy to show you around.

There is a lovely cabin for sitting and relaxing after your session with tea/coffee. Felt like we had beeb transported to Finland!

We caught a great sunset that you can see from the river.

Thank you for such a great experience! We will be back time and time again || Foxglen Wellness has been the most luxurious and relaxing retreat I have ever been to‚Ä¶ From the sauna, cold plunge, and the jacuzzi, everything was perfect! The facilities and staff are amazing, and the scenic views really added to the experience. The treatments were exceptional, leaving me feeling refreshed‚Ä¶I highly recommend Foxglen Wellness and I will 100% be back!! || A group of 6 of us visited this lovely new spot tucked away in West Wicklow‚Äôs rolling hills, this off-grid woodland retreat is pure bliss. The wood-fired sauna, hot tub, and plunge pool, set by a serene river and rock pool, rejuvenated us completely. A perfect nature escape‚Äîhighly recommend! || We loved this!

Excellent welcome on our arrival.
Plenty of cool down areas- 2 cold plunges, showers and buckets.
The jacuzzi was a perfect size.
The sauna was lovely with a pretty view.

Highly recommend and we will be back, bringing our friends and family! || Beautiful place with amazing facilities in peaceful surroundings! There's so much choice for relaxation and wellness - hot tub, large sauna, river dip, cold plunge, showers and cold buckets. I must say we also had a really nice visit because the other clientelle were a really friendly bunch which enhanced the experience.

name: Fad Saoil Saunas Kilcoole
address: Main St, Kilcoole, Co. Wicklow, A63 AP93, Ireland
reviews_text:
Tried this sauna for the first time the other day. I‚Äôve been to many saunas across the country and county and this is definitely in the top 3. The lad working there was friendly and a gent. I had the sauna to myself which was relaxing but will be interesting to try a social one sometime. Nice cold showers and a great cold plunge. Nice essential oil and timers. Highly recommend, great amount of heat in the sauna too and very fairly priced! || I had an incredible experience at this sauna and couldn‚Äôt be more impressed with the facilities and staff. The sauna itself was immaculate, with just the right balance of heat and comfort. It‚Äôs clear that everything is maintained to a very high standard. I especially loved the ice baths‚Äîrefreshing, invigorating, and perfect after a long sauna session. The contrast therapy really made a difference in how I felt afterward.

The showers were very spacious, with great water pressure. The changing rooms were just as impressive: clean, well-lit, and thoughtfully laid out, making it easy to relax and take your time.

What really stood out, though, was the staff. Every person I interacted with was warm, professional, and genuinely welcoming. They clearly care about creating a relaxing and rejuvenating environment. Whether you're a first-timer or a regular, they make you feel completely at ease.

I‚Äôll definitely be back‚Äîit‚Äôs the perfect place to unwind and recharge. || Great sauna, with ice baths and shower facilities. Friendly staff and right next door to Roasted Brown for great coffee too! || Great facility with consistently hot electric sauna, cold showers and plunge pools. Very handy if you don't fancy walking to the sea.  Co-located with Roasted Brown serving top quality coffee! Staff are friendly & helpful.. || I recently visited this sauna for the first time, and the staff were incredibly sound. The facilities are excellent, with a sauna, ice bath, changing rooms. Can‚Äôt ask for anything more.  The coffee from Roasted Brown is also fantastic. I‚Äôll definitely be recommending it!

name: Hot Box Arklow
address: Knockenrahan Industrial Estate, Knockanrahan Lower, Arklow, Co. Wicklow, Y14 XK30, Ireland
reviews_text:
Brilliant recovery  facilities only a stones through away.. Fergal is so accommodating..  ü•äü•ä || Great set up, good facilities, easy access, hot sauna, cold ice bath. || Absolutely incredible experience at the new Hot Box Arklow sauna setup! The sauna is top-notch, and the addition of the jacuzzi and cold bath has taken the wellness vibe to a whole new level. The space is immaculate and thoughtfully designed, creating the perfect balance between heat and cold for an invigorating experience. I was also very impressed by owner Fergal, whose assistance and warm welcome truly made my visit exceptional. This hidden gem in Co Wicklow has it all‚Äîrelaxation, quality facilities, and outstanding hospitality. Highly recommended! || Great spot! Great value. Fergal is as sound as they come. || I came here to become a better version of myself and instead I made questionable noises in a 200-degree box and then screamed my way into a glorified ice bucket. 10/10 would do again.

The sauna made me feel like a rotisserie chicken slowly basting in my own ambition. The cold plunge? Let‚Äôs just say my soul temporarily left my body and filed a complaint.

Staff was super chill and very flexible for us. Left feeling like I could run a marathon or at least confidently do laundry.

Highly recommend if you want to shock your system, humble your ego, and bond with strangers through mutual suffering and endorphins.

name: Axe Club Glendalough (Sauna and Axe Throwing)
address: Axe Club, Brockagh, Glendalough, Co. Wicklow, A67 K3K6, Ireland
reviews_text: Great craic and Nick was a great instructor! Laid back atmosphere and a lovely outdoor location ü™ì || My self & my husband had a lovely day on Saturday in the Sauna in Glendalough.  Matt is so friendly and made us feel very welcome.  There was no time pressure and it was so relaxing.  The plunge in the river was a new experience an it was so refreshing.  I would highly recommend it.  Thanks Matt || Had an amazing day here for my friends birthday. We did axe throwing and a sauna session and we will definitely be back again as it was so fun and so well organised! || One of the best quality saunas I‚Äôve used. The owner was a gent and offered us fruit and refreshments free of charge. River beside sauna is ideal for cold plunge. || Just had a fantastic day throwing axes with Axe Club. Highly recommend a trip to this place. We will try get back and do the hot pod and river dip soon. Thanks again all.

name: The Chilli Pod
address: 97 Ringsend Rd, Dublin, Ireland
reviews_text:
I was so pleasantly surprised by this place! The cold plunge area is really spacious, there‚Äôs a coffee shop, and the sauna is amazing. Definitely a great spot to relax. || First visit today. Sound staff, clean, modern and spacious. Has everything you need in terms of showers, changing area, plunge pool, toilet, access to drinking water.

I paid 15‚Ç¨ for a Friday 45m session and had the place to myself. Great midweek deals include a free coffee. || Hands down one of the finest saunas I was ever in. Superb set up for an oasis of calm in the city centre. 10/10 recommend, and at ‚Ç¨15 for 45 minutes, it‚Äôs incredible value too. || Absolutely fantastic! Brilliant Sauna, got up to 88¬∞C when i was in there, top quality. Better than a lot of saunas around the area and a local Ringsend business, deadly! || My new favourite sauna! First time here and it‚Äôs so so good - great price, and beside the lovely Basil cafe. The perfect combo. I will be coming here from now on. Plus Basil and the team are super friendly. Thanks guys!

name: Camden Court Health Club
address: Camden Court Hotel, Saint Kevin's, Dublin, D02 W086, Ireland
reviews_text:
It feels like u have your own personal gym, not busy most of the times, the facilities for swim, sauna and jacuzzy are like in a turkish bath, plus you have a thai massage with discounts for members...it's a great little gem in town! || My favourite hideaway in Dublin, so much so, I didn‚Äôt want to share it until now. Great gym,   new equipment, has everything you'd need for strength and cardio. The pool, jacuzzi, sauna and steam room are so relaxing and well maintained.
Yet the best thing about it is the staff. Robbie leads an amazing team and they can't do enough to help. || Very clean facility with a warm and welcoming atmosphere. The staff are always friendly and professional. You can tell that good, respectful people come here regularly. Highly recommended! || An absolute paradise for relaxation! The wellness spa was transformative, I loved the hot stone massage and aromatherapy sessions. Staff went above and beyond to ensure every detail was perfect. Can‚Äôt wait to return! || Shocking decision to increase annual membership by 66% from 2023 price in 2024. No new gym equipment, no extra included PT sessions. Only a lick of paint and men showers improved, female showers still the same. One can understand inflation but this price is miles beyond inflation. Can understand if true investment was being made in the gym but that is not to be seen. Current price it is at you are better to go to another gym with superior facilities.

name: Viola Day Spa
address: The Spencer Hotel, Excise Walk, International Financial Services Centre, Dublin 1, Ireland
reviews_text:
I had laser hair removal done and was impressed with the results from the very first session. I had tried the procedure at other places before without success, but the experience at this spa was completely different ‚Äî after just two sessions, I could already see a big improvement.
The staff is very friendly and attentive. I also had a body exfoliation, a full-body massage, and shellac on my nails ‚Äî everything was perfect.
It was truly money well spent. I highly recommend this place and will definitely be back! || Amazing service and quality of work.
Have to admit that probably one of the best quality manicure I had in a long time.
Thank you Talita and Andreza! || Talita is an excellent massage therapist. Very calm, attentive, and professional. I had massages with her when I was pregnant, and they were wonderful sessions. I highly recommend her; her service is excellent. || I tried this spa around 3 years ago and since then it's one of the most relaxing places for me to visit. Everyone is very caring, calm and professional. I tried several types of massage and face treatments and every is great with the pressure adjusted just for you. Highly recommend for relaxation as well as the girls nights. || Las Tuesday we received excellent service. Alondra gave my girlfriend an amazing massage‚Äîprofessional, attentive, and truly relaxing. Talita also gave me a very good massage, with great technique and dedication. We left feeling renewed and extremely satisfied. Highly recommended!

name: Iconic Health Clubs Smithfield
address: Block G, Smithfield Market, Smithfield, Dublin 7, Ireland
reviews_text:
Glad to have quit this place. As the price went up, the quality went down. Got all new dumbbells but reduced the selection by dumping the 14s and 16s. Men's locker room is like a sauna. Trainers (apart from Dave and Barbara) act like they own the place. Machines and facilities out of service on a daily basis. I took the below photos on the gym floor on ONE DAY. A superficial paint job and a rebrand is all well and good, but the essentials are sorely lacking. || Iconic Health Clubs in Smithfield is a solid pick. The space feels modern and well thought out ‚Äî plenty of room to move, good equipment, and clean facilities. The layout lets you work out without feeling cramped, which is a big plus.

Staff are friendly and professional, and they seem genuinely invested in helping members. You don‚Äôt feel like just another number ‚Äî there‚Äôs a human touch. The location is also very convenient: easy to get to, close to amenities, which makes it practical for dropping in before or after work.

If you‚Äôre looking for a gym that balances quality, service, and ease, Iconic Health Clubs delivers well. || I‚Äôm genuinely happy with my experience at Iconic Health Clubs Smithfield. From the first day, everything was well-organised and clearly explained, and I felt well-supported throughout the process. The environment is clean and pleasant, making the overall experience very positive.
Special thanks to Ilayda for her support, attentiveness, and helpful attitude.üå∏üïäÔ∏è || Guys trust me & the other bad reviews you see.. This place is a cesspool. The 3 month notice in cancellation is absolutely appalling. The staff? They are not friendly they are fake. Big difference. The place is not worth the price they ask for. I spent over 8 months in this gym. Many times I ran into issues mainly around staff who wore just very arrogant for no reason. Or very "Oh look at me I'm the boss" if you're aware of body language & people in general. You'll understand exactly what I mean. This gym for what they charge is a total rip off. If this gym cost 30‚Ç¨ a month it would have 4 stars. But at 120‚Ç¨ a month & you have to give a 3 month notice to cancel. 1 star. The price & the experience is completely off. Dont make the same mistakes. Look for a better gym. || Excellent, gym! I love very much. Creative and energetic classes, incredible teachers. All perfect. The best gym for sure!

name: Club Vitae
address: Clayton Hotel Cardiff Lane, Cardiff Ln, Grand Canal Dock, Dublin, Ireland
reviews_text:
Started going a couple of months ago and I'm now going 5 days a week (so far). Great location and staff, I have only used the pool area but the gym also seems very well equipped. I'm leaving a star for basicly nitpicks, things can always improve, my main one is it's a shame there is no deep end of the pool as it's pretty shallow to begin with. || I really like Club Vitae ‚Äì the gym, pool, and sauna are great, and the staff are always kind and helpful.

The only thing that makes me feel uncomfortable is the female changing room. Quite often, women bring their sons inside, and sometimes they look around 10‚Äì11 years old. Honestly, I don‚Äôt think that‚Äôs normal, and I can see that the boys also feel awkward. For example, once I came back from the pool and a boy was getting changed ‚Äì when he noticed me, he looked so shy and ran away.

Maybe it would be a good idea to create a separate changing area for kids? That would make things easier for everyone. || Very nice gym facilities in the centre of Dublin. Lots of equipment to suit all requirement and enough equipment to cope with busy times. There are also scheduled fitness classes that are available for hotel guests too. All equipment, pool and changing facilities were very clean. || Nice gym
It has a lot of equipment and a great swimming pool. || Joined the gym during the summer. The gym itself is big, clean and quiet - no complaints. The gym membership offers pool access which is the reason I chose this gym and my training would be mostly swimming. However, every time I have gone since the start of September, there are two of the three lanes closed off at peak times (4 to 6pm weekdays, all day Sundays) for swimming lessons, leaving all the adult paying members to swim on top of each other or have no access at all. In retrospect I would not have chosen a membership here if I knew my pool access would be so limited and am disappointed no staff member made this clear to me before I committed to a membership. Also during lesson times parents leave their children in the small women's changing room on their devices and headphones as they have nowhere else to go which is unfair on adult women trying to use these small facilities at peak times. The gym definitely favours parents of children doing swimming lessons not it's adult members. Am unsure if we will continue our membership at this time.

name: The Dawson Spa
address: 50 William St S, Dublin, D02 DE93, Ireland
reviews_text:
Pretty disappointing with this place. I went there maybe 2-3 years ago and it was nice.
On this occasion, it was not relaxing!
1- the receptionist needs to work on her manners and speak clearly, know how to welcome clients etc.
2- Toilets and sink are dirty with some blood on the floor.
3- Been taken 10-12 minutes late despite arriving before time (8 minutes before my appointment). My appointment was cut short.
4 - My therapist was lovely but treatment wasn't good - massage was too soft despite asking for a strong one.
5 - Indian head massage - absolutely nothing of a head massage.
6- I was in the room next to the reception so could hear everything.
7- After the treatment, you should be relaxing but you just end up seating in the reception.
Don't think I will be back if there's no improvement. || I had an amazing experience!‚ù§Ô∏èthe Staff are so friendly
Lovely atmosphere. Priyanka was amazing! I‚Äôm definitely coming back || Disappointing experience. The place looks shabby and definitely lacks cleanliness. When entering the building and going up the stairs it is evident the carpet has not been hoovered in a while. I arrived 10 min early for my morning appointment as asked but the reception room was unattended and in the dark as clearly I was the first arrived. Do not pay attention to the polished website as the place itself does not reflect the website. The massage was also disappointing. The therapist clearly has not been trained in Indian Head Massage. The massage strokes were repetitive to the point it was annoying.The massage table felt hard and not comfortable. || I had the 90-minute Coconut Massage with Priyanka and it was genuinely the best massage I have ever had. The pressure was perfect, the movements were incredibly relaxing, and Priyanka was so kind and attentive throughout. The different oils and products, the calming music, and the peaceful atmosphere made the whole experience truly special.

The only point of improvement would be the massage table, which was a bit narrow and not the most comfortable. However, the quality of the massage and the care shown far outweighed this. I also really appreciated the complimentary drink offered at the end.

This was a Groupon booking and it was quite difficult to get an appointment (I had to wait over two months as there were no available slots), but it was absolutely worth the wait.

Thank you so much, Priyanka, I will definitely be back! || This review highlights my experience and confirms the issue that is mentioned in almost all reviews.

Booked and paid for a treatment package with Dawson spa in the hope of having a relaxing time however it turned out to be a nightmare!
Booked my treatments about a month prior only for the business to call me 5 hours prior to the appointment to cancel it due to staff not being available.
As the only solution I was offered was rescheduling, I told them I would call back to schedule a new date as their call was during a work lunch and I was assured that there are availabilities at any time.
(I called back an hour later, a day later, 2 days later, a week later, two weeks later Multiple times, leaving a voice message to be called back as no one answered however there was still no answer nor call back).
I finally sent an email explaining the situation, and after multiple back and forth emails that took days, I was offered an upgrade on my package yet STILL no booking nor a question about it.

I then communicated that I am still trying to get a booking and that is the main issue.
I was asked to send dates that would be available and so I did however still no reply. I decided to go into town that Morning to the business itself and speak to them in person in the hopes that this will be sorted! Staff then told me to send an email and their manager will contact me!!! I proceeded in explaining my situation so they asked me to leave a phone number to be contacted by the manager (Maureen) once she is back.
Although I had already shared my contact information via email with her, I did that again with the staff and left. I finally received a call at 7:30pm that day to tell me that there is no availability for another FIVE Weeks.

THE TREATMENT:

The Massage was OK. I cannot say that it was bad however it certainly was not good.

The Facial was decent. I actually think that the products that were used and the technique were good.

The head massage was not good and I personally found it to be annoying as I specifically asked twice for no oils/creams to be used on my scalp/hair for medical reasons however my request was completely ignored which is very ignorant.

CONCLUSION:
I am not sure I would recommend this place as there are multiple other, much professional options in this price range.

name: Thai Healing Massage
address: 1st Floor, 53 Middle Abbey St, North City, Dublin 1, D01 K296, Ireland
reviews_text:
I was a bit hesitant at first so I only booked a 60 minute deep tissue massage and I got a lady named El to do it. I was genuinely impressed because she did an amazing job. Every knot and sore spot I had was completely relieved and I went home for one of the best naps I have had in a long time. I only wish I had booked the 90 minute session. The building itself is a bit old as many are in Dublin but it is very clean and well maintained. I have tried many massage places around Dublin but this is definitely one I will keep coming back to whenever I am in town. || It was amazing today to be in thai massage I love it definitely I will be back || I walked into Thai Healing Massage with the posture of a question mark and the stress level of someone who just tried to parallel park in Temple Bar. I walked out floating like a lotus blossom on a serene pond‚Ä¶ that had just done CrossFit for the first time in years.

From the moment I stepped inside, the ambiance wrapped around me like a warm cup of herbal tea‚Äîtranquil lighting, soft music, and the gentle scent of lemongrass that whispered, ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre safe now, my child.‚Äù

My therapist was a magician. I don‚Äôt say that lightly. She found knots in my back I think were passed down genetically. There were moments I wasn‚Äôt sure if I was getting a massage or being gently folded into origami‚Äîbut somehow, it all made sense. She was strong, intuitive, and had the rare gift of knowing exactly when to go deep and when to let me breathe. At one point, I think I saw my past life flash before me‚Ä¶ and it had better posture.

This is not your average rub-and-go. This is a healing experience, conducted with precision, grace, and the kind of care that makes you want to text your ex and forgive them (I didn‚Äôt‚Äîbut I thought about it).

Whether you‚Äôre a weary traveler, a stressed-out Dubliner, or just someone whose body feels like it‚Äôs been slept on by a herd of goats, Thai Healing Massage is the reset button you didn‚Äôt know you needed. 10 out of 10 ‚Äî would contort again. || Amazing place to do a Thai message! Got there completely stressed and left floating. Thank you for your kindness || I went today for a deep tissue massage, and it was amazing. The ladie was so nice and she worked very well on my body. I was surprised by the way she handled me. I will definitely go again.
Thank you very much

name: West Wood Club
address: 1 St John's Rd, Sandymount, Dublin 4, D04 H3K2, Ireland
reviews_text:
I think West Wood is definitely the best gym in Dublin! The equipment is new, the gym is huge, and it has everything ‚Äî sauna, pool, tennis courts, stretching areas ‚Äî you can do whatever you want.
If I could give one small tip, it would be to remind people to wear caps when going to the pool. It‚Äôs not really the staff‚Äôs fault, but some people just don‚Äôt follow the rules, and it‚Äôs a bit annoying to see people swimming without caps. Other than that, everything is excellent! üí™üèä‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è || Reception guys in Sandymount Westwood are very kind and helpful. Always open to help. The club itself is very fancy and has lots of facilities and we have access to so much!! Everyone is very welcoming and ready to help! My favourite gym.  || We absolutely love Westwood. It‚Äôs a fantastic place with everything in one club ‚Äî pool, spa, gym and plenty of activities. Both adults and kids really enjoy it, and everyone can find something they like. Some clubs also offer great activities for children, like tennis or climbing, which makes it even better for families. The atmosphere is always welcoming, and having clubs all around Dublin is a huge plus. Highly recommend! || I have been in westwood sandymount this week and i got surprised with the gym, everything so organized and cleaned. Hope be back soon || I used to love the spa. But they did some work in 2025, now the jacuzzi is not warm, steam room doesn‚Äôt have steam and looking ugly, and shower is always cold‚Ä¶. Management should try the spa in Clontarf and feel the difference.

name: SAINT Studios - Premium Fitness in Dublin
address: 19 William St S, Dublin, D02 KV76, Ireland
reviews_text:
I take a reformer class with Gigi every Monday, a ride class with Alana every Saturday, and a recovery session after the ride class. This is what has helped me keep going no matter what, improved my performance at work, and kept me in a good mood. Overall, the Saint team is just incredible‚Äîvery professional and high-energy people. I also love the smoothies at the studio and the great espresso as well. Saint has become a regular part of my schedule, and I would recommend their classes to anyone who wants to feel on top of the world. || I‚Äôve been using SAINT Studios‚Äô Recovery area since it opened, and it‚Äôs outstanding. With three saunas and six plunge baths at different temperatures, the space is always spotless, calm, and never overcrowded. The changing rooms are immaculate and fully stocked with towels, hairdryers, and quality toiletries. The front of house team is fantastic, Axel and Annette are always so welcoming and go above and beyond. The owners, Alana and Ryan, have created an incredible setup with this studio. Highly recommend. || I attended a reformer class with Jen, who is a very kind instructor with great energy and a welcoming attitude. The class was appropriate for beginners, and I appreciated the music and studio lighting, which added a nice touch to the overall atmosphere.

However, the studio felt overcrowded, with too many reformer machines placed very close together, making the space feel quite claustrophobic. The small base of the reformer machines also made some exercises uncomfortable and difficult to perform properly. For this type of service, I was expecting a more spacious and comfortable setup.

Unfortunately, the reception experience was disappointing. The front desk staff were unpleasant and unprofessional, and I did not feel welcomed, which negatively affected my overall experience. || I recently attended two different spin classes at SAINT Studios in Dublin, and it was an exceptional experience from start to finish. When I first arrived, Ste gave me a thorough walk-through of the entire facility, explaining all the fitness options including the spin studio, train/lift/Hyrox, and reformer Pilates classes. He also took time to recommend various supplemental protein options tailored to my exercise routine, which was so lovely and welcoming.

The studio itself is beautifully designed with a sleek, modern aesthetic and spotlessly clean facilities. They provide thoughtful amenities like towels and cleats to enhance your workout comfort. The rooftop sauna and cold plunge pools are fantastic additions, though please note they are at an extra cost and require a separate booking.

I attended spin classes with both Alanna (the Queen of Ride  || A top tier gym studio in the heart of Dublin.

As soon as we walked in the door it was clear that every detail to enhance the customers experience had been thought of such as; a refuel bar, complimentary towels and great music choices. We were welcomed by smiling and friendly staff who booked us in and were super helpful.

We pre-ordered a smoothie, before taking on a hybrid session led by Ryan followed by a recovery session. The class was amazing with a great level of energy from everyone in the room.

The recovery suite was the perfect way to relax and unwind after the class.

The whole experience of visiting this facility was incredible and we will certainly be returning.

name: Mardyke Arena UCC
address: University College Cork, Western Rd, Mardyke Walk, Mardyke, Cork, T12 N1FK, Ireland
reviews_text:
Mardyke Arena UCC is one of the best sports and fitness facilities in Cork. The gym is spacious, modern, and extremely well maintained, with a great range of equipment for all fitness levels. The staff are professional, friendly, and always willing to help, whether it‚Äôs with membership queries or training advice.
The swimming pool, running track, and indoor courts are top class, and the entire facility is kept clean and well organized. The atmosphere is always positive and motivating, and it‚Äôs clear that the Arena puts a strong emphasis on member experience and safety.
Whether you‚Äôre going for a workout, a swim, or taking part in classes, the Mardyke consistently delivers excellent quality and value. Highly recommended for students, athletes, and anyone looking for a premium fitness environment in Cork! || I signed up for the gym and pool 5 days ago and paid almost ‚Ç¨200 upfront for a 3-month membership. Before joining, I clearly asked at reception if members could use the pool even when lessons were running, and I was told yes, as the pool would be divided.

On Saturday (31/01), I brought my 4-year-old daughter to swim. We arrived at 11am and both pools were being used for lessons. I checked again with reception and was told, once more, that we could use the pool.
After getting changed, a pool staff member was extremely rude and told us to leave immediately, saying the children‚Äôs pool would be used. I explained calmly that it was my first day and that reception had confirmed we could use half of the pool. He rolled his eyes, spoke rudely, said there would be a break at 11:30 and that we could not stay, then walked away, leaving me speaking alone. We were basically kicked out.
While getting ready to leave, I briefly took my phone out of the locker to put it in my pocket. Another pool staff member, again very rude, almost shouted at me saying I was not authorised to use a phone in the pool area. When I tried to explain, he turned his back on me and walked away, embarrassing me in front of other people.
The overall feeling was that I was there for free and staff were doing me a favour .which is not true. I paid in advance and, as a first-time user, I expected clear guidance and basic respect.
I had to pay extra 15 Euros in other pool in the city,  where I was treated like member, with friendly staffs !!!

If I could get my money back and never return, I would. Unfortunately, I am now locked into a 3-month membership. || Good facilities however very unfriendly staff. I thought it was just my opinion but after speaking to other members it seems to be a lot of people‚Äôs opinions. The staff only interact with the elderly members and won‚Äôt even smile or say hello to anyone else. You‚Äôre far more likely to get a dirty look from them. There miserable and extremely unapproachable especially the man with long hair. Other gyms there is more of a sense of community and friendliness from staff however not this one. || They posted posters everywhere about so called renovations that cost millions of euros and caused disturbance and disruption on entry exit, car park, and facilities for so long. Yet there is no visible improvement at all.  Just this week the car park was flooded. Machines are all rusty and always at least one is broken waiting for service. One specific receptionist is always rude to anyone I witness she has interactions including her colleagues. The only ok thing is the price but seems like they will increase because of the way they keep claiming they are investing on so called improvements‚Ä¶ || One of a highlight owned by University College Cork. Adjoining a soccer/rugby ground and a hockey turf pitch. Mardyke is a great center which includes swimming, basketball, gym, badminton, squash , steam , sauna and many more activities. Well equipped and well staffed. Only downside is that it has become overcrowded at the moment and they need to facilitate the new crowd(especially in the gyms). 3 gyms -red, green and blue. 2 sections of steam and sauna. Overall a great hub.

name: LeisureWorld Churchfield
address: Knockfree Ave, Churchfield, Cork, Ireland
reviews_text:
My family and I had been really enjoying the facility as members until it unfortunately came to a very distressing end due to extremely poor management making the pool unsafe.

A man struck me in the head out of nowhere two weeks ago (Wednesday, April 16th.) When I approached him to figure out what this was about, they blew me off swam off. I have no idea who this person is or what their issue was.

When the lifeguard approached the man moments later, they ignored them, too, and continued swimming.

When I reported this to the manager on duty, he characterised the assault as "unintentional" and swimming off as "bad manners," and said they were not going to take any action.

Shortly thereafter, the same man blocked my wife in the "swim only" lane and began staring at her in that predatory way a person does if they're trying to threaten you. The same manager was told about this. He said he saw this incident on the CCTV. And... that was it. They shruggingly agreed that a person shoudln't act that way. And they did nothing. The man was not removed, no assurances were given my wife about how threatening behavior would be dealt with in the pool, nothing.

Two days later, having heard nothing from anyone working at the pool, we cancelled our memberships. As my wife said, she feels unsafe in the pool. Of course she does. A large adult male acted threateningly towards her, and attacked her husband, and no action was taken.

This is "law of the jungle" stuff. I have a three year old who comes with us. He's our main reason for being there. It is not appropriate for me to get into a fight with a strange adult male who is looking for a fight and threatening women because management is imposing no standards of safety or care for its members.

The one thing I asked for was a refund for the remainder of our month's subscription. That's it.

That was ten days ago. And I haven't heard anything back.

This is one of those situaitons where people are acting in such a wild manner that you question your own sanity based on how it has been handled. I feel extremely angry at the total lack of care in how we have been treated, and that this hooligan is being enabled as he goes around acting however he wants in a place as particualrly requiring of care and safety as a swimming pool.

Two employees of the pool told us after the fact that they had seen this person's behavior before and indicated that these incidents with us were in line with his character.

Wild. || Fabulous place to take the kids for a little swim day. Warm water and fun slides || An excellent facility to have. Lots of changing rooms. The place is continually cleaned during the day which is great in such a busy pool. Very family friendly. Cool music playing. || Been here twice and they are really helpful. They helped me find the gym and showed me what equipment was best for beginners and to get to my goal. They always wear a smile when I come in and is happy to help. 11/10. Found my gym/pool. They are accomadating to disabilities moth physical and mental. I have a busted knee and asd and they helped me around those and didn't dumb things down for me. Great for people starting out or like me haven't gone swimming in a while || I have been here so many times I don't think I can count. I've taken some lessons here a few years ago and I actually got pretty good at swimming. I come here on weekends and it's not hard to get booked but it really depends on how much people are with you in my opinion 3 is a good size. The thing about the pool is that the medium one is way to small because it could be pretty packed with kids and adults and I recommend going into the biggest pool because it's more free even though the water is kind of cold it's super fun. Now the smallest pool isn't so bad it's actually good especially for babies or if you just want to go on the tire swing or just go down the slide, the water in there is warm but a perfect kind of warm but that's probably because it's more shallow and smaller. Now for the big pool there isn't much toys and Im not sure where to find them but I guess im supposed to ask staff. Also an issue I have is kids staying wayy to long in the pool, I hate to admit this but I've done it before I stayed an extra hour and 30 minutes before I decided to leave and when I did staff just kept watching the pool (which is obviously a good thing) but I don't think they realized I stayed for pretty long. Overall I love this swimming centre and the swimming classes so this deserves 5 stars.

name: Club Vitae Health & Fitness Club - Cork (Clayton Hotel)
address: Clayton Hotel Cork City, 10 Lapp's Quay, Centre, Cork, T12 RD6E, Ireland
reviews_text:
I recently got the membership for a month for the pool,gym etc.The pool is great nicely heated up and fairly clean.Jakuzi was also good.My son which is 14 190cm tall and 68kg wanted to go to the gym,turns out you have to be 16 to use the gym only with certain limited things.
Then when you turn 18 you can obviously use all without supervision.Its quite weird that he wasnt aloud considering the size,strenghth and height he has.My friends son goes to the gym and he is aloud even though he is 14 and much shorter.He goes to the bishopstown complex.Overall everything is fantastic other than that.The gym is filled with good equipment.Staff are friendly and nice.But for the price of 125 euro,he would like to use the gym as he wants to get stronger,as he plays basketball for bluedemons and just wants to improve his overall being thank you.Mark O,driscoll || As a member who goes in regularly I feel compelled to write a review, simply because the staff in the Leisure Centre are just so fab. Beth and Billy, in particular, are two incredible young people. They make you feel welcome and are always in great form.
They know when to be courteous and professional and when to have the craic. I always look forward to going in to the pool/gym, and if either Beth or Billy are working, it's a bonus. The gym/pool facilities are great, but it is the staff of this great Leisure Centre that make it 5 Star. || Its not a bad gym by any means but they are a lot of gyms in cork with more equipment and which cost less. ‚Ç¨55 is very pricy and the ‚Ç¨35 admin fee is a joke considering joining takes 10 minutes and is entirely online with no human interaction. Also they don't allow people to charge their devices on the sockets in the gym which seems cheap. Might be worth it if you are interested in swimming but if that is not the case there are a lot of better options in cork. || Great gym for value. The gym is getting a face-lift at the moment. The staff at the front desk are extremely competent and friendly.  The locker rooms are decent and the cleaners are constantly going around. You can pay more somewhere else and receive a lot less. || Staff are brilliant especially Shane and Dylan, always available for any issues, gym is perfect for all types of level's. Locker room ideal and plenty of room. Sauna, steam room, Jacuzzi and pool are one of the best you'll find in the city

name: Planet Health Club
address: Galway Shopping Centre, Headford Rd, Galway, H91 KP0N, Ireland
reviews_text:
This gym is extremely good , it has a variety of machines that you could choose from even if you dont like some machines there are always other or even free weights.
I have been going here for about 7 months now and i really enjoy it , only thing that bothered me is that it gets extremely full at times but you can still get a good workout in within an hour which is what id say is the average time for me.
There is tons of space for extra activites like boxing, which is what i primarily do and i find it comfortable to train there.
People are pretty friendly but sometimes i would look out for some men that may be anti-social, but apart from that the gym is very well equipped and staff is very friendly.
I would recommened it. || During my stay at Ireland we 2 families with children went there to hangout ‚Ä¶. The ambience was really nice‚Ä¶ there were many attractions for children in game zone‚Ä¶ we specially went for bowling - they had an offer to have one hour group bowling in just 45 euro‚Ä¶. It was fun playing bowling with everyone ‚Ä¶ very nice and kids friendly place. Those who love to grab a hard drink - for them there was dedicated bar counter too. || Excellent gym. Great staff. The new sauna is a brilliant addition.  Would be useful to have a scales in the mens changing room if possible || Not a bad gym. It‚Äôs annoying how many users feel the need to film and photograph themselves in the public changing rooms - also illegal, specially considering many underage people use the gym and people should expect privacy. || Used this gym for the week whilst I was working at Galway Races - excellent spot üôå
Great range of equipment in many different rooms - would highly recommend

name: Kingfisher Club, University of Galway
address: University of Galway, Newcastle Rd, Galway, H91 X53V, Ireland
reviews_text:
We went for the Natural Stromgman tournament. All the staff were friendly and very helpful. They also had a nice cafe with a wide selection of fresh food. Great venue! || AVOID! It's not clean, staff are unfriendly and defensive when you complain. Just look at some of the dreadful responses to reviews on here! Gym floor very untidy and not clean and rarely any staff around.  Machine seats ripped and many not working properly.  Every bathroom has mould around sinks etc.  Hairs in all showers, no soap, no moisturiser, no spinner for swim trunks. Lack of hooks in changing rooms. Over subscribed and used mainly by overseas students probably because they get a heavy discount.  Booking system haphazard.  Lockers not cleaned, swimming pool not clean with discoloured tiles and always foreign objects in water.  Sauna and steam smell bad and neither hot enough.  Disgrace for a university gym, go elsewhere, even Leisureland is better || The gym is a very unpleasant place. It‚Äôs very messy, and has no A/C or appropriate ventilation. The air feels unbreathable and whenever the temperature is slightly higher it‚Äôs just impossible to workout. They only have one fan and it‚Äôs stationed outside the main workout area for some reason.
Edit: there was no AC on in the main gym area upstairs and when I asked the staff to turn it on they said there was no AC available || Great sport complex and gym. It has a lot of training machines and weights/dumbbells, treadmills, etc. During the academic year, it could become very crowded in the mornings (before classes start) and after 5 pm (when classes end). Other issues are machines becoming out of order frequently and being repaired very slowly and not having some machines like chest fly, back fly or any decline benches. || Prices have increased from ‚Ç¨10 to ‚Ç¨12 for pay as you to use the pool. No problem with that if the pool area was well maintained but there are a number of issues that havent been catered for such as; hooks missing from cubicles, doors difficult to lock; no complimentary shampoo in shower and bathrooms/flooring is always filty; some lockers broken. Just lacks care and attention. Why haven't these issues been brought to the attention of maintenance? Reflects poorly on management.

name: The Warehouse Gym, Mervue
address: Monivea Rd, Galway, Ireland
reviews_text:
The gym has good equipment and a solid concept; however, I need to point out an important issue. The environment is extremely cold, especially early in the morning. I work out every day at 5:30 a.m., and even after the membership fee increase, comfort has not been taken into consideration.

People who train early are looking for a pleasant and comfortable environment, not a freezing one that affects both performance and well-being. The gym should adjust the air conditioning to maintain a more comfortable temperature, particularly during the early morning hours.

I hope this issue will be reviewed, as it makes a real difference for daily members. || What you see is what you get: a solid gym with plenty of equipment that's in good repair. They do Day Passes for ‚Ç¨10 too, without the need for a member to be with you. Gabby at reception was very helpful. I'll definitely be back when next in town. üëå || I do not recommend this place to work your body, the place smells bad, is dark , it is like a box with people all together, and the manager is very smart to take your money, If I were the owner I would fire this manager, they debited me 40 euros in 4 days when it was canceled without having used their dirty facilities. Do not debit your fee here because they are very fast with money. CHOOSE ANOTHER GYM WITH A POOL AND SAUNA AND YOU WILL PAY THE SAME AS IN THIS SMELLY AND DARK PLACE, they have debited my money in advance. I hate places like these. || Really amazing gym. Got a day pass for 9 euro, the staff were super friendly, one of the lost well equipped gyms I've ever seen, and they also have good facilities (showers /hair dryers). Sooo many power racks and machines I'd never seen before. Awesome :) || 1‚Ç¨ more than planet gym.. which bigger than this gym.. but it doesn‚Äôt matter .. you can gain muscle at any gym if you do it right.

name: The Ardilaun Leisure Club
address: The Ardilaun Hotel, Taylor's Hill Rd, Galway, H91 H29F, Ireland
reviews_text: I have been a member for almost a year and I‚Äôm delighted with not just facilities and classes available, but also the team of people who work there. Everyone is super nice and welcoming which makes the whole experience even better. Well done guys, especially Anna, who‚Äôs always there with a big smile and ready to assist. || This was always an OK club but lacking in some areas. In the past year, though, it's improved dramatically; wide range of classes, upgraded facilities, cleanliness, lots of new friendly faces. A 5* club in the making! || Very clean and well maintained swimming pool. Staff is friendly and helpful.  My daughter enjoys swimming lessons, you can see an improvement from week to week. Highly recommended. || I've been a member at this gym now for almost a year. The best thing about it is the staff. Fran, Andrew and Anna (among others) are so friendly and warm. Fran's hiit classes and zumba classes are excellent , she puts in so much energy and is so enthusiastic day in, day out. Andrews spin classes are always brilliant and he always encourages his class participants who he remembers by name . Would definitely recommend  this gym if you like to have a variety of classes and staff who always make you feel welcome. || Fantastic leisure club with great staff. Fran has helped  me with training plan for gym and there are regular aquafit classes available to members. Thank you all!

name: The Warehouse Gym
address: Unit 18, Gateway Retail Park, Knocknacarra, Co. Galway, H91 Y68D, Ireland
reviews_text: Visited because was curious about joining. The staff were really unfriendly. There is only one price plan which is odd for a gym. The equipment looks good but the other reviews seem to say otherwise. Music was like a nightclub so I wouldn't be relaxed going here, maybe if you want to get jacked. There also seems to be a very high throughout of people which might explain cold staff and broken equipment/lockers. But thats what you expect when your price plan is a weekly dd. || This gym has everything you need for a complete workout‚Äîtons of equipment, all well-maintained and readily available. The facility is clean, well-organized, and never feels overcrowded. Staff is professional and helpful without being overbearing. Solid choice for serious gym-goers. || Best gym in Galway. Worth the gold pass. 4 stars because during warn days it gets boiling hot, and for some reason they don't turn on the AC??? üßê It makes working out unbearable! || Visited The Warehouse Gym several times while visiting Galway from the US. Many positives: (1) responsive, welcoming team members, (2) affordable/really reasonable day rate, (3) uncrowded, open-plan layout facility, (4) well-stocked, varied equipment, especially for Hyrox style training, (5) plenty of free parking, (6) long opening hours for schedule flexibility (went at 5:30 a.m. before my flight home), (6) amenities like well-appointed bathrooms and cafes/drinks/snacks. Thank you The Warehouse Gym for welcoming me and supporting my training while on vacation! || The Warehouse Gym in Knocknacarra is fantastic! The staff are incredibly friendly and always make you feel welcome from the moment you walk in. The atmosphere is positive and motivating, making it a great place to train. There's a great selection of equipment, and the facilities are always clean and well-maintained. The changing rooms are modern and the sauna is a perfect addition for post-workout relaxation. Highly recommend this gym for anyone serious about fitness or just looking for a great workout environment!

name: Kingfisher Club
address: Renmore Ave, Galway, Ireland
reviews_text:
Marin is an excellent swim teacher! He initially taught my oldest daughter, and is currently teaching my youngest, and we couldn't be happier.

He is incredibly patient, knowledgeable, and a very encouraging teacher. Both of my children genuinely looked forward to his classes, which is a testament to how engaging he is. Marin has an effective individual approach to each child, tailoring his teaching to their specific needs.

I would absolutely recommend him to any parent looking for a skilled and caring swim instructor. We are thoroughly happy with his classes! || Our coach Marin taught my son how to swim, he was very patient and caring with him, he was a very good coach. We recommend Marin 100%. || Friendly staff and great to have a ‚Ç¨12 charge for single use instead of required memberships, lockers are nice and big too. Some things i'd like changed though, free water dispensers on both floors of the gym (There's none at all, EVERY gym should have these!), anti-slip matts in the changing room (Slippery floors and people dizzy from the treadmill is an accident waiting to happen) Pool should be available for ALL to use at ALL times regardless of swimming lessons in progress or at least some of it available, its kind of ridiculous waiting until 5.30pm to use it. Jacuzzi needs to be fixed and more of the smaller dumbell weights (6 to 8KG) added to the gym, 3 times i've went up there to use them but they're all in use || I've been using the club for a while. The staff are really friendly and the pool is the perfect size.
We have started to do 1 to 1 swimming sessions with marin with my 11 year old. Marin is a top guy and my son really enjoys the sessions.
The progress made with marin stands out and his technique has massively improved to the point I can't keep up with him. Marin is a great instructor and great with my young fella.
I might need some lessons myself to keep up üòÜ || I highly recommend individual swimming lessons with Marin. The combination of friendly and flexible approach, excellent communication, feedback after each class, and tangible progress made this a truly worthwhile investment in my daughter‚Äôs swimming journey. I would absolutely seek out Marin‚Äôs instruction again in the future.

name: Active 24 Fitness
address: The Connacht Hotel, Old Dublin Rd, Renmore, Galway, H91 K5DD, Ireland
reviews_text:
They don't do day passes unless you're staying at the adjoining hotel or are with a member. Had to go somewhere else. Looks like a great facility though with gym, swimming pool, etc. || Pretty good gym, always treadmills and weights available to use, lots of space to move around and staff are happy to help with any issues || I absolutely love this gym! It‚Äôs always spotless and the staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. There‚Äôs a fantastic variety of classes available at all different times of day, so it‚Äôs really easy to find something that fits your schedule.
The membership is great value too ‚Äî it includes access to all the classes, the gym, pool, sauna, and steam room. Plus, there‚Äôs loads of free parking. It never feels too busy.
Highly recommend to anyone looking for a clean, well-run, and welcoming gym with top-notch facilities. || Training with Barry has been a real game changer. He‚Äôs approachable, always greets you with a smile, and has this rare intuitive ability to tune into your energy on any given day. His knowledge and sensitivity mean that every session feels tailored and supportive ‚Äì whether I‚Äôm pushing for strength or simply focusing on long-term health and longevity. Working with Barry is not just effective; it‚Äôs genuinely enjoyable. He‚Äôs a true #gymgem at Active Fitness and I feel lucky to have him in my corner. || Nice gym, it get busy but it has good facilities.
The staff is very friendly and helpful.

name: The Connacht Hotel
address: Old Dublin Rd, Galway, H91 K5DD, Ireland
summary: Contemporary rooms, suites and apartments, plus laid-back dining, a pool and a kids' club.
reviews_text:
Fantastic hotel for families, staff were all super helpful and friendly. Everywhere was spotless. Breakfast was delicious and we had very nice afternoon tea. Pool was perfect for family with young kids and easy to not be in the way of adults also using the pool. Great location just outside of Galway, easy drive in or on to Salthill. Would highly recommend! || From the second we walked into this hotel we were made to feel so welcome! Every single member of staff was so nice. Hotel is spotless, food is great. But the staff made it so much better! We will be back! || Great location, super clean. Staff excellant at keeping it clean. Just FYI.. if you want a quite relaxing pool/sauna time.. after 3pm until 8pm place heaving with kids ..swim classes.. cleanest changing rooms ive ever seen.. || Our experience at The Connacht Hotel this year was absolutely spectacular. From d√©cor and service to food, entertainment, and atmosphere - everything was flawless. Our Christmas Party was a huge success, and the entire team was thrilled. The entertainment and food were standout highlights. It was my first visit, but it certainly won‚Äôt be my last. Highly recommended for events and family stays alike! || Amazing Family/Kid friendly hotel.
Welcoming and friendly staff. Spotlessly clean throughout. Excellent food. Dinner and Breakfast, were both delicious. Would highly recommend, for a trip to Galway. Situated very close to the city centre, bars and shops. Will definitely return again!

name: Galway City Gym Limited
address: Town Park Centre, Tuam Rd, Galway, H91 X98Y, Ireland
reviews_text: Great gym. Joined up back in October,  great staff, very knowledgeable and friendly. Members say hello to eachother unlike many other places. Machines are a bit dated but safe and maintained, no issue. Plenty of free weights and saunas in each dressing room. || Went here just with a day pass, it was ‚Ç¨10 which is the standard but the gym was class. Has a great selection of machines and free weights despite its small area and is perfect if you are into traditional bodybuilding. Dressing rooms were perfect and had a sauna which was ideal after the workout. Jason at the front desk was sound and answered any questions I had, would come back here again no problem! || Best gym I have ever been in. I was traveling from the United States and wanted to find a real gym for those who are dedicated to fitness. I walked in the door and was greeted by John. He showed me around and was very kind and helpful. The equipment is everything you would need if you are having bodybuilding or strongmen aspirations. Very cheap day passes! I can't say enough good things about this place! || We visited Galway City Gym twice during our short holiday, and it‚Äôs a classic old-school gym with everything you could possibly need for a great workout. The gym is fully equipped, and the staff were absolutely amazing‚Äîso friendly and welcoming! I highly recommend this gym to anyone looking to stay active while visiting Galway. A wonderful place to keep up with your fitness routine! || Great Gym, has all the equipment you need for a well rounded session. Also a very nice Sauna for relaxation and recovery. The staff are very friendly and the atmosphere of the gym floor is fantastic.
